GIFMOD
  • GUI
mimetex.c
1 /****************************************************************************
2  *
3  * Copyright(c) 2002-2012, John Forkosh Associates, Inc. All rights reserved.
4  * http://www.forkosh.com mailto: john@forkosh.com
5  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6  * This file is part of mimeTeX, which is free software. You may redistribute
7  * and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License,
8  * version 3 or later, as published by the Free Software Foundation.
9  * MimeTeX is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
10  * WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY, not even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY.
11  * See the GNU General Public License for specific details.
12  * By using mimeTeX, you warrant that you have read, understood and
13  * agreed to these terms and conditions, and that you possess the legal
14  * right and ability to enter into this agreement and to use mimeTeX
15  * in accordance with it.
16  * Your mimetex.zip distribution file should contain the file COPYING,
17  * an ascii text copy of the GNU General Public License, version 3.
18  * If not, point your browser to http://www.gnu.org/licenses/
19  * or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
20  * 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA.
21  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
22  *
23  * Purpose: o MimeTeX, licensed under the gpl, lets you easily embed
24  * LaTeX math in your html pages. It parses a LaTeX math
25  * expression and immediately emits the corresponding gif
26  * image, rather than the usual TeX dvi. And mimeTeX is an
27  * entirely separate little program that doesn't use TeX or
28  * its fonts in any way. It's just one cgi that you put in
29  * your site's cgi-bin/ directory, with no other dependencies.
30  * So mimeTeX is very easy to install. And it's equally
31  * easy to use. Just place an html <img> tag in your document
32  * wherever you want to see the corresponding LaTeX expression.
33  * For example,
34  * <img src="../cgi-bin/mimetex.cgi?\int_{-\infty}^xe^{-t^2}dt"
35  * alt="" border=0 align=middle>
36  * immediately generates the corresponding gif image on-the-fly,
37  * displaying the rendered expression wherever you put that
38  * <img> tag.
39  * MimeTeX doesn't need intermediate dvi-to-gif conversion,
40  * and it doesn't clutter up your filesystem with separate
41  * little gif files for each converted expression.
42  * But image caching is available by using mimeTeX's
43  * -DCACHEPATH=\"path/\" compile option (see below).
44  * There's also no inherent need to repeatedly write the
45  * cumbersome <img> tag illustrated above. You can write
46  * your own custom tags, or write a wrapper script around
47  * mimeTeX to simplify the notation.
48  * Further discussion about mimeTeX's features and
49  * usage is available on its homepage,
50  * http://www.forkosh.com/mimetex.html
51  * and similarly in mimetex.html included with your mimetex.zip
52  * distribution file. (Note: http://www.forkosh.com/mimetex.html
53  * is a "quickstart" version of the the full mimetex.html manual
54  * included in your mimetex.zip distribution file.)
55  *
56  * Functions: The following "table of contents" lists each function
57  * comprising mimeTeX in the order it appears in this file.
58  * See individual function entry points for specific comments
59  * about its purpose, calling sequence, side effects, etc.
60  * (All these functions eventually belong in several
61  * different modules, possibly along the lines suggested
62  * by the divisions below. But until the best decomposition
63  * becomes clear, it seems better to keep mimetex.c
64  * neatly together, avoiding a bad decomposition that
65  * becomes permanent by default.)
66  * ===================== Raster Functions ======================
67  * PART2 --- raster constructor functions ---
68  * new_raster(width,height,pixsz) allocation (and constructor)
69  * new_subraster(width,height,pixsz)allocation (and constructor)
70  * new_chardef() allocate chardef struct
71  * delete_raster(rp) deallocate raster (rp = raster ptr)
72  * delete_subraster(sp) deallocate subraster (sp=subraster ptr)
73  * delete_chardef(cp) deallocate chardef (cp = chardef ptr)
74  * --- primitive (sub)raster functions ---
75  * rastcpy(rp) allocate new copy of rp
76  * subrastcpy(sp) allocate new copy of sp
77  * rastrot(rp) new raster rotated right 90 degrees to rp
78  * rastmag(rp,magstep) new raster magnified by "magstep" to rp
79  * bytemapmag(bytemap,width,height,magstep) magnify bytemap
80  * rastref(rp,axis) new raster reflected (axis 1=horz,2=vert)
81  * rastput(target,source,top,left,isopaque) overlay src on trgt
82  * rastcompose(sp1,sp2,offset2,isalign,isfree) sp2 on top of sp1
83  * rastcat(sp1,sp2,isfree) concatanate sp1||sp2
84  * rastack(sp1,sp2,base,space,iscenter,isfree)stack sp2 atop sp1
85  * rastile(tiles,ntiles) create composite raster from tiles
86  * rastsmash(sp1,sp2,xmin,ymin) calc #smash pixels sp1||sp2
87  * rastsmashcheck(term) check if term is "safe" to smash
88  * --- raster "drawing" functions ---
89  * accent_subraster(accent,width,height,direction,pixsz)\hat\vec
90  * arrow_subraster(width,height,drctn,isBig) left/right arrow
91  * uparrow_subraster(width,height,drctn,isBig) up/down arrow
92  * rule_raster(rp,top,left,width,height,type) draw rule in rp
93  * line_raster(rp,row0,col0,row1,col1,thickness) draw line in rp
94  * line_recurse(rp,row0,col0,row1,col1,thickness) recurse line
95  * circle_raster(rp,row0,col0,row1,col1,thickness,quads) ellipse
96  * circle_recurse(rp,row0,col0,row1,col1,thickness,theta0,theta1)
97  * bezier_raster(rp,r0,c0,r1,c1,rt,ct) draw bezier recursively
98  * border_raster(rp,ntop,nbot,isline,isfree)put border around rp
99  * backspace_raster(rp,nback,pback,minspace,isfree) neg space
100  * --- raster (and chardef) output functions ---
101  * type_raster(rp,fp) emit ascii dump of rp on file ptr fp
102  * type_bytemap(bp,grayscale,width,height,fp) dump bytemap on fp
103  * xbitmap_raster(rp,fp) emit mime xbitmap of rp on fp
104  * type_pbmpgm(rp,ptype,file) pbm or pgm image of rp to file
105  * cstruct_chardef(cp,fp,col1) emit C struct of cp on fp
106  * cstruct_raster(rp,fp,col1) emit C struct of rp on fp
107  * hex_bitmap(rp,fp,col1,isstr)emit hex dump of rp->pixmap on fp
108  * --- ancillary output functions ---
109  * emit_string(fp,col1,string,comment) emit string and C comment
110  * gftobitmap(rp) convert .gf-like pixmap to bitmap image
111  * ====================== Font Functions =======================
112  * --- font lookup functions ---
113  * get_symdef(symbol) return mathchardef for symbol
114  * get_ligature(expr,family) return symtable index for ligature
115  * get_chardef(symdef,size) return chardef for symdef,size
116  * get_charsubraster(symdef,size) wrap subraster around chardef
117  * get_symsubraster(symbol,size) returns subraster for symbol
118  * --- ancillary font functions ---
119  * get_baseline(gfdata) determine baseline (in our coords)
120  * get_delim(symbol,height,family) delim just larger than height
121  * make_delim(symbol,height) construct delim exactly height size
122  * ================= Tokenize/Parse Functions ==================
123  * texchar(expression,chartoken) retruns next char or \sequence
124  * texsubexpr(expr,subexpr,maxsubsz,left,right,isescape,isdelim)
125  * texleft(expr,subexpr,maxsubsz,ldelim,rdelim) \left...\right
126  * texscripts(expression,subscript,superscript,which)get scripts
127  * --- ancillary parse functions ---
128  * isbrace(expression,braces,isescape) check for leading brace
129  * preamble(expression,size,subexpr) parse preamble
130  * mimeprep(expression) preprocessor converts \left( to \(, etc.
131  * strchange(nfirst,from,to) change nfirst chars of from to to
132  * strreplace(string,from,to,nreplace) change from to to in str
133  * strwstr(string,substr,white,sublen) find substr in string
134  * strdetex(s,mode) replace math chars like \^_{} for display
135  * strtexchr(string,texchr) find texchr in string
136  * findbraces(expression,command) find opening { or closing }
137  * strpspn(s,reject,segment) non-() chars of s not in reject
138  * isstrstr(string,snippets,iscase) are any snippets in string?
139  * isnumeric(s) determine if s is an integer
140  * evalterm(store,term) evaluate numeric value of expression
141  * getstore(store,identifier)return value corresponding to ident
142  * unescape_url(url,isescape), x2c(what) xlate %xx url-encoded
143  * PART3 =========== Rasterize an Expression (recursively) ===========
144  * --- here's the primary entry point for all of mimeTeX ---
145  * rasterize(expression,size) parse and rasterize expression
146  * --- explicitly called handlers that rasterize... ---
147  * rastparen(subexpr,size,basesp) parenthesized subexpr
148  * rastlimits(expression,size,basesp) dispatch super/sub call
149  * rastscripts(expression,size,basesp) super/subscripted exprssn
150  * rastdispmath(expression,size,sp) scripts for displaymath
151  * --- table-driven handlers that rasterize... ---
152  * rastleft(expression,size,basesp,ildelim,arg2,arg3)\left\right
153  * rastright(expression,size,basesp,ildelim,arg2,arg3) ...\right
154  * rastmiddle(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \middle
155  * rastflags(expression,size,basesp,flag,value,arg3) set flag
156  * rastspace(expression,size,basesp,width,isfill,isheight)\,\:\;
157  * rastnewline(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \\
158  * rastarrow(expression,size,basesp,width,height,drctn) \longarr
159  * rastuparrow(expression,size,basesp,width,height,drctn)up/down
160  * rastoverlay(expression,size,basesp,overlay,arg2,arg3) \not
161  * rastfrac(expression,size,basesp,isfrac,arg2,arg3) \frac \atop
162  * rastackrel(expression,size,basesp,base,arg2,arg3) \stackrel
163  * rastmathfunc(expression,size,basesp,base,arg2,arg3) \lim,\etc
164  * rastsqrt(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \sqrt
165  * rastaccent(expression,size,basesp,accent,isabove,isscript)
166  * rastfont(expression,size,basesp,font,arg2,arg3) \cal{},\scr{}
167  * rastbegin(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \begin{}
168  * rastarray(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \array
169  * rastpicture(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \picture
170  * rastline(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \line
171  * rastrule(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \rule
172  * rastcircle(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \circle
173  * rastbezier(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \bezier
174  * rastraise(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \raisebox
175  * rastrotate(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \rotatebox
176  * rastmagnify(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \magnify
177  * rastreflect(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3)\reflectbox
178  * rastfbox(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \fbox
179  * rastinput(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \input
180  * rastcounter(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \counter
181  * rasteval(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \eval
182  * rasttoday(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \today
183  * rastcalendar(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \calendar
184  * rastenviron(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \environ
185  * rastmessage(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) \message
186  * rastnoop(expression,size,basesp,arg1,arg2,arg3) flush \escape
187  * --- helper functions for handlers ---
188  * rastopenfile(filename,mode) opens filename[.tex] in mode
189  * rasteditfilename(filename) edit filename (for security)
190  * rastreadfile(filename,islock,tag,value) read <tag>...</tag>
191  * rastwritefile(filename,tag,value,isstrict)write<tag>...</tag>
192  * calendar(year,month,day) formats one-month calendar string
193  * timestamp(tzdelta,ifmt) formats timestamp string
194  * tzadjust(tzdelta,year,month,day,hour) adjust date/time
195  * daynumber(year,month,day) #days since Monday, Jan 1, 1973
196  * strwrap(s,linelen,tablen)insert \n's and spaces to wrap lines
197  * strnlower(s,n) lowercase the first n chars of string s
198  * urlprune(url,n) http://abc.def.ghi.com/etc-->abc.def.ghi.com
199  * urlncmp(url1,url2,n) compares topmost n levels of two url's
200  * dbltoa(d,npts) double to comma-separated ascii
201  * === Anti-alias completed raster (lowpass) or symbols (ss) ===
202  * aalowpass(rp,bytemap,grayscale) lowpass grayscale bytemap
203  * aapnm(rp,bytemap,grayscale) lowpass based on pnmalias.c
204  * aapnmlookup(rp,bytemap,grayscale) aapnm based on aagridnum()
205  * aapatterns(rp,irow,icol,gridnum,patternum,grayscale) call 19,
206  * aapattern1124(rp,irow,icol,gridnum,grayscale)antialias pattrn
207  * aapattern19(rp,irow,icol,gridnum,grayscale) antialias pattern
208  * aapattern20(rp,irow,icol,gridnum,grayscale) antialias pattern
209  * aapattern39(rp,irow,icol,gridnum,grayscale) antialias pattern
210  * aafollowline(rp,irow,icol,direction) looks for a "turn"
211  * aagridnum(rp,irow,icol) calculates gridnum, 0-511
212  * aapatternnum(gridnum) looks up pattern#, 1-51, for gridnum
213  * aalookup(gridnum) table lookup for all possible 3x3 grids
214  * aalowpasslookup(rp,bytemap,grayscale) driver for aalookup()
215  * aasupsamp(rp,aa,sf,grayscale) or by supersampling
216  * aacolormap(bytemap,nbytes,colors,colormap)make colors,colormap
217  * aaweights(width,height) builds "canonical" weight matrix
218  * aawtpixel(image,ipixel,weights,rotate) weight image at ipixel
219  * === miscellaneous ===
220  * mimetexsetmsg(newmsglevel,newmsgfp) set msglevel and msgfp
221  * PART1 ========================== Driver ===========================
222  * main(argc,argv) parses math expression and emits mime xbitmap
223  * CreateGifFromEq(expression,gifFileName) entry pt for win dll
224  * ismonth(month) is month current month ("jan"-"dec")?
225  * logger(fp,msglevel,logvars) logs environment variables
226  * emitcache(cachefile,maxage,valign,isbuffer) emit cachefile
227  * readcachefile(cachefile,buffer) read cachefile into buffer
228  * advertisement(expression,mode) wrap expression in ad message
229  * crc16(s) 16-bit crc of string s
230  * md5str(instr) md5 hash library functions
231  * GetPixel(x,y) callback function for gifsave library
232  *
233  * Source: mimetex.c (needs mimetex.h and texfonts.h to compile,
234  * and also needs gifsave.c when compiled with -DAA or -DGIF)
235  *
236  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
237  * Notes o See individual function entry points for specific comments
238  * about the purpose, calling sequence, side effects, etc
239  * of each mimeTeX function listed above.
240  * o See bottom of file for main() driver (and "friends"),
241  * and compile as
242  * cc -DAA mimetex.c gifsave.c -lm -o mimetex.cgi
243  * to produce an executable that emits gif images with
244  * anti-aliasing (see Notes below). You may also compile
245  * cc -DGIF mimetex.c gifsave.c -lm -o mimetex.cgi
246  * to produce an executable that emits gif images without
247  * anti-aliasing. Alternatively, compile mimeTeX as
248  * cc -DXBITMAP mimetex.c -lm -o mimetex.cgi
249  * to produce an executable that just emits mime xbitmaps.
250  * In either case you'll need mimetex.h and texfonts.h,
251  * and with -DAA or -DGIF you'll also need gifsave.c
252  * o The font information in texfonts.h was produced by multiple
253  * runs of gfuntype, one run per struct (i.e., one run per font
254  * family at a particular size). Compile gfuntype as
255  * cc gfuntype.c mimetex.c -lm -o gfuntype
256  * See gfuntype.c, and also mimetex.html#fonts, for details.
257  * o For gif images, the gifsave.c library by Sverre H. Huseby
258  * <http://shh.thathost.com> slightly modified by me to allow
259  * (a)sending output to stdout or returning it in memory,
260  * and (b)specifying a transparent background color index,
261  * is included with mimeTeX, and it's documented in
262  * mimetex.html#gifsave
263  * o MimeTeX's principal reusable function is rasterize(),
264  * which takes a string like "f(x)=\int_{-\infty}^xe^{-t^2}dt"
265  * and returns a (sub)raster representing it as a bit or bytemap.
266  * Your application can do anything it likes with this pixel map.
267  * MimeTeX just outputs it, either as a mime xbitmap or as a gif.
268  * See mimetex.html#makeraster for further discussion
269  * and examples.
270  * o File mimetex.c also contains library functions implementing
271  * a raster datatype, functions to manipulate rasterized .mf
272  * fonts (see gfuntype.c which rasterizes .mf fonts), functions
273  * to parse LaTeX expressions, etc. As already mentioned,
274  * a complete list of mimetex.c functions is above. See their
275  * individual entry points below for further comments.
276  * As also mentioned, these functions eventually belong in
277  * several different modules, possibly along the lines suggested
278  * by the divisions above. But until the best decomposition
279  * becomes clear, it seems better to keep mimetex.c
280  * neatly together, avoiding a bad decomposition that
281  * becomes permanent by default.
282  * o Optional compile-line -D defined symbols are documented
283  * in mimetex.html#options . They include (additional -D
284  * switches are discussed at mimetex.html#options)...
285  * -DAA
286  * Turns on gif anti-aliasing with default values
287  * (CENTERWT=32, ADJACENTWT=3, CORNERWT=1)
288  * for the following anti-aliasing parameters...
289  * -DCENTERWT=n
290  * -DADJACENTWT=j
291  * -DCORNERWT=k
292  * *** Note: Ignore these three switches because
293  * *** mimeTeX's current anti-aliasing algorithm
294  * *** no longer uses them (as of version 1.60).
295  * MimeTeX currently provides a lowpass filtering
296  * algorithm for anti-aliasing, which is applied to the
297  * existing set of bitmap fonts. This lowpass filter
298  * applies default weights
299  * 1 2 1
300  * 2 8 2
301  * 1 2 1
302  * to neighboring pixels. The defaults weights are
303  * CENTERWT=8, ADJACENTWT=2 and CORNERWT=1,
304  * which you can adjust to control anti-aliasing.
305  * Lower CENTERWT values will blur/spread out lines
306  * while higher values will tend to sharpen lines.
307  * Experimentation is recommended to determine
308  * what value works best for you.
309  * -DCACHEPATH=\"path/\"
310  * This option saves each rendered image to a file
311  * in directory path/ which mimeTeX reads rather than
312  * re-rendering the same image every time it's given
313  * the same LaTeX expression. Sometimes mimeTeX disables
314  * caching, e.g., expressions containing \input{ } are
315  * re-rendered since the contents of the inputted file
316  * may have changed. If compiled without -DCACHEPATH
317  * mimeTeX always re-renders expressions. This usually
318  * isn't too cpu intensive, but if you have unusually
319  * high hit rates then image caching may be helpful.
320  * The path/ is relative to mimetex.cgi, and must
321  * be writable by it. Files created under path/ are
322  * named filename.gif, where filename is the 32-character
323  * MD5 hash of the LaTeX expression.
324  * -DDEFAULTSIZE=n
325  * MimeTeX currently has eight font sizes numbered 0-7,
326  * and always starts in DEFAULTSIZE whose default value
327  * is 3 (corresponding to \large). Specify -DDEFAULTSIZE=4
328  * on the compile line if you prefer mimeTeX to start in
329  * larger default size 4 (corresponding to \Large), etc.
330  * -DDISPLAYSIZE=n
331  * By default, operator limits like \int_a^b are rendered
332  * \textstyle at font sizes \normalsize and smaller,
333  * and rendered \displaystyle at font sizes \large and
334  * larger. This default corresponds to -DDISPLAYSIZE=3,
335  * which you can adjust; e.g., -DDISPLAYSIZE=0 always
336  * defaults to \displaystyle, and 99 (or any large number)
337  * always defaults to \textstyle. Note that explicit
338  * \textstyle, \displaystyle, \limits or \nolimits
339  * directives in an expression always override
340  * the DISPLAYSIZE default.
341  * -DERRORSTATUS=n
342  * The default, 0, means mimeTeX always exits with status 0,
343  * regardless of whether or not it detects error(s) while
344  * trying to render your expression. Specify any non-zero
345  * value (typically -1) if you write a script/plugin for
346  * mimeTeX that traps non-zero exit statuses. MimeTeX then
347  * exits with its own non-zero status when it detects an
348  * error it can identify, or with your ERRORSTATUS value
349  * for errors it can't specifically identify.
350  * -DREFERER=\"domain\" -or-
351  * -DREFERER=\"domain1,domain2,etc\"
352  * Blocks mimeTeX requests from unauthorized domains that
353  * may be using your server's mimetex.cgi without permission.
354  * If REFERER is defined, mimeTeX checks for the environment
355  * variable HTTP_REFERER and, if it exists, performs a
356  * case-insensitive test to make sure it contains 'domain'
357  * as a substring. If given several 'domain's (second form)
358  * then HTTP_REFERER must contain either 'domain1' or
359  * 'domain2', etc, as a (case-insensitive) substring.
360  * If HTTP_REFERER fails to contain a substring matching
361  * any of these domain(s), mimeTeX emits an error message
362  * image corresponding to the expression specified by
363  * the invalid_referer_msg string defined in main().
364  * Note: if HTTP_REFERER is not an environment variable,
365  * mimeTeX correctly generates the requested expression
366  * (i.e., no referer error).
367  * -DWARNINGS=n -or-
368  * -DNOWARNINGS
369  * If an expression submitted to mimeTeX contains an
370  * unrecognzied escape sequence, e.g., "y=x+\abc+1", then
371  * mimeTeX generates a gif image containing an embedded
372  * warning in the form "y=x+[\abc?]+1". If you want these
373  * warnings suppressed, -DWARNINGS=0 or -DNOWARNINGS tells
374  * mimeTeX to ignore unrecognized symbols, and the rendered
375  * image is "y=x++1" instead.
376  * -DWHITE
377  * MimeTeX usually renders black symbols on a white
378  * background. This option renders white symbols on
379  * a black background instead.
380  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
381  * Revision History:
382  * 09/18/02 J.Forkosh Installation.
383  * 12/11/02 J.Forkosh Version 1.00 released.
384  * 07/04/03 J.Forkosh Version 1.01 released.
385  * 10/17/03 J.Forkosh Version 1.20 released.
386  * 12/21/03 J.Forkosh Version 1.30 released.
387  * 02/01/04 J.Forkosh Version 1.40 released.
388  * 10/02/04 J.Forkosh Version 1.50 released.
389  * 11/30/04 J.Forkosh Version 1.60 released.
390  * 10/11/05 J.Forkosh Version 1.64 released.
391  * 11/30/06 J.Forkosh Version 1.65 released.
392  * 09/06/08 J.Forkosh Version 1.70 released.
393  * 03/23/09 J.Forkosh Version 1.71 released.
394  * 11/18/09 J.Forkosh Version 1.72 released.
395  * 11/15/11 J.Forkosh Version 1.73 released.
396  * 02/15/12 J.Forkosh Version 1.74 released.
397  * 09/26/12 J.Forkosh Most recent revision (also see REVISIONDATE)
398  * See http://www.forkosh.com/mimetexchangelog.html for further details.
399  *
400  ****************************************************************************/
401 
402 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
403 Program id
404 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
405 #define VERSION "1.74" /* mimeTeX version number */
406 #define REVISIONDATE "26 Sept 2012" /* date of most recent revision */
407 #define COPYRIGHTTEXT "Copyright(c) 2002-2012, John Forkosh Associates, Inc"
408 
409 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
410 header files and macros
411 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
412 /* --- standard headers --- */
413 #include <stdio.h>
414 #include <stdlib.h>
415 /*#include <unistd.h>*/
416 #include <string.h>
417 #include <ctype.h>
418 #include <math.h>
419 #include <time.h>
420 extern char **environ; /* for \environment directive */
421 
422 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
423 messages (used mostly by main() and also by rastmessage())
424 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
425 static char *copyright1 = /* copyright, gnu/gpl notice */
426  "+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+\n"
427  "|mimeTeX vers " VERSION ", " COPYRIGHTTEXT "|\n"
428  "+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+\n"
429  "| mimeTeX is free software, licensed to you under terms of the GNU/GPL, |\n"
430  "| and comes with absolutely no warranty whatsoever. |",
431 *copyright2 =
432  "| See http://www.forkosh.com/mimetex.html for details. |\n"
433  "+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+";
434 static int maxmsgnum = 3, /* maximum msgtable[] index */
435  /* --- keep these message numbers updated if table changes --- */
436  invmsgnum = 0, /* general invalid message */
437  refmsgnum = 3; /* urlncmp() failed to validate */
438 static char *msgtable[] = { /* messages referenced by [index] */
439  "\\red\\small\\rm\\fbox{\\array{" /* [0] is invalid_referer_msg */
440  "Please~read~www.forkosh.com/mimetex.html\\\\and~install~mimetex.cgi~"
441  "on~your~own~server.\\\\Thank~you,~John~Forkosh}}",
442  "\\red\\small\\rm\\fbox{\\array{" /* [1] */
443  "Please~provide~your~{\\tiny~HTTP-REFERER}~to~access~the~public\\\\"
444  "mimetex~server.~~Or~please~read~~www.forkosh.com/mimetex.html\\\\"
445  "and~install~mimetex.cgi~on~your~own~server.~~Thank~you,~John~Forkosh}}",
446  "\\red\\small\\rm\\fbox{\\array{" /* [2] */
447  "The~public~mimetex~server~is~for~testing.~~For~production,\\\\"
448  "please~read~~www.forkosh.com/mimetex.html~~and~install\\\\"
449  "mimetex.cgi~on~your~own~server.~~Thank~you,~John~Forkosh}}",
450  "\\red\\small\\rm\\fbox{\\array{" /* [3] */
451  "Only~SERVER_NAME~may~use~mimetex~on~this~server.\\\\"
452  "Please~read~~www.forkosh.com/mimetex.html~~and~install\\\\"
453  "mimetex.cgi~on~your~own~server.~~Thank~you,~John~Forkosh}}",
454  NULL } ; /* trailer */
455 
456 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
457 additional symbols
458 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
459 /* ---
460  * windows-specific header info
461  * ---------------------------- */
462 #ifndef WINDOWS /* -DWINDOWS not supplied by user */
463  #if defined(_WINDOWS) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(WIN32) \
464  || defined(DJGPP) /* try to recognize windows compilers */ \
465  || defined(_USRDLL) /* must be WINDOWS if compiling for DLL */
466  #define WINDOWS /* signal windows */
467  #endif
468 #endif
469 #ifdef WINDOWS /* Windows opens stdout in char mode, and */
470  #include <fcntl.h> /* precedes every 0x0A with spurious 0x0D.*/
471  #include <io.h> /* So emitcache() issues a Win _setmode() */
472  /* call to put stdout in binary mode. */
473  #if defined(_O_BINARY) && !defined(O_BINARY) /* only have _O_BINARY */
474  #define O_BINARY _O_BINARY /* make O_BINARY available, etc... */
475  #define setmode _setmode
476  #define fileno _fileno
477  #endif
478  #if defined(_O_BINARY) || defined(O_BINARY) /* setmode() now available */
479  #define HAVE_SETMODE /* so we'll use setmode() */
480  #endif
481  #if defined(_MSC_VER) && defined(_DEBUG) /* MS VC++ in debug mode */
482  /* to show source file and line numbers where memory leaks occur... */
483  #define _CRTDBG_MAP_ALLOC /* ...include this debug macro */
484  #include <crtdbg.h> /* and this debug library */
485  #endif
486  #define ISWINDOWS 1
487 #else
488  #define ISWINDOWS 0
489 #endif
490 
491 /* ---
492  * check for supersampling or low-pass anti-aliasing
493  * ------------------------------------------------- */
494 #ifdef SS
495  #define ISSUPERSAMPLING 1
496  #ifndef AAALGORITHM
497  #define AAALGORITHM 1 /* default supersampling algorithm */
498  #endif
499  #ifndef AA /* anti-aliasing not explicitly set */
500  #define AA /* so define it ourselves */
501  #endif
502  #ifndef SSFONTS /* need supersampling fonts */
503  #define SSFONTS
504  #endif
505 #else
506  #define ISSUPERSAMPLING 0
507  #ifndef AAALGORITHM
508  #define AAALGORITHM 3 /*2*/ /* default lowpass algorithm */
509  #endif
510 #endif
511 #ifndef MAXFOLLOW
512  #define MAXFOLLOW 8 /* aafollowline() maxturn default */
513 #endif
514 
515 /* ---
516  * set aa (and default gif) if any anti-aliasing options specified
517  * --------------------------------------------------------------- */
518 #if defined(AA) || defined(GIF) || defined(PNG) \
519 || defined(CENTERWT) || defined(ADJACENTWT) || defined(CORNERWT) \
520 || defined(MINADJACENT) || defined(MAXADJACENT)
521  #if !defined(GIF) && !defined(AA) /* aa not explicitly specified */
522  #define AA /* so define it ourselves */
523  #endif
524  #if !defined(GIF) && !defined(PNG) /* neither gif nor png specified */
525  #define GIF /* so default to gif */
526  #endif
527 #endif
528 /* --- resolve output option inconsistencies --- */
529 #if defined(XBITMAP) /* xbitmap supercedes gif and png */
530  #ifdef AA
531  #undef AA
532  #endif
533  #ifdef GIF
534  #undef GIF
535  #endif
536  #ifdef PNG
537  #undef PNG
538  #endif
539 #endif
540 
541 /* ---
542  * decide whether or not to compile main()
543  * --------------------------------------- */
544 #if defined(XBITMAP) || defined(GIF) || defined(PNG)
545  /* --- yes, compile main() --- */
546  #define DRIVER /* main() driver will be compiled */
547 #else /* --- main() won't be compiled (e.g., for gfuntype.c) --- */
548  #ifndef TEXFONTS
549  #define NOTEXFONTS /* texfonts not required */
550  #endif
551 #endif
552 
553 /* ---
554  * application headers
555  * ------------------- */
556 #if !defined(NOTEXFONTS) && !defined(TEXFONTS)
557  #define TEXFONTS /* to include texfonts.h */
558 #endif
559 #include "mimetex.h"
560 
561 /* ---
562  * info needed when gif image returned in memory buffer
563  * ---------------------------------------------------- */
564 #ifdef GIF /* compiling along with gifsave.c */
565  extern int gifSize;
566  extern int maxgifSize;
567 #else /* or just set dummy values */
568  static int gifSize=0, maxgifSize=0;
569 #endif
570 /* --- gamma correction --- */
571 #ifndef GAMMA
572  #define GAMMA 1.25 /*1.75*/ /*2.2*/
573 #endif
574 #ifndef REVERSEGAMMA
575  #define REVERSEGAMMA 0.5 /* for \reverse white-on-black */
576 #endif
577 /* --- opaque background (default to transparent) --- */
578 #ifndef OPAQUE
579  #define ISTRANSPARENT 1
580 #else
581  #define ISTRANSPARENT 0
582 #endif
583 
584 /* ---
585  * internal buffer sizes
586  * --------------------- */
587 #if !defined(MAXEXPRSZ)
588  #define MAXEXPRSZ (32768-1) /*max #bytes in input tex expression*/
589 #endif
590 #if !defined(MAXSUBXSZ)
591  #define MAXSUBXSZ (((MAXEXPRSZ+1)/2)-1)/*max #bytes in input subexpression*/
592 #endif
593 #if !defined(MAXTOKNSZ)
594  #define MAXTOKNSZ (((MAXSUBXSZ+1)/4)-1) /* max #bytes in input token */
595 #endif
596 #if !defined(MAXFILESZ)
597  #define MAXFILESZ (65536-1) /*max #bytes in input (output) file*/
598 #endif
599 #if !defined(MAXLINESZ)
600  #define MAXLINESZ (4096-1) /* max #chars in line from file */
601 #endif
602 #if !defined(MAXGIFSZ)
603  #define MAXGIFSZ 131072 /* max #bytes in output GIF image */
604 #endif
605 
606 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
607 adjustable default values
608 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
609 /* ---
610  * anti-aliasing parameters
611  * ------------------------ */
612 #ifndef CENTERWT
613  /*#define CENTERWT 32*/ /* anti-aliasing centerwt default */
614  /*#define CENTERWT 10*/ /* anti-aliasing centerwt default */
615  #define CENTERWT 8 /* anti-aliasing centerwt default */
616 #endif
617 #ifndef ADJACENTWT
618  /*#define ADJACENTWT 3*/ /* anti-aliasing adjacentwt default*/
619  #define ADJACENTWT 2 /* anti-aliasing adjacentwt default*/
620 #endif
621 #ifndef CORNERWT
622  #define CORNERWT 1 /* anti-aliasing cornerwt default*/
623 #endif
624 #ifndef MINADJACENT
625  #define MINADJACENT 6 /*anti-aliasing minadjacent default*/
626 #endif
627 #ifndef MAXADJACENT
628  #define MAXADJACENT 8 /*anti-aliasing maxadjacent default*/
629 #endif
630 /* --- variables for anti-aliasing parameters --- */
631 GLOBAL(int,centerwt,CENTERWT); /*lowpass matrix center pixel wt */
632 GLOBAL(int,adjacentwt,ADJACENTWT); /*lowpass matrix adjacent pixel wt*/
633 GLOBAL(int,cornerwt,CORNERWT); /*lowpass matrix corner pixel wt */
634 GLOBAL(int,minadjacent,MINADJACENT); /* darken if>=adjacent pts black*/
635 GLOBAL(int,maxadjacent,MAXADJACENT); /* darken if<=adjacent pts black */
636 GLOBAL(int,weightnum,1); /* font wt, */
637 GLOBAL(int,maxaaparams,4); /* #entries in table */
638 /* --- anti-aliasing parameter values by font weight --- */
639 #define aaparameters struct aaparameters_struct /* typedef */
640 aaparameters
641  { int centerwt; /* lowpass matrix center pixel wt*/
642  int adjacentwt; /* lowpass matrix adjacent pixel wt*/
643  int cornerwt; /* lowpass matrix corner pixel wt*/
644  int minadjacent; /* darken if >= adjacent pts black */
645  int maxadjacent; /* darken if <= adjacent pts black */
646  int fgalias,fgonly,bgalias,bgonly; } ; /* aapnm() params */
647 STATIC aaparameters aaparams[] /* set params by weight */
648  #ifdef INITVALS
649  =
650  { /* ----------------------------------------------------
651  centerwt adj corner minadj max fgalias,only,bgalias,only
652  ------------------------------------------------------- */
653  { 64, 1, 1, 6, 8, 1,0,0,0 }, /* 0 = light */
654  { CENTERWT,ADJACENTWT,CORNERWT,MINADJACENT,MAXADJACENT,1,0,0,0 },
655  { 8, 1, 1, 5, 8, 1,0,0,0 }, /* 2 = semibold */
656  { 8, 2, 1, 4, 9, 1,0,0,0 } /* 3 = bold */
657  } /* --- end-of-aaparams[] --- */
658  #endif
659  ;
660 /* --- anti-aliasing diagnostics (to help improve algorithm) --- */
661 STATIC int patternnumcount0[99], patternnumcount1[99], /*aalookup() counts*/
662  ispatternnumcount = 1; /* true to accumulate counts */
663 
664 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
665 other variables
666 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
667 /* --- black on white background (default), or white on black --- */
668 #ifdef WHITE
669  #define ISBLACKONWHITE 0 /* white on black background */
670 #else
671  #define ISBLACKONWHITE 1 /* black on white background */
672 #endif
673 /* --- colors --- */
674 #define BGRED (ISBLACKONWHITE?255:0)
675 #define BGGREEN (ISBLACKONWHITE?255:0)
676 #define BGBLUE (ISBLACKONWHITE?255:0)
677 #ifndef FGRED
678  #define FGRED (ISBLACKONWHITE?0:255)
679 #endif
680 #ifndef FGGREEN
681  #define FGGREEN (ISBLACKONWHITE?0:255)
682 #endif
683 #ifndef FGBLUE
684  #define FGBLUE (ISBLACKONWHITE?0:255)
685 #endif
686 /* --- advertisement
687  one image in every ADFREQUENCY is wrapped in "advertisement" --- */
688 #if !defined(ADFREQUENCY)
689  #define ADFREQUENCY 0 /* never show advertisement if 0 */
690 #endif
691 #ifndef HOST_SHOWAD
692  #define HOST_SHOWAD "\000" /* show ads on all hosts */
693 #endif
694 /* --- "smash" margin (0 means no smashing) --- */
695 #ifndef SMASHMARGIN
696  #ifdef NOSMASH
697  #define SMASHMARGIN 0
698  #else
699  #define SMASHMARGIN 3
700  #endif
701 #endif
702 #ifndef SMASHCHECK
703  #define SMASHCHECK 0
704 #endif
705 /* --- textwidth --- */
706 #ifndef TEXTWIDTH
707  #define TEXTWIDTH (400)
708 #endif
709 /* --- font "combinations" --- */
710 #define CMSYEX (109) /*select CMSY10, CMEX10 or STMARY10*/
711 /* --- prefix prepended to all expressions --- */
712 #ifndef PREFIX
713  #define PREFIX "\000" /* default no prepended prefix */
714 #endif
715 /* --- skip argv[]'s preceding ARGSIGNAL when parsing command-line args --- */
716 #ifdef NOARGSIGNAL
717  #define ARGSIGNAL NULL
718 #endif
719 #ifndef ARGSIGNAL
720  #define ARGSIGNAL "++"
721 #endif
722 /* --- security and logging (inhibit message logging, etc) --- */
723 #ifndef SECURITY
724  #define SECURITY 999 /* default highest security level */
725 #endif
726 #ifndef LOGFILE
727  #define LOGFILE "mimetex.log" /* default log file */
728 #endif
729 #ifndef CACHELOG
730  #define CACHELOG "mimetex.log" /* default caching log file */
731 #endif
732 #if !defined(NODUMPENVP) && !defined(DUMPENVP)
733  #define DUMPENVP /* assume char *envp[] available */
734 #endif
735 /* --- max query_string length if no http_referer supplied --- */
736 #ifndef NOREFMAXLEN
737  #define NOREFMAXLEN 9999 /* default to any length query */
738 #endif
739 #ifndef NOREFSAFELEN
740  #define NOREFSAFELEN 24 /* too small for hack exploit */
741 #endif
742 /* --- check whether or not to perform http_referer check --- */
743 #ifdef REFERER /* only specified referers allowed */
744  #undef NOREFMAXLEN
745  #define NOREFMAXLEN NOREFSAFELEN
746 #else /* all http_referer's allowed */
747  #define REFERER NULL
748 #endif
749 /* --- check top levels of http_referer against server_name --- */
750 #ifdef REFLEVELS /* #topmost levels to check */
751  #undef NOREFMAXLEN
752  #define NOREFMAXLEN NOREFSAFELEN
753 #else
754  #ifdef NOREFCHECK
755  #define REFLEVELS 0 /* don't match host and referer */
756  #else
757  #define REFLEVELS 3 /* default matches abc.def.com */
758  #endif
759 #endif
760 /* --- check whether or not \input, \counter, \environment permitted --- */
761 #ifdef DEFAULTSECURITY /* default security specified */
762  #define EXPLICITDEFSECURITY /* don't override explicit default */
763 #else /* defualt security not specified */
764  #define DEFAULTSECURITY (8) /* so set default security level */
765 #endif
766 #ifdef INPUTREFERER /*http_referer's permitted to \input*/
767  #ifndef INPUTSECURITY /* so we need to permit \input{} */
768  #define INPUTSECURITY (99999) /* make sure SECURITY<INPUTSECURITY */
769  #endif
770 #else /* no INPUTREFERER list supplied */
771  #define INPUTREFERER NULL /* so init it as NULL pointer */
772 #endif
773 #ifndef INPUTPATH /* \input{} paths permitted for... */
774  #define INPUTPATH NULL /* ...any referer */
775 #endif
776 #ifndef INPUTSECURITY /* \input{} security not specified */
777  #ifdef INPUTOK /* but INPUTOK flag specified */
778  #define INPUTSECURITY (99999) /* so enable \input{} */
779  #ifndef EXPLICITDEFSECURITY /* don't override explicit default */
780  #undef DEFAULTSECURITY /* but we'll override our default */
781  #define DEFAULTSECURITY (99999) /*let -DINPUTOK enable \counter,etc*/
782  #endif
783  #else /* else no \input{} specified */
784  #define INPUTSECURITY DEFAULTSECURITY /* set default \input security */
785  #endif
786 #endif
787 #ifndef COUNTERSECURITY /*\counter{} security not specified*/
788  #ifdef COUNTEROK /* but COUNTEROK flag specified */
789  #define COUNTERSECURITY (99999) /* so enable \counter{} */
790  #else /* else no \counter{} specified */
791  #define COUNTERSECURITY DEFAULTSECURITY /*set default \counter security*/
792  #endif
793 #endif
794 #ifndef ENVIRONSECURITY /* \environ security not specified */
795  #ifdef ENVIRONOK /* but ENVIRONOK flag specified */
796  #define ENVIRONSECURITY (99999) /* so enable \environ */
797  #else /* else no \environ specified */
798  #define ENVIRONSECURITY DEFAULTSECURITY /*set default \environ security*/
799  #endif
800 #endif
801 /* --- image caching (cache images if given -DCACHEPATH=\"path\") --- */
802 #ifndef CACHEPATH
803  #define ISCACHING 0 /* no caching */
804  #define CACHEPATH "\000" /* same directory as mimetex.cgi */
805 #else
806  #define ISCACHING 1 /* caching if -DCACHEPATH="path" */
807 #endif
808 /* --- \input paths (prepend prefix if given -DPATHPREFIX=\"prefix\") --- */
809 #ifndef PATHPREFIX
810  #define PATHPREFIX "\000" /* paths relative mimetex.cgi */
811 #endif
812 /* --- time zone delta t (in hours) --- */
813 #ifndef TZDELTA
814  #define TZDELTA 0
815 #endif
816 /* --- treat +'s in query string as blanks? --- */
817 #ifdef PLUSBLANK /* + always interpreted as blank */
818  #define ISPLUSBLANK 1
819 #else
820  #ifdef PLUSNOTBLANK /* + never interpreted as blank */
821  #define ISPLUSBLANK 0
822  #else /* program tries to determine */
823  #define ISPLUSBLANK (-1)
824  #endif
825 #endif
826 
827 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
828 debugging and logging / error reporting
829 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
830 /* --- debugging and error reporting --- */
831 #ifndef MSGLEVEL
832  #define MSGLEVEL 1
833 #endif
834 #define DBGLEVEL 9 /* debugging if msglevel>=DBGLEVEL */
835 #define LOGLEVEL 3 /* logging if msglevel>=LOGLEVEL */
836 #ifndef FORMLEVEL
837  #define FORMLEVEL LOGLEVEL /*msglevel if called from html form*/
838 #endif
839 #ifndef ERRORSTATUS /* exit(ERRORSTATUS) for any error */
840  #define ERRORSTATUS 0 /* default doesn't signal errors */
841 #endif
842 GLOBAL(int,seclevel,SECURITY); /* security level */
843 GLOBAL(int,inputseclevel,INPUTSECURITY); /* \input{} security level */
844 GLOBAL(int,counterseclevel,COUNTERSECURITY); /* \counter{} security level */
845 GLOBAL(int,environseclevel,ENVIRONSECURITY); /* \environ{} security level */
846 GLOBAL(int,msglevel,MSGLEVEL); /* message level for verbose/debug */
847 GLOBAL(int,errorstatus,ERRORSTATUS); /* exit status if error encountered*/
848 GLOBAL(int,exitstatus,0); /* exit status (0=success) */
849 STATIC FILE *msgfp; /* output in command-line mode */
850 /* --- embed warnings in rendered expressions, [\xxx?] if \xxx unknown --- */
851 #ifdef WARNINGS
852  #define WARNINGLEVEL WARNINGS
853 #else
854  #ifdef NOWARNINGS
855  #define WARNINGLEVEL 0
856  #else
857  #define WARNINGLEVEL 1
858  #endif
859 #endif
860 GLOBAL(int,warninglevel,WARNINGLEVEL); /* warning level */
861 
862 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
863 control flags and values
864 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
865 GLOBAL(int,isquery,0); /* true=cgi?query; false=commandline*/
866 GLOBAL(int,daemonlevel,0); /* incremented in main() */
867 GLOBAL(int,recurlevel,0); /* inc/decremented in rasterize() */
868 GLOBAL(int,scriptlevel,0); /* inc/decremented in rastlimits() */
869 GLOBAL(int,isstring,0); /*pixmap is ascii string, not raster*/
870 GLOBAL(int,isligature,0); /* true if ligature found */
871 GLOBAL(char,*subexprptr,(char *)NULL); /* ptr within expression to subexpr*/
872 /*SHARED(int,imageformat,1);*/ /* image is 1=bitmap, 2=.gf-like */
873 GLOBAL(int,isdisplaystyle,1); /* displaystyle mode (forced if 2) */
874 GLOBAL(int,ispreambledollars,0); /* displaystyle mode set by $$...$$ */
875 GLOBAL(int,ninputcmds,0); /* # of \input commands processed */
876 GLOBAL(int,fontnum,0); /* cal=1,scr=2,rm=3,it=4,bb=5,bf=6 */
877 GLOBAL(int,fontsize,NORMALSIZE); /* current size */
878 GLOBAL(int,magstep,1); /* magstep (1=no change) */
879 GLOBAL(int,displaysize,DISPLAYSIZE); /* use \displaystyle when fontsize>=*/
880 GLOBAL(int,shrinkfactor,3); /* shrinkfactors[fontsize] */
881 GLOBAL(int,rastlift,0); /* rastraise() lift parameter */
882 GLOBAL(int,rastlift1,0); /* rastraise() lift for base exprssn*/
883 GLOBAL(double,unitlength,1.0); /* #pixels per unit (may be <1.0) */
884 GLOBAL(int,iunitlength,1); /* #pixels per unit as int for store*/
885 /*GLOBAL(int,textwidth,TEXTWIDTH);*/ /* #pixels across line */
886 GLOBAL(int,adfrequency,ADFREQUENCY); /* advertisement frequency */
887 GLOBAL(int,isnocatspace,0); /* >0 to not add space in rastcat()*/
888 GLOBAL(int,smashmargin,SMASHMARGIN); /* minimum "smash" margin */
889 GLOBAL(int,mathsmashmargin,SMASHMARGIN); /* needed for \text{if $n-m$ even}*/
890 GLOBAL(int,issmashdelta,1); /* true if smashmargin is a delta */
891 GLOBAL(int,isexplicitsmash,0); /* true if \smash explicitly given */
892 GLOBAL(int,smashcheck,SMASHCHECK); /* check if terms safe to smash */
893 GLOBAL(int,isnomath,0); /* true to inhibit math mode */
894 GLOBAL(int,isscripted,0); /* is (lefthand) term text-scripted*/
895 GLOBAL(int,isdelimscript,0); /* is \right delim text-scripted */
896 GLOBAL(int,issmashokay,0); /*is leading char okay for smashing*/
897 #define BLANKSIGNAL (-991234) /*rastsmash signal right-hand blank*/
898 GLOBAL(int,blanksignal,BLANKSIGNAL); /*rastsmash signal right-hand blank*/
899 GLOBAL(int,blanksymspace,0); /* extra (or too much) space wanted*/
900 GLOBAL(int,istransparent,ISTRANSPARENT);/* true sets background transparent*/
901 GLOBAL(int,fgred,FGRED);
902  GLOBAL(int,fggreen,FGGREEN);
903  GLOBAL(int,fgblue,FGBLUE); /* fg r,g,b */
904 GLOBAL(int,bgred,BGRED);
905  GLOBAL(int,bggreen,BGGREEN);
906  GLOBAL(int,bgblue,BGBLUE); /* bg r,g,b */
907 GLOBAL(double,gammacorrection,GAMMA); /* gamma correction */
908 GLOBAL(int,isplusblank,ISPLUSBLANK); /*interpret +'s in query as blanks?*/
909 GLOBAL(int,isblackonwhite,ISBLACKONWHITE); /*1=black on white,0=reverse*/
910 GLOBAL(char,exprprefix[256],PREFIX); /* prefix prepended to expressions */
911 GLOBAL(int,aaalgorithm,AAALGORITHM); /* for lp, 1=aalowpass, 2 =aapnm */
912 GLOBAL(int,maxfollow,MAXFOLLOW); /* aafollowline() maxturn parameter*/
913 GLOBAL(int,fgalias,1);
914  GLOBAL(int,fgonly,0);
915  GLOBAL(int,bgalias,0);
916  GLOBAL(int,bgonly,0); /* aapnm() params */
917 GLOBAL(int,issupersampling,ISSUPERSAMPLING); /*1=supersampling 0=lowpass*/
918 GLOBAL(int,isss,ISSUPERSAMPLING); /* supersampling flag for main() */
919 GLOBAL(int,ispbmpgm,0); /* true for pbm/pgm instead of gif */
920 GLOBAL(int,pbmpgmtype,0); /* 1=pbm / 2=pgm (else error) */
921 GLOBAL(int,*workingparam,(int *)NULL); /* working parameter */
922 GLOBAL(subraster,*workingbox,(subraster *)NULL); /*working subraster box*/
923 GLOBAL(int,isreplaceleft,0); /* true to replace leftexpression */
924 GLOBAL(subraster,*leftexpression,(subraster *)NULL); /*rasterized so far*/
925 GLOBAL(mathchardef,*leftsymdef,NULL); /* mathchardef for preceding symbol*/
926 GLOBAL(int,fraccenterline,NOVALUE); /* baseline for punct. after \frac */
927 /*GLOBAL(int,currentcharclass,NOVALUE);*/ /*primarily to check for PUNCTION*/
928 GLOBAL(int,iscaching,ISCACHING); /* true if caching images */
929 GLOBAL(char,cachepath[256],CACHEPATH); /* relative path to cached files */
930 GLOBAL(int,isemitcontenttype,1); /* true to emit mime content-type */
931 int iscachecontenttype = 0; /* true to cache mime content-type */
932 char contenttype[2048] = "\000"; /* content-type:, etc buffer */
933 GLOBAL(char,pathprefix[256],PATHPREFIX); /*prefix for \input,\counter paths*/
934 /*GLOBAL(int,iswindows,ISWINDOWS);*/ /* true if compiled for ms windows */
935 
936 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
937 store for evalterm() [n.b., these are stripped-down funcs from nutshell]
938 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
939 #define STORE struct store_struct /* "typedef" for store struct */
940 #define MAXSTORE 100 /* max 100 identifiers */
941 STORE {
942  char *identifier; /* identifier */
943  int *value; /* address of corresponding value */
944  } ; /* --- end-of-store_struct --- */
945 static STORE mimestore[MAXSTORE] = {
946  { "fontsize", &fontsize }, { "fs", &fontsize }, /* font size */
947  { "fontnum", &fontnum }, { "fn", &fontnum }, /* font number */
948  { "unitlength", &iunitlength }, /* unitlength */
949  /*{ "mytestvar", &mytestvar },*/
950  { NULL, NULL } /* end-of-store */
951  } ; /* --- end-of-mimestore[] --- */
952 
953 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
954 miscellaneous macros
955 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
956 #if 0 /* --- these are now #define'd in mimetex.h --- */
957 #define max2(x,y) ((x)>(y)? (x):(y)) /* larger of 2 arguments */
958 #define min2(x,y) ((x)<(y)? (x):(y)) /* smaller of 2 arguments */
959 #define max3(x,y,z) max2(max2(x,y),(z)) /* largest of 3 arguments */
960 #define min3(x,y,z) min2(min2(x,y),(z)) /* smallest of 3 arguments */
961 #define absval(x) ((x)>=0?(x):(-(x))) /* absolute value */
962 #define iround(x) ((int)((x)>=0?(x)+0.5:(x)-0.5)) /* round double to int */
963 #define dmod(x,y) ((x)-((y)*((double)((int)((x)/(y)))))) /*x%y for doubles*/
964 #endif
965 #define compress(s,c) if((s)!=NULL) /* remove embedded c's from s */ \
966  { char *p; while((p=strchr((s),(c)))!=NULL) {strsqueeze(p,1);} } else
967 #define slower(s) if ((s)!=NULL) /* lowercase all chars in s */ \
968  { char *p=(s); while(*p!='\000'){*p=tolower(*p); p++;} } else
969 /*subraster *subrastcpy();*/ /* need global module declaration */
970 /*#define spnosmash(sp) if (sp->type==CHARASTER) sp=subrastcpy(sp); \ */
971 /* sp->type=blanksignal */
972 /* ---evaluate \directive[arg] or \directive{arg} scaled by unitlength--- */
973 #define eround(arg) (iround(unitlength*((double)evalterm(mimestore,(arg)))))
974 /* --- check if a string is empty --- */
975 #define isempty(s) ((s)==NULL?1:(*(s)=='\000'?1:0))
976 /* --- last char of a string --- */
977 #define lastchar(s) (isempty(s)?'\000':*((s)+(strlen(s)-1)))
978 /* --- lowercase a string --- */
979 #define strlower(s) strnlower((s),0) /* lowercase an entire string */
980 /* --- strip leading and trailing whitespace (including ~) --- */
981 #define trimwhite(thisstr) if ( (thisstr) != NULL ) { \
982  int thislen = strlen(thisstr); \
983  while ( --thislen >= 0 ) \
984  if ( isthischar((thisstr)[thislen]," \t\n\r\f\v") ) \
985  (thisstr)[thislen] = '\000'; \
986  else break; \
987  if ( (thislen = strspn((thisstr)," \t\n\r\f\v")) > 0 ) \
988  {strsqueeze((thisstr),thislen);} } else
989 /* --- strncpy() n bytes and make sure it's null-terminated --- */
990 #define strninit(target,source,n) if( (target)!=NULL && (n)>=0 ) { \
991  char *thissource = (source); \
992  (target)[0] = '\000'; \
993  if ( (n)>0 && thissource!=NULL ) { \
994  strncpy((target),thissource,(n)); \
995  (target)[(n)] = '\000'; } }
996 /* --- strcpy(s,s+n) using memmove() (also works for negative n) --- */
997 #define strsqueeze(s,n) if((n)!=0) { if(!isempty((s))) { \
998  int thislen3=strlen(s); \
999  if ((n) >= thislen3) *(s) = '\000'; \
1000  else memmove(s,s+(n),1+thislen3-(n)); }} else/*user supplies final;*/
1001 /* --- strsqueeze(s,t) with two pointers --- */
1002 #define strsqueezep(s,t) if(!isempty((s))&&!isempty((t))) { \
1003  int sqlen=strlen((s))-strlen((t)); \
1004  if (sqlen>0 && sqlen<=999) {strsqueeze((s),sqlen);} } else
1005 
1006 /* ---
1007  * PART2
1008  * ------ */
1009 #if !defined(PARTS) || defined(PART2)
1010 /* ==========================================================================
1011  * Function: new_raster ( width, height, pixsz )
1012  * Purpose: Allocation and constructor for raster.
1013  * mallocs and initializes memory for width*height pixels,
1014  * and returns raster struct ptr to caller.
1015  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1016  * Arguments: width (I) int containing width, in bits,
1017  * of raster pixmap to be allocated
1018  * height (I) int containing height, in bits/scans,
1019  * of raster pixmap to be allocated
1020  * pixsz (I) int containing #bits per pixel, 1 or 8
1021  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1022  * Returns: ( raster * ) ptr to allocated and initialized
1023  * raster struct, or NULL for any error.
1024  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1025  * Notes:
1026  * ======================================================================= */
1027 /* --- entry point --- */
1028 raster *new_raster ( int width, int height, int pixsz )
1029 {
1030 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1031 Allocations and Declarations
1032 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1033 raster *rp = (raster *)NULL; /* raster ptr returned to caller */
1034 pixbyte *pixmap = NULL; /* raster pixel map to be malloced */
1035 int nbytes = pixsz*bitmapsz(width,height); /* #bytes needed for pixmap */
1036 int filler = (isstring?' ':0); /* pixmap filler */
1037 int delete_raster(); /* in case pixmap malloc() fails */
1038 int npadding = (0&&issupersampling?8+256:0); /* padding bytes */
1039 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1040 allocate and initialize raster struct and embedded bitmap
1041 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1042 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
1043  { fprintf(msgfp,"new_raster(%d,%d,%d)> entry point\n",
1044  width,height,pixsz); fflush(msgfp); }
1045 /* --- allocate and initialize raster struct --- */
1046 rp = (raster *)malloc(sizeof(raster)); /* malloc raster struct */
1047 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
1048  { fprintf(msgfp,"new_raster> rp=malloc(%d) returned (%s)\n",
1049  (int)sizeof(raster),(rp==NULL?"null ptr":"success")); fflush(msgfp); }
1050 if ( rp == (raster *)NULL ) /* malloc failed */
1051  goto end_of_job; /* return error to caller */
1052 rp->width = width; /* store width in raster struct */
1053 rp->height = height; /* and store height */
1054 rp->format = 1; /* initialize as bitmap format */
1055 rp->pixsz = pixsz; /* store #bits per pixel */
1056 rp->pixmap = (pixbyte *)NULL; /* init bitmap as null ptr */
1057 /* --- allocate and initialize bitmap array --- */
1058 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
1059  { fprintf(msgfp,"new_raster> calling pixmap=malloc(%d)\n",
1060  nbytes); fflush(msgfp); }
1061 if ( nbytes>0 && nbytes<=pixsz*maxraster ) /* fail if width*height too big*/
1062  pixmap = (pixbyte *)malloc(nbytes+npadding); /*bytes for width*height bits*/
1063 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
1064  { fprintf(msgfp,"new_raster> pixmap=malloc(%d) returned (%s)\n",
1065  nbytes,(pixmap==NULL?"null ptr":"success")); fflush(msgfp); }
1066 if ( pixmap == (pixbyte *)NULL ) /* malloc failed */
1067  { delete_raster(rp); /* so free everything */
1068  rp = (raster *)NULL; /* reset pointer */
1069  goto end_of_job; } /* and return error to caller */
1070 memset((void *)pixmap,filler,nbytes); /* init bytes to binary 0's or ' 's*/
1071 *pixmap = (pixbyte)0; /* and first byte alwasy 0 */
1072 rp->pixmap = pixmap; /* store ptr to malloced memory */
1073 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1074 Back to caller with address of raster struct, or NULL ptr for any error.
1075 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1076 end_of_job:
1077  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
1078  { fprintf(msgfp,"new_raster(%d,%d,%d)> returning (%s)\n",
1079  width,height,pixsz,(rp==NULL?"null ptr":"success")); fflush(msgfp); }
1080  return ( rp ); /* back to caller with raster */
1081 } /* --- end-of-function new_raster() --- */
1082 
1083 
1084 /* ==========================================================================
1085  * Function: new_subraster ( width, height, pixsz )
1086  * Purpose: Allocate a new subraster along with
1087  * an embedded raster of width x height.
1088  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1089  * Arguments: width (I) int containing width of embedded raster
1090  * height (I) int containing height of embedded raster
1091  * pixsz (I) int containing #bits per pixel, 1 or 8
1092  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1093  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to newly-allocated subraster,
1094  * or NULL for any error.
1095  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1096  * Notes: o if width or height <=0, embedded raster not allocated
1097  * ======================================================================= */
1098 /* --- entry point --- */
1099 subraster *new_subraster ( int width, int height, int pixsz )
1100 {
1101 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1102 Allocations and Declarations
1103 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1104 subraster *sp=NULL; /* subraster returned to caller */
1105 raster *new_raster(), *rp=NULL; /* image raster embedded in sp */
1106 int delete_subraster(); /* in case new_raster() fails */
1107 int size = NORMALSIZE, /* default size */
1108  baseline = height-1; /* and baseline */
1109 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1110 allocate and initialize subraster struct
1111 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1112 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
1113  { fprintf(msgfp,"new_subraster(%d,%d,%d)> entry point\n",
1114  width,height,pixsz); fflush(msgfp); }
1115 /* --- allocate subraster struct --- */
1116 sp = (subraster *)malloc(sizeof(subraster)); /* malloc subraster struct */
1117 if ( sp == (subraster *)NULL ) /* malloc failed */
1118  goto end_of_job; /* return error to caller */
1119 /* --- initialize subraster struct --- */
1120 sp->type = NOVALUE; /* character or image raster */
1121 sp->symdef = (mathchardef *)NULL; /* mathchardef identifying image */
1122 sp->baseline = baseline; /*0 if image is entirely descending*/
1123 sp->size = size; /* font size 0-4 */
1124 sp->toprow = sp->leftcol = (-1); /* upper-left corner of subraster */
1125 sp->image = (raster *)NULL; /*ptr to bitmap image of subraster*/
1126 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1127 allocate raster and embed it in subraster, and return to caller
1128 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1129 /* --- allocate raster struct if desired --- */
1130 if ( width>0 && height>0 && pixsz>0 ) /* caller wants raster */
1131  { if ( (rp=new_raster(width,height,pixsz)) /* allocate embedded raster */
1132  != NULL ) /* if allocate succeeded */
1133  sp->image = rp; /* embed raster in subraster */
1134  else /* or if allocate failed */
1135  { delete_subraster(sp); /* free non-unneeded subraster */
1136  sp = NULL; } } /* signal error */
1137 /* --- back to caller with new subraster or NULL --- */
1138 end_of_job:
1139  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
1140  { fprintf(msgfp,"new_subraster(%d,%d,%d)> returning (%s)\n",
1141  width,height,pixsz,(sp==NULL?"null ptr":"success")); fflush(msgfp); }
1142  return ( sp );
1143 } /* --- end-of-function new_subraster() --- */
1144 
1145 
1146 /* ==========================================================================
1147  * Function: new_chardef ( )
1148  * Purpose: Allocates and initializes a chardef struct,
1149  * but _not_ the embedded raster struct.
1150  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1151  * Arguments: none
1152  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1153  * Returns: ( chardef * ) ptr to allocated and initialized
1154  * chardef struct, or NULL for any error.
1155  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1156  * Notes:
1157  * ======================================================================= */
1158 /* --- entry point --- */
1159 chardef *new_chardef ( )
1160 {
1161 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1162 Allocations and Declarations
1163 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1164 chardef *cp = (chardef *)NULL; /* chardef ptr returned to caller */
1165 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1166 allocate and initialize chardef struct
1167 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1168 cp = (chardef *)malloc(sizeof(chardef)); /* malloc chardef struct */
1169 if ( cp == (chardef *)NULL ) /* malloc failed */
1170  goto end_of_job; /* return error to caller */
1171 cp->charnum = cp->location = 0; /* init character description */
1172 cp->toprow = cp->topleftcol = 0; /* init upper-left corner */
1173 cp->botrow = cp->botleftcol = 0; /* init lower-left corner */
1174 cp->image.width = cp->image.height = 0; /* init raster dimensions */
1175 cp->image.format = 0; /* init raster format */
1176 cp->image.pixsz = 0; /* and #bits per pixel */
1177 cp->image.pixmap = NULL; /* init raster pixmap as null */
1178 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1179 Back to caller with address of chardef struct, or NULL ptr for any error.
1180 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1181 end_of_job:
1182  return ( cp );
1183 } /* --- end-of-function new_chardef() --- */
1184 
1185 
1186 /* ==========================================================================
1187  * Function: delete_raster ( rp )
1188  * Purpose: Destructor for raster.
1189  * Frees memory for raster bitmap and struct.
1190  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1191  * Arguments: rp (I) ptr to raster struct to be deleted.
1192  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1193  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
1194  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
1195  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1196  * Notes:
1197  * ======================================================================= */
1198 /* --- entry point --- */
1199 int delete_raster ( raster *rp )
1200 {
1201 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1202 free raster bitmap and struct
1203 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1204 if ( rp != (raster *)NULL ) /* can't free null ptr */
1205  {
1206  if ( rp->pixmap != (pixbyte *)NULL ) /* can't free null ptr */
1207  free((void *)rp->pixmap); /* free pixmap within raster */
1208  free((void *)rp); /* lastly, free raster struct */
1209  } /* --- end-of-if(rp!=NULL) --- */
1210 return ( 1 ); /* back to caller, 1=okay 0=failed */
1211 } /* --- end-of-function delete_raster() --- */
1212 
1213 
1214 /* ==========================================================================
1215  * Function: delete_subraster ( sp )
1216  * Purpose: Deallocates a subraster (and embedded raster)
1217  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1218  * Arguments: sp (I) ptr to subraster struct to be deleted.
1219  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1220  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
1221  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
1222  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1223  * Notes:
1224  * ======================================================================= */
1225 /* --- entry point --- */
1226 int delete_subraster ( subraster *sp )
1227 {
1228 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1229 free subraster struct
1230 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1231 int delete_raster(); /* to delete embedded raster */
1232 if ( sp != (subraster *)NULL ) /* can't free null ptr */
1233  {
1234  if ( sp->type != CHARASTER ) /* not static character data */
1235  if ( sp->image != NULL ) /*raster allocated within subraster*/
1236  delete_raster(sp->image); /* so free embedded raster */
1237  free((void *)sp); /* and free subraster struct itself*/
1238  } /* --- end-of-if(sp!=NULL) --- */
1239 return ( 1 ); /* back to caller, 1=okay 0=failed */
1240 } /* --- end-of-function delete_subraster() --- */
1241 
1242 
1243 /* ==========================================================================
1244  * Function: delete_chardef ( cp )
1245  * Purpose: Deallocates a chardef (and bitmap of embedded raster)
1246  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1247  * Arguments: cp (I) ptr to chardef struct to be deleted.
1248  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1249  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
1250  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
1251  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1252  * Notes:
1253  * ======================================================================= */
1254 /* --- entry point --- */
1255 int delete_chardef ( chardef *cp )
1256 {
1257 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1258 free chardef struct
1259 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1260 if ( cp != (chardef *)NULL ) /* can't free null ptr */
1261  {
1262  if ( cp->image.pixmap != NULL ) /* pixmap allocated within raster */
1263  free((void *)cp->image.pixmap); /* so free embedded pixmap */
1264  free((void *)cp); /* and free chardef struct itself */
1265  } /* --- end-of-if(cp!=NULL) --- */
1266 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1267 Back to caller with 1=okay, 0=failed.
1268 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1269 return ( 1 );
1270 } /* --- end-of-function delete_chardef() --- */
1271 
1272 
1273 /* ==========================================================================
1274  * Function: rastcpy ( rp )
1275  * Purpose: makes duplicate copy of rp
1276  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1277  * Arguments: rp (I) ptr to raster struct to be copied
1278  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1279  * Returns: ( raster * ) ptr to new copy rp,
1280  * or NULL for any error.
1281  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1282  * Notes: o
1283  * ======================================================================= */
1284 /* --- entry point --- */
1285 raster *rastcpy ( raster *rp )
1286 {
1287 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1288 Allocations and Declarations
1289 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1290 raster *new_raster(), *newrp=NULL; /*copied raster returned to caller*/
1291 int height= (rp==NULL?0:rp->height), /* original and copied height */
1292  width = (rp==NULL?0:rp->width), /* original and copied width */
1293  pixsz = (rp==NULL?0:rp->pixsz), /* #bits per pixel */
1294  nbytes= (rp==NULL?0:(pixmapsz(rp))); /* #bytes in rp's pixmap */
1295 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1296 allocate rotated raster and fill it
1297 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1298 /* --- allocate copied raster with same width,height, and copy bitmap --- */
1299 if ( rp != NULL ) /* nothing to copy if ptr null */
1300  if ( (newrp = new_raster(width,height,pixsz)) /*same width,height in copy*/
1301  != NULL ) /* check that allocate succeeded */
1302  memcpy(newrp->pixmap,rp->pixmap,nbytes); /* fill copied raster pixmap */
1303 return ( newrp ); /* return copied raster to caller */
1304 } /* --- end-of-function rastcpy() --- */
1305 
1306 
1307 /* ==========================================================================
1308  * Function: subrastcpy ( sp )
1309  * Purpose: makes duplicate copy of sp
1310  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1311  * Arguments: sp (I) ptr to subraster struct to be copied
1312  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1313  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to new copy sp,
1314  * or NULL for any error.
1315  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1316  * Notes: o
1317  * ======================================================================= */
1318 /* --- entry point --- */
1319 subraster *subrastcpy ( subraster *sp )
1320 {
1321 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1322 Allocations and Declarations
1323 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1324 subraster *new_subraster(), *newsp=NULL; /* allocate new subraster */
1325 raster *rastcpy(), *newrp=NULL; /* and new raster image within it */
1326 int delete_subraster(); /* dealloc newsp if rastcpy() fails*/
1327 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1328 make copy, and return it to caller
1329 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1330 if ( sp == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* nothing to copy */
1331 /* --- allocate new subraster "envelope" for copy --- */
1332 if ( (newsp=new_subraster(0,0,0)) /* allocate subraster "envelope" */
1333 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if we fail to allocate */
1334 /* --- transparently copy original envelope to new one --- */
1335 memcpy((void *)newsp,(void *)sp,sizeof(subraster)); /* copy envelope */
1336 /* --- make a copy of the rasterized image itself, if there is one --- */
1337 if ( sp->image != NULL ) /* there's an image embedded in sp */
1338  if ( (newrp = rastcpy(sp->image)) /* so copy rasterized image in sp */
1339  == NULL ) /* failed to copy successfully */
1340  { delete_subraster(newsp); /* won't need newsp any more */
1341  newsp = NULL; /* because we're returning error */
1342  goto end_of_job; } /* back to caller with error signal*/
1343 /* --- set new params in new envelope --- */
1344 newsp->image = newrp; /* new raster image we just copied */
1345 switch ( sp->type ) /* set new raster image type */
1346  { case STRINGRASTER: case CHARASTER: newsp->type = STRINGRASTER; break;
1347  case ASCIISTRING: newsp->type = ASCIISTRING; break;
1348  case FRACRASTER: newsp->type = FRACRASTER; break;
1349  case BLANKSIGNAL: newsp->type = blanksignal; break;
1350  case IMAGERASTER: default: newsp->type = IMAGERASTER; break; }
1351 /* --- return copy of sp to caller --- */
1352 end_of_job:
1353  return ( newsp ); /* copy back to caller */
1354 } /* --- end-of-function subrastcpy() --- */
1355 
1356 
1357 /* ==========================================================================
1358  * Function: rastrot ( rp )
1359  * Purpose: rotates rp image 90 degrees right/clockwise
1360  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1361  * Arguments: rp (I) ptr to raster struct to be rotated
1362  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1363  * Returns: ( raster * ) ptr to new raster rotated relative to rp,
1364  * or NULL for any error.
1365  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1366  * Notes: o An underbrace is } rotated 90 degrees clockwise,
1367  * a hat is <, etc.
1368  * ======================================================================= */
1369 /* --- entry point --- */
1370 raster *rastrot ( raster *rp )
1371 {
1372 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1373 Allocations and Declarations
1374 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1375 raster *new_raster(), *rotated=NULL; /*rotated raster returned to caller*/
1376 int height = rp->height, irow, /* original height, row index */
1377  width = rp->width, icol, /* original width, column index */
1378  pixsz = rp->pixsz; /* #bits per pixel */
1379 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1380 allocate rotated raster and fill it
1381 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1382 /* --- allocate rotated raster with flipped width<-->height --- */
1383 if ( (rotated = new_raster(height,width,pixsz)) /* flip width,height */
1384 != NULL ) /* check that allocation succeeded */
1385  /* --- fill rotated raster --- */
1386  for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ ) /* for each row of rp */
1387  for ( icol=0; icol<width; icol++ ) /* and each column of rp */
1388  { int value = getpixel(rp,irow,icol);
1389  /* setpixel(rotated,icol,irow,value); } */
1390  setpixel(rotated,icol,(height-1-irow),value); }
1391 return ( rotated ); /* return rotated raster to caller */
1392 } /* --- end-of-function rastrot() --- */
1393 
1394 
1395 /* ==========================================================================
1396  * Function: rastmag ( rp, magstep )
1397  * Purpose: magnifies rp by integer magstep,
1398  * e.g., double-height and double-width if magstep=2
1399  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1400  * Arguments: rp (I) ptr to raster struct to be "magnified"
1401  * magstep (I) int containing magnification scale,
1402  * e.g., 2 to double the width and height of rp
1403  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1404  * Returns: ( raster * ) ptr to new raster magnified relative to rp,
1405  * or NULL for any error.
1406  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1407  * Notes: o
1408  * ======================================================================= */
1409 /* --- entry point --- */
1410 raster *rastmag ( raster *rp, int magstep )
1411 {
1412 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1413 Allocations and Declarations
1414 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1415 raster *new_raster(), *magnified=NULL; /* magnified raster back to caller */
1416 int height = rp->height, irow, /* height, row index */
1417  width = rp->width, icol, /* width, column index */
1418  mrow = 0, mcol = 0, /* dup pixels magstep*magstep times*/
1419  pixsz = rp->pixsz; /* #bits per pixel */
1420 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1421 check args
1422 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1423 if ( rp == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no input raster supplied */
1424 if ( magstep<1 || magstep>10 ) goto end_of_job; /* sanity check */
1425 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1426 allocate magnified raster and fill it
1427 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1428 /* --- allocate magnified raster with magstep*width, magstep*height --- */
1429 if ( (magnified = new_raster(magstep*width,magstep*height,pixsz))/*allocate*/
1430 != NULL ) /* check that allocation succeeded */
1431  /* --- fill reflected raster --- */
1432  for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ ) /* for each row of rp */
1433  for ( mrow=0; mrow<magstep; mrow++ ) /* dup row magstep times */
1434  for ( icol=0; icol<width; icol++ ) /* and for each column of rp */
1435  for ( mcol=0; mcol<magstep; mcol++ ) { /* dup col magstep times */
1436  int value = getpixel(rp,irow,icol);
1437  int row1 = irow*magstep, col1 = icol*magstep;
1438  setpixel(magnified,(row1+mrow),(col1+mcol),value); }
1439 end_of_job:
1440  return ( magnified ); /*return magnified raster to caller*/
1441 } /* --- end-of-function rastmag() --- */
1442 
1443 
1444 /* ==========================================================================
1445  * Function: bytemapmag ( bytemap, width, height, magstep )
1446  * Purpose: magnifies a bytemap by integer magstep,
1447  * e.g., double-height and double-width if magstep=2
1448  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1449  * Arguments: bytemap (I) intbyte * ptr to byte map to be "magnified"
1450  * width (I) int containing #cols in original bytemap
1451  * height (I) int containing #rows in original bytemap
1452  * magstep (I) int containing magnification scale,
1453  * e.g., 2 to double the width and height of rp
1454  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1455  * Returns: ( intbyte * ) ptr to new bytemap magnified relative to
1456  * original bytemap, or NULL for any error.
1457  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1458  * Notes: o Apply EPX/Scale2x/AdvMAME2x for magstep 2,
1459  * and Scale3x/AdvMAME3x for magstep 3,
1460  * as described by http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2xSaI
1461  * ======================================================================= */
1462 /* --- entry point --- */
1463 intbyte *bytemapmag ( intbyte *bytemap, int width, int height, int magstep )
1464 {
1465 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1466 Allocations and Declarations
1467 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1468 intbyte *magnified=NULL; /* magnified bytemap back to caller*/
1469 int irow, icol, /* original height, width indexes */
1470  mrow=0, mcol=0; /* dup bytes magstep*magstep times */
1471 int imap = (-1), /* original bytemap[] index */
1472  byteval = 0; /* byteval=bytemap[imap] */
1473 int isAdvMAME = 1; /* true to apply AdvMAME2x and 3x */
1474 int icell[10], /* bytemap[] nearest neighbors */
1475  bmmdiff = 64; /* nearest neighbor diff allowed */
1476 #define bmmeq(i,j) ((absval((icell[i]-icell[j]))<=bmmdiff)) /*approx equal*/
1477 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1478 check args
1479 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1480 if ( bytemap == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no input bytemap supplied */
1481 if ( width<1 || height<1 ) goto end_of_job; /* invalid bytemap dimensions */
1482 if ( width*height>100000 ) goto end_of_job; /* sanity check */
1483 if ( magstep<1 || magstep>10 ) goto end_of_job; /* sanity check */
1484 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1485 allocate magnified bytemap and fill it
1486 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1487 /* --- allocate bytemap for magstep*width, magstep*height --- */
1488 if ( (magnified = (intbyte *)(malloc(magstep*width*magstep*height)))/*alloc*/
1489 != NULL ) /* check that allocation succeeded */
1490  /* --- fill reflected raster --- */
1491  for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ ) /* for each row of bytemap */
1492  for ( icol=0; icol<width; icol++ ) { /* and for each column of bytemap */
1493  int imag1 = (icol + irow*(width*magstep))*magstep; /*upper-left corner*/
1494  imap++; /* bump bytemap[] index */
1495  byteval = (int)(bytemap[imap]); /* grayscale value at this pixel */
1496  for ( mrow=0; mrow<magstep; mrow++ ) /* dup row magstep times */
1497  for ( mcol=0; mcol<magstep; mcol++ ) { /* dup col magstep times */
1498  int idup = mcol + mrow*(width*magstep); /* offset from imag1 */
1499  int imag = imag1+idup; /* adjust magnified[imag] */
1500  magnified[imag] = (intbyte)(byteval);
1501  /* --- apply AdvMAME2x and 3x (if desired) --- */
1502  if ( isAdvMAME ) { /* AdvMAME2x and 3x wanted */
1503  int mcell = 1 + mcol + magstep*mrow; /*1,2,3,4 or 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9*/
1504  icell[5]= byteval, /* center cell of 3x3 bytemap[] */
1505  icell[4]= (icol>0?(int)(bytemap[imap-1]):byteval), /*left of center*/
1506  icell[6]= (icol<width?(int)(bytemap[imap+1]):byteval), /*right*/
1507  icell[2]= (irow>0?(int)(bytemap[imap-width]):byteval),/*above center*/
1508  icell[8]= (irow<height?(int)(bytemap[imap+width]):byteval), /*below*/
1509  icell[1]= (irow>0&&icol>0?(int)(bytemap[imap-width-1]):byteval),
1510  icell[3]= (irow>0&&icol<width?(int)(bytemap[imap-width+1]):byteval),
1511  icell[7]= (irow<height&&icol>0?(int)(bytemap[imap+width-1]):byteval),
1512  icell[9]=(irow<height&&icol<width?(int)(bytemap[imap+width+1]):byteval);
1513  switch ( magstep ) { /* 2x magstep=2, 3x magstep=3 */
1514  default: break; /* no AdvMAME at other magsteps */
1515  case 2: /* AdvMAME2x */
1516  if ( mcell == 1 )
1517  if ( bmmeq(4,2) && !bmmeq(4,8) && !bmmeq(2,6) )
1518  magnified[imag] = icell[2];
1519  if ( mcell == 2 )
1520  if ( bmmeq(2,6) && !bmmeq(2,4) && !bmmeq(6,8) )
