1521  magnified[imag] = icell[6];
1522  if ( mcell == 4 )
1523  if ( bmmeq(6,8) && !bmmeq(6,2) && !bmmeq(8,4) )
1524  magnified[imag] = icell[8];
1525  if ( mcell == 3 )
1526  if ( bmmeq(8,4) && !bmmeq(8,6) && !bmmeq(4,2) )
1527  magnified[imag] = icell[4];
1528  break;
1529  case 3: /* AdvMAME3x */
1530  if ( mcell == 1 )
1531  if ( bmmeq(4,2) && !bmmeq(4,8) && !bmmeq(2,6) )
1532  magnified[imag] = icell[4];
1533  if ( mcell == 2 )
1534  if ( (bmmeq(4,2) && !bmmeq(4,8) && !bmmeq(2,6) && !bmmeq(5,3))
1535  || (bmmeq(2,6) && !bmmeq(2,4) && !bmmeq(6,8) && !bmmeq(5,1)) )
1536  magnified[imag] = icell[2];
1537  if ( mcell == 3 )
1538  if ( bmmeq(2,6) && !bmmeq(2,4) && !bmmeq(6,8) )
1539  magnified[imag] = icell[6];
1540  if ( mcell == 4 )
1541  if ( (bmmeq(8,4) && !bmmeq(8,6) && !bmmeq(4,2) && !bmmeq(5,1))
1542  || (bmmeq(4,2) && !bmmeq(4,8) && !bmmeq(2,6) && !bmmeq(5,7)) )
1543  magnified[imag] = icell[4];
1544  if ( mcell == 6 )
1545  if ( (bmmeq(2,6) && !bmmeq(2,4) && !bmmeq(6,8) && !bmmeq(5,9))
1546  || (bmmeq(6,8) && !bmmeq(6,2) && !bmmeq(8,4) && !bmmeq(5,3)) )
1547  magnified[imag] = icell[6];
1548  if ( mcell == 7 )
1549  if ( bmmeq(8,4) && !bmmeq(8,6) && !bmmeq(4,2) )
1550  magnified[imag] = icell[4];
1551  if ( mcell == 8 )
1552  if ( (bmmeq(6,8) && !bmmeq(6,2) && !bmmeq(8,4) && !bmmeq(5,7))
1553  || (bmmeq(8,4) && !bmmeq(8,6) && !bmmeq(4,2) && !bmmeq(5,9)) )
1554  magnified[imag] = icell[8];
1555  if ( mcell == 9 )
1556  if ( bmmeq(6,8) && !bmmeq(6,2) && !bmmeq(8,4) )
1557  magnified[imag] = icell[6];
1558  break;
1559  } } /* --- end-of-switch(magstep) --- */
1560  } /* --- end-of-for(mrow,mcol) --- */
1561  } /* --- end-of-for(irow,icol) --- */
1562 end_of_job:
1563  return ( magnified ); /*return magnified raster to caller*/
1564 } /* --- end-of-function bytemapmag() --- */
1565 
1566 
1567 /* ==========================================================================
1568  * Function: rastref ( rp, axis )
1569  * Purpose: reflects rp, horizontally about y-axis |_ becomes _| if axis=1
1570  * or vertically about x-axis M becomes W if axis=2.
1571  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1572  * Arguments: rp (I) ptr to raster struct to be reflected
1573  * axis (I) int containing 1 for horizontal reflection,
1574  * or 2 for vertical
1575  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1576  * Returns: ( raster * ) ptr to new raster reflected relative to rp,
1577  * or NULL for any error.
1578  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1579  * Notes: o
1580  * ======================================================================= */
1581 /* --- entry point --- */
1582 raster *rastref ( raster *rp, int axis )
1583 {
1584 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1585 Allocations and Declarations
1586 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1587 raster *new_raster(), *reflected=NULL; /* reflected raster back to caller */
1588 int height = rp->height, irow, /* height, row index */
1589  width = rp->width, icol, /* width, column index */
1590  pixsz = rp->pixsz; /* #bits per pixel */
1591 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1592 allocate reflected raster and fill it
1593 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1594 /* --- allocate reflected raster with same width, height --- */
1595 if ( axis==1 || axis==2 ) /* first validate axis arg */
1596  if ( (reflected = new_raster(width,height,pixsz)) /* same width, height */
1597  != NULL ) /* check that allocation succeeded */
1598  /* --- fill reflected raster --- */
1599  for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ ) /* for each row of rp */
1600  for ( icol=0; icol<width; icol++ ) { /* and each column of rp */
1601  int value = getpixel(rp,irow,icol);
1602  if ( axis == 1 ) { setpixel(reflected,irow,width-1-icol,value); }
1603  if ( axis == 2 ) { setpixel(reflected,height-1-irow,icol,value); } }
1604 return ( reflected ); /*return reflected raster to caller*/
1605 } /* --- end-of-function rastref() --- */
1606 
1607 
1608 /* ==========================================================================
1609  * Function: rastput ( target, source, top, left, isopaque )
1610  * Purpose: Overlays source onto target,
1611  * with the 0,0-bit of source onto the top,left-bit of target.
1612  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1613  * Arguments: target (I) ptr to target raster struct
1614  * source (I) ptr to source raster struct
1615  * top (I) int containing 0 ... target->height - 1
1616  * left (I) int containing 0 ... target->width - 1
1617  * isopaque (I) int containing false (zero) to allow
1618  * original 1-bits of target to "show through"
1619  * 0-bits of source.
1620  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1621  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
1622  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
1623  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1624  * Notes:
1625  * ======================================================================= */
1626 /* --- entry point --- */
1627 int rastput ( raster *target, raster *source,
1628  int top, int left, int isopaque )
1629 {
1630 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1631 Allocations and Declarations
1632 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1633 int irow, icol, /* indexes over source raster */
1634  twidth=target->width, theight=target->height, /*target width,height*/
1635  tpix, ntpix = twidth*theight; /* #pixels in target */
1636 int isfatal = 0, /* true to abend on out-of-bounds error */
1637  isstrict = 0/*1*/, /* true for strict bounds check - no "wrap"*/
1638  isokay = 1; /* true if no pixels out-of-bounds */
1639 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1640 superimpose source onto target, one bit at a time
1641 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1642 if ( isstrict && (top<0 || left<0) ) /* args fail strict test */
1643  isokay = 0; /* so just return error */
1644 else
1645  for ( irow=0; irow<source->height; irow++ ) /* for each scan line */
1646  {
1647  tpix = (top+irow)*target->width + left - 1; /*first target pixel (-1)*/
1648  for ( icol=0; icol<source->width; icol++ ) /* each pixel in scan line */
1649  {
1650  int svalue = getpixel(source,irow,icol); /* source pixel value */
1651  ++tpix; /* bump target pixel */
1652  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 ) /* debugging output */
1653  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastput> tpix,ntpix=%d,%d top,irow,theight=%d,%d,%d "
1654  "left,icol,twidth=%d,%d,%d\n", tpix,ntpix, top,irow,theight,
1655  left,icol,twidth); fflush(msgfp); }
1656  if ( tpix >= ntpix /* bounds check failed */
1657  || (isstrict && (irow+top>=theight || icol+left>=twidth)) )
1658  { isokay = 0; /* reset okay flag */
1659  if ( isfatal ) goto end_of_job; /* abort if error is fatal */
1660  else break; } /*or just go on to next row*/
1661  if ( tpix >= 0 ) /* bounds check okay */
1662  if ( svalue!=0 || isopaque ) { /*got dark or opaque source*/
1663  setpixel(target,irow+top,icol+left,svalue); }/*overlay source on targ*/
1664  } /* --- end-of-for(icol) --- */
1665  } /* --- end-of-for(irow) --- */
1666 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1667 Back to caller with 1=okay, 0=failed.
1668 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1669 end_of_job:
1670  return ( isokay /*isfatal? (tpix<ntpix? 1:0) : 1*/ );
1671 } /* --- end-of-function rastput() --- */
1672 
1673 
1674 /* ==========================================================================
1675  * Function: rastcompose ( sp1, sp2, offset2, isalign, isfree )
1676  * Purpose: Overlays sp2 on top of sp1, leaving both unchanged
1677  * and returning a newly-allocated composite subraster.
1678  * Frees/deletes input sp1 and/or sp2 depending on value
1679  * of isfree (0=none, 1=sp1, 2=sp2, 3=both).
1680  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1681  * Arguments: sp1 (I) subraster * to "underneath" subraster,
1682  * whose baseline is preserved
1683  * sp2 (I) subraster * to "overlaid" subraster
1684  * offset2 (I) int containing 0 or number of pixels
1685  * to horizontally shift sp2 relative to sp1,
1686  * either positive (right) or negative
1687  * isalign (I) int containing 1 to align baselines,
1688  * or 0 to vertically center sp2 over sp1.
1689  * For isalign=2, images are vertically
1690  * centered, but then adjusted by \raisebox
1691  * lifts, using global variables rastlift1
1692  * for sp1 and rastlift for sp2.
1693  * isfree (I) int containing 1=free sp1 before return,
1694  * 2=free sp2, 3=free both, 0=free none.
1695  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1696  * Returns: ( subraster * ) pointer to constructed subraster
1697  * or NULL for any error
1698  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1699  * Notes: o The top-left corner of each raster box has coords (0,0),
1700  * down to (h-1,w-1) for a box of height h and width w.
1701  * o A raster's baseline, b, is typically 0 <= b < h.
1702  * But b can actually go out-of-bounds, b>=h or b<0, for
1703  * an image additionally lifted (b>=h) or lowered (b<0)
1704  * with respect to the surrounding expression.
1705  * o Note that b=h-1 means no descenders and the bottom
1706  * of the symbol rests exactly on the baseline,
1707  * whereas b=0 means the top pixel of the symbol rests
1708  * on the baseline, and all other pixels are descenders.
1709  * o The composite raster is constructed as follows...
1710  * The base image is labelled height h1 and baseline b1,
1711  * the overlay h2 and b2, and the composite H and B.
1712  * base overlay
1713  * --- +------------------------+ --- For the overlay to be
1714  * ^ | ^ +----------+| ^ vertically centered with
1715  * | | | | || | respect to the base,
1716  * | | |B-b1 | || | B - b1 = H-B -(h1-b1), so
1717  * | | v | || | 2*B = H-h1 + 2*b1
1718  * | |+----------+| || | B = b1 + (H-h1)/2
1719  * B || ^ ^ || || | And when the base image is
1720  * | || | | || || | bigger, H=h1 and B=b1 is
1721  * | || b1 | || || | the obvious correct answer.
1722  * | || | h1 || || H=h2
1723  * v || v | || || |
1724  * ----------||-------|--|| ||--|--------
1725  * baseline || h1-b1 v || overlay || |
1726  * for base |+----------+| baseline || |
1727  * and com- | ^ | ignored || |
1728  * posite | |H-B- |----------|| |
1729  * | | (h1-b1)| || |
1730  * | v +----------+| v
1731  * +------------------------+ ---
1732  * ======================================================================= */
1733 /* --- entry point --- */
1734 subraster *rastcompose ( subraster *sp1, subraster *sp2, int offset2,
1735  int isalign, int isfree )
1736 {
1737 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1738 Allocations and Declarations
1739 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1740 subraster *new_subraster(), *sp=(subraster *)NULL; /* returned subraster */
1741 raster *rp=(raster *)NULL; /* new composite raster in sp */
1742 int delete_subraster(); /* in case isfree non-zero */
1743 int rastput(); /*place sp1,sp2 in composite raster*/
1744 int base1 = sp1->baseline, /*baseline for underlying subraster*/
1745  height1 = (sp1->image)->height, /* height for underlying subraster */
1746  width1 = (sp1->image)->width, /* width for underlying subraster */
1747  pixsz1 = (sp1->image)->pixsz, /* pixsz for underlying subraster */
1748  base2 = sp2->baseline, /*baseline for overlaid subraster */
1749  height2 = (sp2->image)->height, /* height for overlaid subraster */
1750  width2 = (sp2->image)->width, /* width for overlaid subraster */
1751  pixsz2 = (sp2->image)->pixsz; /* pixsz for overlaid subraster */
1752 int height = max2(height1,height2), /*composite height if sp2 centered*/
1753  base = base1 + (height-height1)/2, /* and composite baseline */
1754  tlc2 = (height-height2)/2, /* top-left corner for overlay */
1755  width=0, pixsz=0; /* other params for composite */
1756 int lift1 = rastlift1, /* vertical \raisebox lift for sp1 */
1757  lift2 = rastlift; /* vertical \raisebox lift for sp2 */
1758 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1759 Initialization
1760 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1761 /* --- determine height, width and baseline of composite raster --- */
1762 switch ( isalign ) {
1763  default:
1764  case 0: /* centered, baselines not aligned */
1765  height = max2(height1,height2); /* max height */
1766  base = base1 + (height-height1)/2; /* baseline for sp1 */
1767  break;
1768  case 1: /* baselines of sp1,sp2 aligned */
1769  height = max2(base1+1,base2+1) /* max height above baseline */
1770  + max2(height1-base1-1,height2-base2-1); /*+max descending below*/
1771  base = max2(base1,base2); /* max space above baseline */
1772  break;
1773  case 2: /* centered +/- \raisebox lifts */
1774  base1 -= lift1; base2 -= lift2; /* reset to unlifted images */
1775  /* --- start with default for centered, unlifted images --- */
1776  height2 += 2*absval(lift2); /* "virtual" height of overlay */
1777  height = max2(height1,height2); /* max height */
1778  base = base1 + (height-height1)/2; /* baseline for sp1 */
1779  tlc2 = (height-height2)/2 /* top-left corner for overlay */
1780  + (lift2>=0?0:2*absval(lift2)); /* "reflect" overlay below base */
1781  break;
1782  } /* --- end-of-switch(isalign) --- */
1783 width = max2(width1,width2+abs(offset2)); /* max width */
1784 pixsz = max2(pixsz1,pixsz2); /* bitmap,bytemap becomes bytemap */
1785 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1786 allocate concatted composite subraster
1787 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1788 /* --- allocate returned subraster (and then initialize it) --- */
1789 if ( (sp=new_subraster(width,height,pixsz)) /* allocate new subraster */
1790 == (subraster *)NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* failed, so quit */
1791 /* --- initialize subraster parameters --- */
1792 sp->type = IMAGERASTER; /* image */
1793 sp->baseline = base; /* composite baseline */
1794 sp->size = sp1->size; /* underlying char is sp1 */
1795 if ( isalign == 2 ) sp->baseline += lift1; /* adjust baseline */
1796 /* --- extract raster from subraster --- */
1797 rp = sp->image; /* raster allocated in subraster */
1798 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1799 overlay sp1 and sp2 in new composite raster
1800 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1801 switch ( isalign ) {
1802  default:
1803  case 0: /* centered, baselines not aligned */
1804  rastput (rp, sp1->image, base-base1, (width-width1)/2, 1); /*underlying*/
1805  rastput (rp, sp2->image, (height-height2)/2, /*overlaid*/
1806  (width-width2)/2+offset2, 0);
1807  break;
1808  case 1: /* baselines of sp1,sp2 aligned */
1809  rastput (rp, sp1->image, base-base1, (width-width1)/2, 1); /*underlying*/
1810  rastput (rp, sp2->image, base-base2, /*overlaid*/
1811  (width-width2)/2+offset2, 0);
1812  break;
1813  case 2: if(1){ /* centered +/- \raisebox lifts */
1814  rastput (rp, sp1->image, base-base1, (width-width1)/2, 1);
1815  rastput (rp, sp2->image, tlc2, (width-width2)/2+offset2, 0); }
1816  break;
1817  } /* --- end-of-switch(isalign) --- */
1818 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1819 free input if requested
1820 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1821 if ( isfree > 0 ) /* caller wants input freed */
1822  { if ( isfree==1 || isfree>2 ) delete_subraster(sp1); /* free sp1 */
1823  if ( isfree >= 2 ) delete_subraster(sp2); } /* and/or sp2 */
1824 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1825 Back to caller with pointer to concatted subraster or with null for error
1826 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1827 end_of_job:
1828  return ( sp ); /* back with subraster or null ptr */
1829 } /* --- end-of-function rastcompose() --- */
1830 
1831 
1832 /* ==========================================================================
1833  * Function: rastcat ( sp1, sp2, isfree )
1834  * Purpose: "Concatanates" subrasters sp1||sp2, leaving both unchanged
1835  * and returning a newly-allocated subraster.
1836  * Frees/deletes input sp1 and/or sp2 depending on value
1837  * of isfree (0=none, 1=sp1, 2=sp2, 3=both).
1838  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1839  * Arguments: sp1 (I) subraster * to left-hand subraster
1840  * sp2 (I) subraster * to right-hand subraster
1841  * isfree (I) int containing 1=free sp1 before return,
1842  * 2=free sp2, 3=free both, 0=free none.
1843  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1844  * Returns: ( subraster * ) pointer to constructed subraster sp1||sp2
1845  * or NULL for any error
1846  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1847  * Notes:
1848  * ======================================================================= */
1849 /* --- entry point --- */
1850 subraster *rastcat ( subraster *sp1, subraster *sp2, int isfree )
1851 {
1852 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1853 Allocations and Declarations
1854 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1855 subraster *new_subraster(), *sp=(subraster *)NULL; /* returned subraster */
1856 raster *rp=(raster *)NULL; /* new concatted raster */
1857 int delete_subraster(); /* in case isfree non-zero */
1858 int rastput(); /*place sp1,sp2 in concatted raster*/
1859 int type_raster(); /* debugging display */
1860 int base1 = sp1->baseline, /*baseline for left-hand subraster*/
1861  height1 = (sp1->image)->height, /* height for left-hand subraster */
1862  width1 = (sp1->image)->width, /* width for left-hand subraster */
1863  pixsz1 = (sp1->image)->pixsz, /* pixsz for left-hand subraster */
1864  type1 = sp1->type, /* image type for left-hand */
1865  base2 = sp2->baseline, /*baseline for right-hand subraster*/
1866  height2 = (sp2->image)->height, /* height for right-hand subraster */
1867  width2 = (sp2->image)->width, /* width for right-hand subraster */
1868  pixsz2 = (sp2->image)->pixsz, /* pixsz for right-hand subraster */
1869  type2 = sp2->type; /* image type for right-hand */
1870 int height=0, width=0, pixsz=0, base=0; /*concatted sp1||sp2 composite*/
1871 int issmash = (smashmargin!=0?1:0), /* true to "squash" sp1||sp2 */
1872  isopaque = (issmash?0:1), /* not oppaque if smashing */
1873  rastsmash(), isblank=0, nsmash=0, /* #cols to smash */
1874  oldsmashmargin = smashmargin, /* save original smashmargin */
1875  oldblanksymspace = blanksymspace, /* save original blanksymspace */
1876  oldnocatspace = isnocatspace; /* save original isnocatspace */
1877 mathchardef *symdef1 = sp1->symdef, /*mathchardef of last left-hand char*/
1878  *symdef2 = sp2->symdef; /* mathchardef of right-hand char */
1879 int class1 = (symdef1==NULL?ORDINARY:symdef1->class), /* symdef->class */
1880  class2 = (symdef2==NULL?ORDINARY:symdef2->class), /* or default */
1881  smash1 = (symdef1!=NULL)&&(class1==ORDINARY||class1==VARIABLE||
1882  class1==OPENING||class1==CLOSING||class1==PUNCTION),
1883  smash2 = (symdef2!=NULL)&&(class2==ORDINARY||class2==VARIABLE||
1884  class2==OPENING||class2==CLOSING||class2==PUNCTION),
1885  space = fontsize/2+1; /* #cols between sp1 and sp2 */
1886 int isfrac = (type1 == FRACRASTER /* sp1 is a \frac */
1887  && class2 == PUNCTION); /* and sp2 is punctuation */
1888 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1889 Initialization
1890 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1891 /* --- determine inter-character space from character class --- */
1892 if ( !isstring )
1893  space = max2(2,(symspace[class1][class2] + fontsize-3)); /* space */
1894 else space = 1; /* space for ascii string */
1895 if ( isnocatspace > 0 ) { /* spacing explicitly turned off */
1896  space = 0; /* reset space */
1897  isnocatspace--; } /* and decrement isnocatspace flag */
1898 if ( 0 && sp1->type == BLANKSIGNAL ) space=0; /*implicitly turn off spacing*/
1899 if ( sp1->type==BLANKSIGNAL && sp2->type==BLANKSIGNAL ) /* both blank */
1900  space = 0; /* no extra space between spaces */
1901 if ( sp2->type != BLANKSIGNAL ) /* not a blank space signal */
1902  if ( blanksymspace != 0 ) { /* and we have a space adjustment */
1903  space = max2(0,space+blanksymspace); /* adjust as much as possible */
1904  blanksymspace = 0; } /* and reset adjustment */
1905 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 ) /* display space results */
1906  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastcat> space=%d, blanksymspace=%d, isnocatspace=%d\n",
1907  space,oldblanksymspace,oldnocatspace); fflush(msgfp); }
1908 /* --- determine smash --- */
1909 if ( !isstring && !isfrac ) /* don't smash strings or \frac's */
1910  if ( issmash ) { /* raster smash wanted */
1911  int maxsmash = rastsmash(sp1,sp2), /* calculate max smash space */
1912  margin = smashmargin; /* init margin without delta */
1913  if ( (1 && smash1 && smash2) /* concatanating two chars */
1914  || (1 && type1!=IMAGERASTER && type2!=IMAGERASTER
1915  && type1!=FRACRASTER && type2!=FRACRASTER ) )
1916  /*maxsmash = 0;*/ /* turn off smash */
1917  margin = max2(space-1,0); /* force small smashmargin */
1918  else /* adjust for delta if images */
1919  if ( issmashdelta ) /* smashmargin is a delta value */
1920  margin += fontsize; /* add displaystyle base to margin */
1921  if ( maxsmash == blanksignal ) /* sp2 is intentional blank */
1922  isblank = 1; /* set blank flag signal */
1923  else /* see how much extra space we have*/
1924  if ( maxsmash > margin ) /* enough space for adjustment */
1925  nsmash = maxsmash-margin; /* make adjustment */
1926  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 ) /* display smash results */
1927  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastcat> maxsmash=%d, margin=%d, nsmash=%d\n",
1928  maxsmash,margin,nsmash);
1929  fprintf(msgfp,"rastcat> type1=%d,2=%d, class1=%d,2=%d\n", type1,type2,
1930  (symdef1==NULL?-999:class1),(symdef2==NULL?-999:class2));
1931  fflush(msgfp); }
1932  } /* --- end-of-if(issmash) --- */
1933 /* --- determine height, width and baseline of composite raster --- */
1934 if ( !isstring )
1935  { height = max2(base1+1,base2+1) /* max height above baseline */
1936  + max2(height1-base1-1,height2-base2-1); /*+ max descending below*/
1937  width = width1+width2 + space-nsmash; /*add widths and space-smash*/
1938  width = max3(width,width1,width2); } /* don't "over-smash" composite */
1939 else /* ascii string */
1940  { height = 1; /* default */
1941  width = width1 + width2 + space - 1; } /* no need for two nulls */
1942 pixsz = max2(pixsz1,pixsz2); /* bitmap||bytemap becomes bytemap */
1943 base = max2(base1,base2); /* max space above baseline */
1944 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 ) /* display components */
1945  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastcat> Left-hand ht,width,pixsz,base = %d,%d,%d,%d\n",
1946  height1,width1,pixsz1,base1);
1947  type_raster(sp1->image,msgfp); /* display left-hand raster */
1948  fprintf(msgfp,"rastcat> Right-hand ht,width,pixsz,base = %d,%d,%d,%d\n",
1949  height2,width2,pixsz2,base2);
1950  type_raster(sp2->image,msgfp); /* display right-hand raster */
1951  fprintf(msgfp,
1952  "rastcat> Composite ht,width,smash,pixsz,base = %d,%d,%d,%d,%d\n",
1953  height,width,nsmash,pixsz,base);
1954  fflush(msgfp); } /* flush msgfp buffer */
1955 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1956 allocate concatted composite subraster
1957 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1958 /* --- allocate returned subraster (and then initialize it) --- */
1959 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
1960  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastcat> calling new_subraster(%d,%d,%d)\n",
1961  width,height,pixsz); fflush(msgfp); }
1962 if ( (sp=new_subraster(width,height,pixsz)) /* allocate new subraster */
1963 == (subraster *)NULL ) /* failed */
1964  { if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=1 ) /* report failure */
1965  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastcat> new_subraster(%d,%d,%d) failed\n",
1966  width,height,pixsz); fflush(msgfp); }
1967  goto end_of_job; } /* failed, so quit */
1968 /* --- initialize subraster parameters --- */
1969 /* sp->type = (!isstring?STRINGRASTER:ASCIISTRING); */ /*concatted string*/
1970 if ( !isstring )
1971  sp->type = /*type2;*//*(type1==type2?type2:IMAGERASTER);*/
1972  (type2!=CHARASTER? type2 :
1973  (type1!=CHARASTER&&type1!=BLANKSIGNAL
1974  &&type1!=FRACRASTER?type1:IMAGERASTER));
1975 else
1976  sp->type = ASCIISTRING; /* concatted ascii string */
1977 sp->symdef = symdef2; /* rightmost char is sp2 */
1978 sp->baseline = base; /* composite baseline */
1979 sp->size = sp2->size; /* rightmost char is sp2 */
1980 if ( isblank ) /* need to propagate blanksignal */
1981  sp->type = blanksignal; /* may not be completely safe??? */
1982 /* --- extract raster from subraster --- */
1983 rp = sp->image; /* raster allocated in subraster */
1984 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1985 overlay sp1 and sp2 in new composite raster
1986 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1987 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
1988  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastcat> calling rastput() to concatanate left||right\n");
1989  fflush(msgfp); } /* flush msgfp buffer */
1990 if ( !isstring )
1991  rastput (rp, sp1->image, base-base1, /* overlay left-hand */
1992  max2(0,nsmash-width1), 1); /* plus any residual smash space */
1993 else
1994  memcpy(rp->pixmap,(sp1->image)->pixmap,width1-1); /*init left string*/
1995 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
1996  { type_raster(sp->image,msgfp); /* display composite raster */
1997  fflush(msgfp); } /* flush msgfp buffer */
1998 if ( !isstring )
1999  { int fracbase = ( isfrac? /* baseline for punc after \frac */
2000  max2(fraccenterline,base2):base ); /*adjust baseline or use original*/
2001  rastput (rp, sp2->image, fracbase-base2, /* overlay right-hand */
2002  max2(0,width1+space-nsmash), isopaque); /* minus any smashed space */
2003  if ( 1 && type1 == FRACRASTER /* we're done with \frac image */
2004  && type2 != FRACRASTER ) /* unless we have \frac\frac */
2005  fraccenterline = NOVALUE; /* so reset centerline signal */
2006  if ( fraccenterline != NOVALUE ) /* sp2 is a fraction */
2007  fraccenterline += (base-base2); } /* so adjust its centerline */
2008 else
2009  { strcpy((char *)(rp->pixmap)+width1-1+space,(char *)((sp2->image)->pixmap));
2010  ((char *)(rp->pixmap))[width1+width2+space-2] = '\000'; } /*null-term*/
2011 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9999 )
2012  { type_raster(sp->image,msgfp); /* display composite raster */
2013  fflush(msgfp); } /* flush msgfp buffer */
2014 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2015 free input if requested
2016 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2017 if ( isfree > 0 ) /* caller wants input freed */
2018  { if ( isfree==1 || isfree>2 ) delete_subraster(sp1); /* free sp1 */
2019  if ( isfree >= 2 ) delete_subraster(sp2); } /* and/or sp2 */
2020 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2021 Back to caller with pointer to concatted subraster or with null for error
2022 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2023 end_of_job:
2024  smashmargin = oldsmashmargin; /* reset original smashmargin */
2025  return ( sp ); /* back with subraster or null ptr */
2026 } /* --- end-of-function rastcat() --- */
2027 
2028 
2029 /* ==========================================================================
2030  * Function: rastack ( sp1, sp2, base, space, iscenter, isfree )
2031  * Purpose: Stack subrasters sp2 atop sp1, leaving both unchanged
2032  * and returning a newly-allocated subraster,
2033  * whose baseline is sp1's if base=1, or sp2's if base=2.
2034  * Frees/deletes input sp1 and/or sp2 depending on value
2035  * of isfree (0=none, 1=sp1, 2=sp2, 3=both).
2036  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2037  * Arguments: sp1 (I) subraster * to lower subraster
2038  * sp2 (I) subraster * to upper subraster
2039  * base (I) int containing 1 if sp1 is baseline,
2040  * or 2 if sp2 is baseline.
2041  * space (I) int containing #rows blank space inserted
2042  * between sp1's image and sp2's image.
2043  * iscenter (I) int containing 1 to center both sp1 and sp2
2044  * in stacked array, 0 to left-justify both
2045  * isfree (I) int containing 1=free sp1 before return,
2046  * 2=free sp2, 3=free both, 0=free none.
2047  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2048  * Returns: ( subraster * ) pointer to constructed subraster sp2 atop sp1
2049  * or NULL for any error
2050  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2051  * Notes:
2052  * ======================================================================= */
2053 /* --- entry point --- */
2054 subraster *rastack ( subraster *sp1, subraster *sp2,
2055  int base, int space, int iscenter, int isfree )
2056 {
2057 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2058 Allocations and Declarations
2059 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2060 subraster *new_subraster(), *sp=(subraster *)NULL; /* returned subraster */
2061 raster *rp=(raster *)NULL; /* new stacked raster in sp */
2062 int delete_subraster(); /* in case isfree non-zero */
2063 int rastput(); /* place sp1,sp2 in stacked raster */
2064 int base1 = sp1->baseline, /* baseline for lower subraster */
2065  height1 = (sp1->image)->height, /* height for lower subraster */
2066  width1 = (sp1->image)->width, /* width for lower subraster */
2067  pixsz1 = (sp1->image)->pixsz, /* pixsz for lower subraster */
2068  base2 = sp2->baseline, /* baseline for upper subraster */
2069  height2 = (sp2->image)->height, /* height for upper subraster */
2070  width2 = (sp2->image)->width, /* width for upper subraster */
2071  pixsz2 = (sp2->image)->pixsz; /* pixsz for upper subraster */
2072 int height=0, width=0, pixsz=0, baseline=0; /*for stacked sp2 atop sp1*/
2073 mathchardef *symdef1 = sp1->symdef, /* mathchardef of right lower char */
2074  *symdef2 = sp2->symdef; /* mathchardef of right upper char */
2075 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2076 Initialization
2077 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2078 /* --- determine height, width and baseline of composite raster --- */
2079 height = height1 + space + height2; /* sum of heights plus space */
2080 width = max2(width1,width2); /* max width is overall width */
2081 pixsz = max2(pixsz1,pixsz2); /* bitmap||bytemap becomes bytemap */
2082 baseline = (base==1? height2+space+base1 : (base==2? base2 : 0));
2083 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2084 allocate stacked composite subraster (with embedded raster)
2085 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2086 /* --- allocate returned subraster (and then initialize it) --- */
2087 if ( (sp=new_subraster(width,height,pixsz)) /* allocate new subraster */
2088 == (subraster *)NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* failed, so quit */
2089 /* --- initialize subraster parameters --- */
2090 sp->type = IMAGERASTER; /* stacked rasters */
2091 sp->symdef = (base==1? symdef1 : (base==2? symdef2 : NULL)); /* symdef */
2092 sp->baseline = baseline; /* composite baseline */
2093 sp->size = (base==1? sp1->size : (base==2? sp2->size : NORMALSIZE)); /*size*/
2094 /* --- extract raster from subraster --- */
2095 rp = sp->image; /* raster embedded in subraster */
2096 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2097 overlay sp1 and sp2 in new composite raster
2098 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2099 if ( iscenter == 1 ) /* center both sp1 and sp2 */
2100  { rastput (rp, sp2->image, 0, (width-width2)/2, 1); /* overlay upper */
2101  rastput (rp, sp1->image, height2+space, (width-width1)/2, 1); } /*lower*/
2102 else /* left-justify both sp1 and sp2 */
2103  { rastput (rp, sp2->image, 0, 0, 1); /* overlay upper */
2104  rastput (rp, sp1->image, height2+space, 0, 1); } /*lower*/
2105 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2106 free input if requested
2107 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2108 if ( isfree > 0 ) /* caller wants input freed */
2109  { if ( isfree==1 || isfree>2 ) delete_subraster(sp1); /* free sp1 */
2110  if ( isfree>=2 ) delete_subraster(sp2); } /* and/or sp2 */
2111 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2112 Back to caller with pointer to stacked subraster or with null for error
2113 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2114 end_of_job:
2115  return ( sp ); /* back with subraster or null ptr */
2116 } /* --- end-of-function rastack() --- */
2117 
2118 
2119 /* ==========================================================================
2120  * Function: rastile ( tiles, ntiles )
2121  * Purpose: Allocate and build up a composite raster
2122  * from the ntiles components/characters supplied in tiles.
2123  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2124  * Arguments: tiles (I) subraster * to array of subraster structs
2125  * describing the components and their locations
2126  * ntiles (I) int containing number of subrasters in tiles[]
2127  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2128  * Returns: ( raster * ) ptr to composite raster,
2129  * or NULL for any error.
2130  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2131  * Notes: o The top,left corner of a raster is row=0,col=0
2132  * with row# increasing as you move down,
2133  * and col# increasing as you move right.
2134  * Metafont numbers rows with the baseline=0,
2135  * so the top row is a positive number that
2136  * decreases as you move down.
2137  * o rastile() is no longer used.
2138  * It was used by an earlier rasterize() algorithm,
2139  * and I've left it in place should it be needed again.
2140  * But recent changes haven't been tested/exercised.
2141  * ======================================================================= */
2142 /* --- entry point --- */
2143 raster *rastile ( subraster *tiles, int ntiles )
2144 {
2145 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2146 Allocations and Declarations
2147 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2148 raster *new_raster(), *composite=(raster *)NULL; /*raster back to caller*/
2149 int width=0, height=0, pixsz=0, /*width,height,pixsz of composite raster*/
2150  toprow=9999, rightcol=-999, /* extreme upper-right corner of tiles */
2151  botrow=-999, leftcol=9999; /* extreme lower-left corner of tiles */
2152 int itile; /* tiles[] index */
2153 int rastput(); /* overlay each tile in composite raster */
2154 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2155 run through tiles[] to determine dimensions for composite raster
2156 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2157 /* --- determine row and column bounds of composite raster --- */
2158 for ( itile=0; itile<ntiles; itile++ )
2159  {
2160  subraster *tile = &(tiles[itile]); /* ptr to current tile */
2161  /* --- upper-left corner of composite --- */
2162  toprow = min2(toprow, tile->toprow);
2163  leftcol = min2(leftcol, tile->leftcol);
2164  /* --- lower-right corner of composite --- */
2165  botrow = max2(botrow, tile->toprow + (tile->image)->height - 1);
2166  rightcol = max2(rightcol, tile->leftcol + (tile->image)->width - 1);
2167  /* --- pixsz of composite --- */
2168  pixsz = max2(pixsz,(tile->image)->pixsz);
2169  } /* --- end-of-for(itile) --- */
2170 /* --- calculate width and height from bounds --- */
2171 width = rightcol - leftcol + 1;
2172 height = botrow - toprow + 1;
2173 /* --- sanity check (quit if bad dimensions) --- */
2174 if ( width<1 || height<1 ) goto end_of_job;
2175 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2176 allocate composite raster, and embed tiles[] within it
2177 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2178 /* --- allocate composite raster --- */
2179 if ( (composite=new_raster(width,height,pixsz)) /*allocate composite raster*/
2180 == (raster *)NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
2181 /* --- embed tiles[] in composite --- */
2182 for ( itile=0; itile<ntiles; itile++ )
2183  { subraster *tile = &(tiles[itile]); /* ptr to current tile */
2184  rastput (composite, tile->image, /* overlay tile image at...*/
2185  tile->toprow-toprow, tile->leftcol-leftcol, 1); } /*upper-left corner*/
2186 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2187 Back to caller with composite raster (or null for any error)
2188 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2189 end_of_job:
2190  return ( composite ); /* back with composite or null ptr */
2191 } /* --- end-of-function rastile() --- */
2192 
2193 
2194 /* ==========================================================================
2195  * Function: rastsmash ( sp1, sp2 )
2196  * Purpose: When concatanating sp1||sp2, calculate #pixels
2197  * we can "smash sp2 left"
2198  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2199  * Arguments: sp1 (I) subraster * to left-hand raster
2200  * sp2 (I) subraster * to right-hand raster
2201  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2202  * Returns: ( int ) max #pixels we can smash sp1||sp2,
2203  * or "blanksignal" if sp2 intentionally blank,
2204  * or 0 for any error.
2205  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2206  * Notes: o
2207  * ======================================================================= */
2208 /* --- entry point --- */
2209 int rastsmash ( subraster *sp1, subraster *sp2 )
2210 {
2211 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2212 Allocations and Declarations
2213 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2214 int nsmash = 0; /* #pixels to smash sp1||sp2 */
2215 int base1 = sp1->baseline, /*baseline for left-hand subraster*/
2216  height1 = (sp1->image)->height, /* height for left-hand subraster */
2217  width1 = (sp1->image)->width, /* width for left-hand subraster */
2218  base2 = sp2->baseline, /*baseline for right-hand subraster*/
2219  height2 = (sp2->image)->height, /* height for right-hand subraster */
2220  width2 = (sp2->image)->width; /* width for right-hand subraster */
2221 int base = max2(base1,base2), /* max ascenders - 1 above baseline*/
2222  top1=base-base1, top2=base-base2, /* top irow indexes for sp1, sp2 */
2223  bot1=top1+height1-1, bot2=top2+height2-1, /* bot irow indexes */
2224  height = max2(bot1,bot2)+1; /* total height */
2225 int irow1=0,irow2=0, icol=0; /* row,col indexes */
2226 int firstcol1[1025], nfirst1=0, /* 1st sp1 col containing set pixel*/
2227  firstcol2[1025], nfirst2=0; /* 1st sp2 col containing set pixel*/
2228 int smin=9999, xmin=9999,ymin=9999; /* min separation (s=x+y) */
2229 int type_raster(); /* display debugging output */
2230 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2231 find right edge of sp1 and left edge of sp2 (these will be abutting edges)
2232 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2233 /* --- check args --- */
2234 if ( isstring ) goto end_of_job; /* ignore string rasters */
2235 if ( 0 && istextmode ) goto end_of_job; /* don't smash in text mode */
2236 if ( height > 1023 ) goto end_of_job; /* don't try to smash huge image */
2237 if ( sp2->type == blanksignal ) /*blanksignal was propagated to us*/
2238  goto end_of_job; /* don't smash intentional blank */
2239 /* --- init firstcol1[], firstcol2[] --- */
2240 for ( irow1=0; irow1<height; irow1++ ) /* for each row */
2241  firstcol1[irow1] = firstcol2[irow1] = blanksignal; /* signal empty rows */
2242 /* --- set firstcol2[] indicating left edge of sp2 --- */
2243 for ( irow2=top2; irow2<=bot2; irow2++ ) /* for each row inside sp2 */
2244  for ( icol=0; icol<width2; icol++ ) /* find first non-empty col in row */
2245  if ( getpixel(sp2->image,irow2-top2,icol) != 0 ) /* found a set pixel */
2246  { firstcol2[irow2] = icol; /* icol is #cols from left edge */
2247  nfirst2++; /* bump #rows containing set pixels*/
2248  break; } /* and go on to next row */
2249 if ( nfirst2 < 1 ) /*right-hand sp2 is completely blank*/
2250  { nsmash = blanksignal; /* signal intentional blanks */
2251  goto end_of_job; } /* don't smash intentional blanks */
2252 /* --- now check if preceding image in sp1 was an intentional blank --- */
2253 if ( sp1->type == blanksignal ) /*blanksignal was propagated to us*/
2254  goto end_of_job; /* don't smash intentional blank */
2255 /* --- set firstcol1[] indicating right edge of sp1 --- */
2256 for ( irow1=top1; irow1<=bot1; irow1++ ) /* for each row inside sp1 */
2257  for ( icol=width1-1; icol>=0; icol-- ) /* find last non-empty col in row */
2258  if ( getpixel(sp1->image,irow1-top1,icol) != 0 ) /* found a set pixel */
2259  { firstcol1[irow1] = (width1-1)-icol; /* save #cols from right edge */
2260  nfirst1++; /* bump #rows containing set pixels*/
2261  break; } /* and go on to next row */
2262 if ( nfirst1 < 1 ) /*left-hand sp1 is completely blank*/
2263  goto end_of_job; /* don't smash intentional blanks */
2264 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2265 find minimum separation
2266 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2267 for ( irow2=top2; irow2<=bot2; irow2++ ) { /* check each row inside sp2 */
2268  int margin1, margin2=firstcol2[irow2]; /* #cols to first set pixel */
2269  if ( margin2 != blanksignal ) { /* irow2 not an empty/blank row */
2270  for ( irow1=max2(irow2-smin,top1); ; irow1++ )
2271  if ( irow1 > min2(irow2+smin,bot1) ) break; /* upper bound check */
2272  else
2273  if ( (margin1=firstcol1[irow1]) != blanksignal ) { /*have non-blank row*/
2274  int dx=(margin1+margin2), dy=absval(irow2-irow1), ds=dx+dy; /* deltas */
2275  if ( ds >= smin ) continue; /* min unchanged */
2276  if ( dy>smashmargin && dx<xmin && smin<9999 ) continue; /* dy alone */
2277  smin=ds; xmin=dx; ymin=dy; /* set new min */
2278  } /* --- end-of-if(margin1!=blanksignal) --- */
2279  } /* --- end-of-if(margin2!=blanksignal) --- */
2280  if ( smin<2 ) goto end_of_job; /* can't smash */
2281  } /* --- end-of-for(irow2) --- */
2282 /*nsmash = min2(xmin,width2);*/ /* permissible smash */
2283 nsmash = xmin; /* permissible smash */
2284 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2285 Back to caller with #pixels to smash sp1||sp2
2286 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2287 end_of_job:
2288  /* --- debugging output --- */
2289  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel >= 99 ) /* display for debugging */
2290  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastsmash> nsmash=%d, smashmargin=%d\n",
2291  nsmash,smashmargin);
2292  if ( msglevel >= 999 ) /* also display rasters */
2293  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastsmash>left-hand image...\n");
2294  if(sp1!=NULL) type_raster(sp1->image,msgfp); /* left image */
2295  fprintf(msgfp,"rastsmash>right-hand image...\n");
2296  if(sp2!=NULL) type_raster(sp2->image,msgfp); } /* right image */
2297  fflush(msgfp); }
2298  return ( nsmash ); /* back with #smash pixels */
2299 } /* --- end-of-function rastsmash() --- */
2300 
2301 
2302 /* ==========================================================================
2303  * Function: rastsmashcheck ( term )
2304  * Purpose: Check an exponent term to see if its leading symbol
2305  * would make smashing dangerous
2306  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2307  * Arguments: term (I) char * to null-terminated string
2308  * containing right-hand exponent term about to
2309  * be smashed against existing left-hand.
2310  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2311  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if it's okay to smash term, or
2312  * 0 if smash is dangerous.
2313  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2314  * Notes: o
2315  * ======================================================================= */
2316 /* --- entry point --- */
2317 int rastsmashcheck ( char *term )
2318 {
2319 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2320 Allocations and Declarations
2321 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2322 int isokay = 0; /* 1 to signal okay to caller */
2323 static char nosmashchars[64] = "-.,="; /* don't smash these leading chars */
2324 static char *nosmashstrs[64] = { "\\frac", NULL }; /* or leading strings */
2325 static char *grayspace[64] = { "\\tiny", "\\small", "\\normalsize",
2326  "\\large", "\\Large", "\\LARGE", "\\huge", "\\Huge", NULL };
2327 char *expression = term; /* local ptr to beginning of expression */
2328 char *token = NULL; int i; /* token = nosmashstrs[i] or grayspace[i] */
2329 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2330 see if smash check enabled
2331 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2332 if ( smashcheck < 1 ) { /* no smash checking wanted */
2333  if ( smashcheck >= 0 ) /* -1 means check should always fail */
2334  isokay = 1; /* otherwise (if 0), signal okay to smash */
2335  goto end_of_job; } /* return to caller */
2336 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2337 skip leading white and gray space
2338 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2339 /* --- first check input --- */
2340 if ( isempty(term) ) goto end_of_job; /* no input so return 0 to caller */
2341 /* --- skip leading white space --- */
2342 skipwhite(term); /* skip leading white space */
2343 if ( *term == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* nothing but white space */
2344 /* --- skip leading gray space --- */
2345 skipgray:
2346  for ( i=0; (token=grayspace[i]) != NULL; i++ ) /* check each grayspace */
2347  if ( strncmp(term,token,strlen(token)) == 0 ) { /* found grayspace */
2348  term += strlen(token); /* skip past this grayspace token */
2349  skipwhite(term); /* and skip any subsequent white space */
2350  if ( *term == '\000' ) { /* nothing left so quit */
2351  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel >= 99 ) /* display for debugging */
2352  fprintf(msgfp,"rastsmashcheck> only grayspace in %.32s\n",expression);
2353  goto end_of_job; }
2354  goto skipgray; } /* restart grayspace check from beginning */
2355 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2356 check for leading no-smash single char
2357 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2358 /* --- don't smash if term begins with a "nosmash" char --- */
2359 if ( (token=strchr(nosmashchars,*term)) != NULL ) {
2360  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel >= 99 ) /* display for debugging */
2361  fprintf(msgfp,"rastsmashcheck> char %.1s found in %.32s\n",token,term);
2362  goto end_of_job; }
2363 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2364 check for leading no-smash token
2365 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2366 for ( i=0; (token=nosmashstrs[i]) != NULL; i++ ) /* check each nosmashstr */
2367  if ( strncmp(term,token,strlen(token)) == 0 ) { /* found a nosmashstr */
2368  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel >= 99 ) /* display for debugging */
2369  fprintf(msgfp,"rastsmashcheck> token %s found in %.32s\n",token,term);
2370  goto end_of_job; } /* so don't smash term */
2371 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2372 back to caller
2373 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2374 isokay = 1; /* no problem, so signal okay to smash */
2375 end_of_job:
2376  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel >= 999 ) /* display for debugging */
2377  fprintf(msgfp,"rastsmashcheck> returning isokay=%d for \"%.32s\"\n",
2378  isokay,(expression==NULL?"<no input>":expression));
2379  return ( isokay ); /* back to caller with 1 if okay to smash */
2380 } /* --- end-of-function rastsmashcheck() --- */
2381 
2382 
2383 /* ==========================================================================
2384  * Function: accent_subraster ( accent, width, height, direction, pixsz )
2385  * Purpose: Allocate a new subraster of width x height
2386  * (or maybe different dimensions, depending on accent),
2387  * and draw an accent (\hat or \vec or \etc) that fills it
2388  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2389  * Arguments: accent (I) int containing either HATACCENT or VECACCENT,
2390  * etc, indicating the type of accent desired
2391  * width (I) int containing desired width of accent (#cols)
2392  * height (I) int containing desired height of accent(#rows)
2393  * direction (I) int containing desired direction of accent,
2394  * +1=right, -1=left, 0=left/right
2395  * pixsz (I) int containing 1 for bitmap, 8 for bytemap
2396  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2397  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to newly-allocated subraster with accent,
2398  * or NULL for any error.
2399  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2400  * Notes: o Some accents have internally-determined dimensions,
2401  * and caller should check dimensions in returned subraster
2402  * ======================================================================= */
2403 /* --- entry point --- */
2404 subraster *accent_subraster ( int accent, int width, int height,
2405 int direction, int pixsz )
2406 {
2407 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2408 Allocations and Declarations
2409 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2410 /* --- general info --- */
2411 raster *new_raster(), *rp=NULL; /*raster containing desired accent*/
2412 subraster *new_subraster(), *sp=NULL; /* subraster returning accent */
2413 int delete_raster(), delete_subraster(); /*free allocated raster on err*/
2414 int line_raster(), /* draws lines */
2415  rule_raster(), /* draw solid boxes */
2416  thickness = 1; /* line thickness */
2417 /*int pixval = (pixsz==1? 1 : (pixsz==8?255:(-1)));*/ /*black pixel value*/
2418 /* --- other working info --- */
2419 int col0, col1, /* cols for line */
2420  row0, row1; /* rows for line */
2421 subraster *get_delim(), *accsp=NULL; /*find suitable cmex10 symbol/accent*/
2422 /* --- info for under/overbraces, tildes, etc --- */
2423 char brace[16]; /*"{" for over, "}" for under, etc*/
2424 raster *rastrot(), /* rotate { for overbrace, etc */
2425  *rastcpy(); /* may need copy of original */
2426 subraster *arrow_subraster(); /* rightarrow for vec */
2427 subraster *rastack(); /* stack accent atop extra space */
2428 int iswidthneg = 0; /* set true if width<0 arg passed */
2429 int serifwidth=0; /* serif for surd */
2430 int isBig=0; /* true for ==>arrow, false for -->*/
2431 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2432 initialization
2433 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2434 if ( width < 0 ) { width=(-width); iswidthneg=1; } /* set neg width flag */
2435 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2436 outer switch() traps accents that may change caller's height,width
2437 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2438 switch ( accent )
2439  {
2440  default:
2441  /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2442  inner switch() first allocates fixed-size raster for accents that don't
2443  ------------------------------------------------------------------------ */
2444  if ( (rp = new_raster(width,height,pixsz)) /* allocate fixed-size raster */
2445  != NULL ) /* and if we succeeded... */
2446  switch ( accent ) /* ...draw requested accent in it */
2447  {
2448  /* --- unrecognized request --- */
2449  default: delete_raster(rp); /* unrecognized accent requested */
2450  rp = NULL; break; /* so free raster and signal error */
2451  /* --- bar request --- */
2452  case UNDERBARACCENT:
2453  case BARACCENT:
2454  thickness = 1; /*height-1;*/ /* adjust thickness */
2455  if ( accent == BARACCENT ) /* bar is above expression */
2456  { row0 = row1 = max2(height-3,0); /* row numbers for overbar */
2457  line_raster(rp,row0,0,row1,width-1,thickness); } /*blanks at bot*/
2458  else /* underbar is below expression */
2459  { row0 = row1 = min2(2,height-1); /* row numbers for underbar */
2460  line_raster(rp,row0,0,row1,width-1,thickness); } /*blanks at top*/
2461  break;
2462  /* --- dot request --- */
2463  case DOTACCENT:
2464  thickness = height-1; /* adjust thickness */
2465  /*line_raster(rp,0,width/2,1,(width/2)+1,thickness);*//*centered dot*/
2466  rule_raster(rp,0,(width+1-thickness)/2,thickness,thickness,3); /*box*/
2467  break;
2468  /* --- ddot request --- */
2469  case DDOTACCENT:
2470  thickness = height-1; /* adjust thickness */
2471  col0 = max2((width+1)/3-(thickness/2)-1,0); /* one-third of width */
2472  col1 = min2((2*width+1)/3-(thickness/2)+1,width-thickness); /*2/3rds*/
2473  if ( col0+thickness >= col1 ) /* dots overlap */
2474  { col0 = max2(col0-1,0); /* try moving left dot more left */
2475  col1 = min2(col1+1,width-thickness); } /* and right dot right */
2476  if ( col0+thickness >= col1 ) /* dots _still_ overlap */
2477  thickness = max2(thickness-1,1); /* so try reducing thickness */
2478  /*line_raster(rp,0,col0,1,col0+1,thickness);*//*set dot at 1st third*/
2479  /*line_raster(rp,0,col1,1,col1+1,thickness);*//*and another at 2nd*/
2480  rule_raster(rp,0,col0,thickness,thickness,3); /*box at 1st third*/
2481  rule_raster(rp,0,col1,thickness,thickness,3); /*box at 2nd third*/
2482  break;
2483  /* --- hat request --- */
2484  case HATACCENT:
2485  thickness = 1; /*(width<=12? 2 : 3);*/ /* adjust thickness */
2486  line_raster(rp,height-1,0,0,width/2,thickness); /* / part of hat*/
2487  line_raster(rp,0,(width-1)/2,height-1,width-1,thickness); /* \ part*/
2488  break;
2489  /* --- sqrt request --- */
2490  case SQRTACCENT:
2491  serifwidth = SURDSERIFWIDTH(height); /* leading serif on surd */
2492  col1 = SQRTWIDTH(height,(iswidthneg?1:2)) - 1; /*right col of sqrt*/
2493  /*col0 = (col1-serifwidth+2)/3;*/ /* midpoint col of sqrt */
2494  col0 = (col1-serifwidth+1)/2; /* midpoint col of sqrt */
2495  row0 = max2(1,((height+1)/2)-2); /* midpoint row of sqrt */
2496  row1 = height-1; /* bottom row of sqrt */
2497  /*line_raster(rp,row0,0,row1,col0,thickness);*/ /*descending portion*/
2498  line_raster(rp,row0+serifwidth,0,row0,serifwidth,thickness);
2499  line_raster(rp,row0,serifwidth,row1,col0,thickness); /* descending */
2500  line_raster(rp,row1,col0,0,col1,thickness); /* ascending portion */
2501  line_raster(rp,0,col1,0,width-1,thickness); /*overbar of thickness 1*/
2502  break;
2503  } /* --- end-of-inner-switch(accent) --- */
2504  break; /* break from outer accent switch */
2505  /* --- underbrace, overbrace request --- */
2506  case UNDERBRACE:
2507  case OVERBRACE:
2508  if ( accent == UNDERBRACE ) strcpy(brace,"}"); /* start with } brace */
2509  if ( accent == OVERBRACE ) strcpy(brace,"{"); /* start with { brace */
2510  if ( (accsp=get_delim(brace,width,CMEX10)) /* use width for height */
2511  != NULL ) /* found desired brace */
2512  { rp = rastrot(accsp->image); /* rotate 90 degrees clockwise */
2513  delete_subraster(accsp); } /* and free subraster "envelope" */
2514  break;
2515  /* --- hat request --- */
2516  case HATACCENT:
2517  if ( accent == HATACCENT ) strcpy(brace,"<"); /* start with < */
2518  if ( (accsp=get_delim(brace,width,CMEX10)) /* use width for height */
2519  != NULL ) /* found desired brace */
2520  { rp = rastrot(accsp->image); /* rotate 90 degrees clockwise */
2521  delete_subraster(accsp); } /* and free subraster "envelope" */
2522  break;
2523  /* --- vec request --- */
2524  case VECACCENT:
2525  height = 2*(height/2) + 1; /* force height odd */
2526  if ( absval(direction) >= 9 ) { /* want ==> arrow rather than --> */
2527  isBig = 1; /* signal "Big" arrow */
2528  direction -= 10; } /* reset direction = +1, -1, or 0 */
2529  if ((accsp=arrow_subraster(width,height,pixsz,direction,isBig)) /*arrow*/
2530  != NULL ) /* succeeded */
2531  { rp = accsp->image; /* "extract" raster with bitmap */
2532  free((void *)accsp); } /* and free subraster "envelope" */
2533  break;
2534  /* --- tilde request --- */
2535  case TILDEACCENT:
2536  accsp=(width<25? get_delim("\\sim",-width,CMSY10) :
2537  get_delim("~",-width,CMEX10)); /*width search for tilde*/
2538  if ( accsp != NULL ) /* found desired tilde */
2539  if ( (sp=rastack(new_subraster(1,1,pixsz),accsp,1,0,1,3))/*space below*/
2540  != NULL ) /* have tilde with space below it */
2541  { rp = sp->image; /* "extract" raster with bitmap */
2542  free((void *)sp); /* and free subraster "envelope" */
2543  leftsymdef = NULL; } /* so \tilde{x}^2 works properly */
2544  break;
2545  } /* --- end-of-outer-switch(accent) --- */
2546 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2547 if we constructed accent raster okay, embed it in a subraster and return it
2548 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2549 /* --- if all okay, allocate subraster to contain constructed raster --- */
2550 if ( rp != NULL ) { /* accent raster constructed okay */
2551  if ( (sp=new_subraster(0,0,0)) /* allocate subraster "envelope" */
2552  == NULL ) /* and if we fail to allocate */
2553  delete_raster(rp); /* free now-unneeded raster */
2554  else /* subraster allocated okay */
2555  { /* --- init subraster parameters, embedding raster in it --- */
2556  sp->type = IMAGERASTER; /* constructed image */
2557  sp->image = rp; /* raster we just constructed */
2558  sp->size = (-1); /* can't set font size here */
2559  sp->baseline = 0; } /* can't set baseline here */
2560  } /* --- end-of-if(rp!=NULL) --- */
2561 /* --- return subraster containing desired accent to caller --- */
2562 return ( sp ); /* return accent or NULL to caller */
2563 } /* --- end-of-function accent_subraster() --- */
2564 
2565 
2566 /* ==========================================================================
2567  * Function: arrow_subraster ( width, height, pixsz, drctn, isBig )
2568  * Purpose: Allocate a raster/subraster and draw left/right arrow in it
2569  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2570  * Arguments: width (I) int containing number of cols for arrow
2571  * height (I) int containing number of rows for arrow
2572  * pixsz (I) int containing 1 for bitmap, 8 for bytemap
2573  * drctn (I) int containing +1 for right arrow,
2574  * or -1 for left, 0 for leftright
2575  * isBig (I) int containing 1/true for \Long arrows,
2576  * or false for \long arrows, i.e.,
2577  * true for ===> or false for --->.
2578  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2579  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to constructed left/right arrow
2580  * or NULL for any error.
2581  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2582  * Notes: o
2583  * ======================================================================= */
2584 /* --- entry point --- */
2585 subraster *arrow_subraster ( int width, int height, int pixsz,
2586  int drctn, int isBig )
2587 {
2588 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2589 Allocations and Declarations
2590 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2591 subraster *new_subraster(), *arrowsp=NULL; /* allocate arrow subraster */
2592 int rule_raster(); /* draw arrow line */
2593 int irow, midrow=height/2; /* index, midrow is arrowhead apex */
2594 int icol, thickness=(height>15?2:2); /* arrowhead thickness and index */
2595 int pixval = (pixsz==1? 1 : (pixsz==8?255:(-1))); /* black pixel value */
2596 int ipix, /* raster pixmap[] index */
2597  npix = width*height; /* #pixels malloced in pixmap[] */
2598 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2599 allocate raster/subraster and draw arrow line
2600 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2601 if ( height < 3 ) { height=3; midrow=1; } /* set minimum height */
2602 if ( (arrowsp=new_subraster(width,height,pixsz)) /* allocate empty raster */
2603 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
2604 if ( !isBig ) /* single line */
2605  rule_raster(arrowsp->image,midrow,0,width,1,0); /*draw line across midrow*/
2606 else
2607  { int delta = (width>6? (height>15? 3: (height>7? 2 : 1)) : 1);
2608  rule_raster(arrowsp->image,midrow-delta,delta,width-2*delta,1,0);
2609  rule_raster(arrowsp->image,midrow+delta,delta,width-2*delta,1,0); }
2610 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2611 construct arrowhead(s)
2612 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2613 for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ ) /* for each row of arrow */
2614  {
2615  int delta = abs(irow-midrow); /*arrowhead offset for irow*/
2616  /* --- right arrowhead --- */
2617  if ( drctn >= 0 ) /* right arrowhead wanted */
2618  for ( icol=0; icol<thickness; icol++ ) /* for arrowhead thickness */
2619  { ipix = ((irow+1)*width - 1) - delta - icol; /* rightmost-delta-icol */
2620  if ( ipix >= 0 ) { /* bounds check */
2621  if ( pixsz == 1 ) /* have a bitmap */
2622  setlongbit((arrowsp->image)->pixmap,ipix);/*turn on arrowhead bit*/
2623  else /* should have a bytemap */
2624  if ( pixsz == 8 ) /* check pixsz for bytemap */
2625  ((arrowsp->image)->pixmap)[ipix] = pixval; } }/*set arrowhead byte*/
2626  /* --- left arrowhead (same as right except for ipix calculation) --- */
2627  if ( drctn <= 0 ) /* left arrowhead wanted */
2628  for ( icol=0; icol<thickness; icol++ ) /* for arrowhead thickness */
2629  { ipix = irow*width + delta + icol; /* leftmost bit+delta+icol */
2630  if ( ipix < npix ) { /* bounds check */
2631  if ( pixsz == 1 ) /* have a bitmap */
2632  setlongbit((arrowsp->image)->pixmap,ipix);/*turn on arrowhead bit*/
2633  else /* should have a bytemap */
2634  if ( pixsz == 8 ) /* check pixsz for bytemap */
2635  ((arrowsp->image)->pixmap)[ipix] = pixval; } }/*set arrowhead byte*/
2636  } /* --- end-of-for(irow) --- */
2637 end_of_job:
2638  return ( arrowsp ); /*back to caller with arrow or NULL*/
2639 } /* --- end-of-function arrow_subraster() --- */
2640 
2641 
2642 /* ==========================================================================
2643  * Function: uparrow_subraster ( width, height, pixsz, drctn, isBig )
2644  * Purpose: Allocate a raster/subraster and draw up/down arrow in it
2645  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2646  * Arguments: width (I) int containing number of cols for arrow
2647  * height (I) int containing number of rows for arrow
2648  * pixsz (I) int containing 1 for bitmap, 8 for bytemap
2649  * drctn (I) int containing +1 for up arrow,
2650  * or -1 for down, or 0 for updown
2651  * isBig (I) int containing 1/true for \Long arrows,
2652  * or false for \long arrows, i.e.,
2653  * true for ===> or false for --->.
2654  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2655  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to constructed up/down arrow
2656  * or NULL for any error.
2657  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2658  * Notes: o
2659  * ======================================================================= */
2660 /* --- entry point --- */
2661 subraster *uparrow_subraster ( int width, int height, int pixsz,
2662  int drctn, int isBig )
2663 {
2664 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2665 Allocations and Declarations
2666 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2667 subraster *new_subraster(), *arrowsp=NULL; /* allocate arrow subraster */
2668 int rule_raster(); /* draw arrow line */
2669 int icol, midcol=width/2; /* index, midcol is arrowhead apex */
2670 int irow, thickness=(width>15?2:2); /* arrowhead thickness and index */
2671 int pixval = (pixsz==1? 1 : (pixsz==8?255:(-1))); /* black pixel value */
2672 int ipix, /* raster pixmap[] index */
2673  npix = width*height; /* #pixels malloced in pixmap[] */
2674 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2675 allocate raster/subraster and draw arrow line
2676 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2677 if ( width < 3 ) { width=3; midcol=1; } /* set minimum width */
2678 if ( (arrowsp=new_subraster(width,height,pixsz)) /* allocate empty raster */
2679 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
2680 if ( !isBig ) /* single line */
2681  rule_raster(arrowsp->image,0,midcol,1,height,0); /*draw line down midcol*/
2682 else
2683  { int delta = (height>6? (width>15? 3: (width>7? 2 : 1)) : 1);
2684  rule_raster(arrowsp->image,delta,midcol-delta,1,height-2*delta,0);
2685  rule_raster(arrowsp->image,delta,midcol+delta,1,height-2*delta,0); }
2686 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2687 construct arrowhead(s)
2688 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2689 for ( icol=0; icol<width; icol++ ) /* for each col of arrow */
2690  {
2691  int delta = abs(icol-midcol); /*arrowhead offset for icol*/
2692  /* --- up arrowhead --- */
2693  if ( drctn >= 0 ) /* up arrowhead wanted */
2694  for ( irow=0; irow<thickness; irow++ ) /* for arrowhead thickness */
2695  { ipix = (irow+delta)*width + icol; /* leftmost+icol */
2696  if ( ipix < npix ) { /* bounds check */
2697  if ( pixsz == 1 ) /* have a bitmap */
2698  setlongbit((arrowsp->image)->pixmap,ipix);/*turn on arrowhead bit*/
2699  else /* should have a bytemap */
2700  if ( pixsz == 8 ) /* check pixsz for bytemap */
2701  ((arrowsp->image)->pixmap)[ipix] = pixval; } }/*set arrowhead byte*/
2702  /* --- down arrowhead (same as up except for ipix calculation) --- */
2703  if ( drctn <= 0 ) /* down arrowhead wanted */
2704  for ( irow=0; irow<thickness; irow++ ) /* for arrowhead thickness */
2705  { ipix = (height-1-delta-irow)*width + icol; /* leftmost + icol */
2706  if ( ipix > 0 ) { /* bounds check */
2707  if ( pixsz == 1 ) /* have a bitmap */
2708  setlongbit((arrowsp->image)->pixmap,ipix);/*turn on arrowhead bit*/
2709  else /* should have a bytemap */
2710  if ( pixsz == 8 ) /* check pixsz for bytemap */
2711  ((arrowsp->image)->pixmap)[ipix] = pixval; } }/*set arrowhead byte*/
2712  } /* --- end-of-for(icol) --- */
2713 end_of_job:
2714  return ( arrowsp ); /*back to caller with arrow or NULL*/
2715 } /* --- end-of-function uparrow_subraster() --- */
2716 
2717 
2718 /* ==========================================================================
2719  * Function: rule_raster ( rp, top, left, width, height, type )
2720  * Purpose: Draw a solid or dashed line (or box) in existing raster rp,
2721  * starting at top,left with dimensions width,height.
2722  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2723  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster in which rule
2724  * will be drawn
2725  * top (I) int containing row at which top-left corner
2726  * of rule starts (0 is topmost)
2727  * left (I) int containing col at which top-left corner
2728  * of rule starts (0 is leftmost)
2729  * width (I) int containing number of cols for rule
2730  * height (I) int containing number of rows for rule
2731  * type (I) int containing 0 for solid rule,
2732  * 1 for horizontal dashes, 2 for vertical
2733  * 3 for solid rule with corners removed (bevel)
2734  * 4 for strut (nothing drawn)
2735  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2736  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if rule drawn okay,
2737  * or 0 for any error.
2738  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2739  * Notes: o Rule line is implicitly "horizontal" or "vertical" depending
2740  * on relative width,height dimensions. It's a box if they're
2741  * more or less comparable.
2742  * ======================================================================= */
2743 /* --- entry point --- */
2744 int rule_raster ( raster *rp, int top, int left,
2745  int width, int height, int type )
2746 {
2747 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2748 Allocations and Declarations
2749 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2750 int irow=0, icol=0; /* indexes over rp raster */
2751 int ipix = 0, /* raster pixmap[] index */
2752  npix = rp->width * rp->height; /* #pixels malloced in rp->pixmap[] */
2753 int isfatal = 0; /* true to abend on out-of-bounds error */
2754 int hdash=1, vdash=2, /* type for horizontal, vertical dashes */
2755  bevel=99/*3*/, strut=4; /* type for bevel (turned off), strut */
2756 int dashlen=3, spacelen=2, /* #pixels for dash followed by space */
2757  isdraw=1; /* true when drawing dash (init for solid) */
2758 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2759 Check args
2760 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2761 if ( rp == (raster *)NULL ) { /* no raster arg supplied */
2762  if ( workingbox != (subraster *)NULL ) /* see if we have a workingbox */
2763  rp = workingbox->image; /* use workingbox if possible */
2764  else return ( 0 ); } /* otherwise signal error to caller */
2765 if ( type == bevel ) /* remove corners of solid box */
2766  if ( width<3 || height<3 ) type=0; /* too small to remove corners */
2767 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2768 Fill line/box
2769 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2770 if ( width > 0 ) /* zero width implies strut*/
2771  for ( irow=top; irow<top+height; irow++ ) /* for each scan line */
2772  {
2773  if ( type == strut ) isdraw = 0; /* draw nothing for strut */
2774  if ( type == vdash ) /*set isdraw for vert dash*/
2775  isdraw = (((irow-top)%(dashlen+spacelen)) < dashlen);
2776  ipix = irow*rp->width + left - 1; /*first pixel preceding icol*/
2777  for ( icol=left; icol<left+width; icol++ ) /* each pixel in scan line */
2778  {
2779  if ( type == bevel ) { /* remove corners of box */
2780  if ( (irow==top && icol==left) /* top-left corner */
2781  || (irow==top && icol>=left+width-1) /* top-right corner */
2782  || (irow>=top+height-1 && icol==left) /* bottom-left corner */
2783  || (irow>=top+height-1 && icol>=left+width-1) ) /* bottom-right */
2784  isdraw = 0; else isdraw = 1; } /*set isdraw to skip corner*/
2785  if ( type == hdash ) /*set isdraw for horiz dash*/
2786  isdraw = (((icol-left)%(dashlen+spacelen)) < dashlen);
2787  if ( ++ipix >= npix ) /* bounds check failed */
2788  if ( isfatal ) goto end_of_job; /* abort if error is fatal */
2789  else break; /*or just go on to next row*/
2790  else /*ibit is within rp bounds*/
2791  if ( isdraw ) { /*and we're drawing this bit*/
2792  if ( rp->pixsz == 1 ) /* have a bitmap */
2793  setlongbit(rp->pixmap,ipix); /* so turn on bit in line */
2794  else /* should have a bytemap */
2795  if ( rp->pixsz == 8 ) /* check pixsz for bytemap */
2796  ((unsigned char *)(rp->pixmap))[ipix] = 255; } /* set black byte */
2797  } /* --- end-of-for(icol) --- */
2798  } /* --- end-of-for(irow) --- */
2799 end_of_job:
2800  return ( isfatal? (ipix<npix? 1:0) : 1 );
2801 } /* --- end-of-function rule_raster() --- */
2802 
2803 
2804 /* ==========================================================================
2805  * Function: line_raster ( rp, row0, col0, row1, col1, thickness )
2806  * Purpose: Draw a line from row0,col0 to row1,col1 of thickness
2807  * in existing raster rp.
2808  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2809  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster in which a line
2810  * will be drawn
2811  * row0 (I) int containing row at which
2812  * line will start (0 is topmost)
2813  * col0 (I) int containing col at which
2814  * line will start (0 is leftmost)
2815  * row1 (I) int containing row at which
2816  * line will end (rp->height-1 is bottom-most)
2817  * col1 (I) int containing col at which
2818  * line will end (rp->width-1 is rightmost)
2819  * thickness (I) int containing number of pixels/bits
2820  * thick the line will be
2821  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2822  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if line drawn okay,
2823  * or 0 for any error.
2824  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2825  * Notes: o if row0==row1, a horizontal line is drawn
2826  * between col0 and col1, with row0(==row1) the top row
2827  * and row0+(thickness-1) the bottom row
2828  * o if col0==col1, a vertical bar is drawn
2829  * between row0 and row1, with col0(==col1) the left col
2830  * and col0+(thickness-1) the right col
2831  * o if both the above, you get a square thickness x thickness
2832  * whose top-left corner is row0,col0.
2833  * ======================================================================= */
2834 /* --- entry point --- */
2835 int line_raster ( raster *rp, int row0, int col0,
2836  int row1, int col1, int thickness )
2837 {
2838 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2839 Allocations and Declarations
2840 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2841 int irow=0, icol=0, /* indexes over rp raster */
2842  locol=col0, hicol=col1, /* col limits at irow */
2843  lorow=row0, hirow=row1; /* row limits at icol */
2844 int width=rp->width, height=rp->height; /* dimensions of input raster */
2845 int ipix = 0, /* raster pixmap[] index */
2846  npix = width*height; /* #pixels malloced in rp->pixmap[] */
2847 int isfatal = 0; /* true to abend on out-of-bounds error */
2848 int isline=(row1==row0), isbar=(col1==col0); /*true if slope a=0,\infty*/
2849 double dy = row1-row0 /* + (row1>=row0? +1.0 : -1.0) */, /* delta-x */
2850  dx = col1-col0 /* + (col1>=col0? +1.0 : -1.0) */, /* delta-y */
2851  a= (isbar||isline? 0.0 : dy/dx), /* slope = tan(theta) = dy/dx */
2852  xcol=0, xrow=0; /* calculated col at irow, or row at icol */
2853 double ar = ASPECTRATIO, /* aspect ratio width/height of one pixel */
2854  xwidth= (isline? 0.0 : /*#pixels per row to get sloped line thcknss*/
2855  ((double)thickness)*sqrt((dx*dx)+(dy*dy*ar*ar))/fabs(dy*ar)),
2856  xheight = 1.0;
2857 int line_recurse(), isrecurse=1; /* true to draw line recursively */
2858 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2859 Check args
2860 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2861 if ( rp == (raster *)NULL ) { /* no raster arg supplied */
2862  if ( workingbox != (subraster *)NULL ) /* see if we have a workingbox */
2863  rp = workingbox->image; /* use workingbox if possible */
2864  else return ( 0 ); } /* otherwise signal error to caller */
2865 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2866 Initialization
2867 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2868 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=29 ) { /* debugging */
2869  fprintf(msgfp,"line_raster> row,col0=%d,%d row,col1=%d,%d, thickness=%d\n"
2870  "\t dy,dx=%3.1f,%3.1f, a=%4.3f, xwidth=%4.3f\n",
2871  row0,col0, row1,col1, thickness, dy,dx, a, xwidth); fflush(msgfp); }
2872 /* --- check for recursive line drawing --- */
2873 if ( isrecurse ) { /* drawing lines recursively */
2874  for ( irow=0; irow<thickness; irow++ ) /* each line 1 pixel thick */
2875  { double xrow0=(double)row0, xcol0=(double)col0,
2876  xrow1=(double)row1, xcol1=(double)col1;
2877  if ( isline ) xrow0 = xrow1 = (double)(row0+irow);
2878  else if ( isbar ) xcol0 = xcol1 = (double)(col0+irow);
2879  if( xrow0>(-0.001) && xcol0>(-0.001) /*check line inside raster*/
2880  && xrow1<((double)(height-1)+0.001) && xcol1<((double)(width-1)+0.001) )
2881  line_recurse(rp,xrow0,xcol0,xrow1,xcol1,thickness); }
2882  return ( 1 ); }
2883 /* --- set params for horizontal line or vertical bar --- */
2884 if ( isline ) /*interpret row as top row*/
2885  row1 = row0 + (thickness-1); /* set bottom row for line */
2886 if ( 0&&isbar ) /*interpret col as left col*/
2887  hicol = col0 + (thickness-1); /* set right col for bar */
2888 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2889 draw line one row at a time
2890 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2891 for ( irow=min2(row0,row1); irow<=max2(row0,row1); irow++ ) /*each scan line*/
2892  {
2893  if ( !isbar && !isline ) /* neither vert nor horiz */
2894  { xcol = col0 + ((double)(irow-row0))/a; /* "middle" col in irow */
2895  locol = max2((int)(xcol-0.5*(xwidth-1.0)),0); /* leftmost col */
2896  hicol = min2((int)(xcol+0.5*(xwidth-0.0)),max2(col0,col1)); } /*right*/
2897  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=29 ) /* debugging */
2898  fprintf(msgfp,"\t irow=%d, xcol=%4.2f, lo,hicol=%d,%d\n",
2899  irow,xcol,locol,hicol);
2900  ipix = irow*rp->width + min2(locol,hicol) - 1; /*first pix preceding icol*/
2901  for ( icol=min2(locol,hicol); icol<=max2(locol,hicol); icol++ ) /*each pix*/
2902  if ( ++ipix >= npix ) /* bounds check failed */
2903  if ( isfatal ) goto end_of_job; /* abort if error is fatal */
2904  else break; /*or just go on to next row*/
2905  else /* turn on pixel in line */
2906  if ( rp->pixsz == 1 ) /* have a pixel bitmap */
2907  setlongbit(rp->pixmap,ipix); /* so turn on bit in line */
2908  else /* should have a bytemap */
2909  if ( rp->pixsz == 8 ) /* check pixsz for bytemap */
2910  ((unsigned char *)(rp->pixmap))[ipix] = 255; /* set black byte */
2911  } /* --- end-of-for(irow) --- */
2912 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2913 now _redraw_ line one col at a time to avoid "gaps"
2914 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2915 if ( 1 )
2916  for ( icol=min2(col0,col1); icol<=max2(col0,col1); icol++ )/*each scan line*/
2917  {
2918  if ( !isbar && !isline ) /* neither vert nor horiz */
2919  { xrow = row0 + ((double)(icol-col0))*a; /* "middle" row in icol */
