2920  lorow = max2((int)(xrow-0.5*(xheight-1.0)),0); /* topmost row */
2921  hirow = min2((int)(xrow+0.5*(xheight-0.0)),max2(row0,row1)); } /*bot*/
2922  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=29 ) /* debugging */
2923  fprintf(msgfp,"\t icol=%d, xrow=%4.2f, lo,hirow=%d,%d\n",
2924  icol,xrow,lorow,hirow);
2925  ipix = irow*rp->width + min2(locol,hicol) - 1; /*first pix preceding icol*/
2926  for ( irow=min2(lorow,hirow); irow<=max2(lorow,hirow); irow++ ) /*each pix*/
2927  if ( irow<0 || irow>=rp->height
2928  || icol<0 || icol>=rp->width ) /* bounds check */
2929  if ( isfatal ) goto end_of_job; /* abort if error is fatal */
2930  else continue; /*or just go on to next row*/
2931  else
2932  setpixel(rp,irow,icol,255); /* set pixel at irow,icol */
2933  } /* --- end-of-for(irow) --- */
2934 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2935 Back to caller with 1=okay, 0=failed.
2936 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2937 end_of_job:
2938  return ( isfatal? (ipix<npix? 1:0) : 1 );
2939 } /* --- end-of-function line_raster() --- */
2940 
2941 
2942 /* ==========================================================================
2943  * Function: line_recurse ( rp, row0, col0, row1, col1, thickness )
2944  * Purpose: Draw a line from row0,col0 to row1,col1 of thickness
2945  * in existing raster rp.
2946  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2947  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster in which a line
2948  * will be drawn
2949  * row0 (I) double containing row at which
2950  * line will start (0 is topmost)
2951  * col0 (I) double containing col at which
2952  * line will start (0 is leftmost)
2953  * row1 (I) double containing row at which
2954  * line will end (rp->height-1 is bottom-most)
2955  * col1 (I) double containing col at which
2956  * line will end (rp->width-1 is rightmost)
2957  * thickness (I) int containing number of pixels/bits
2958  * thick the line will be
2959  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2960  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if line drawn okay,
2961  * or 0 for any error.
2962  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2963  * Notes: o Recurses, drawing left- and right-halves of line
2964  * until a horizontal or vertical segment is found
2965  * ======================================================================= */
2966 /* --- entry point --- */
2967 int line_recurse ( raster *rp, double row0, double col0,
2968  double row1, double col1, int thickness )
2969 {
2970 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2971 Allocations and Declarations
2972 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2973 double delrow = fabs(row1-row0), /* 0 if line horizontal */
2974  delcol = fabs(col1-col0), /* 0 if line vertical */
2975  tolerance = 0.5; /* draw line when it goes to point */
2976 double midrow = 0.5*(row0+row1), /* midpoint row */
2977  midcol = 0.5*(col0+col1); /* midpoint col */
2978 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2979 recurse if either delta > tolerance
2980 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2981 if ( delrow > tolerance /* row hasn't converged */
2982 || delcol > tolerance ) /* col hasn't converged */
2983  { line_recurse(rp,row0,col0,midrow,midcol,thickness); /* left half */
2984  line_recurse(rp,midrow,midcol,row1,col1,thickness); /* right half */
2985  return ( 1 ); }
2986 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2987 draw converged point
2988 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2989 setpixel(rp,iround(midrow),iround(midcol),255); /*set pixel at midrow,midcol*/
2990 return ( 1 );
2991 } /* --- end-of-function line_recurse() --- */
2992 
2993 
2994 /* ==========================================================================
2995  * Function: circle_raster ( rp, row0, col0, row1, col1,
2996  * thickness, quads )
2997  * Purpose: Draw quad(rant)s of an ellipse in box determined by
2998  * diagonally opposite corner points (row0,col0) and
2999  * (row1,col1), of thickness pixels in existing raster rp.
3000  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3001  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster in which an ellipse
3002  * will be drawn
3003  * row0 (I) int containing 1st corner row bounding ellipse
3004  * (0 is topmost)
3005  * col0 (I) int containing 1st corner col bounding ellipse
3006  * (0 is leftmost)
3007  * row1 (I) int containing 2nd corner row bounding ellipse
3008  * (rp->height-1 is bottom-most)
3009  * col1 (I) int containing 2nd corner col bounding ellipse
3010  * (rp->width-1 is rightmost)
3011  * thickness (I) int containing number of pixels/bits
3012  * thick the ellipse arc line will be
3013  * quads (I) char * to null-terminated string containing
3014  * any subset/combination of "1234" specifying
3015  * which quadrant(s) of ellipse to draw.
3016  * NULL ptr draws all four quadrants;
3017  * otherwise 1=upper-right quadrant,
3018  * 2=uper-left, 3=lower-left, 4=lower-right,
3019  * i.e., counterclockwise from 1=positive quad.
3020  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3021  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if ellipse drawn okay,
3022  * or 0 for any error.
3023  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3024  * Notes: o row0==row1 or col0==col1 are errors
3025  * o using ellipse equation x^2/a^2 + y^2/b^2 = 1
3026  * ======================================================================= */
3027 /* --- entry point --- */
3028 int circle_raster ( raster *rp, int row0, int col0,
3029  int row1, int col1, int thickness, char *quads )
3030 {
3031 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3032 Allocations and Declarations
3033 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3034 /* --- lower-left and upper-right bounding points (in our coords) --- */
3035 int lorow = min2(row0,row1), /* lower bounding row (top of box) */
3036  locol = min2(col0,col1), /* lower bounding col (left of box)*/
3037  hirow = max2(row0,row1), /* upper bounding row (bot of box) */
3038  hicol = max2(col0,col1); /* upper bounding col (right of box)*/
3039 /* --- a and b ellipse params --- */
3040 int width = hicol-locol+1, /* width of bounding box */
3041  height= hirow-lorow+1, /* height of bounding box */
3042  islandscape = (width>=height? 1:0); /*true if ellipse lying on side*/
3043 double a = ((double)width)/2.0, /* x=a when y=0 */
3044  b = ((double)height)/2.0, /* y=b when x=0 */
3045  abmajor = (islandscape? a : b), /* max2(a,b) */
3046  abminor = (islandscape? b : a), /* min2(a,b) */
3047  abmajor2 = abmajor*abmajor, /* abmajor^2 */
3048  abminor2 = abminor*abminor; /* abminor^2 */
3049 /* --- other stuff --- */
3050 int imajor=0, nmajor=max2(width,height), /*index, #pixels on major axis*/
3051  iminor=0, nminor=min2(width,height); /* solved index on minor axis */
3052 int irow, icol, /* raster indexes at circumference */
3053  rsign=1, csign=1; /* row,col signs, both +1 in quad 1*/
3054 double midrow= ((double)(row0+row1))/2.0, /* center row */
3055  midcol= ((double)(col0+col1))/2.0; /* center col */
3056 double xy, xy2, /* major axis ellipse coord */
3057  yx2, yx; /* solved minor ellipse coord */
3058 int isokay = 1; /* true if no pixels out-of-bounds */
3059 char *qptr=NULL, *allquads="1234"; /* quadrants if input quads==NULL */
3060 int circle_recurse(), isrecurse=1; /* true to draw ellipse recursively*/
3061 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3062 pixel-by-pixel along positive major axis, quit when it goes negative
3063 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3064 if ( quads == NULL ) quads = allquads; /* draw all quads, or only user's */
3065 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=39 ) /* debugging */
3066  fprintf(msgfp,"circle_raster> width,height;quads=%d,%d,%s\n",
3067  width,height,quads);
3068 if ( nmajor < 1 ) isokay = 0; /* problem with input args */
3069 else
3070  {
3071  if ( isrecurse ) /* use recursive algorithm */
3072  {
3073  for ( qptr=quads; *qptr!='\000'; qptr++ ) /* for each character in quads */
3074  {
3075  double theta0=0.0, theta1=0.0; /* set thetas based on quadrant */
3076  switch ( *qptr ) /* check for quadrant 1,2,3,4 */
3077  { default: /* unrecognized, assume quadrant 1 */
3078  case '1': theta0= 0.0; theta1= 90.0; break; /* first quadrant */
3079  case '2': theta0= 90.0; theta1=180.0; break; /* second quadrant */
3080  case '3': theta0=180.0; theta1=270.0; break; /* third quadrant */
3081  case '4': theta0=270.0; theta1=360.0; break; } /* fourth quadrant */
3082  circle_recurse(rp,row0,col0,row1,col1,thickness,theta0,theta1);
3083  } /* --- end-of-for(qptr) --- */
3084  return ( 1 );
3085  } /* --- end-of-if(isrecurse) --- */
3086  for ( imajor=(nmajor+1)/2; ; imajor-- )
3087  {
3088  /* --- xy is coord along major axis, yx is "solved" along minor axis --- */
3089  xy = ((double)imajor); /* xy = abmajor ... 0 */
3090  if ( xy < 0.0 ) break; /* negative side symmetrical */
3091  yx2 = abminor2*(1.0 - xy*xy/abmajor2); /* "solve" ellipse equation */
3092  yx = (yx2>0.0? sqrt(yx2) : 0.0); /* take sqrt if possible */
3093  iminor = iround(yx); /* nearest integer */
3094  /* --- set pixels for each requested quadrant --- */
3095  for ( qptr=quads; *qptr!='\000'; qptr++ ) /* for each character in quads */
3096  {
3097  rsign = (-1); csign = 1; /* init row,col in user quadrant 1 */
3098  switch ( *qptr ) /* check for quadrant 1,2,3,4 */
3099  { default: break; /* unrecognized, assume quadrant 1 */
3100  case '4': rsign = 1; break; /* row,col both pos in quadrant 4 */
3101  case '3': rsign = 1; /* row pos, col neg in quadrant 3 */
3102  case '2': csign = (-1); break; } /* row,col both neg in quadrant 2 */
3103  irow = iround(midrow + (double)rsign*(islandscape?yx:xy));
3104  irow = min2(hirow,max2(lorow,irow)); /* keep irow in bounds */
3105  icol = iround(midcol + (double)csign*(islandscape?xy:yx));
3106  icol = min2(hicol,max2(locol,icol)); /* keep icol in bounds */
3107  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=49 ) /* debugging */
3108  fprintf(msgfp,"\t...imajor=%d; iminor,quad,irow,icol=%d,%c,%d,%d\n",
3109  imajor,iminor,*qptr,irow,icol);
3110  if ( irow<0 || irow>=rp->height /* row outside raster */
3111  || icol<0 || icol>=rp->width ) /* col outside raster */
3112  { isokay = 0; /* signal out-of-bounds pixel */
3113  continue; } /* but still try remaining points */
3114  setpixel(rp,irow,icol,255); /* set pixel at irow,icol */
3115  } /* --- end-of-for(qptr) --- */
3116  } /* --- end-of-for(imajor) --- */
3117  /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------
3118  now do it _again_ along minor axis to avoid "gaps"
3119  ------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3120  if ( 1 && iminor>0 )
3121  for ( iminor=(nminor+1)/2; ; iminor-- )
3122  {
3123  /* --- yx is coord along minor axis, xy is "solved" along major axis --- */
3124  yx = ((double)iminor); /* yx = abminor ... 0 */
3125  if ( yx < 0.0 ) break; /* negative side symmetrical */
3126  xy2 = abmajor2*(1.0 - yx*yx/abminor2); /* "solve" ellipse equation */
3127  xy = (xy2>0.0? sqrt(xy2) : 0.0); /* take sqrt if possible */
3128  imajor = iround(xy); /* nearest integer */
3129  /* --- set pixels for each requested quadrant --- */
3130  for ( qptr=quads; *qptr!='\000'; qptr++ ) /* for each character in quads */
3131  {
3132  rsign = (-1); csign = 1; /* init row,col in user quadrant 1 */
3133  switch ( *qptr ) /* check for quadrant 1,2,3,4 */
3134  { default: break; /* unrecognized, assume quadrant 1 */
3135  case '4': rsign = 1; break; /* row,col both pos in quadrant 4 */
3136  case '3': rsign = 1; /* row pos, col neg in quadrant 3 */
3137  case '2': csign = (-1); break; } /* row,col both neg in quadrant 2 */
3138  irow = iround(midrow + (double)rsign*(islandscape?yx:xy));
3139  irow = min2(hirow,max2(lorow,irow)); /* keep irow in bounds */
3140  icol = iround(midcol + (double)csign*(islandscape?xy:yx));
3141  icol = min2(hicol,max2(locol,icol)); /* keep icol in bounds */
3142  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=49 ) /* debugging */
3143  fprintf(msgfp,"\t...iminor=%d; imajor,quad,irow,icol=%d,%c,%d,%d\n",
3144  iminor,imajor,*qptr,irow,icol);
3145  if ( irow<0 || irow>=rp->height /* row outside raster */
3146  || icol<0 || icol>=rp->width ) /* col outside raster */
3147  { isokay = 0; /* signal out-of-bounds pixel */
3148  continue; } /* but still try remaining points */
3149  setpixel(rp,irow,icol,255); /* set pixel at irow,icol */
3150  } /* --- end-of-for(qptr) --- */
3151  } /* --- end-of-for(iminor) --- */
3152  } /* --- end-of-if/else(nmajor<1) --- */
3153 return ( isokay );
3154 } /* --- end-of-function circle_raster() --- */
3155 
3156 
3157 /* ==========================================================================
3158  * Function: circle_recurse ( rp, row0, col0, row1, col1,
3159  * thickness, theta0, theta1 )
3160  * Purpose: Recursively draws arc theta0<=theta<=theta1 of the ellipse
3161  * in box determined by diagonally opposite corner points
3162  * (row0,col0) and (row1,col1), of thickness pixels in raster rp.
3163  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3164  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster in which an ellipse
3165  * will be drawn
3166  * row0 (I) int containing 1st corner row bounding ellipse
3167  * (0 is topmost)
3168  * col0 (I) int containing 1st corner col bounding ellipse
3169  * (0 is leftmost)
3170  * row1 (I) int containing 2nd corner row bounding ellipse
3171  * (rp->height-1 is bottom-most)
3172  * col1 (I) int containing 2nd corner col bounding ellipse
3173  * (rp->width-1 is rightmost)
3174  * thickness (I) int containing number of pixels/bits
3175  * thick the ellipse arc line will be
3176  * theta0 (I) double containing first angle -360 -> +360
3177  * theta1 (I) double containing second angle -360 -> +360
3178  * 0=x-axis, positive moving counterclockwise
3179  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3180  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if ellipse drawn okay,
3181  * or 0 for any error.
3182  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3183  * Notes: o row0==row1 or col0==col1 are errors
3184  * o using ellipse equation x^2/a^2 + y^2/b^2 = 1
3185  * Then, with x=r*cos(theta), y=r*sin(theta), ellipse
3186  * equation is r = ab/sqrt(a^2*sin^2(theta)+b^2*cos^2(theta))
3187  * ======================================================================= */
3188 /* --- entry point --- */
3189 int circle_recurse ( raster *rp, int row0, int col0,
3190  int row1, int col1, int thickness, double theta0, double theta1 )
3191 {
3192 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3193 Allocations and Declarations
3194 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3195 /* --- lower-left and upper-right bounding points (in our coords) --- */
3196 int lorow = min2(row0,row1), /* lower bounding row (top of box) */
3197  locol = min2(col0,col1), /* lower bounding col (left of box)*/
3198  hirow = max2(row0,row1), /* upper bounding row (bot of box) */
3199  hicol = max2(col0,col1); /* upper bounding col (right of box)*/
3200 /* --- a and b ellipse params --- */
3201 int width = hicol-locol+1, /* width of bounding box */
3202  height= hirow-lorow+1; /* height of bounding box */
3203 double a = ((double)width)/2.0, /* col x=a when row y=0 */
3204  b = ((double)height)/2.0, /* row y=b when col x=0 */
3205  ab=a*b, a2=a*a, b2=b*b; /* product and squares */
3206 /* --- arc parameters --- */
3207 double rads = 0.017453292, /* radians per degree = 1/57.29578 */
3208  lotheta = rads*dmod(min2(theta0,theta1),360), /* smaller angle */
3209  hitheta = rads*dmod(max2(theta0,theta1),360), /* larger angle */
3210  locos=cos(lotheta), losin=sin(lotheta), /* trigs for lotheta */
3211  hicos=cos(hitheta), hisin=sin(hitheta), /* trigs for hitheta */
3212  rlo = ab/sqrt(b2*locos*locos+a2*losin*losin), /* r for lotheta */
3213  rhi = ab/sqrt(b2*hicos*hicos+a2*hisin*hisin), /* r for hitheta */
3214  xlo=rlo*locos, ylo=rlo*losin, /*col,row pixel coords for lotheta*/
3215  xhi=rhi*hicos, yhi=rhi*hisin, /*col,row pixel coords for hitheta*/
3216  xdelta=fabs(xhi-xlo), ydelta=fabs(yhi-ylo), /* col,row deltas */
3217  tolerance = 0.5; /* convergence tolerance */
3218 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3219 recurse if either delta > tolerance
3220 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3221 if ( ydelta > tolerance /* row hasn't converged */
3222 || xdelta > tolerance ) /* col hasn't converged */
3223  { double midtheta = 0.5*(theta0+theta1); /* mid angle for arc */
3224  circle_recurse(rp,row0,col0,row1,col1,thickness,theta0,midtheta); /*lo*/
3225  circle_recurse(rp,row0,col0,row1,col1,thickness,midtheta,theta1); }/*hi*/
3226 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3227 draw converged point
3228 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3229 else
3230  { double xcol=0.5*(xlo+xhi), yrow=0.5*(ylo+yhi), /* relative to center*/
3231  centerrow = 0.5*((double)(lorow+hirow)), /* ellipse y-center */
3232  centercol = 0.5*((double)(locol+hicol)), /* ellipse x-center */
3233  midrow=centerrow-yrow, midcol=centercol+xcol; /* pixel coords */
3234  setpixel(rp,iround(midrow),iround(midcol),255); } /* set midrow,midcol */
3235 return ( 1 );
3236 } /* --- end-of-function circle_recurse() --- */
3237 
3238 
3239 /* ==========================================================================
3240  * Function: bezier_raster ( rp, r0,c0, r1,c1, rt,ct )
3241  * Purpose: Recursively draw bezier from r0,c0 to r1,c1
3242  * (with tangent point rt,ct) in existing raster rp.
3243  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3244  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster in which a line
3245  * will be drawn
3246  * r0 (I) double containing row at which
3247  * bezier will start (0 is topmost)
3248  * c0 (I) double containing col at which
3249  * bezier will start (0 is leftmost)
3250  * r1 (I) double containing row at which
3251  * bezier will end (rp->height-1 is bottom-most)
3252  * c1 (I) double containing col at which
3253  * bezier will end (rp->width-1 is rightmost)
3254  * rt (I) double containing row for tangent point
3255  * ct (I) double containing col for tangent point
3256  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3257  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if line drawn okay,
3258  * or 0 for any error.
3259  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3260  * Notes: o Recurses, drawing left- and right-halves of bezier curve
3261  * until a point is found
3262  * ======================================================================= */
3263 /* --- entry point --- */
3264 int bezier_raster ( raster *rp, double r0, double c0,
3265  double r1, double c1, double rt, double ct )
3266 {
3267 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3268 Allocations and Declarations
3269 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3270 double delrow = fabs(r1-r0), /* 0 if same row */
3271  delcol = fabs(c1-c0), /* 0 if same col */
3272  tolerance = 0.5; /* draw curve when it goes to point*/
3273 double midrow = 0.5*(r0+r1), /* midpoint row */
3274  midcol = 0.5*(c0+c1); /* midpoint col */
3275 int irow=0, icol=0; /* point to be drawn */
3276 int status = 1; /* return status */
3277 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3278 recurse if either delta > tolerance
3279 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3280 if ( delrow > tolerance /* row hasn't converged */
3281 || delcol > tolerance ) /* col hasn't converged */
3282  { bezier_raster(rp, r0,c0, /* left half */
3283  0.5*(rt+midrow), 0.5*(ct+midcol),
3284  0.5*(r0+rt), 0.5*(c0+ct) );
3285  bezier_raster(rp, 0.5*(rt+midrow), 0.5*(ct+midcol), /* right half */
3286  r1,c1,
3287  0.5*(r1+rt), 0.5*(c1+ct) );
3288  return ( 1 ); }
3289 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3290 draw converged point
3291 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3292 /* --- get integer point --- */
3293 irow = iround(midrow); /* row pixel coord */
3294 icol = iround(midcol); /* col pixel coord */
3295 /* --- bounds check --- */
3296 if ( irow>=0 && irow<rp->height /* row in bounds */
3297 && icol>=0 && icol<rp->width ) /* col in bounds */
3298  setpixel(rp,irow,icol,255); /* so set pixel at irow,icol*/
3299 else status = 0; /* bad status if out-of-bounds */
3300 return ( status );
3301 } /* --- end-of-function bezier_raster() --- */
3302 
3303 
3304 /* ==========================================================================
3305  * Function: border_raster ( rp, ntop, nbot, isline, isfree )
3306  * Purpose: Allocate a new raster containing a copy of input rp,
3307  * along with ntop extra rows at top and nbot at bottom,
3308  * and whose width is either adjusted correspondingly,
3309  * or is automatically enlarged to a multiple of 8
3310  * with original bitmap centered
3311  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3312  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster on which a border
3313  * is to be placed
3314  * ntop (I) int containing number extra rows at top.
3315  * if negative, abs(ntop) used, and same
3316  * number of extra cols added at left.
3317  * nbot (I) int containing number extra rows at bottom.
3318  * if negative, abs(nbot) used, and same
3319  * number of extra cols added at right.
3320  * isline (I) int containing 0 to leave border pixels clear
3321  * or >0 to draw a line around border of
3322  * thickness isline pixels. See Notes below.
3323  * isfree (I) int containing true to free rp before return
3324  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3325  * Returns: ( raster * ) ptr to bordered raster,
3326  * or NULL for any error.
3327  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3328  * Notes: o The isline arg also controls which sides border lines
3329  * are drawn for. To do this, isline is interpreted as
3330  * thickness + 100*sides so that, e.g., passing isline=601
3331  * is interpreted as sides=6 and thickness=1. And
3332  * sides is further interpreted as 1=left side, 2=top,
3333  * 4=right and 8=bottom. For example, sides=6 where 6=2+4
3334  * draws the top and right borders only. 15 draws all four
3335  * sides. And 0 (no sides value embedded in isline)
3336  * draws all four sides, too.
3337  * ======================================================================= */
3338 /* --- entry point --- */
3339 raster *border_raster ( raster *rp, int ntop, int nbot,
3340  int isline, int isfree )
3341 {
3342 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3343 Allocations and Declarations
3344 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3345 raster *new_raster(), *bp=(raster *)NULL; /*raster back to caller*/
3346 int rastput(); /* overlay rp in new bordered raster */
3347 int width = (rp==NULL?0:rp->width), /* width of raster */
3348  height = (rp==NULL?0:rp->height), /* height of raster */
3349  istopneg=0, isbotneg=0, /* true if ntop or nbot negative */
3350  leftmargin = 0; /* adjust width to whole number of bytes */
3351 int left=1, top=1, right=1, bot=1; /* frame sides to draw */
3352 int delete_raster(); /* free input rp if isfree is true */
3353 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3354 Initialization
3355 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3356 if ( rp == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no input raster provided */
3357 if ( isstring || (1 && rp->height==1) ) /* explicit string signal or infer */
3358  { bp=rp; goto end_of_job; } /* return ascii string unchanged */
3359 /* --- check for negative args --- */
3360 if ( ntop < 0 ) { ntop = -ntop; istopneg=1; } /*flip positive and set flag*/
3361 if ( nbot < 0 ) { nbot = -nbot; isbotneg=1; } /*flip positive and set flag*/
3362 /* --- adjust height for ntop and nbot margins --- */
3363 height += (ntop+nbot); /* adjust height for margins */
3364 /* --- adjust width for left and right margins --- */
3365 if ( istopneg || isbotneg ) /*caller wants nleft=ntop and/or nright=nbot*/
3366  { /* --- adjust width (and leftmargin) as requested by caller -- */
3367  if ( istopneg ) { width += ntop; leftmargin = ntop; }
3368  if ( isbotneg ) width += nbot; }
3369 else
3370  { /* --- or adjust width (and leftmargin) to whole number of bytes --- */
3371  leftmargin = (width%8==0? 0 : 8-(width%8)); /*makes width multiple of 8*/
3372  width += leftmargin; /* width now multiple of 8 */
3373  leftmargin /= 2; } /* center original raster */
3374 /* --- check which sides to draw --- */
3375 if ( isline > 100 ) { /* sides arg embedded in isline */
3376  int iside=0, sides=isline/100; /* index, sides=1-15 from 101-1599 */
3377  isline -= 100*sides; /* and remove sides from isline */
3378  for ( iside=1; iside<=4; iside++ ) { /* check left, top, right, bot */
3379  int shift = sides/2; /* shift sides left one bit */
3380  if ( sides == 2*shift ) /* low-order bit is >>not<< set */
3381  switch ( iside ) { /* don't draw corresponding side */
3382  default: break; /* internal error */
3383  case 1: left = 0; break; /* 1 = left side */
3384  case 2: top = 0; break; /* 2 = top side */
3385  case 3: right= 0; break; /* 4 = tight side */
3386  case 4: bot = 0; break; } /* 8 = bottom side */
3387  sides = shift; /* ready for next side */
3388  } /* --- end-of-for(iside) --- */
3389  } /* --- end-of-if(isline>100) --- */
3390 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3391 allocate bordered raster, and embed rp within it
3392 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3393 /* --- allocate bordered raster --- */
3394 if ( (bp=new_raster(width,height,rp->pixsz)) /*allocate bordered raster*/
3395 == (raster *)NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
3396 /* --- embed rp in it --- */
3397 rastput(bp,rp,ntop,leftmargin,1); /* rp embedded in bp */
3398 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3399 draw border if requested
3400 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3401 if ( isline )
3402  { int irow, icol, nthick=isline; /*height,width index, line thickness*/
3403  /* --- draw left- and right-borders --- */
3404  for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ ) /* for each row of bp */
3405  for ( icol=0; icol<nthick; icol++ ) /* and each pixel of thickness */
3406  { if(left){setpixel(bp,irow,icol,255);} /* left border */
3407  if(right){setpixel(bp,irow,width-1-icol,255);} } /* right border */
3408  /* --- draw top- and bottom-borders --- */
3409  for ( icol=0; icol<width; icol++ ) /* for each col of bp */
3410  for ( irow=0; irow<nthick; irow++ ) /* and each pixel of thickness */
3411  { if(top){setpixel(bp,irow,icol,255);} /* top border */
3412  if(bot){setpixel(bp,height-1-irow,icol,255);} } /* bottom border */
3413  } /* --- end-of-if(isline) --- */
3414 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3415 free rp if no longer needed
3416 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3417 if ( isfree ) /*caller no longer needs rp*/
3418  delete_raster(rp); /* so free it for him */
3419 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3420 Back to caller with bordered raster (or null for any error)
3421 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3422 end_of_job:
3423  return ( bp ); /* back with bordered or null ptr */
3424 } /* --- end-of-function border_raster() --- */
3425 
3426 
3427 /* ==========================================================================
3428  * Function: backspace_raster ( rp, nback, pback, minspace, isfree )
3429  * Purpose: Allocate a new raster containing a copy of input rp,
3430  * but with trailing nback columns removed.
3431  * If minspace>=0 then (at least) that many columns
3432  * of whitespace will be left in place, regardless of nback.
3433  * If minspace<0 then existing black pixels will be deleted
3434  * as required.
3435  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3436  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster on which a border
3437  * is to be placed
3438  * nback (I) int containing number of columns to
3439  * backspace (>=0)
3440  * pback (O) ptr to int returning #pixels actually
3441  * backspaced (or NULL to not use)
3442  * minspace (I) int containing number of columns
3443  * of whitespace to be left in place
3444  * isfree (I) int containing true to free rp before return
3445  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3446  * Returns: ( raster * ) ptr to backspaced raster,
3447  * or NULL for any error.
3448  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3449  * Notes: o For \! negative space, for \hspace{-10}, etc.
3450  * ======================================================================= */
3451 /* --- entry point --- */
3452 raster *backspace_raster ( raster *rp, int nback, int *pback, int minspace,
3453  int isfree )
3454 {
3455 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3456 Allocations and Declarations
3457 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3458 raster *new_raster(), *bp=(raster *)NULL; /* raster returned to caller */
3459 int delete_raster(); /* free input rp if isfree is true */
3460 int width = (rp==NULL?0:rp->width), /* original width of raster */
3461  height = (rp==NULL?0:rp->height), /* height of raster */
3462  mback = nback, /* nback adjusted for minspace */
3463  newwidth = width, /* adjusted width after backspace */
3464  icol=0, irow=0; /* col,row index */
3465 if ( rp == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no input given */
3466 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3467 locate rightmost column of rp containing ink, and determine backspaced width
3468 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3469 /* --- locate rightmost column of rp containing ink --- */
3470 if ( minspace >= 0 ) /* only needed if given minspace */
3471  for ( icol=width-1; icol>=0; icol-- ) /* find first non-empty col in row */
3472  for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ ) /* for each row inside rp */
3473  if ( getpixel(rp,irow,icol) != 0 ) { /* found a set pixel */
3474  int whitecols = (width-1) - icol; /* #cols containing white space */
3475  mback = min2(nback,max2(0,whitecols-minspace)); /*leave minspace cols*/
3476  goto gotright; } /* no need to look further */
3477 /* --- determine width of new backspaced raster --- */
3478 gotright: /* found col with ink (or rp empty)*/
3479  if ( mback > width ) mback = width; /* can't backspace before beginning*/
3480  newwidth = max2(1,width-mback); /* #cols in backspaced raster */
3481  if ( pback != NULL ) *pback = width-newwidth; /* caller wants #pixels */
3482 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3483 allocate new raster and fill it with leftmost cols of rp
3484 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3485 /* --- allocate backspaced raster --- */
3486 if ( (bp=new_raster(newwidth,height,rp->pixsz)) /*allocate backspaced raster*/
3487 == (raster *)NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
3488 /* --- fill new raster --- */
3489 if ( 1 || width-nback > 0 ) /* don't fill 1-pixel wide empty bp*/
3490  for ( icol=0; icol<newwidth; icol++ ) /* find first non-empty col in row */
3491  for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ ) /* for each row inside rp */
3492  { int value = getpixel(rp,irow,icol); /* original pixel at irow,icol */
3493  setpixel(bp,irow,icol,value); } /* saved in backspaced raster */
3494 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3495 Back to caller with backspaced raster (or null for any error)
3496 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3497 end_of_job:
3498  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 ) { fprintf(msgfp, /* diagnostics */
3499  "backspace_raster> nback=%d,minspace=%d,mback=%d, width:old=%d,new=%d\n",
3500  nback,minspace,mback,width,newwidth); fflush(msgfp); }
3501  if ( isfree && bp!=NULL ) delete_raster(rp); /* free original raster */
3502  return ( bp ); /* back with backspaced or null ptr*/
3503 } /* --- end-of-function backspace_raster() --- */
3504 
3505 
3506 /* ==========================================================================
3507  * Function: type_raster ( rp, fp )
3508  * Purpose: Emit an ascii dump representing rp, on fp.
3509  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3510  * Arguments: rp (I) ptr to raster struct for which an
3511  * ascii dump is to be constructed.
3512  * fp (I) File ptr to output device (defaults to
3513  * stdout if passed as NULL).
3514  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3515  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
3516  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
3517  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3518  * Notes:
3519  * ======================================================================= */
3520 /* --- entry point --- */
3521 int type_raster ( raster *rp, FILE *fp )
3522 {
3523 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3524 Allocations and Declarations
3525 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3526 static int display_width = 72; /* max columns for display */
3527 static char display_chars[16] = /* display chars for bytemap */
3528  { ' ','1','2','3','4','5','6','7','8','9','A','B','C','D','E','*' };
3529 char scanline[133]; /* ascii image for one scan line */
3530 int scan_width; /* #chars in scan (<=display_width)*/
3531 int irow, locol,hicol=(-1); /* height index, width indexes */
3532 raster *gftobitmap(), *bitmaprp=rp; /* convert .gf to bitmap if needed */
3533 int delete_raster(); /*free bitmap converted for display*/
3534 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3535 initialization
3536 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3537 /* --- redirect null fp --- */
3538 if ( fp == (FILE *)NULL ) fp = stdout; /* default fp to stdout if null */
3539 if ( msglevel >= 999 ) { fprintf(fp, /* debugging diagnostics */
3540  "type_raster> width=%d height=%d ...\n",
3541  rp->width,rp->height); fflush(fp); }
3542 /* --- check for ascii string --- */
3543 if ( isstring /* pixmap has string, not raster */
3544 || (0 && rp->height==1) ) /* infer input rp is a string */
3545  {
3546  char *string = (char *)(rp->pixmap); /*interpret pixmap as ascii string*/
3547  int width = strlen(string); /* #chars in ascii string */
3548  while ( width > display_width-2 ) /* too big for one line */
3549  { fprintf(fp,"\"%.*s\"\n",display_width-2,string); /*display leading chars*/
3550  string += (display_width-2); /* bump string past displayed chars*/
3551  width -= (display_width-2); } /* decrement remaining width */
3552  fprintf(fp,"\"%.*s\"\n",width,string); /* display trailing chars */
3553  return ( 1 );
3554  } /* --- end-of-if(isstring) --- */
3555 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3556 display ascii dump of bitmap image (in segments if display_width < rp->width)
3557 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3558 if ( rp->format == 2 /* input is .gf-formatted */
3559 || rp->format == 3 )
3560  bitmaprp = gftobitmap(rp); /* so convert it for display */
3561 if ( bitmaprp != NULL ) /* if we have image for display */
3562  while ( (locol=hicol+1) < rp->width ) /*start where prev segment left off*/
3563  {
3564  /* --- set hicol for this pass (locol set above) --- */
3565  hicol += display_width; /* show as much as display allows */
3566  if (hicol >= rp->width) hicol = rp->width - 1; /*but not more than raster*/
3567  scan_width = hicol-locol+1; /* #chars in this scan */
3568  if ( locol > 0 ) fprintf(fp,"----------\n"); /*separator between segments*/
3569  /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------
3570  display all scan lines for this local...hicol segment range
3571  ------------------------------------------------------------------------ */
3572  for ( irow=0; irow<rp->height; irow++ ) /* all scan lines for col range */
3573  {
3574  /* --- allocations and declarations --- */
3575  int ipix, /* pixmap[] index for this scan */
3576  lopix = irow*rp->width + locol; /*first pixmap[] pixel in this scan*/
3577  /* --- set chars in scanline[] based on pixels in rp->pixmap[] --- */
3578  for ( ipix=0; ipix<scan_width; ipix++ ) /* set each char */
3579  if ( bitmaprp->pixsz == 1 ) /*' '=0 or '*'=1 to display bitmap*/
3580  scanline[ipix]=(getlongbit(bitmaprp->pixmap,lopix+ipix)==1? '*':'.');
3581  else /* should have a bytemap */
3582  if ( bitmaprp->pixsz == 8 ) /* double-check pixsz for bytemap */
3583  { int pixval = (int)((bitmaprp->pixmap)[lopix+ipix]), /*byte value*/
3584  ichar = min2(15,pixval/16); /* index for ' ', '1'...'e', '*' */
3585  scanline[ipix] = display_chars[ichar]; } /*set ' ' for 0-15, etc*/
3586  /* --- display completed scan line --- */
3587  fprintf(fp,"%.*s\n",scan_width,scanline);
3588  } /* --- end-of-for(irow) --- */
3589  } /* --- end-of-while(hicol<rp->width) --- */
3590 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3591 Back to caller with 1=okay, 0=failed.
3592 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3593 if ( rp->format == 2 /* input was .gf-format */
3594 || rp->format == 3 )
3595  if ( bitmaprp != NULL ) /* and we converted it for display */
3596  delete_raster(bitmaprp); /* no longer needed, so free it */
3597 return ( 1 );
3598 } /* --- end-of-function type_raster() --- */
3599 
3600 
3601 /* ==========================================================================
3602  * Function: type_bytemap ( bp, grayscale, width, height, fp )
3603  * Purpose: Emit an ascii dump representing bp, on fp.
3604  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3605  * Arguments: bp (I) intbyte * to bytemap for which an
3606  * ascii dump is to be constructed.
3607  * grayscale (I) int containing #gray shades, 256 for 8-bit
3608  * width (I) int containing #cols in bytemap
3609  * height (I) int containing #rows in bytemap
3610  * fp (I) File ptr to output device (defaults to
3611  * stdout if passed as NULL).
3612  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3613  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
3614  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
3615  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3616  * Notes:
3617  * ======================================================================= */
3618 /* --- entry point --- */
3619 int type_bytemap ( intbyte *bp, int grayscale,
3620  int width, int height, FILE *fp )
3621 {
3622 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3623 Allocations and Declarations
3624 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3625 static int display_width = 72; /* max columns for display */
3626 int byte_width = 3, /* cols to display byte (ff+space) */
3627  maxbyte = 0; /* if maxbyte<16, set byte_width=2 */
3628 int white_byte = 0, /* show dots for white_byte's */
3629  black_byte = grayscale-1; /* show stars for black_byte's */
3630 char scanline[133]; /* ascii image for one scan line */
3631 int scan_width, /* #chars in scan (<=display_width)*/
3632  scan_cols; /* #cols in scan (hicol-locol+1) */
3633 int ibyte, /* bp[] index */
3634  irow, locol,hicol=(-1); /* height index, width indexes */
3635 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3636 initialization
3637 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3638 /* --- redirect null fp --- */
3639 if ( fp == (FILE *)NULL ) fp = stdout; /* default fp to stdout if null */
3640 /* --- check for ascii string --- */
3641 if ( isstring ) /* bp has ascii string, not raster */
3642  { width = strlen((char *)bp); /* #chars in ascii string */
3643  height = 1; } /* default */
3644 /* --- see if we can get away with byte_width=1 --- */
3645 for ( ibyte=0; ibyte<width*height; ibyte++ ) /* check all bytes */
3646  { int byteval = (int)bp[ibyte]; /* current byte value */
3647  if ( byteval < black_byte ) /* if it's less than black_byte */
3648  maxbyte = max2(maxbyte,byteval); } /* then find max non-black value */
3649 if ( maxbyte < 16 ) /* bytevals will fit in one column */
3650  byte_width = 1; /* so reset display byte_width */
3651 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3652 display ascii dump of bitmap image (in segments if display_width < rp->width)
3653 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3654 while ( (locol=hicol+1) < width ) /*start where prev segment left off*/
3655  {
3656  /* --- set hicol for this pass (locol set above) --- */
3657  hicol += display_width/byte_width; /* show as much as display allows */
3658  if (hicol >= width) hicol = width - 1; /* but not more than bytemap */
3659  scan_cols = hicol-locol+1; /* #cols in this scan */
3660  scan_width = byte_width*scan_cols; /* #chars in this scan */
3661  if ( locol>0 && !isstring ) fprintf(fp,"----------\n"); /* separator */
3662  /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------
3663  display all scan lines for this local...hicol segment range
3664  ------------------------------------------------------------------------ */
3665  for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ ) /* all scan lines for col range */
3666  {
3667  /* --- allocations and declarations --- */
3668  int lobyte = irow*width + locol; /* first bp[] byte in this scan */
3669  char scanbyte[32]; /* sprintf() buffer for byte */
3670  /* --- set chars in scanline[] based on bytes in bytemap bp[] --- */
3671  memset(scanline,' ',scan_width); /* blank out scanline */
3672  for ( ibyte=0; ibyte<scan_cols; ibyte++ ) /* set chars for each col */
3673  { int byteval = (int)bp[lobyte+ibyte]; /* value of current byte */
3674  memset(scanbyte,'.',byte_width); /* dot-fill scanbyte */
3675  if ( byteval == black_byte ) /* but if we have a black byte */
3676  memset(scanbyte,'*',byte_width); /* star-fill scanbyte instead */
3677  if ( byte_width > 1 ) /* don't blank out single char */
3678  scanbyte[byte_width-1] = ' '; /* blank-fill rightmost character */
3679  if ( byteval != white_byte /* format bytes that are non-white */
3680  && byteval != black_byte ) /* and that are non-black */
3681  sprintf(scanbyte,"%*x ",max2(1,byte_width-1),byteval); /*hex-format*/
3682  memcpy(scanline+ibyte*byte_width,scanbyte,byte_width); } /*in line*/
3683  /* --- display completed scan line --- */
3684  fprintf(fp,"%.*s\n",scan_width,scanline);
3685  } /* --- end-of-for(irow) --- */
3686  } /* --- end-of-while(hicol<width) --- */
3687 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3688 Back to caller with 1=okay, 0=failed.
3689 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3690 return ( 1 );
3691 } /* --- end-of-function type_bytemap() --- */
3692 
3693 
3694 /* ==========================================================================
3695  * Function: xbitmap_raster ( rp, fp )
3696  * Purpose: Emit a mime xbitmap representing rp, on fp.
3697  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3698  * Arguments: rp (I) ptr to raster struct for which a mime
3699  * xbitmap is to be constructed.
3700  * fp (I) File ptr to output device (defaults to
3701  * stdout if passed as NULL).
3702  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3703  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
3704  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
3705  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3706  * Notes:
3707  * ======================================================================= */
3708 /* --- entry point --- */
3709 int xbitmap_raster ( raster *rp, FILE *fp )
3710 {
3711 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3712 Allocations and Declarations
3713 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3714 char *title = "image"; /* dummy title */
3715 int hex_bitmap(); /* dump bitmap as hex bytes */
3716 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3717 emit text to display mime xbitmap representation of rp->bitmap image
3718 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3719 /* --- first redirect null fp --- */
3720 if ( fp == (FILE *)NULL ) fp = stdout; /* default fp to stdout if null */
3721 /* --- check for ascii string --- */
3722 if ( isstring ) /* pixmap has string, not raster */
3723  return ( 0 ); /* can't handle ascii string */
3724 /* --- emit prologue strings and hex dump of bitmap for mime xbitmap --- */
3725 fprintf( fp, "Content-type: image/x-xbitmap\n\n" );
3726 fprintf( fp, "#define %s_width %d\n#define %s_height %d\n",
3727  title,rp->width, title,rp->height );
3728 fprintf( fp, "static char %s_bits[] = {\n", title );
3729 hex_bitmap(rp,fp,0,0); /* emit hex dump of bitmap bytes */
3730 fprintf (fp,"};\n"); /* ending with "};" for C array */
3731 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3732 Back to caller with 1=okay, 0=failed.
3733 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3734 return ( 1 );
3735 } /* --- end-of-function xbitmap_raster() --- */
3736 
3737 
3738 /* ==========================================================================
3739  * Function: type_pbmpgm ( rp, ptype, file )
3740  * Purpose: Write pbm or pgm image of rp to file
3741  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3742  * Arguments: rp (I) ptr to raster struct for which
3743  * a pbm/pgm file is to be written.
3744  * ptype (I) int containing 1 for pbm, 2 for pgm, or
3745  * 0 to determine ptype from values in rp
3746  * file (I) ptr to null-terminated char string
3747  * containing name of fuke to be written
3748  * (see notes below).
3749  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3750  * Returns: ( int ) total #bytes written,
3751  * or 0 for any error.
3752  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3753  * Notes: o (a) If file==NULL, output is written to stdout;
3754  * (b) if *file=='\000' then file is taken as the
3755  * address of an output buffer to which output
3756  * is written (and is followed by a terminating
3757  * '\0' which is not counted in #bytes returned);
3758  * (c) otherwise file is the filename (opened and
3759  * closed internally) to which output is written,
3760  * except that any final .ext extension is replaced
3761  * by .pbm or .pgm depending on ptype.
3762  * ======================================================================= */
3763 /* --- entry point --- */
3764 int type_pbmpgm ( raster *rp, int ptype, char *file )
3765 {
3766 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3767 Allocations and Declarations
3768 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3769 int isokay=0, nbytes=0; /* completion flag, total #bytes written */
3770 int irow=0, jcol=0; /*height(row), width(col) indexes in raster*/
3771 int pixmin=9999, pixmax=(-9999), /* min, max pixel value in raster */
3772  ngray = 0; /* #gray scale values */
3773 FILE /* *fopen(), */ *fp=NULL; /* pointer to output file (or NULL) */
3774 char outline[1024], outfield[256], /* output line, field */
3775  cr[16] = "\n\000"; /* cr at end-of-line */
3776 int maxlinelen = 70; /* maximum allowed line length */
3777 int pixfrac=6; /* use (pixmax-pixmin)/pixfrac as step */
3778 static char
3779  *suffix[] = { NULL, ".pbm", ".pgm" }, /* file.suffix[ptype] */
3780  *magic[] = { NULL, "P1", "P2" }, /*identifying "magic number"*/
3781  *mode[] = { NULL, "w", "w" }; /* fopen() mode[ptype] */
3782 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3783 check input, determine grayscale, and set up output file if necessary
3784 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3785 /* --- check input args --- */
3786 if ( rp == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no input raster provided */
3787 if ( ptype != 0 ) /* we'll determine ptype below */
3788  if ( ptype<1 || ptype>2 ) goto end_of_job; /*invalid output graphic format*/
3789 /* --- determine largest (and smallest) value in pixmap --- */
3790 for ( irow=0; irow<rp->height; irow++ ) /* for each row, top-to-bottom */
3791  for ( jcol=0; jcol<rp->width; jcol++ ) /* for each col, left-to-right */
3792  { int pixval = getpixel(rp,irow,jcol); /* value of pixel at irow,jcol */
3793  pixmin = min2(pixmin,pixval); /* new minimum */
3794  pixmax = max2(pixmax,pixval); } /* new maximum */
3795 ngray = 1 + (pixmax-pixmin); /* should be 2 for b/w bitmap */
3796 if ( ptype == 0 ) /* caller wants us to set ptype */
3797  ptype = (ngray>=3?2:1); /* use grayscale if >2 shades */
3798 /* --- open output file if necessary --- */
3799 if ( file == NULL ) fp = stdout; /*null ptr signals output to stdout*/
3800 else if ( *file != '\000' ) { /* explicit filename provided, so...*/
3801  char fname[512], *pdot=NULL; /* file.ext, ptr to last . in fname*/
3802  strncpy(fname,file,255); /* local copy of file name */
3803  fname[255] = '\000'; /* make sure it's null terminated */
3804  if ( (pdot=strrchr(fname,'.')) == NULL ) /*no extension on original name*/
3805  strcat(fname,suffix[ptype]); /* so add extension */
3806  else /* we already have an extension */
3807  strcpy(pdot,suffix[ptype]); /* so replace original extension */
3808  if ( (fp = fopen(fname,mode[ptype])) /* open output file */
3809  == (FILE *)NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed to open */
3810  } /* --- ens-of-if(*file!='\0') --- */
3811 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3812 emit http headers if running as cgi
3813 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3814 /* --- emit mime content-type line --- */
3815 if ( isquery && fp==stdout ) /* writing to http server */
3816  { fprintf( stdout, "Cache-Control: max-age=9999\n" );
3817  fprintf( stdout, "Content-type: text/plain\n\n" ); }
3818 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3819 format and write header
3820 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3821 /* --- format header info --- */
3822 *outline = '\000'; /* initialize line buffer */
3823 strcat(outline,magic[ptype]); /* begin file with "magic number" */
3824 strcat(outline,cr); /* followed by cr to end line */
3825 sprintf(outfield,"%d %d",rp->width,rp->height); /* format width and height */
3826 strcat(outline,outfield); /* add width and height to header */
3827 strcat(outline,cr); /* followed by cr to end line */
3828 if ( ptype == 2 ) /* need max grayscale value */
3829  { sprintf(outfield,"%d",pixmax); /* format maximum pixel value */
3830  strcat(outline,outfield); /* add max value to header */
3831  strcat(outline,cr); } /* followed by cr to end line */
3832 /* --- write header to file or memory buffer --- */
3833 if ( fp == NULL ) /* if we have no open file... */
3834  strcat(file,outline); /* add header to caller's buffer */
3835 else /* or if we have an open file... */
3836  if ( fputs(outline,fp) /* try writing header to open file */
3837  == EOF ) goto end_of_job; /* return with error if failed */
3838 nbytes += strlen(outline); /* bump output byte count */
3839 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3840 format and write pixels
3841 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3842 *outline = '\000'; /* initialize line buffer */
3843 for ( irow=0; irow<=rp->height; irow++ ) /* for each row, top-to-bottom */
3844  for ( jcol=0; jcol<rp->width; jcol++ ) { /* for each col, left-to-right */
3845  /* --- format value at irow,jcol--- */
3846  *outfield = '\000'; /* init empty field */
3847  if ( irow < rp->height ) { /* check row index */
3848  int pixval = getpixel(rp,irow,jcol); /* value of pixel at irow,jcol */
3849  if ( ptype == 1 ) /* pixval must be 1 or 0 */
3850  pixval = (pixval>pixmin+((pixmax-pixmin)/pixfrac)?1:0);
3851  sprintf(outfield,"%d ",pixval); } /* format pixel value */
3852  /* --- write line if this value won't fit on it (or last line) --- */
3853  if ( strlen(outline)+strlen(outfield)+strlen(cr) >= maxlinelen /*won't fit*/
3854  || irow >= rp->height ) { /* force writing last line */
3855  strcat(outline,cr); /* add cr to end current line */
3856  if ( fp == NULL ) /* if we have no open file... */
3857  strcat(file,outline); /* add header to caller's buffer */
3858  else /* or if we have an open file... */
3859  if ( fputs(outline,fp) /* try writing header to open file */
3860  == EOF ) goto end_of_job; /* return with error if failed */
3861  nbytes += strlen(outline); /* bump output byte count */
3862  *outline = '\000'; /* re-initialize line buffer */
3863  } /* --- end-of-if(strlen>=maxlinelen) --- */
3864  if ( irow >= rp->height ) break; /* done after writing last line */
3865  /* --- concatanate value to line -- */
3866  strcat(outline,outfield); /* concatanate value to line */
3867  } /* --- end-of-for(jcol,irow) --- */
3868 isokay = 1; /* signal successful completion */
3869 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3870 Back to caller with total #bytes written, or 0=failed.
3871 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3872 end_of_job:
3873  if ( fp != NULL /* output written to an open file */
3874  && fp != stdout ) /* and it's not just stdout */
3875  fclose(fp); /* so close file before returning */
3876  return ( (isokay?nbytes:0) ); /*back to caller with #bytes written*/
3877 } /* --- end-of-function type_pbmpgm() --- */
3878 
3879 
3880 /* ==========================================================================
3881  * Function: cstruct_chardef ( cp, fp, col1 )
3882  * Purpose: Emit a C struct of cp on fp, starting in col1.
3883  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3884  * Arguments: cp (I) ptr to chardef struct for which
3885  * a C struct is to be generated.
3886  * fp (I) File ptr to output device (defaults to
3887  * stdout if passed as NULL).
3888  * col1 (I) int containing 0...65; output lines
3889  * are preceded by col1 blanks.
3890  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3891  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
3892  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
3893  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3894  * Notes:
3895  * ======================================================================= */
3896 /* --- entry point --- */
3897 int cstruct_chardef ( chardef *cp, FILE *fp, int col1 )
3898 {
3899 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3900 Allocations and Declarations
3901 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3902 char field[64]; /* field within output line */
3903 int cstruct_raster(), /* emit a raster */
3904  emit_string(); /* emit a string and comment */
3905 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3906 emit charnum, location, name / hirow, hicol, lorow, locol
3907 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3908 /* --- charnum, location, name --- */
3909 sprintf(field,"{ %3d,%5d,\n", cp->charnum,cp->location); /*char#,location*/
3910 emit_string ( fp, col1, field, "character number, location");
3911 /* --- toprow, topleftcol, botrow, botleftcol --- */
3912 sprintf(field," %3d,%2d, %3d,%2d,\n", /* format... */
3913  cp->toprow,cp->topleftcol, /* toprow, topleftcol, */
3914  cp->botrow,cp->botleftcol); /* and botrow, botleftcol */
3915 emit_string ( fp, col1, field, "topleft row,col, and botleft row,col");
3916 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3917 emit raster and chardef's closing brace, and then return to caller
3918 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3919 cstruct_raster(&cp->image,fp,col1+4); /* emit raster */
3920 emit_string ( fp, 0, " }", NULL); /* emit closing brace */
3921 return ( 1 ); /* back to caller with 1=okay, 0=failed */
3922 } /* --- end-of-function cstruct_chardef() --- */
3923 
3924 
3925 /* ==========================================================================
3926  * Function: cstruct_raster ( rp, fp, col1 )
3927  * Purpose: Emit a C struct of rp on fp, starting in col1.
3928  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3929  * Arguments: rp (I) ptr to raster struct for which
3930  * a C struct is to be generated.
3931  * fp (I) File ptr to output device (defaults to
3932  * stdout if passed as NULL).
3933  * col1 (I) int containing 0...65; output lines
3934  * are preceded by col1 blanks.
3935  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3936  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
3937  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
3938  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3939  * Notes:
3940  * ======================================================================= */
3941 /* --- entry point --- */
3942 int cstruct_raster ( raster *rp, FILE *fp, int col1 )
3943 {
3944 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3945 Allocations and Declarations
3946 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3947 char field[64]; /* field within output line */
3948 char typecast[64] = "(pixbyte *)"; /* type cast for pixmap string */
3949 int hex_bitmap(); /* to emit raster bitmap */
3950 int emit_string(); /* emit a string and comment */
3951 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3952 emit width and height
3953 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3954 sprintf(field,"{ %2d, %3d,%2d,%2d, %s\n", /* format width,height,pixsz */
3955  rp->width,rp->height,rp->format,rp->pixsz,typecast);
3956 emit_string ( fp, col1, field, "width,ht, fmt,pixsz,map...");
3957 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3958 emit bitmap and closing brace, and return to caller
3959 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3960 hex_bitmap(rp,fp,col1+2,1); /* emit bitmap */
3961 emit_string ( fp, 0, " }", NULL); /* emit closing brace */
3962 return ( 1 ); /* back to caller with 1=okay, 0=failed */
3963 } /* --- end-of-function cstruct_raster() --- */
3964 
3965 
3966 /* ==========================================================================
3967  * Function: hex_bitmap ( rp, fp, col1, isstr )
3968  * Purpose: Emit a hex dump of the bitmap of rp on fp, starting in col1.
3969  * If isstr (is string) is true, the dump is of the form
3970  * "\x01\x02\x03\x04\x05..."
3971  * Otherwise, if isstr is false, the dump is of the form
3972  * 0x01,0x02,0x03,0x04,0x05...
3973  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3974  * Arguments: rp (I) ptr to raster struct for which
3975  * a hex dump is to be constructed.
3976  * fp (I) File ptr to output device (defaults to
3977  * stdout if passed as NULL).
3978  * col1 (I) int containing 0...65; output lines
3979  * are preceded by col1 blanks.
3980  * isstr (I) int specifying dump format as described above
3981  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3982  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
3983  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
3984  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3985  * Notes:
3986  * ======================================================================= */
3987 /* --- entry point --- */
3988 int hex_bitmap ( raster *rp, FILE *fp, int col1, int isstr )
3989 {
3990 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
3991 Allocations and Declarations
3992 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3993 int ibyte, /* pixmap[ibyte] index */
3994  nbytes = pixbytes(rp); /*#bytes in bitmap or .gf-formatted*/
3995 char stub[64]=" ";/* col1 leading blanks */
3996 int linewidth = 64, /* (roughly) rightmost column */
3997  colwidth = (isstr? 4:5); /* #cols required for each byte */
3998 int ncols = (linewidth-col1)/colwidth; /* new line after ncols bytes */
3999 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4000 initialization
4001 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4002 /* --- redirect null fp --- */
4003 if ( fp == (FILE *)NULL ) fp = stdout; /* default fp to stdout if null */
4004 /* --- emit initial stub if wanted --- */
4005 if ( col1 > 0 ) fprintf(fp,"%.*s",col1,stub); /* stub preceding 1st line */
4006 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4007 emit hex dump of rp->bitmap image
4008 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4009 if ( isstr ) fprintf(fp,"\""); /* opening " before first line */
4010 for ( ibyte=0; ibyte<nbytes; ibyte++ ) /* one byte at a time */
4011  {
4012  /* --- display a byte as hex char or number, depending on isstr --- */
4013  if ( isstr ) /* string format wanted */
4014  fprintf(fp,"\\x%02x",(rp->pixmap)[ibyte]); /*print byte as hex char*/
4015  else /* comma-separated format wanted */
4016  fprintf(fp,"0x%02x",(rp->pixmap)[ibyte]); /*print byte as hex number*/
4017  /* --- add a separator and newline, etc, as necessary --- */
4018  if ( ibyte < nbytes-1) /* not the last byte yet */
4019  {
4020  if ( !isstr ) fprintf(fp,","); /* follow hex number with comma */
4021  if ( (ibyte+1)%ncols==0 ) { /* need new line after every ncols */
4022  if ( !isstr ) /* for hex numbers format ... */
4023  fprintf(fp,"\n%.*s",col1,stub); /* ...just need newline and stub */
4024  else /* for string format... */
4025  fprintf(fp,"\"\n%.*s\"",col1,stub); } /*...need closing, opening "s*/
4026  } /* --- end-of-if(ibyte<nbytes-1) --- */
4027  } /* --- end-of-for(ibyte) --- */
4028 if ( isstr ) fprintf(fp,"\""); /* closing " after last line */
4029 return ( 1 ); /* back with 1=okay, 0=failed */
4030 } /* --- end-of-function hex_bitmap() --- */
4031 
4032 
4033 /* ==========================================================================
4034  * Function: emit_string ( fp, col1, string, comment )
4035  * Purpose: Emit string on fp, starting in col1,
4036  * and followed by right-justified comment.
4037  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4038  * Arguments: fp (I) File ptr to output device (defaults to
4039  * stdout if passed as NULL).
4040  * col1 (I) int containing 0 or #blanks preceding string
4041  * string (I) char * containing string to be emitted.
4042  * If last char of string is '\n',
4043  * the emitted line ends with a newline,
4044  * otherwise not.
4045  * comment (I) NULL or char * containing right-justified
4046  * comment (we enclose between /star and star/)
4047  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4048  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if completed successfully,
4049  * or 0 otherwise (for any error).
4050  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4051  * Notes: o
4052  * ======================================================================= */
4053 /* --- entry point --- */
4054 int emit_string ( FILE *fp, int col1, char *string, char *comment )
4055 {
4056 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4057 Allocations and Declarations
4058 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4059 char line[256]; /* construct line with caller's fields */
4060 int fieldlen; /* #chars in one of caller's fields */
4061 int linelen = 72; /*line length (for right-justified comment)*/
4062 int isnewline = 0; /* true to emit \n at end of line */
4063 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4064 construct line containing prolog, string, epilog, and finally comment
4065 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4066 /* --- init line --- */
4067 memset(line,' ',255); /* start line with blanks */
4068 /* --- embed string into line --- */
4069 if ( string != NULL ) /* if caller gave us a string... */
4070  { fieldlen = strlen(string); /* #cols required for string */
4071  if ( string[fieldlen-1] == '\n' ) /* check last char for newline */
4072  { isnewline = 1; /* got it, so set flag */
4073  fieldlen--; } /* but don't print it yet */
4074  memcpy(line+col1,string,fieldlen); /* embid string starting at col1 */
4075  col1 += fieldlen; } /* bump col past epilog */
4076 /* --- embed comment into line --- */
4077 if ( comment != NULL ) /* if caller gave us a comment... */
4078  { fieldlen = 6 + strlen(comment); /* plus /star, star/, 2 spaces */
4079  if ( linelen-fieldlen < col1 ) /* comment won't fit */
4080  fieldlen -= (col1 - (linelen-fieldlen)); /* truncate comment to fit */
4081  if ( fieldlen > 6 ) /* can fit all or part of comment */
4082  sprintf(line+linelen-fieldlen,"/%c %.*s %c/", /* so embed it in line */
4083  '*', fieldlen-6,comment, '*');
4084  col1 = linelen; } /* indicate line filled */
4085 /* --- line completed --- */
4086 line[col1] = '\000'; /* null-terminate completed line */
4087 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4088 emit line, then back to caller with 1=okay, 0=failed.
4089 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4090 /* --- first redirect null fp --- */
4091 if ( fp == (FILE *)NULL ) fp = stdout; /* default fp to stdout if null */
4092 /* --- emit line (and optional newline) --- */
4093 fprintf(fp,"%.*s",linelen,line); /* no more than linelen chars */
4094 if ( isnewline ) fprintf(fp,"\n"); /*caller wants terminating newline*/
4095 return ( 1 );
4096 } /* --- end-of-function emit_string() --- */
4097 
4098 
4099 /* ==========================================================================
4100  * Function: gftobitmap ( gf )
4101  * Purpose: convert .gf-like pixmap to bitmap image
4102  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4103  * Arguments: gf (I) raster * to struct in .gf-format
4104  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4105  * Returns: ( raster * ) image-format raster * if successful,
4106  * or NULL for any error.
4107  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4108  * Notes: o
4109  * ======================================================================= */
4110 /* --- entry point --- */
4111 raster *gftobitmap ( raster *gf )
4112 {
4113 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4114 Allocations and Declarations
4115 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4116 raster *new_raster(), *rp=NULL; /* image raster retuned to caller */
4117 int width=0, height=0, totbits=0; /* gf->width, gf->height, #bits */
4118 int format=0, icount=0, ncounts=0, /*.gf format, count index, #counts*/
4119  ibit=0, bitval=0; /* bitmap index, bit value */
4120 int isrepeat = 1, /* true to process repeat counts */
4121  repeatcmds[2] = {255,15}, /*opcode for repeat/duplicate count*/
4122  nrepeats=0, irepeat=0, /* scan line repeat count,index */
4123  wbits = 0; /* count bits to width of scan line*/
4124 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4125 initialization
4126 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4127 /* --- check args --- */
4128 if ( gf == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* input raster not provided */
4129 format = gf->format; /* 2 or 3 */
4130 if ( format!=2 && format!=3 ) goto end_of_job; /* invalid raster format */
4131 ncounts = gf->pixsz; /*pixsz is really #counts in pixmap*/
4132 /* --- allocate output raster with proper dimensions for bitmap --- */
4133 width=gf->width; height=gf->height; /* dimensions of raster */
4134 if ( (rp = new_raster(width,height,1)) /* allocate new raster and bitmap */
4135 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed to allocate */
4136 totbits = width*height; /* total #bits in image */
4137 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4138 fill bitmap
4139 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4140 for ( icount=0,bitval=0; icount<ncounts; icount++ )
4141  {
4142  int nbits = (int)(getbyfmt(format,gf->pixmap,icount)); /*#bits to set*/
4143  if ( isrepeat /* we're proxessing repeat counts */
4144  && nbits == repeatcmds[format-2] ) { /* and repeat opcode found */
4145  if ( nrepeats == 0 ) /* recursive repeat is error */
4146  { nrepeats = (int)(getbyfmt(format,gf->pixmap,icount+1));/*repeat count*/
4147  nbits = (int)(getbyfmt(format,gf->pixmap,icount+2)); /*#bits to set*/
4148  icount += 2; } /* bump byte/nibble count */
4149  else /* some internal error occurred */
4150  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=1 ) /* report error */
4151  fprintf(msgfp,"gftobitmap> found embedded repeat command\n"); }
4152  if ( 0 )
4153  fprintf(stdout,
4154  "gftobitmap> icount=%d bitval=%d nbits=%d ibit=%d totbits=%d\n",
4155  icount,bitval,nbits,ibit,totbits);
4156  for ( ; nbits>0; nbits-- ) /* count down */
4157  { if ( ibit >= totbits ) goto end_of_job; /* overflow check */
4158  for ( irepeat=0; irepeat<=nrepeats; irepeat++ )
4159  if ( bitval == 1 ) /* set pixel */
4160  { setlongbit(rp->pixmap,(ibit+irepeat*width)); }
4161  else /* clear pixel */
4162  { unsetlongbit(rp->pixmap,(ibit+irepeat*width)); }
4163  if ( nrepeats > 0 ) wbits++; /* count another repeated bit */
4164  ibit++; } /* bump bit index */
4165  bitval = 1-bitval; /* flip bit value */
4166  if ( wbits >= width ) { /* completed repeats */
4167  ibit += nrepeats*width; /*bump bit count past repeated scans*/
4168  if ( wbits > width ) /* out-of alignment error */
4169  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=1 ) /* report error */
4170  fprintf(msgfp,"gftobitmap> width=%d wbits=%d\n",width,wbits);
4171  wbits = nrepeats = 0; } /* reset repeat counts */
4172  } /* --- end-of-for(icount) --- */
4173 end_of_job:
4174  return ( rp ); /* back to caller with image */
4175 } /* --- end-of-function gftobitmap() --- */
4176 
4177 
4178 /* ==========================================================================
4179  * Function: get_symdef ( symbol )
4180  * Purpose: returns mathchardef struct for symbol
4181  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4182  * Arguments: symbol (I) char * containing symbol
4183  * whose corresponding mathchardef is wanted
4184  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4185  * Returns: ( mathchardef * ) pointer to struct defining symbol,
4186  * or NULL for any error
4187  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4188  * Notes: o Input symbol need only contain a leading substring to match,
4189  * e.g., \gam passed in symbol will match \gamma in the table.
4190  * If the table contains two or more possible matches,
4191  * the shortest is returned, e.g., input \e will return with
4192  * data for \eta rather than \epsilon. To get \epsilon,
4193  * you must pass a leading substring long enough to eliminate
4194  * shorter table matches, i.e., in this case \ep
4195  * ======================================================================= */
4196 /* --- entry point --- */
4197 mathchardef *get_symdef ( char *symbol )
4198 {
4199 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4200 Allocations and Declarations
4201 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4202 mathchardef *symdefs = symtable; /* table of mathchardefs */
4203 int ligdef=0, get_ligature(); /* or we may have a ligature */
4204 int idef = 0, /* symdefs[] index */
4205  bestdef = (-9999); /*index of shortest matching symdef*/
4206 int symlen = strlen(symbol), /* length of input symbol */
4207  deflen, minlen=9999; /*length of shortest matching symdef*/
4208 int /*alnumsym = (symlen==1 && isalnum(*symbol)),*/ /*alphanumeric sym*/
4209  alphasym = (symlen==1 && isalpha(*symbol)), /* or alpha symbol */
4210  slashsym = (*symbol=='\\'); /* or \backslashed symbol */
4211 int family = fontinfo[fontnum].family; /* current font family */
4212 static char *displaysyms[][2] = { /*xlate to Big sym for \displaystyle*/
4213  /* --- see table on page 536 in TLC2 --- */
4214  {"\\int", "\\Bigint"},
4215  {"\\oint", "\\Bigoint"},
4216  {"\\sum", "\\Bigsum"},
4217  {"\\prod", "\\Bigprod"},
4218  {"\\coprod", "\\Bigcoprod"},
4219  /* --- must be 'big' when related to similar binary operators --- */
4220  {"\\bigcup", "\\Bigcup"},
4221  {"\\bigsqcup", "\\Bigsqcup"},
4222  {"\\bigcap", "\\Bigcap"},
4223  /*{"\\bigsqcap", "\\sqcap"},*/ /* don't have \Bigsqcap */
4224  {"\\bigodot", "\\Bigodot"},
4225  {"\\bigoplus", "\\Bigoplus"},
4226  {"\\bigominus", "\\ominus"},
4227  {"\\bigotimes", "\\Bigotimes"},
4228  {"\\bigoslash", "\\oslash"},
4229  {"\\biguplus", "\\Biguplus"},
4230  {"\\bigwedge", "\\Bigwedge"},
4231  {"\\bigvee", "\\Bigvee"},
4232  {NULL, NULL} };
4233 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4234 First check for ligature
4235 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4236 isligature = 0; /* init signal for no ligature */
4237 if ( family == CYR10 ) /*only check for cyrillic ligatures*/
4238  if ( (ligdef=get_ligature(subexprptr,family)) /* check for ligature */
4239  >= 0 ) /* found a ligature */
4240  { bestdef = ligdef; /* set bestdef for ligature */
4241  isligature = 1; /* signal we found a ligature */
4242  goto end_of_job; } /* so just give it to caller */
4243 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4244 If in \displaystyle mode, first xlate int to Bigint, etc.
4245 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4246 if ( isdisplaystyle > 1 ) /* we're in \displaystyle mode */
4247  for ( idef=0; ; idef++ ) { /* lookup symbol in displaysyms */
4248  char *fromsym = displaysyms[idef][0], /* look for this symbol */
4249  *tosym = displaysyms[idef][1]; /* and xlate it to this symbol */
4250  if ( fromsym == NULL ) break; /* end-of-table */
4251  if ( !strcmp(symbol,fromsym) ) /* found a match */
4252  { if ( msglevel>=99 && msgfp!=NULL ) /* debugging output */
4253  { fprintf(msgfp,"get_symdef> isdisplaystyle=%d, xlated %s to %s\n",
4254  isdisplaystyle,symbol,tosym); fflush(msgfp); }
4255  symbol = tosym; /* so look up tosym instead */
4256  symlen = strlen(symbol); /* reset symbol length */
4257  break; } /* no need to search further */
4258  } /* --- end-of-for(idef) --- */
4259 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4260 search symdefs[] in order for first occurrence of symbol
4261 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4262 for ( idef=0; ;idef++ ) /* until trailer record found */
4263  if ( symdefs[idef].symbol == NULL ) break; /* reached end-of-table */
4264  else /* check against caller's symbol */
4265  if ( strncmp(symbol,symdefs[idef].symbol,symlen) == 0 ) /* found match */
4266  if ( (fontnum==0||family==CYR10) /* mathmode, so check every match */
4267  || (1 && symdefs[idef].handler!=NULL) /* or check every directive */
4268  || (1 && istextmode && slashsym) /*text mode and \backslashed symbol*/
4269  || (0 && istextmode && (!alphasym /* text mode and not alpha symbol */
4270  || symdefs[idef].handler!=NULL)) /* or text mode and directive */
4271  || (symdefs[idef].family==family /* have correct family */
4272  && symdefs[idef].handler==NULL) ) /* and not a handler collision */
4273 #if 0
4274  || (fontnum==1 && symdefs[idef].family==CMR10) /*textmode && rm text*/
4275  || (fontnum==2 && symdefs[idef].family==CMMI10) /*textmode && it text*/
4276  || (fontnum==3 && symdefs[idef].family==BBOLD10 /*textmode && bb text*/
4277  && symdefs[idef].handler==NULL)
4278  || (fontnum==4 && symdefs[idef].family==CMMIB10 /*textmode && bf text*/
4279  && symdefs[idef].handler==NULL) )
4280 #endif
4281  if ( (deflen=strlen(symdefs[idef].symbol)) < minlen ) /*new best match*/
4282  { bestdef = idef; /* save index of new best match */
4283  if ( (minlen = deflen) /* and save its len for next test */
4284  == symlen ) break; } /*perfect match, so return with it*/
4285 if ( bestdef < 0 ) /* failed to look up symbol */
4286  if ( fontnum != 0 ) /* we're in a restricted font mode */
4287  { int oldfontnum = fontnum; /* save current font family */
4288  mathchardef *symdef = NULL; /* lookup result with fontnum=0 */
4289  fontnum = 0; /*try to look up symbol in any font*/
4290  symdef = get_symdef(symbol); /* repeat lookup with fontnum=0 */
4291  fontnum = oldfontnum; /* reset font family */
4292  return symdef; } /* caller gets fontnum=0 lookup */
4293 end_of_job:
4294  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 ) /* debugging output */
4295  { fprintf(msgfp,
4296  "get_symdef> symbol=%s matches symtable[%d]=%s (isligature=%d)\n",
4297  symbol,bestdef,(bestdef<0?"NotFound":symdefs[bestdef].symbol),isligature);
4298  fflush(msgfp); }
4299  return ( (bestdef<0? NULL : &(symdefs[bestdef])) );/*NULL or best symdef[]*/
4300 } /* --- end-of-function get_symdef() --- */
4301 
4302 
4303 /* ==========================================================================
4304  * Function: get_ligature ( expression, family )
4305  * Purpose: returns symtable[] index for ligature
4306  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4307  * Arguments: expression (I) char * containing ligature
4308  * whose corresponding mathchardef is wanted
4309  * family (I) int containing NOVALUE for any family,
4310  * or, e.g., CYR10 for cyrillic, etc.
4311  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4312  * Returns: ( int ) symtable[] index defining ligature,
4313  * or -9999 if no ligature found or for any error
