4314  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4315  * Notes: o
4316  * ======================================================================= */
4317 /* --- entry point --- */
4318 int get_ligature ( char *expression, int family )
4319 {
4320 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4321 Allocations and Declarations
4322 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4323 mathchardef *symdefs = symtable; /* table of mathchardefs */
4324 char *ligature = expression /*- 1*/, /* expression ptr */
4325  *symbol = NULL; /* symdefs[idef].symbol */
4326 int liglen = strlen(ligature); /* #chars remaining in expression */
4327 int iscyrfam = (family==CYR10); /* true for cyrillic families */
4328 int idef = 0, /* symdefs[] index */
4329  bestdef = (-9999), /*index of longest matching symdef*/
4330  maxlen=(-9999); /*length of longest matching symdef*/
4331 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4332 search symdefs[] in order for first occurrence of symbol
4333 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4334 if ( !isstring ) { /* no ligatures in "string" mode */
4335  for ( idef=0; ;idef++ ) /* until trailer record found */
4336  if ( (symbol=symdefs[idef].symbol) == NULL ) break; /* end-of-table */
4337  else { /* check against caller's ligature */
4338  int symlen = strlen(symbol); /* #chars in symbol */
4339  if ( ( symlen>1 || iscyrfam ) /*ligature >1 char long or cyrillic*/
4340  && symlen <= liglen /* and enough remaining chars */
4341  && ( *symbol!='\\' || iscyrfam ) /* not escaped or cyrillic */
4342  && symdefs[idef].handler == NULL ) /* and not a handler */
4343  if ( strncmp(ligature,symbol,symlen) == 0 ) /* found match */
4344  if ( family < 0 /* no family specifies */
4345  || symdefs[idef].family == family ) /* or have correct family */
4346  if ( symlen > maxlen ) /* new longest ligature */
4347  { bestdef = idef; /* save index of new best match */
4348  maxlen = symlen; } /* and save its len for next test */
4349  } /* --- end-of-if/else(symbol==NULL) --- */
4350  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 ) /* debugging output */
4351  { fprintf(msgfp,"get_ligature> ligature=%.4s matches symtable[%d]=%s\n",
4352  ligature,bestdef,(bestdef<0?"NotFound":symdefs[bestdef].symbol));
4353  fflush(msgfp); }
4354  } /* --- end-of-if(!isstring) --- */
4355 return ( bestdef ); /* -9999 or index of best symdef[] */
4356 } /* --- end-of-function get_ligature --- */
4357 
4358 
4359 /* ==========================================================================
4360  * Function: get_chardef ( symdef, size )
4361  * Purpose: returns chardef ptr containing data for symdef at given size
4362  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4363  * Arguments: symdef (I) mathchardef * corresponding to symbol
4364  * whose corresponding chardef is wanted
4365  * size (I) int containing 0-5 for desired size
4366  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4367  * Returns: ( chardef * ) pointer to struct defining symbol at size,
4368  * or NULL for any error
4369  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4370  * Notes: o if size unavailable, the next-closer-to-normalsize
4371  * is returned instead.
4372  * ======================================================================= */
4373 /* --- entry point --- */
4374 chardef *get_chardef ( mathchardef *symdef, int size )
4375 {
4376 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4377 Allocations and Declarations
4378 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4379 fontfamily *fonts = fonttable; /* table of font families */
4380 chardef **fontdef, /*tables for desired font, by size*/
4381  *gfdata = (chardef *)NULL; /* chardef for symdef,size */
4382 int ifont; /* fonts[] index */
4383 int family, charnum; /* indexes retrieved from symdef */
4384 int sizeinc = 0, /*+1 or -1 to get closer to normal*/
4385  normalsize = 2; /* this size always present */
4386 int isBig = 0; /*true if symbol's 1st char is upper*/
4387 char *symptr = NULL; /* look for 1st alpha of symbol */
4388 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4389 initialization
4390 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4391 /* --- check symdef --- */
4392 if ( symdef == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* get_symdef() probably failed */
4393 /* --- get local copy of indexes from symdef --- */
4394 family = symdef->family; /* font family containing symbol */
4395 charnum = symdef->charnum; /* char# of symbol within font */
4396 /* --- check for supersampling --- */
4397 if ( issupersampling ) /* check for supersampling fonts */
4398  if ( fonts != ssfonttable ) /* uh oh--probably internal error */
4399  { fonts = ssfonttable; } /* force it */
4400 /* --- check requested size, and set size increment --- */
4401 if ( 0 && issupersampling ) /* set size index for supersampling */
4402  size = LARGESTSIZE+1; /* index 1 past largest size */
4403 else /* low pass indexes 0...LARGESTSIZE */
4404  {
4405  if( size<0 ) size = 0; /* size was definitely too small */
4406  if( size>LARGESTSIZE ) size = LARGESTSIZE; /* or definitely too large */
4407  if( size<normalsize ) sizeinc = (+1); /*use next larger if size too small*/
4408  if( size>normalsize ) sizeinc = (-1); /*or next smaller if size too large*/
4409  }
4410 /* --- check for really big symbol (1st char of symbol name uppercase) --- */
4411 for ( symptr=symdef->symbol; *symptr!='\000'; symptr++ ) /*skip leading \'s*/
4412  if ( isalpha(*symptr) ) /* found leading alpha char */
4413  { isBig = isupper(*symptr); /* is 1st char of name uppercase? */
4414  if ( !isBig /* 1st char lowercase */
4415  && strlen(symptr) >= 4 ) /* but followed by at least 3 chars */
4416  isBig = !memcmp(symptr,"big\\",4) /* isBig if name starts with big\ */
4417  || !memcmp(symptr,"bigg",4); /* or with bigg */
4418  break; } /* don't check beyond 1st char */
4419 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4420 find font family in table of fonts[]
4421 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4422 /* --- look up font family --- */
4423 for ( ifont=0; ;ifont++ ) /* until trailer record found */
4424  if ( fonts[ifont].family < 0 ) { /* error, no such family */
4425  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 ) { /* emit error */
4426  fprintf(msgfp,"get_chardef> failed to find font family %d\n",
4427  family); fflush(msgfp); }
4428  goto end_of_job; } /* quit if can't find font family*/
4429  else if ( fonts[ifont].family == family ) break; /* found font family */
4430 /* --- get local copy of table for this family by size --- */
4431 fontdef = fonts[ifont].fontdef; /* font by size */
4432 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4433 get font in desired size, or closest available size, and return symbol
4434 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4435 /* --- get font in desired size --- */
4436 while ( 1 ) /* find size or closest available */
4437  if ( fontdef[size] != NULL ) break; /* found available size */
4438  else /* adjust size closer to normal */
4439  if ( size == NORMALSIZE /* already normal so no more sizes,*/
4440  || sizeinc == 0 ) { /* or must be supersampling */
4441  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 ) { /* emit error */
4442  fprintf(msgfp,"get_chardef> failed to find font size %d\n",
4443  size); fflush(msgfp); }
4444  goto end_of_job; } /* quit if can't find desired size */
4445  else /*bump size 1 closer to NORMALSIZE*/
4446  size += sizeinc; /* see if adjusted size available */
4447 /* --- ptr to chardef struct --- */
4448 gfdata = &((fontdef[size])[charnum]); /*ptr to chardef for symbol in size*/
4449 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4450 kludge to tweak CMEX10 (which appears to have incorrect descenders)
4451 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4452 if ( family == CMEX10 ) /* cmex10 needs tweak */
4453  { int height = gfdata->toprow - gfdata->botrow + 1; /*total height of char*/
4454  gfdata->botrow = (isBig? (-height/3) : (-height/4));
4455  gfdata->toprow = gfdata->botrow + gfdata->image.height; }
4456 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4457 return subraster containing chardef data for symbol in requested size
4458 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4459 end_of_job:
4460  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 )
4461  { if (symdef == NULL) fprintf(msgfp,"get_chardef> input symdef==NULL\n");
4462  else
4463  fprintf(msgfp,"get_chardef> requested symbol=\"%s\" size=%d %s\n",
4464  symdef->symbol,size,(gfdata==NULL?"FAILED":"Succeeded"));
4465  fflush(msgfp); }
4466  return ( gfdata ); /*ptr to chardef for symbol in size*/
4467 } /* --- end-of-function get_chardef() --- */
4468 
4469 
4470 /* ==========================================================================
4471  * Function: get_charsubraster ( symdef, size )
4472  * Purpose: returns new subraster ptr containing
4473  * data for symdef at given size
4474  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4475  * Arguments: symdef (I) mathchardef * corresponding to symbol whose
4476  * corresponding chardef subraster is wanted
4477  * size (I) int containing 0-5 for desired size
4478  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4479  * Returns: ( subraster * ) pointer to struct defining symbol at size,
4480  * or NULL for any error
4481  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4482  * Notes: o just wraps a subraster envelope around get_chardef()
4483  * ======================================================================= */
4484 /* --- entry point --- */
4485 subraster *get_charsubraster ( mathchardef *symdef, int size )
4486 {
4487 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4488 Allocations and Declarations
4489 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4490 chardef *get_chardef(), *gfdata=NULL; /* chardef struct for symdef,size */
4491 int get_baseline(); /* baseline of gfdata */
4492 subraster *new_subraster(), *sp=NULL; /* subraster containing gfdata */
4493 raster *bitmaprp=NULL, *gftobitmap(); /* convert .gf-format to bitmap */
4494 int delete_subraster(); /* in case gftobitmap() fails */
4495 int aasupsamp(), /*antialias char with supersampling*/
4496  grayscale=256; /* aasupersamp() parameters */
4497 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4498 look up chardef for symdef at size, and embed data (gfdata) in subraster
4499 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4500 if ( (gfdata=get_chardef(symdef,size)) /* look up chardef for symdef,size */
4501 != NULL ) /* and check that we found it */
4502  if ( (sp=new_subraster(0,0,0)) /* allocate subraster "envelope" */
4503  != NULL ) /* and check that we succeeded */
4504  {
4505  raster *image = &(gfdata->image); /* ptr to chardef's bitmap or .gf */
4506  int format = image->format; /* 1=bitmap, else .gf */
4507  sp->symdef = symdef; /* replace NULL with caller's arg */
4508  sp->size = size; /*replace default with caller's size*/
4509  sp->baseline = get_baseline(gfdata); /* get baseline of character */
4510  if ( format == 1 ) /* already a bitmap */
4511  { sp->type = CHARASTER; /* static char raster */
4512  sp->image = image; } /* store ptr to its bitmap */
4513  else /* need to convert .gf-to-bitmap */
4514  if ( (bitmaprp = gftobitmap(image)) /* convert */
4515  != (raster *)NULL ) /* successful */
4516  { sp->type = IMAGERASTER; /* allocated raster will be freed */
4517  sp->image = bitmaprp; } /* store ptr to converted bitmap */
4518  else /* conversion failed */
4519  { delete_subraster(sp); /* free unneeded subraster */
4520  sp = (subraster *)NULL; /* signal error to caller */
4521  goto end_of_job; } /* quit */
4522  if ( issupersampling ) /* antialias character right here */
4523  {
4524  raster *aa = NULL; /* antialiased char raster */
4525  int status = aasupsamp(sp->image,&aa,shrinkfactor,grayscale);
4526  if ( status ) /* supersampled successfully */
4527  { int baseline = sp->baseline; /* baseline before supersampling */
4528  int height = gfdata->image.height; /* #rows before supersampling */
4529  sp->image = aa; /* replace chardef with ss image */
4530  if ( baseline >= height-1 ) /* baseline at bottom of char */
4531  sp->baseline = aa->height -1; /* so keep it at bottom */
4532  else /* char has descenders */
4533  sp->baseline /= shrinkfactor; /* rescale baseline */
4534  sp->type = IMAGERASTER; } /* character is an image raster */
4535  } /* --- end-of-if(issupersampling) --- */
4536  } /* --- end-of-if(sp!=NULL) --- */
4537 end_of_job:
4538  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 )
4539  { fprintf(msgfp,"get_charsubraster> requested symbol=\"%s\" baseline=%d"
4540  " %s %s\n", symdef->symbol, (sp==NULL?0:sp->baseline),
4541  (sp==NULL?"FAILED":"Succeeded"), (gfdata==NULL?"(gfdata=NULL)":" "));
4542  fflush(msgfp); }
4543 return ( sp ); /* back to caller */
4544 } /* --- end-of-function get_charsubraster() --- */
4545 
4546 
4547 /* ==========================================================================
4548  * Function: get_symsubraster ( symbol, size )
4549  * Purpose: returns new subraster ptr containing
4550  * data for symbol at given size
4551  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4552  * Arguments: symbol (I) char * corresponding to symbol
4553  * whose corresponding subraster is wanted
4554  * size (I) int containing 0-5 for desired size
4555  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4556  * Returns: ( subraster * ) pointer to struct defining symbol at size,
4557  * or NULL for any error
4558  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4559  * Notes: o just combines get_symdef() and get_charsubraster()
4560  * ======================================================================= */
4561 /* --- entry point --- */
4562 subraster *get_symsubraster ( char *symbol, int size )
4563 {
4564 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4565 Allocations and Declarations
4566 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4567 subraster *sp=NULL, *get_charsubraster(); /* subraster containing gfdata */
4568 mathchardef *symdef=NULL, *get_symdef(); /* mathchardef lookup for symbol */
4569 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4570 look up mathchardef for symbol
4571 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4572 if ( symbol != NULL ) /* user supplied input symbol */
4573  symdef = get_symdef(symbol); /*look up corresponding mathchardef*/
4574 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4575 look up chardef for mathchardef and wrap a subraster structure around data
4576 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4577 if ( symdef != NULL ) /* lookup succeeded */
4578  sp = get_charsubraster(symdef,size); /* so get symbol data in subraster */
4579 return ( sp ); /* back to caller with sp or NULL */
4580 } /* --- end-of-function get_symsubraster() --- */
4581 
4582 
4583 /* ==========================================================================
4584  * Function: get_baseline ( gfdata )
4585  * Purpose: returns baseline for a chardef struct
4586  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4587  * Arguments: gfdata (I) chardef * containing chardef for symbol
4588  * whose baseline is wanted
4589  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4590  * Returns: ( int ) baseline for symdef,
4591  * or -1 for any error
4592  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4593  * Notes: o Unlike TeX, the top-left corners of our rasters are (0,0),
4594  * with (row,col) increasing as you move down and right.
4595  * Baselines are calculated with respect to this scheme,
4596  * so 0 would mean the very top row is on the baseline
4597  * and everything else descends below the baseline.
4598  * ======================================================================= */
4599 /* --- entry point --- */
4600 int get_baseline ( chardef *gfdata )
4601 {
4602 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4603 Allocations and Declarations
4604 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4605 int /*toprow = gfdata->toprow,*/ /*TeX top row from .gf file info*/
4606  botrow = gfdata->botrow, /*TeX bottom row from .gf file info*/
4607  height = gfdata->image.height; /* #rows comprising symbol */
4608 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4609 give caller baseline
4610 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4611 return ( (height-1) + botrow ); /* note: descenders have botrow<0 */
4612 } /* --- end-of-function get_baseline() --- */
4613 
4614 
4615 /* ==========================================================================
4616  * Function: get_delim ( char *symbol, int height, int family )
4617  * Purpose: returns subraster corresponding to the samllest
4618  * character containing symbol, but at least as large as height,
4619  * and in caller's family (if specified).
4620  * If no symbol character as large as height is available,
4621  * then the largest availabale character is returned instead.
4622  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4623  * Arguments: symbol (I) char * containing (substring of) desired
4624  * symbol, e.g., if symbol="(", then any
4625  * mathchardef like "(" or "\\(", etc, match.
4626  * height (I) int containing minimum acceptable height
4627  * for returned character
4628  * family (I) int containing -1 to consider all families,
4629  * or, e.g., CMEX10 for only that family
4630  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4631  * Returns: ( subraster * ) best matching character available,
4632  * or NULL for any error
4633  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4634  * Notes: o If height is passed as negative, its absolute value is used
4635  * but the best-fit width is searched for (rather than height)
4636  * ======================================================================= */
4637 /* --- entry point --- */
4638 subraster *get_delim ( char *symbol, int height, int family )
4639 {
4640 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4641 Allocations and Declarations
4642 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4643 mathchardef *symdefs = symtable; /* table of mathchardefs */
4644 subraster *get_charsubraster(), *sp=(subraster *)NULL; /* best match char */
4645 subraster *make_delim(); /* construct delim if can't find it*/
4646 chardef *get_chardef(), *gfdata=NULL; /* get chardef struct for a symdef */
4647 char lcsymbol[256], *symptr, /* lowercase symbol for comparison */
4648  *unescsymbol = symbol; /* unescaped symbol */
4649 int symlen = (symbol==NULL?0:strlen(symbol)), /* #chars in caller's sym*/
4650  deflen = 0; /* length of symdef (aka lcsymbol) */
4651 int idef = 0, /* symdefs[] index */
4652  bestdef = (-9999), /* index of best fit symdef */
4653  bigdef = (-9999); /*index of biggest (in case no best)*/
4654 int size = 0, /* size index 0...LARGESTSIZE */
4655  bestsize = (-9999), /* index of best fit size */
4656  bigsize = (-9999); /*index of biggest (in case no best)*/
4657 int defheight, bestheight=9999, /* height of best fit symdef */
4658  bigheight = (-9999); /*height of biggest(in case no best)*/
4659 int iswidth = 0; /* true if best-fit width desired */
4660 int isunesc = 0, /* true if leading escape removed */
4661  issq=0, isoint=0; /* true for \sqcup,etc, \oint,etc */
4662 int iscurly = 0; /* true for StMary's curly symbols */
4663 char *bigint="bigint", *bigoint="bigoint"; /* substitutes for int, oint */
4664 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4665 determine if searching height or width, and search symdefs[] for best-fit
4666 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4667 /* --- arg checks --- */
4668 if ( symlen < 1 ) return (sp); /* no input symbol suplied */
4669 if ( strcmp(symbol,"e") == 0 ) return(sp); /* e causes segfault??? */
4670 if ( strstr(symbol,"curly") != NULL ) iscurly=1; /* user wants curly delim */
4671 /* --- ignore leading escapes for CMEX10 --- */
4672 if ( 1 ) /* ignore leading escape */
4673  if ( (family==CMEX10 || family==CMSYEX) ) { /* for CMEX10 or CMSYEX */
4674  if ( strstr(symbol,"sq") != NULL ) /* \sq symbol requested */
4675  issq = 1; /* seq \sq signal */
4676  if ( strstr(symbol,"oint") != NULL ) /* \oint symbol requested */
4677  isoint = 1; /* seq \oint signal */
4678  if ( *symbol=='\\' ) /* have leading \ */
4679  { unescsymbol = symbol+1; /* push past leading \ */
4680  if ( --symlen < 1 ) return(sp); /* one less char */
4681  if ( strcmp(unescsymbol,"int") == 0 ) /* \int requested by caller */
4682  unescsymbol = bigint; /* but big version looks better */
4683  if ( strcmp(unescsymbol,"oint") == 0 ) /* \oint requested by caller */
4684  unescsymbol = bigoint; /* but big version looks better */
4685  symlen = strlen(unescsymbol); /* explicitly recalculate length */
4686  isunesc = 1; } /* signal leading escape removed */
4687  } /* --- end-of-if(family) --- */
4688 /* --- determine whether searching for best-fit height or width --- */
4689 if ( height < 0 ) /* negative signals width search */
4690  { height = (-height); /* flip "height" positive */
4691  iswidth = 1; } /* set flag for width search */
4692 /* --- search symdefs[] for best-fit height (or width) --- */
4693 for ( idef=0; ;idef++ ) /* until trailer record found */
4694  {
4695  char *defsym = symdefs[idef].symbol; /* local copies */
4696  int deffam = symdefs[idef].family;
4697  if ( defsym == NULL ) break; /* reached end-of-table */
4698  else /* check against caller's symbol */
4699  if ( family<0 || deffam == family /* if explicitly in caller's family*/
4700  || (family==CMSYEX && (deffam==CMSY10||deffam==CMEX10||deffam==STMARY10)) )
4701  {
4702  strcpy(lcsymbol,defsym); /* local copy of symdefs[] symbol */
4703  if ( isunesc && *lcsymbol=='\\' ) /* ignored leading \ in symbol */
4704  {strsqueeze(lcsymbol,1);} /*so squeeze it out of lcsymbol too*/
4705  if ( 0 ) /* don't ignore case */
4706  for ( symptr=lcsymbol; *symptr!='\000'; symptr++ )/*for each symbol ch*/
4707  if ( isalpha(*symptr) ) *symptr=tolower(*symptr);/*lowercase the char*/
4708  deflen = strlen(lcsymbol); /* #chars in symbol we're checking */
4709  if ((symptr=strstr(lcsymbol,unescsymbol)) != NULL) /*found caller's sym*/
4710  if ( (isoint || strstr(lcsymbol,"oint")==NULL) /* skip unwanted "oint"*/
4711  && (issq || strstr(lcsymbol,"sq")==NULL) ) /* skip unwanted "sq" */
4712  if ( ( deffam == CMSY10 ? /* CMSY10 or not CMSY10 */
4713  symptr == lcsymbol /* caller's sym is a prefix */
4714  && deflen == symlen: /* and same length */
4715  (iscurly || strstr(lcsymbol,"curly")==NULL) &&/*not unwanted curly*/
4716  (symptr == lcsymbol /* caller's sym is a prefix */
4717  || symptr == lcsymbol+deflen-symlen) ) ) /* or a suffix */
4718  for ( size=0; size<=LARGESTSIZE; size++ ) /* check all font sizes */
4719  if ( (gfdata=get_chardef(&(symdefs[idef]),size)) != NULL ) /*got one*/
4720  { defheight = gfdata->image.height; /* height of this character */
4721  if ( iswidth ) /* width search wanted instead... */
4722  defheight = gfdata->image.width; /* ...so substitute width */
4723  leftsymdef = &(symdefs[idef]); /* set symbol class, etc */
4724  if ( defheight>=height && defheight<bestheight ) /*new best fit*/
4725  { bestdef=idef; bestsize=size; /* save indexes of best fit */
4726  bestheight = defheight; } /* and save new best height */
4727  if ( defheight >= bigheight ) /* new biggest character */
4728  { bigdef=idef; bigsize=size; /* save indexes of biggest */
4729  bigheight = defheight; } /* and save new big height */
4730  } /* --- end-of-if(gfdata!=NULL) --- */
4731  } /* --- end-of-if(family) --- */
4732  } /* --- end-of-for(idef) --- */
4733 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4734 construct subraster for best fit character, and return it to caller
4735 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4736 if ( bestdef >= 0 ) /* found a best fit for caller */
4737  sp = get_charsubraster(&(symdefs[bestdef]),bestsize); /* best subraster */
4738 if ( (sp==NULL && height-bigheight>5) /* try to construct delim */
4739 || bigdef < 0 ) /* delim not in font tables */
4740  sp = make_delim(symbol,(iswidth?-height:height)); /* try to build delim */
4741 if ( sp==NULL && bigdef>=0 ) /* just give biggest to caller */
4742  sp = get_charsubraster(&(symdefs[bigdef]),bigsize); /* biggest subraster */
4743 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 )
4744  fprintf(msgfp,"get_delim> symbol=%.50s, height=%d family=%d isokay=%s\n",
4745  (symbol==NULL?"null":symbol),height,family,(sp==NULL?"fail":"success"));
4746 return ( sp );
4747 } /* --- end-of-function get_delim() --- */
4748 
4749 
4750 /* ==========================================================================
4751  * Function: make_delim ( char *symbol, int height )
4752  * Purpose: constructs subraster corresponding to symbol
4753  * exactly as large as height,
4754  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4755  * Arguments: symbol (I) char * containing, e.g., if symbol="("
4756  * for desired delimiter
4757  * height (I) int containing height
4758  * for returned character
4759  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4760  * Returns: ( subraster * ) constructed delimiter
4761  * or NULL for any error
4762  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4763  * Notes: o If height is passed as negative, its absolute value is used
4764  * and interpreted as width (rather than height)
4765  * ======================================================================= */
4766 /* --- entry point --- */
4767 subraster *make_delim ( char *symbol, int height )
4768 {
4769 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4770 Allocations and Declarations
4771 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4772 subraster *sp = (subraster *)NULL, /* subraster returned to caller */
4773  *new_subraster(); /* allocate subraster */
4774 subraster *get_symsubraster(), /* look up delim pieces in cmex10 */
4775  *symtop=NULL, *symbot=NULL, *symmid=NULL, *symbar=NULL, /* pieces */
4776  *topsym=NULL, *botsym=NULL, *midsym=NULL, *barsym=NULL, /* +filler */
4777  *rastack(), *rastcat(); /* stack pieces, concat filler */
4778 int isdrawparen = 0; /*1=draw paren, 0=build from pieces*/
4779 raster *rasp = (raster *)NULL; /* sp->image */
4780 int isokay=0, delete_subraster(); /* set true if delimiter drawn ok */
4781 int pixsz = 1, /* pixels are one bit each */
4782  symsize = 0; /* size arg for get_symsubraster() */
4783 int thickness = 1; /* drawn lines are one pixel thick */
4784 int aspectratio = 8; /* default height/width for parens */
4785 int iswidth = 0, /*true if width specified by height*/
4786  width = height; /* #pixels width (e.g., of ellipse)*/
4787 char *lp=NULL, *rp=NULL, /* check symbol for left or right */
4788  *lp2=NULL, *rp2=NULL, /* synonym for lp,rp */
4789  *lp3=NULL, *rp3=NULL, /* synonym for lp,rp */
4790  *lp4=NULL, *rp4=NULL; /* synonym for lp,rp */
4791 int circle_raster(), /* ellipse for ()'s in sp->image */
4792  rule_rsater(), /* horizontal or vertical lines */
4793  line_raster(); /* line between two points */
4794 subraster *uparrow_subraster(); /* up/down arrows */
4795 int isprealloc = 1; /*pre-alloc subraster, except arrow*/
4796 int oldsmashmargin = smashmargin, /* save original smashmargin */
4797  wasnocatspace = isnocatspace; /* save original isnocatspace */
4798 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4799 initialization
4800 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4801 /* --- determine whether constructing height or width --- */
4802 if ( height < 0 ) /* negative "height" signals width */
4803  { width = height = (-height); /* flip height positive */
4804  iswidth = 1; } /* set flag for width */
4805 if ( height < 3 ) goto end_of_job; /* too small, must be error */
4806 /* --- set default width (or height) accordingly --- */
4807 if ( iswidth ) height = (width+(aspectratio+1)/2)/aspectratio;
4808 else width = (height+(aspectratio+1)/2)/aspectratio;
4809 if ( strchr(symbol,'=') != NULL /* left or right || bracket wanted */
4810 || strstr(symbol,"\\|") != NULL /* same || in standard tex notation*/
4811 || strstr(symbol,"dbl") != NULL ) /* semantic bracket with ||'s */
4812  width = max2(width,6); /* need space between two |'s */
4813 if ( width < 2 ) width=2; /* set min width */
4814 if ( strchr(symbol,'(') != NULL /* if left ( */
4815 || strchr(symbol,')') != NULL ) /* or right ) paren wanted */
4816  { width = (3*width)/2; /* adjust width */
4817  if ( !isdrawparen ) isprealloc=0; } /* don't prealloc if building */
4818 if ( strchr(symbol,'/') != NULL /* left / */
4819 || strstr(symbol,"\\\\") != NULL /* or \\ for right \ */
4820 || strstr(symbol,"backsl") != NULL ) /* or \backslash for \ */
4821  width = max2(height/3,5);
4822 if ( strstr(symbol,"arrow") != NULL ) /* arrow wanted */
4823  { width = min2(height/3,20); /* adjust width */
4824  isprealloc = 0; } /* don't preallocate subraster */
4825 if ( strchr(symbol,'{') != NULL /* if left { */
4826 || strchr(symbol,'}') != NULL ) /* or right } brace wanted */
4827  { isprealloc = 0; } /* don't preallocate */
4828 /* --- allocate and initialize subraster for constructed delimiter --- */
4829 if ( isprealloc ) /* pre-allocation wanted */
4830  { if ( (sp=new_subraster(width,height,pixsz)) /* allocate new subraster */
4831  == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
4832  /* --- initialize delimiter subraster parameters --- */
4833  sp->type = IMAGERASTER; /* image */
4834  sp->symdef = NULL; /* not applicable for image */
4835  sp->baseline = height/2 + 2; /* is a little above center good? */
4836  sp->size = NORMALSIZE; /* size (probably unneeded) */
4837  rasp = sp->image; } /* pointer to image in subraster */
4838 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4839 ( ) parens
4840 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4841 if ( (lp=strchr(symbol,'(')) != NULL /* left ( paren wanted */
4842 || (rp=strchr(symbol,')')) != NULL ) /* right ) paren wanted */
4843  {
4844  if ( isdrawparen ) { /* draw the paren */
4845  int mywidth = min2(width,20); /* max width for ()'s */
4846  circle_raster ( rasp, /* embedded raster image */
4847  0, 0, /* row0,col0 are upper-left corner */
4848  height-1, mywidth-1, /* row1,col1 are lower-right */
4849  thickness, /* line thickness is 1 pixel */
4850  (rp==NULL?"23":"41") ); /* "1234" quadrants to be drawn */
4851  isokay = 1; } /* set flag */
4852  else {
4853  int isleft = (lp!=NULL?1:0); /* true for left, false for right */
4854  char *parentop = (isleft?"\\leftparentop":"\\rightparentop"),
4855  *parenbot = (isleft?"\\leftparenbot":"\\rightparenbot"),
4856  *parenbar = (isleft?"\\leftparenbar":"\\rightparenbar");
4857  int baseht=0, barht=0, /* height of base=top+bot, bar */
4858  ibar=0, nbars=0; /* bar index, #bars between top&bot*/
4859  int largestsize = min2(2,LARGESTSIZE), /* largest size for parens */
4860  topfill=(isleft?0:0), botfill=(isleft?0:0),
4861  barfill=(isleft?0:7); /* alignment fillers */
4862  /* --- get pieces at largest size smaller than total height --- */
4863  for ( symsize=largestsize; symsize>=0; symsize-- ) /*largest to smallest*/
4864  {
4865  /* --- get pieces at current test size --- */
4866  isokay = 1; /* check for all pieces */
4867  if ( (symtop=get_symsubraster(parentop,symsize)) == NULL ) isokay=0;
4868  if ( (symbot=get_symsubraster(parenbot,symsize)) == NULL ) isokay=0;
4869  if ( (symbar=get_symsubraster(parenbar,symsize)) == NULL ) isokay=0;
4870  /* --- check sum of pieces against total desired height --- */
4871  if ( isokay ) { /* all pieces retrieved */
4872  baseht = (symtop->image)->height + (symbot->image)->height; /*top+bot*/
4873  barht = (symbar->image)->height; /* bar height */
4874  if ( baseht < height+5 ) break; /* largest base that's not too big */
4875  if ( symsize < 1 ) break; /* or smallest available base */
4876  } /* --- end-of-if(isokay) --- */
4877  /* --- free test pieces that were too big --- */
4878  if ( symtop != NULL ) delete_subraster(symtop); /* free top */
4879  if ( symbot != NULL ) delete_subraster(symbot); /* free bot */
4880  if ( symbar != NULL ) delete_subraster(symbar); /* free bar */
4881  isokay = 0; /* nothing available */
4882  if ( symsize < 1 ) break; /* leave isokay=0 after smallest */
4883  } /* --- end-of-for(symsize) --- */
4884  /* --- construct brace from pieces --- */
4885  if ( isokay ) { /* we have the pieces */
4886  /* --- add alignment fillers --- */
4887  smashmargin=0; isnocatspace=99; /*turn off rastcat smashing,space*/
4888  topsym = (topfill>0?rastcat(new_subraster(topfill,1,1),symtop,3):symtop);
4889  botsym = (botfill>0?rastcat(new_subraster(botfill,1,1),symbot,3):symbot);
4890  barsym = (barfill>0?rastcat(new_subraster(barfill,1,1),symbar,3):symbar);
4891  smashmargin = oldsmashmargin; /* reset smashmargin */
4892  isnocatspace = wasnocatspace; /* reset isnocatspace */
4893  /* --- #bars needed between top and bot --- */
4894  nbars = (barht<1?0:max2(0,1+(height-baseht)/barht)); /* #bars needed */
4895  /* --- stack pieces --- */
4896  sp = topsym; /* start with top piece */
4897  if ( nbars > 0 ) /* need nbars between top and bot */
4898  for ( ibar=1; ibar<=nbars; ibar++ ) sp = rastack(barsym,sp,1,0,0,2);
4899  sp = rastack(botsym,sp,1,0,0,3); /* bottom below bars or middle */
4900  delete_subraster(barsym); /* barsym no longer needed */
4901  } /* --- end-of-if(isokay) --- */
4902  } /* --- end-of-if/else(isdrawparen) --- */
4903  } /* --- end-of-if(left- or right-() paren wanted) --- */
4904 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4905 { } braces
4906 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4907 else
4908  if ( (lp=strchr(symbol,'{')) != NULL /* left { brace wanted */
4909  || (rp=strchr(symbol,'}')) != NULL ) /* right } brace wanted */
4910  {
4911  int isleft = (lp!=NULL?1:0); /* true for left, false for right */
4912  char *bracetop = (isleft?"\\leftbracetop":"\\rightbracetop"),
4913  *bracebot = (isleft?"\\leftbracebot":"\\rightbracebot"),
4914  *bracemid = (isleft?"\\leftbracemid":"\\rightbracemid"),
4915  *bracebar = (isleft?"\\leftbracebar":"\\rightbracebar");
4916  int baseht=0, barht=0, /* height of base=top+bot+mid, bar */
4917  ibar=0, nbars=0; /* bar index, #bars above,below mid*/
4918  int largestsize = min2(2,LARGESTSIZE), /* largest size for braces */
4919  topfill=(isleft?4:0), botfill=(isleft?4:0),
4920  midfill=(isleft?0:4), barfill=(isleft?4:4); /* alignment fillers */
4921  /* --- get pieces at largest size smaller than total height --- */
4922  for ( symsize=largestsize; symsize>=0; symsize-- ) /*largest to smallest*/
4923  {
4924  /* --- get pieces at current test size --- */
4925  isokay = 1; /* check for all pieces */
4926  if ( (symtop=get_symsubraster(bracetop,symsize)) == NULL ) isokay=0;
4927  if ( (symbot=get_symsubraster(bracebot,symsize)) == NULL ) isokay=0;
4928  if ( (symmid=get_symsubraster(bracemid,symsize)) == NULL ) isokay=0;
4929  if ( (symbar=get_symsubraster(bracebar,symsize)) == NULL ) isokay=0;
4930  /* --- check sum of pieces against total desired height --- */
4931  if ( isokay ) { /* all pieces retrieved */
4932  baseht = (symtop->image)->height + (symbot->image)->height
4933  + (symmid->image)->height; /* top+bot+mid height */
4934  barht = (symbar->image)->height; /* bar height */
4935  if ( baseht < height+5 ) break; /* largest base that's not too big */
4936  if ( symsize < 1 ) break; /* or smallest available base */
4937  } /* --- end-of-if(isokay) --- */
4938  /* --- free test pieces that were too big --- */
4939  if ( symtop != NULL ) delete_subraster(symtop); /* free top */
4940  if ( symbot != NULL ) delete_subraster(symbot); /* free bot */
4941  if ( symmid != NULL ) delete_subraster(symmid); /* free mid */
4942  if ( symbar != NULL ) delete_subraster(symbar); /* free bar */
4943  isokay = 0; /* nothing available */
4944  if ( symsize < 1 ) break; /* leave isokay=0 after smallest */
4945  } /* --- end-of-for(symsize) --- */
4946  /* --- construct brace from pieces --- */
4947  if ( isokay ) { /* we have the pieces */
4948  /* --- add alignment fillers --- */
4949  smashmargin=0; isnocatspace=99; /*turn off rastcat smashing,space*/
4950  topsym = (topfill>0?rastcat(new_subraster(topfill,1,1),symtop,3):symtop);
4951  botsym = (botfill>0?rastcat(new_subraster(botfill,1,1),symbot,3):symbot);
4952  midsym = (midfill>0?rastcat(new_subraster(midfill,1,1),symmid,3):symmid);
4953  barsym = (barfill>0?rastcat(new_subraster(barfill,1,1),symbar,3):symbar);
4954  smashmargin = oldsmashmargin; /* reset smashmargin */
4955  isnocatspace = wasnocatspace; /* reset isnocatspace */
4956  /* --- #bars needed on each side of mid piece --- */
4957  nbars = (barht<1?0:max2(0,1+(height-baseht)/barht/2)); /*#bars per side*/
4958  /* --- stack pieces --- */
4959  sp = topsym; /* start with top piece */
4960  if ( nbars > 0 ) /* need nbars above middle */
4961  for ( ibar=1; ibar<=nbars; ibar++ ) sp = rastack(barsym,sp,1,0,0,2);
4962  sp = rastack(midsym,sp,1,0,0,3); /*mid after top or bars*/
4963  if ( nbars > 0 ) /* need nbars below middle */
4964  for ( ibar=1; ibar<=nbars; ibar++ ) sp = rastack(barsym,sp,1,0,0,2);
4965  sp = rastack(botsym,sp,1,0,0,3); /* bottom below bars or middle */
4966  delete_subraster(barsym); /* barsym no longer needed */
4967  } /* --- end-of-if(isokay) --- */
4968  } /* --- end-of-if(left- or right-{} brace wanted) --- */
4969 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
4970 [ ] brackets
4971 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4972 else
4973  if ( (lp=strchr(symbol,'[')) != NULL /* left [ bracket wanted */
4974  || (rp=strchr(symbol,']')) != NULL /* right ] bracket wanted */
4975  || (lp2=strstr(symbol,"lceil")) != NULL /* left ceiling wanted */
4976  || (rp2=strstr(symbol,"rceil")) != NULL /* right ceiling wanted */
4977  || (lp3=strstr(symbol,"lfloor")) != NULL /* left floor wanted */
4978  || (rp3=strstr(symbol,"rfloor")) != NULL /* right floor wanted */
4979  || (lp4=strstr(symbol,"llbrack")) != NULL /* left semantic bracket */
4980  || (rp4=strstr(symbol,"rrbrack")) != NULL ) /* right semantic bracket */
4981  {
4982  /* --- use rule_raster ( rasp, top, left, width, height, type=0 ) --- */
4983  int mywidth = min2(width,12), /* max width for horizontal bars */
4984  wthick = 1; /* thickness of top.bottom bars */
4985  thickness = (height<25?1:2); /* set lines 1 or 2 pixels thick */
4986  if ( lp2!=NULL || rp2!=NULL || lp3!=NULL || rp3 !=NULL ) /*ceil or floor*/
4987  wthick = thickness; /* same thickness for top/bot bar */
4988  if ( lp3==NULL && rp3==NULL ) /* set top bar if floor not wanted */
4989  rule_raster(rasp, 0,0, mywidth,wthick, 0); /* top horizontal bar */
4990  if ( lp2==NULL && rp2==NULL ) /* set bot bar if ceil not wanted */
4991  rule_raster(rasp, height-wthick,0, mywidth,thickness, 0); /* bottom */
4992  if ( lp!=NULL || lp2!=NULL || lp3!=NULL || lp4!=NULL ) /* left bracket */
4993  rule_raster(rasp, 0,0, thickness,height, 0); /* left vertical bar */
4994  if ( lp4 != NULL ) /* 2nd left vertical bar needed */
4995  rule_raster(rasp, 0,thickness+1, 1,height, 0); /* 2nd left vertical bar */
4996  if ( rp!=NULL || rp2!=NULL || rp3!=NULL || rp4!=NULL ) /* right bracket */
4997  rule_raster(rasp, 0,mywidth-thickness, thickness,height, 0); /* right */
4998  if ( rp4 != NULL ) /* 2nd right vertical bar needed */
4999  rule_raster(rasp, 0,mywidth-thickness-2, 1,height, 0); /*2nd right vert*/
5000  isokay = 1; /* set flag */
5001  } /* --- end-of-if(left- or right-[] bracket wanted) --- */
5002 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5003 < > brackets
5004 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5005 else
5006  if ( (lp=strchr(symbol,'<')) != NULL /* left < bracket wanted */
5007  || (rp=strchr(symbol,'>')) != NULL ) /* right > bracket wanted */
5008  {
5009  /* --- use line_raster( rasp, row0, col0, row1, col1, thickness ) --- */
5010  int mywidth = min2(width,12), /* max width for brackets */
5011  mythick = 1; /* all lines one pixel thick */
5012  thickness = (height<25?1:2); /* set line pixel thickness */
5013  if ( lp != NULL ) /* left < bracket wanted */
5014  { line_raster(rasp,height/2,0,0,mywidth-1,mythick);
5015  if ( thickness>1 )
5016  line_raster(rasp,height/2,1,0,mywidth-1,mythick);
5017  line_raster(rasp,height/2,0,height-1,mywidth-1,mythick);
5018  if ( thickness>1 )
5019  line_raster(rasp,height/2,1,height-1,mywidth-1,mythick); }
5020  if ( rp != NULL ) /* right > bracket wanted */
5021  { line_raster(rasp,height/2,mywidth-1,0,0,mythick);
5022  if ( thickness>1 )
5023  line_raster(rasp,height/2,mywidth-2,0,0,mythick);
5024  line_raster(rasp,height/2,mywidth-1,height-1,0,mythick);
5025  if ( thickness>1 )
5026  line_raster(rasp,height/2,mywidth-2,height-1,0,mythick); }
5027  isokay = 1; /* set flag */
5028  } /* --- end-of-if(left- or right-<> bracket wanted) --- */
5029 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5030 / \ delimiters
5031 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5032 else
5033  if ( (lp=strchr(symbol,'/')) != NULL /* left / wanted */
5034  || (rp=strstr(symbol,"\\\\")) != NULL /* right \ wanted */
5035  || (rp2=strstr(symbol,"backsl")) != NULL ) /* right \ wanted */
5036  {
5037  /* --- use line_raster( rasp, row0, col0, row1, col1, thickness ) --- */
5038  int mywidth = width; /* max width for / \ */
5039  thickness = 1; /* set line pixel thickness */
5040  if ( lp != NULL ) /* left / wanted */
5041  line_raster(rasp,0,mywidth-1,height-1,0,thickness);
5042  if ( rp!=NULL || rp2!=NULL ) /* right \ wanted */
5043  line_raster(rasp,0,0,height-1,mywidth-1,thickness);
5044  isokay = 1; /* set flag */
5045  } /* --- end-of-if(left- or right-/\ delimiter wanted) --- */
5046 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5047 arrow delimiters
5048 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5049 else
5050  if ( strstr(symbol,"arrow") != NULL ) /* arrow delimiter wanted */
5051  {
5052  /* --- use uparrow_subraster(width,height,pixsz,drctn,isBig) --- */
5053  int mywidth = width; /* max width for / \ */
5054  int isBig = (strstr(symbol,"Up")!=NULL /* isBig if we have an Up */
5055  || strstr(symbol,"Down")!=NULL); /* or a Down */
5056  int drctn = +1; /* init for uparrow */
5057  if ( strstr(symbol,"down")!=NULL /* down if we have down */
5058  || strstr(symbol,"Down")!=NULL ) /* or Down */
5059  { drctn = (-1); /* reset direction to down */
5060  if ( strstr(symbol,"up")!=NULL /* updown if we have up or Up */
5061  || strstr(symbol,"Up")!=NULL ) /* and down or Down */
5062  drctn = 0; } /* reset direction to updown */
5063  sp = uparrow_subraster(mywidth,height,pixsz,drctn,isBig);
5064  if ( sp != NULL )
5065  { sp->type = IMAGERASTER; /* image */
5066  sp->symdef = NULL; /* not applicable for image */
5067  sp->baseline = height/2 + 2; /* is a little above center good? */
5068  sp->size = NORMALSIZE; /* size (probably unneeded) */
5069  isokay = 1; } /* set flag */
5070  } /* --- end-of-if(arrow delimiter wanted) --- */
5071 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5072 \- for | | brackets or \= for || || brackets
5073 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5074 else
5075  if ( (lp=strchr(symbol,'-')) != NULL /* left or right | bracket wanted */
5076  || (lp2=strchr(symbol,'|')) != NULL /* synonym for | bracket */
5077  || (rp=strchr(symbol,'=')) != NULL /* left or right || bracket wanted */
5078  || (rp2=strstr(symbol,"\\|"))!= NULL ) /* || in standard tex notation */
5079  {
5080  /* --- rule_raster ( rasp, top, left, width, height, type=0 ) --- */
5081  int midcol = width/2; /* middle col, left of mid if even */
5082  if ( rp != NULL /* left or right || bracket wanted */
5083  || rp2 != NULL ) /* or || in standard tex notation */
5084  { thickness = (height<75?1:2); /* each | of || 1 or 2 pixels thick*/
5085  rule_raster(rasp, 0,max2(0,midcol-2), thickness,height, 0); /* left */
5086  rule_raster(rasp, 0,min2(width,midcol+2), thickness,height, 0); }
5087  else /*nb, lp2 spuriously set if rp2 set*/
5088  if ( lp != NULL /* left or right | bracket wanted */
5089  || lp2 != NULL ) /* ditto for synomym */
5090  { thickness = (height<75?1:2); /* set | 1 or 2 pixels thick */
5091  rule_raster(rasp, 0,midcol, thickness,height, 0); } /*mid vertical bar*/
5092  isokay = 1; /* set flag */
5093  } /* --- end-of-if(left- or right-[] bracket wanted) --- */
5094 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5095 back to caller
5096 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5097 end_of_job:
5098  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 )
5099  fprintf(msgfp,"make_delim> symbol=%.50s, isokay=%d\n",
5100  (symbol==NULL?"null":symbol),isokay);
5101  if ( !isokay ) /* don't have requested delimiter */
5102  { if (sp!=NULL) delete_subraster(sp); /* so free unneeded structure */
5103  sp = NULL; } /* and signal error to caller */
5104  return ( sp ); /*back to caller with delim or NULL*/
5105 } /* --- end-of-function make_delim() --- */
5106 
5107 
5108 /* ==========================================================================
5109  * Function: texchar ( expression, chartoken )
5110  * Purpose: scans expression, returning either its first character,
5111  * or the next \sequence if that first char is \,
5112  * and a pointer to the first expression char past that.
5113  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5114  * Arguments: expression (I) char * to first char of null-terminated
5115  * string containing valid LaTeX expression
5116  * to be scanned
5117  * chartoken (O) char * to null-terminated string returning
5118  * either the first (non-whitespace) character
5119  * of expression if that char isn't \, or else
5120  * the \ and everything following it up to
5121  * the next non-alphabetic character (but at
5122  * least one char following the \ even if
5123  * it's non-alpha)
5124  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5125  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to the first char of expression
5126  * past returned chartoken,
5127  * or NULL for any parsing error.
5128  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5129  * Notes: o Does *not* skip leading whitespace, but simply
5130  * returns any whitespace character as the next character.
5131  * ======================================================================= */
5132 /* --- entry point --- */
5133 char *texchar ( char *expression, char *chartoken )
5134 {
5135 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5136 Allocations and Declarations
5137 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5138 int esclen = 0, /*length of escape sequence*/
5139  maxesclen = 128; /* max len of esc sequence */
5140 char *ptoken = chartoken; /* ptr into chartoken */
5141 int iprefix = 0; /* prefix index */
5142 static char *prefixes[] = /*e.g., \big followed by ( */
5143  { /* "\\left", "\\right", */
5144  "\\big", "\\Big", "\\bigg", "\\Bigg",
5145  "\\bigl", "\\Bigl", "\\biggl", "\\Biggl",
5146  "\\bigr", "\\Bigr", "\\biggr", "\\Biggr", NULL };
5147 static char *starred[] = /* may be followed by * */
5148  { "\\hspace", "\\!", NULL };
5149 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5150 just return the next char if it's not \
5151 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5152 /* --- error check for end-of-string --- */
5153 *ptoken = '\000'; /* init in case of error */
5154 if ( expression == NULL ) return(NULL); /* nothing to scan */
5155 if ( *expression == '\000' ) return(NULL); /* nothing to scan */
5156 /* --- always returning first character (either \ or some other char) --- */
5157 *ptoken++ = *expression++; /* here's first character */
5158 /* --- if first char isn't \, then just return it to caller --- */
5159 if ( !isthischar(*(expression-1),ESCAPE) ) /* not a \, so return char */
5160  { *ptoken = '\000'; /* add a null terminator */
5161  goto end_of_job; } /* ptr past returned char */
5162 if ( *expression == '\000' ) /* \ is very last char */
5163  { *chartoken = '\000'; /* flush bad trailing \ */
5164  return(NULL); } /* and signal end-of-job */
5165 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5166 we have an escape sequence, so return all alpha chars following \
5167 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5168 /* --- accumulate chars until first non-alpha char found --- */
5169 for ( ; isalpha(*expression); esclen++ ) /* till first non-alpha... */
5170  { if ( esclen < maxesclen-3 ) /* more room in chartoken */
5171  *ptoken++ = *expression; /*copy alpha char, bump ptr*/
5172  expression++; } /* bump expression ptr */
5173 /* --- if we have a prefix, append next texchar, e.g., \big( --- */
5174 *ptoken = '\000'; /* set null for compare */
5175 for ( iprefix=0; prefixes[iprefix] != NULL; iprefix++ ) /* run thru list */
5176  if ( strcmp(chartoken,prefixes[iprefix]) == 0 ) /* have an exact match */
5177  { char nextchar[256]; int nextlen=0; /* texchar after prefix */
5178  skipwhite(expression); /* skip space after prefix*/
5179  expression = texchar(expression,nextchar); /* get nextchar */
5180  if ( (nextlen = strlen(nextchar)) > 0 ) /* #chars in nextchar */
5181  { strcpy(ptoken,nextchar); /* append nextchar */
5182  ptoken += strlen(nextchar); /* point to null terminator*/
5183  esclen += strlen(nextchar); } /* and bump escape length */
5184  break; } /* stop checking prefixes */
5185 /* --- every \ must be followed by at least one char, e.g., \[ --- */
5186 if ( esclen < 1 ) /* \ followed by non-alpha */
5187  *ptoken++ = *expression++; /*copy non-alpha, bump ptrs*/
5188 *ptoken = '\000'; /* null-terminate token */
5189 /* --- check for \hspace* or other starred commands --- */
5190 for ( iprefix=0; starred[iprefix] != NULL; iprefix++ ) /* run thru list */
5191  if ( strcmp(chartoken,starred[iprefix]) == 0 ) /* have an exact match */
5192  if ( *expression == '*' ) /* follows by a * */
5193  { *ptoken++ = *expression++; /* copy * and bump ptr */
5194  *ptoken = '\000'; /* null-terminate token */
5195  break; } /* stop checking */
5196 /* --- respect spaces in text mode, except first space after \escape --- */
5197 if ( esclen >= 1 ) { /*only for alpha \sequences*/
5198  if ( istextmode ) /* in \rm or \it text mode */
5199  if ( isthischar(*expression,WHITEDELIM) ) /* delim follows \sequence */
5200  expression++; } /* so flush delim */
5201 /* --- back to caller --- */
5202 end_of_job:
5203  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 )
5204  { fprintf(msgfp,"texchar> returning token = \"%s\"\n",chartoken);
5205  fflush(msgfp); }
5206  return ( expression ); /*ptr to 1st non-alpha char*/
5207 } /* --- end-of-function texchar() --- */
5208 
5209 
5210 /* ==========================================================================
5211  * Function: texsubexpr (expression,subexpr,maxsubsz,
5212  * left,right,isescape,isdelim)
5213  * Purpose: scans expression, returning everything between a balanced
5214  * left{...right} subexpression if the first non-whitespace
5215  * char of expression is an (escaped or unescaped) left{,
5216  * or just the next texchar() otherwise,
5217  * and a pointer to the first expression char past that.
5218  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5219  * Arguments: expression (I) char * to first char of null-terminated
5220  * string containing valid LaTeX expression
5221  * to be scanned
5222  * subexpr (O) char * to null-terminated string returning
5223  * either everything between a balanced {...}
5224  * subexpression if the first char is {,
5225  * or the next texchar() otherwise.
5226  * maxsubsz (I) int containing max #bytes returned
5227  * in subexpr buffer (0 means unlimited)
5228  * left (I) char * specifying allowable left delimiters
5229  * that begin subexpression, e.g., "{[(<"
5230  * right (I) char * specifying matching right delimiters
5231  * in the same order as left, e.g., "}])>"
5232  * isescape (I) int controlling whether escaped and/or
5233  * unescaped left,right are matched;
5234  * see isbrace() comments below for details.
5235  * isdelim (I) int containing true (non-zero) to return
5236  * the leading left and trailing right delims
5237  * (if any were found) along with subexpr,
5238  * or containing false=0 to return subexpr
5239  * without its delimiters
5240  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5241  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to the first char of expression
5242  * past returned subexpr (see Notes),
5243  * or NULL for any parsing error.
5244  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5245  * Notes: o If subexpr is of the form left{...right},
5246  * the outer {}'s are returned as part of subexpr
5247  * if isdelim is true; if isdelim is false the {}'s aren't
5248  * returned. In either case the returned pointer is
5249  * *always* bumped past the closing right}, even if
5250  * that closing right} isn't returned in subexpr.
5251  * o If subexpr is not of the form left{...right},
5252  * the returned pointer is on the character immediately
5253  * following the last character returned in subexpr
5254  * o \. acts as LaTeX \right. and matches any \left(
5255  * And it also acts as a LaTeX \left. and matches any \right)
5256  * ======================================================================= */
5257 /* --- entry point --- */
5258 char *texsubexpr ( char *expression, char *subexpr, int maxsubsz,
5259  char *left, char *right, int isescape, int isdelim )
5260 {
5261 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5262 Allocations and Declarations
5263 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5264 char *texchar(); /*next char (or \sequence) from expression*/
5265 char *leftptr, leftdelim[256] = "(\000", /* left( found in expression */
5266  rightdelim[256] = ")\000"; /* and matching right) */
5267 char *origexpression=expression, *origsubexpr=subexpr; /*original inputs*/
5268 char *strtexchr(), *texleft(); /* check for \left, and get it */
5269 int gotescape = 0, /* true if leading char of expression is \ */
5270  prevescape = 0; /* while parsing, true if preceding char \ */
5271 int isbrace(); /* check for left,right braces */
5272 int isanyright = 1; /* true matches any right with left, (...] */
5273 int isleftdot = 0; /* true if left brace is a \. */
5274 int nestlevel = 1; /* current # of nested braces */
5275 int subsz=0 /*,maxsubsz=MAXSUBXSZ*/; /*#chars in returned subexpr buffer*/
5276 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5277 skip leading whitespace and just return the next char if it's not {
5278 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5279 /* --- skip leading whitespace and error check for end-of-string --- */
5280 *subexpr = '\000'; /* init in case of error */
5281 if ( expression == NULL ) return(NULL); /*can't dereference null ptr*/
5282 skipwhite(expression); /* leading whitespace gone */
5283 if ( *expression == '\000' ) return(NULL); /* nothing left to scan */
5284 /* --- set maxsubsz --- */
5285 if ( maxsubsz < 1 ) maxsubsz = MAXSUBXSZ-2; /* input 0 means unlimited */
5286 /* --- check for escape --- */
5287 if ( isthischar(*expression,ESCAPE) ) /* expression is escaped */
5288  gotescape = 1; /* so set flag accordingly */
5289 /* --- check for \left...\right --- */
5290 if ( gotescape ) /* begins with \ */
5291  if ( memcmp(expression+1,"left",4) ) /* and followed by left */
5292  if ( strchr(left,'l') != NULL ) /* caller wants \left's */
5293  if ( strtexchr(expression,"\\left") == expression ) /*expression=\left...*/
5294  { char *pright = texleft(expression,subexpr,maxsubsz, /* find ...\right*/
5295  (isdelim?NULL:leftdelim),rightdelim);
5296  if ( isdelim ) strcat(subexpr,rightdelim); /* caller wants delims */
5297  return ( pright ); /*back to caller past \right*/
5298  } /* --- end-of-if(expression=="\\left") --- */
5299 /* --- if first char isn't left{ or script, just return it to caller --- */
5300 if ( !isbrace(expression,left,isescape) ) { /* not a left{ */
5301  if ( !isthischar(*expression,SCRIPTS) ) /* and not a script */
5302  return ( texchar(expression,subexpr) ); /* next char to caller */
5303  else /* --- kludge for super/subscripts to accommodate texscripts() --- */
5304  { *subexpr++ = *expression; /* signal script */
5305  *subexpr = '\000'; /* null-terminate subexpr */
5306  return ( expression ); } } /* leave script in stream */
5307 /* --- extract left and find matching right delimiter --- */
5308 *leftdelim = *(expression+gotescape); /* the left( in expression */
5309 if ( (gotescape && *leftdelim == '.') /* we have a left \. */
5310 || (gotescape && isanyright) ) /*or are matching any right*/
5311  { isleftdot = 1; /* so just set flag */
5312  *leftdelim = '\000'; } /* and reset leftdelim */
5313 else /* find matching \right */
5314  if ( (leftptr=strchr(left,*leftdelim)) != NULL ) /* ptr to that left( */
5315  *rightdelim = right[(int)(leftptr-left)]; /* get the matching right) */
5316  else /* can't happen -- pgm bug */
5317  return ( NULL ); /*just signal eoj to caller*/
5318 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5319 accumulate chars between balanced {}'s, i.e., till nestlevel returns to 0
5320 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5321 /* --- first initialize by bumping past left{ or \{ --- */
5322 if ( isdelim ) *subexpr++ = *expression++; /*caller wants { in subexpr*/
5323  else expression++; /* always bump past left{ */
5324 if ( gotescape ) { /*need to bump another char*/
5325  if ( isdelim ) *subexpr++ = *expression++; /* caller wants char, too */
5326  else expression++; } /* else just bump past it */
5327 /* --- set maximum size for numerical arguments --- */
5328 if ( 0 ) /* check turned on or off? */
5329  if ( !isescape && !isdelim ) /*looking for numerical arg*/
5330  maxsubsz = 96; /* set max arg size */
5331 /* --- search for matching right} --- */
5332 while ( 1 ) /*until balanced right} */
5333  {
5334  /* --- error check for end-of-string --- */
5335  if ( *expression == '\000' ) /* premature end-of-string */
5336  { if ( 0 && (!isescape && !isdelim) ) /*looking for numerical arg,*/
5337  { expression = origexpression; /* so end-of-string is error*/
5338  subexpr = origsubexpr; } /* so reset all ptrs */
5339  if ( isdelim ) { /* generate fake right */
5340  if ( gotescape ) /* need escaped right */
5341  { *subexpr++ = '\\'; /* set escape char */
5342  *subexpr++ = '.'; } /* and fake \right. */
5343  else /* escape not wanted */
5344  *subexpr++ = *rightdelim; } /* so fake actual right */
5345  *subexpr = '\000'; /* null-terminate subexpr */
5346  return ( expression ); } /* back with final token */
5347  /* --- check preceding char for escape --- */
5348  if ( isthischar(*(expression-1),ESCAPE) ) /* previous char was \ */
5349  prevescape = 1-prevescape; /* so flip escape flag */
5350  else prevescape = 0; /* or turn flag off */
5351  /* --- check for { and } (un/escaped as per leading left) --- */
5352  if ( gotescape == prevescape ) /* escaped iff leading is */
5353  { /* --- check for (closing) right delim and see if we're done --- */
5354  if ( isthischar(*expression,rightdelim) /* found a right} */
5355  || (isleftdot && isthischar(*expression,right)) /*\left. matches all*/
5356  || (prevescape && isthischar(*expression,".")) ) /*or found \right. */
5357  if ( --nestlevel < 1 ) /*\right balances 1st \left*/
5358  { if ( isdelim ) /*caller wants } in subexpr*/
5359  *subexpr++ = *expression; /* so end subexpr with } */
5360  else /*check for \ before right}*/
5361  if ( prevescape ) /* have unwanted \ */
5362  *(subexpr-1) = '\000'; /* so replace it with null */
5363  *subexpr = '\000'; /* null-terminate subexpr */
5364  return ( expression+1 ); } /* back with char after } */
5365  /* --- check for (another) left{ --- */
5366  if ( isthischar(*expression,leftdelim) /* found another left{ */
5367  || (isleftdot && isthischar(*expression,left)) ) /* any left{ */
5368  nestlevel++;
5369  } /* --- end-of-if(gotescape==prevescape) --- */
5370  /* --- not done, so copy char to subexpr and continue with next char --- */
5371  if ( ++subsz < maxsubsz-5 ) /* more room in subexpr */
5372  *subexpr++ = *expression; /* so copy char and bump ptr*/
5373  expression++; /* bump expression ptr */
5374  } /* --- end-of-while(1) --- */
5375 } /* --- end-of-function texsubexpr() --- */
5376 
5377 
5378 /* ==========================================================================
5379  * Function: texleft (expression,subexpr,maxsubsz,ldelim,rdelim)
5380  * Purpose: scans expression, starting after opening \left,
5381  * and returning ptr after matching closing \right.
5382  * Everything between is returned in subexpr, if given.
5383  * Likewise, if given, ldelim returns delimiter after \left
5384  * and rdelim returns delimiter after \right.
5385  * If ldelim is given, the returned subexpr doesn't include it.
5386  * If rdelim is given, the returned pointer is after that delim.
5387  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5388  * Arguments: expression (I) char * to first char of null-terminated
5389  * string immediately following opening \left
5390  * subexpr (O) char * to null-terminated string returning
5391  * either everything between balanced
5392  * \left ... \right. If leftdelim given,
5393  * subexpr does _not_ contain that delimiter.
5394  * maxsubsz (I) int containing max #bytes returned
5395  * in subexpr buffer (0 means unlimited)
5396  * ldelim (O) char * returning delimiter following
5397  * opening \left
5398  * rdelim (O) char * returning delimiter following
5399  * closing \right
5400  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5401  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to the first char of expression
5402  * past closing \right, or past closing
5403  * right delimiter if rdelim!=NULL,
5404  * or NULL for any error.
5405  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5406  * Notes: o
5407  * ======================================================================= */
5408 /* --- entry point --- */
5409 char *texleft ( char *expression, char *subexpr, int maxsubsz,
5410  char *ldelim, char *rdelim )
5411 {
5412 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5413 Allocations and Declarations
5414 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5415 char *texchar(), /* get delims after \left,\right */
5416  *strtexchr(), *pright=expression; /* locate matching \right */
5417 static char left[16]="\\left", right[16]="\\right"; /* tex delimiters */
5418 int sublen = 0; /* #chars between \left...\right */
5419 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5420 initialization
5421 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5422 /* --- init output --- */
5423 if ( subexpr != NULL ) *subexpr = '\000'; /* init subexpr, if given */
5424 if ( ldelim != NULL ) *ldelim = '\000'; /* init ldelim, if given */
5425 if ( rdelim != NULL ) *rdelim = '\000'; /* init rdelim, if given */
5426 /* --- check args --- */
5427 if ( expression == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no input supplied */
5428 if ( *expression == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* nothing after \left */
5429 /* --- determine left delimiter --- */
5430 if ( ldelim != NULL ) /* caller wants left delim */
5431  { skipwhite(expression); /* interpret \left ( as \left( */
5432  expression = texchar(expression,ldelim); } /*delim from expression*/
5433 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5434 locate \right balancing opening \left
5435 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5436 /* --- first \right following \left --- */
5437 if ( (pright=strtexchr(expression,right)) /* look for \right after \left */
5438 != NULL ) { /* found it */
5439  /* --- find matching \right by pushing past any nested \left's --- */
5440  char *pleft = expression; /* start after first \left( */
5441  while ( 1 ) { /*break when matching \right found*/
5442  /* -- locate next nested \left if there is one --- */
5443  if ( (pleft=strtexchr(pleft,left)) /* find next \left */
5444  == NULL ) break; /*no more, so matching \right found*/
5445  pleft += strlen(left); /* push ptr past \left token */
5446  if ( pleft >= pright ) break; /* not nested if \left after \right*/
5447  /* --- have nested \left, so push forward to next \right --- */
5448  if ( (pright=strtexchr(pright+strlen(right),right)) /* find next \right */
5449  == NULL ) break; /* ran out of \right's */
5450  } /* --- end-of-while(1) --- */
5451  } /* --- end-of-if(pright!=NULL) --- */
5452 /* --- set subexpression length, push pright past \right --- */
5453 if ( pright != (char *)NULL ) /* found matching \right */
5454  { sublen = (int)(pright-expression); /* #chars between \left...\right */
5455  pright += strlen(right); } /* so push pright past \right */
5456 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5457 get rightdelim and subexpr between \left...\right
5458 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5459 /* --- get delimiter following \right --- */
5460 if ( rdelim != NULL ) { /* caller wants right delim */
5461  if ( pright == (char *)NULL ) /* assume \right. at end of exprssn*/
5462  { strcpy(rdelim,"."); /* set default \right. */
5463  sublen = strlen(expression); /* use entire remaining expression */
5464  pright = expression + sublen; } /* and push pright to end-of-string*/
5465  else /* have explicit matching \right */
5466  { skipwhite(pright); /* interpret \right ) as \right) */
5467  pright = texchar(pright,rdelim); /* pull delim from expression */
5468  if ( *rdelim == '\000' ) strcpy(rdelim,"."); } } /* or set \right. */
5469 /* --- get subexpression between \left...\right --- */
5470 if ( sublen > 0 ) /* have subexpr */
5471  if ( subexpr != NULL ) { /* and caller wants it */
5472  if ( maxsubsz > 0 ) sublen = min2(sublen,maxsubsz-1); /* max buffer size */
5473  memcpy(subexpr,expression,sublen); /* stuff between \left...\right */
5474  subexpr[sublen] = '\000'; } /* null-terminate subexpr */
5475 end_of_job:
5476  if ( msglevel>=99 && msgfp!=NULL )
5477  { fprintf(msgfp,"texleft> ldelim=%s, rdelim=%s, subexpr=%.128s\n",
5478  (ldelim==NULL?"none":ldelim),(rdelim==NULL?"none":rdelim),
5479  (subexpr==NULL?"none":subexpr)); fflush(msgfp); }
5480  return ( pright );
5481 } /* --- end-of-function texleft --- */
5482 
5483 
5484 /* ==========================================================================
5485  * Function: texscripts ( expression, subscript, superscript, which )
5486  * Purpose: scans expression, returning subscript and/or superscript
5487  * if expression is of the form _x^y or ^{x}_{y},
5488  * or any (valid LaTeX) permutation of the above,
5489  * and a pointer to the first expression char past "scripts"
5490  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5491  * Arguments: expression (I) char * to first char of null-terminated
5492  * string containing valid LaTeX expression
5493  * to be scanned
5494  * subscript (O) char * to null-terminated string returning
5495  * subscript (without _), if found, or "\000"
5496  * superscript (O) char * to null-terminated string returning
5497  * superscript (without ^), if found, or "\000"
5498  * which (I) int containing 1 for subscript only,
5499  * 2 for superscript only, >=3 for either/both
5500  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5501  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to the first char of expression
5502  * past returned "scripts" (unchanged
5503  * except for skipped whitespace if
5504  * neither subscript nor superscript found),
5505  * or NULL for any parsing error.
5506  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5507  * Notes: o an input expression like ^a^b_c will return superscript="b",
5508  * i.e., totally ignoring all but the last "script" encountered
5509  * ======================================================================= */
5510 /* --- entry point --- */
5511 char *texscripts ( char *expression, char *subscript,
5512  char *superscript, int which )
5513 {
5514 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5515 Allocations and Declarations
5516 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5517 char *texsubexpr(); /* next subexpression from expression */
5518 int gotsub=0, gotsup=0; /* check that we don't eat, e.g., x_1_2 */
5519 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5520 init "scripts"
5521 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5522 if ( subscript != NULL ) *subscript = '\000'; /*init in case no subscript*/
5523 if ( superscript!=NULL ) *superscript = '\000'; /*init in case no super*/
5524 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5525 get subscript and/or superscript from expression
5526 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5527 while ( expression != NULL ) {
5528  skipwhite(expression); /* leading whitespace gone */
5529  if ( *expression == '\000' ) return(expression); /* nothing left to scan */
5530  if ( isthischar(*expression,SUBSCRIPT) /* found _ */
5531  && (which==1 || which>2 ) ) /* and caller wants it */
5532  { if ( gotsub /* found 2nd subscript */
5533  || subscript == NULL ) break; /* or no subscript buffer */
5534  gotsub = 1; /* set subscript flag */
5535  expression = texsubexpr(expression+1,subscript,0,"{","}",0,0); }
5536  else /* no _, check for ^ */
5537  if ( isthischar(*expression,SUPERSCRIPT) /* found ^ */
5538  && which>=2 ) /* and caller wants it */
5539  { if ( gotsup /* found 2nd superscript */
5540  || superscript == NULL ) break; /* or no superscript buffer*/
5541  gotsup = 1; /* set superscript flag */
5542  expression = texsubexpr(expression+1,superscript,0,"{","}",0,0); }
5543  else /* neither _ nor ^ */
5544  return ( expression ); /*return ptr past "scripts"*/
5545  } /* --- end-of-while(expression!=NULL) --- */
5546 return ( expression );
5547 } /* --- end-of-function texscripts() --- */
5548 
5549 
5550 /* ==========================================================================
5551  * Function: isbrace ( expression, braces, isescape )
5552  * Purpose: checks leading char(s) of expression for a brace,
5553  * either escaped or unescaped depending on isescape,
5554  * except that { and } are always matched, if they're
5555  * in braces, regardless of isescape.
5556  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5557  * Arguments: expression (I) char * to first char of null-terminated
5558  * string containing a valid LaTeX expression
5559  * whose leading char(s) are checked for braces
5560  * that begin subexpression, e.g., "{[(<"
5561  * braces (I) char * specifying matching brace delimiters
5562  * to be checked for, e.g., "{[(<" or "}])>"
5563  * isescape (I) int containing 0 to match only unescaped
5564  * braces, e.g., (...) or {...}, etc,
5565  * or containing 1 to match only escaped
5566  * braces, e.g., \(...\) or \[...\], etc,
5567  * or containing 2 to match either.
5568  * But note: if {,} are in braces
5569  * then they're *always* matched whether
5570  * escaped or not, regardless of isescape.
5571  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5572  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if the leading char(s) of expression
5573  * is a brace, or 0 if not.
5574  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5575  * Notes: o
5576  * ======================================================================= */
5577 /* --- entry point --- */
5578 int isbrace ( char *expression, char *braces, int isescape )
5579 {
5580 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5581 Allocations and Declarations
5582 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5583 int gotescape = 0, /* true if leading char is an escape */
5584  gotbrace = 0; /*true if first non-escape char is a brace*/
5585 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5586 check for brace
5587 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5588 /* --- first check for end-of-string or \= ligature --- */
5589 if ( *expression == '\000' /* nothing to check */
5590 || isligature ) goto end_of_job; /* have a \= ligature */
5591 /* --- check leading char for escape --- */
5592 if ( isthischar(*expression,ESCAPE) ) /* expression is escaped */
5593  { gotescape = 1; /* so set flag accordingly */
5594  expression++; } /* and bump past escape */
5595 /* --- check (maybe next char) for brace --- */
5596 if ( isthischar(*expression,braces) ) /* expression is braced */
5597  gotbrace = 1; /* so set flag accordingly */
5598 if ( gotescape && *expression == '.' ) /* \. matches any brace */
5599  gotbrace = 1; /* set flag */
5600 /* --- check for TeX brace { or } --- */
5601 if ( gotbrace && isthischar(*expression,"{}") ) /*expression has TeX brace*/
5602  if ( isescape ) isescape = 2; /* reset escape flag */
5603 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5604 back to caller
5605 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5606 end_of_job:
5607  if ( msglevel>=999 && msgfp!=NULL )
5608  { fprintf(msgfp,"isbrace> expression=%.8s, gotbrace=%d (isligature=%d)\n",
5609  expression,gotbrace,isligature); fflush(msgfp); }
5610  if ( gotbrace && /* found a brace */
5611  ( isescape==2 || /* escape irrelevant */
5612  gotescape==isescape ) /* un/escaped as requested */
5613  ) return ( 1 ); return ( 0 ); /* return 1,0 accordingly */
5614 } /* --- end-of-function isbrace() --- */
5615 
5616 
5617 /* ==========================================================================
5618  * Function: preamble ( expression, size, subexpr )
5619  * Purpose: parses $-terminated preamble, if present, at beginning
5620  * of expression, re-setting size if necessary, and
5621  * returning any other parameters besides size in subexpr.
5622  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5623  * Arguments: expression (I) char * to first char of null-terminated
5624  * string containing LaTeX expression possibly
5625  * preceded by $-terminated preamble
5626  * size (I/O) int * containing 0-4 default font size,
5627  * and returning size modified by first
5628  * preamble parameter (or unchanged)
5629  * subexpr(O) char * returning any remaining preamble
5630  * parameters past size
5631  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5632  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to first char past preamble in expression
5633  * or NULL for any parsing error.
5634  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5635  * Notes: o size can be any number >=0. If preceded by + or -, it's
5636  * interpreted as an increment to input size; otherwise
5637  * it's interpreted as the size.
5638  * o if subexpr is passed as NULL ptr, then returned expression
5639  * ptr will have "flushed" and preamble parameters after size
5640  * ======================================================================= */
5641 /* --- entry point --- */
5642 char *preamble ( char *expression, int *size, char *subexpr )
5643 {
5644 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5645 Allocations and Declarations
5646 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5647 char pretext[512], *prep=expression, /*pream from expression, ptr into it*/
5648  *dollar, *comma; /* preamble delimiters */
5649 int prelen = 0, /* preamble length */
5650  sizevalue = 0, /* value of size parameter */
5651  isfontsize = 0, /*true if leading fontsize present*/
5652  isdelta = 0; /*true to increment passed size arg*/
5653 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5654 initialization
5655 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5656 if ( subexpr != NULL ) /* caller passed us an address */
5657  *subexpr = '\000'; /* so init assuming no preamble */
5658 if ( expression == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no input */
5659 if ( *expression == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* input is an empty string */
5660 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5661 process preamble if present
5662 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5663 /*process_preamble:*/
5664 if ( (dollar=strchr(expression,'$')) /* $ signals preceding preamble */
5665 != NULL ) { /* found embedded $ */
5666  if ( (prelen = (int)(dollar-expression)) /*#chars in expression preceding $*/
5667  > 0 ) { /* must have preamble preceding $ */
5668  if ( prelen < 65 ) { /* too long for a prefix */
5669  memcpy(pretext,expression,prelen); /* local copy of preamble */
5670  pretext[prelen] = '\000'; /* null-terminated */
5671  if ( strchr(pretext,*(ESCAPE))==NULL /*shouldn't be an escape in preamble*/
5672  && strchr(pretext,'{') == NULL ) { /*shouldn't be a left{ in preamble*/
5673  /* --- skip any leading whitespace --- */
5674  prep = pretext; /* start at beginning of preamble */
5675  skipwhite(prep); /* skip any leading white space */
5676  /* --- check for embedded , or leading +/- (either signalling size) --- */
