5677  if ( isthischar(*prep,"+-") ) /* have leading + or - */
5678  isdelta = 1; /* so use size value as increment */
5679  comma = strchr(pretext,','); /* , signals leading size param */
5680  /* --- process leading size parameter if present --- */
5681  if ( comma != NULL /* size param explicitly signalled */
5682  || isdelta || isdigit(*prep) ) { /* or inferred implicitly */
5683  /* --- parse size parameter and reset size accordingly --- */
5684  if( comma != NULL ) *comma = '\000';/*, becomes null, terminating size*/
5685  sizevalue = atoi(prep); /* convert size string to integer */
5686  if ( size != NULL ) /* caller passed address for size */
5687  *size = (isdelta? *size+sizevalue : sizevalue); /* so reset size */
5688  /* --- finally, set flag and shift size parameter out of preamble --- */
5689  isfontsize = 1; /*set flag showing font size present*/
5690  if ( comma != NULL ) /*2/15/12-isn't this superfluous???*/
5691  {strsqueezep(pretext,comma+1);} /* squeeze out leading size param */
5692  } /* --- end-of-if(comma!=NULL||etc) --- */
5693  /* --- copy any preamble params following size to caller's subexpr --- */
5694  if ( comma != NULL || !isfontsize ) /*preamb contains params past size*/
5695  if ( subexpr != NULL ) /* caller passed us an address */
5696  strcpy(subexpr,pretext); /*so return extra params to caller*/
5697  /* --- finally, set prep to shift preamble out of expression --- */
5698  prep = expression + prelen+1; /* set prep past $ in expression */
5699  } /* --- end-of-if(strchr(pretext,*ESCAPE)==NULL) --- */
5700  } /* --- end-of-if(prelen<65) --- */
5701  } /* --- end-of-if(prelen>0) --- */
5702  else { /* $ is first char of expression */
5703  int ndollars = 0; /* number of $...$ pairs removed */
5704  prep = expression; /* start at beginning of expression*/
5705  while ( *prep == '$' ) { /* remove all matching $...$'s */
5706  int explen = strlen(prep)-1; /* index of last char in expression*/
5707  if ( explen < 2 ) break; /* no $...$'s left to remove */
5708  if ( prep[explen] != '$' ) break; /* unmatched $ */
5709  prep[explen] = '\000'; /* remove trailing $ */
5710  prep++; /* and remove matching leading $ */
5711  ndollars++; /* count another pair removed */
5712  } /* --- end-of-while(*prep=='$') --- */
5713  ispreambledollars = ndollars; /* set flag to fix \displaystyle */
5714  if ( ndollars == 1 ) /* user submitted $...$ expression */
5715  isdisplaystyle = 0; /* so set \textstyle */
5716  if ( ndollars > 1 ) /* user submitted $$...$$ */
5717  isdisplaystyle = 2; /* so set \displaystyle */
5718  /*goto process_preamble;*/ /*check for preamble after leading $*/
5719  } /* --- end-of-if/else(prelen>0) --- */
5720  } /* --- end-of-if(dollar!=NULL) --- */
5721 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5722 back to caller
5723 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5724 end_of_job:
5725  return ( prep ); /*expression, or ptr past preamble*/
5726 } /* --- end-of-function preamble() --- */
5727 
5728 
5729 /* ==========================================================================
5730  * Function: mimeprep ( expression )
5731  * Purpose: preprocessor for mimeTeX input, e.g.,
5732  * (a) removes comments,
5733  * (b) converts \left( to \( and \right) to \),
5734  * (c) xlates &html; special chars to equivalent latex
5735  * Should only be called once (after unescape_url())
5736  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5737  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char * to first char of null-terminated
5738  * string containing mimeTeX/LaTeX expression,
5739  * and returning preprocessed string
5740  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5741  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to input expression,
5742  * or NULL for any parsing error.
5743  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
5744  * Notes: o
5745  * ======================================================================= */
5746 /* --- entry point --- */
5747 char *mimeprep ( char *expression )
5748 {
5749 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
5750 Allocations and Declarations
5751 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5752 char *expptr=expression, /* ptr within expression */
5753  *tokptr=NULL, /*ptr to token found in expression*/
5754  *texsubexpr(), argval[8192]; /*parse for macro args after token*/
5755 char *strchange(); /* change leading chars of string */
5756 int strreplace(); /* replace nnn with actual num, etc*/
5757 char *strwstr(); /*use strwstr() instead of strstr()*/
5758 char *findbraces(); /*find left { and right } for \atop*/
5759 int idelim=0, /* left- or right-index */
5760  isymbol=0; /*symbols[],rightcomment[],etc index*/
5761 int xlateleft = 0; /* true to xlate \left and \right */
5762 /* ---
5763  * comments
5764  * -------- */
5765 char *leftptr=NULL; /* find leftcomment in expression */
5766 static char *leftcomment = "%%", /* open comment */
5767  *rightcomment[] = {"\n", "%%", NULL}; /* close comments */
5768 /* ---
5769  * special long (more than 1-char) \left and \right delimiters
5770  * ----------------------------------------------------------- */
5771 static char *leftfrom[] = /* xlate any \left suffix... */
5772  { "\\|", /* \left\| */
5773  "\\{", /* \left\{ */
5774  "\\langle", /* \left\langle */
5775  NULL } ; /* --- end-of-leftfrom[] --- */
5776 static char *leftto[] = /* ...to this instead */
5777  { "=", /* = */
5778  "{", /* { */
5779  "<", /* < */
5780  NULL } ; /* --- end-of-leftto[] --- */
5781 static char *rightfrom[] = /* xlate any \right suffix... */
5782  { "\\|", /* \right\| */
5783  "\\}", /* \right\} */
5784  "\\rangle", /* \right\rangle */
5785  NULL } ; /* --- end-of-rightfrom[] --- */
5786 static char *rightto[] = /* ...to this instead */
5787  { "=", /* = */
5788  "}", /* } */
5789  ">", /* > */
5790  NULL } ; /* --- end-of-rightto[] --- */
5791 /* ---
5792  * { \atop }-like commands
5793  * ----------------------- */
5794 char *atopsym=NULL; /* atopcommands[isymbol] */
5795 static char *atopcommands[] = /* list of {a+b\command c+d}'s */
5796  { "\\over", /* plain tex for \frac */
5797  "\\choose", /* binomial coefficient */
5798  #ifndef NOATOP /*noatop preserves old mimeTeX rule*/
5799  "\\atop",
5800  #endif
5801  NULL } ; /* --- end-of-atopcommands[] --- */
5802 static char *atopdelims[] = /* delims for atopcommands[] */
5803  { NULL, NULL, /* \\over has no delims */
5804  "\\left(", "\\right)", /* \\choose has ( ) delims*/
5805  #ifndef NOATOP /*noatop preserves old mimeTeX rule*/
5806  NULL, NULL, /* \\atop has no delims */
5807  #endif
5808  NULL, NULL } ; /* --- end-of-atopdelims[] --- */
5809 /* ---
5810  * html special/escape chars converted to latex equivalents
5811  * -------------------------------------------------------- */
5812 char *htmlsym=NULL; /* symbols[isymbol].html */
5813 static struct { char *html; char *args; char *latex; } symbols[] =
5814  { /* --------------------------------------------
5815  user-supplied newcommands
5816  -------------------------------------------- */
5817  #ifdef NEWCOMMANDS /* -DNEWCOMMANDS=\"filename.h\" */
5818  #include NEWCOMMANDS
5819  #endif
5820  /* --------------------------------------------
5821  Specials termchar value...
5822  -------------------------------------------- */
5823  { "\\version", NULL, "{\\small\\red\\text \\fbox{\\begin{gather}"
5824  "mime\\TeX version \\versionnumber \\\\"
5825  "last revised \\revisiondate \\\\ \\copyrighttext \\\\"
5826  "see \\homepagetext for details \\end{gather}}}" },
5827  { "\\copyright", NULL,
5828  "{\\small\\red\\text \\fbox{\\begin{gather}"
5829  "mimeTeX \\copyrighttext \\\\"
5830  "see \\homepagetext for details \\end{gather}}}" },
5831  { "\\versionnumber", NULL, "{\\text " VERSION "}" },
5832  { "\\revisiondate", NULL, "{\\text " REVISIONDATE "}" },
5833  { "\\copyrighttext", NULL, "{\\text " COPYRIGHTTEXT ".}" },
5834  { "\\homepagetext", NULL,
5835  "{\\text http://www.forkosh.com/mimetex.html}" },
5836  /* --------------------------------------------
5837  Cyrillic termchar mimeTeX equivalent...
5838  -------------------------------------------- */
5839  { "\\\'G", "embed\\","{\\acute{G}}" },
5840  { "\\\'g", "embed\\","{\\acute{g}}" },
5841  { "\\\'K", "embed\\","{\\acute{K}}" },
5842  { "\\\'k", "embed\\","{\\acute{k}}" },
5843  { "\\u U", "embed\\","{\\breve{U}}" },
5844  { "\\u u", "embed\\","{\\breve{u}}" },
5845  /*{ "\\\"E", "embed\\","{\\ddot{E}}" },*/
5846  /*{ "\\\"e", "embed\\","{\\ddot{e}}" },*/
5847  { "\\\"I", "embed\\","{\\ddot{\\=I}}" },
5848  { "\\\"\\i", "embed\\","{\\ddot{\\=\\i}}" },
5849  /* --------------------------------------------
5850  LaTeX Macro #args,default template...
5851  -------------------------------------------- */
5852  { "\\lvec", "2n", "{#2_1,\\cdots,#2_{#1}}" },
5853  { "\\grave", "1", "{\\stackrel{\\Huge\\gravesym}{#1}}" }, /* \grave */
5854  { "\\acute", "1", "{\\stackrel{\\Huge\\acutesym}{#1}}" }, /* \acute */
5855  { "\\check", "1", "{\\stackrel{\\Huge\\checksym}{#1}}" }, /* \check */
5856  { "\\breve", "1", "{\\stackrel{\\Huge\\brevesym}{#1}}" }, /* \breve */
5857  { "\\buildrel","3", "{\\stackrel{#1}{#3}}" }, /* ignore #2 = \over */
5858  { "\\overset", NULL, "\\stackrel" }, /* just an alias */
5859  { "\\underset", "2", "\\relstack{#2}{#1}" }, /* reverse args */
5860  { "\\dfrac", "2", "{\\frac{#1}{#2}}" },
5861  { "\\binom", "2", "{\\begin{pmatrix}{#1}\\\\{#2}\\end{pmatrix}}" },
5862  { "\\aangle","26", "{\\boxaccent{#1}{#2}}" },
5863  { "\\actuarial","2 ","{#1\\boxaccent{6}{#2}}" }, /*comprehensive sym list*/
5864  { "\\boxaccent","2", "{\\fbox[,#1]{#2}}" },
5865  /* --------------------------------------------
5866  html char termchar LaTeX equivalent...
5867  -------------------------------------------- */
5868  { "&quot", ";", "\"" }, /* &quot; is first, &#034; */
5869  { "&amp", ";", "&" },
5870  { "&lt", ";", "<" },
5871  { "&gt", ";", ">" },
5872  /*{ "&#092", ";", "\\" },*/ /* backslash */
5873  { "&backslash",";", "\\" },
5874  { "&nbsp", ";", "~" },
5875  { "&iexcl", ";", "{\\raisebox{-2}{\\rotatebox{180}{!}}}" },
5876  { "&brvbar", ";", "|" },
5877  { "&plusmn", ";", "\\pm" },
5878  { "&sup2", ";", "{{}^2}" },
5879  { "&sup3", ";", "{{}^3}" },
5880  { "&micro", ";", "\\mu" },
5881  { "&sup1", ";", "{{}^1}" },
5882  { "&frac14", ";", "{\\frac14}" },
5883  { "&frac12", ";", "{\\frac12}" },
5884  { "&frac34", ";", "{\\frac34}" },
5885  { "&iquest", ";", "{\\raisebox{-2}{\\rotatebox{180}{?}}}" },
5886  { "&Acirc", ";", "{\\rm~\\hat~A}" },
5887  { "&Atilde", ";", "{\\rm~\\tilde~A}" },
5888  { "&Auml", ";", "{\\rm~\\ddot~A}" },
5889  { "&Aring", ";", "{\\rm~A\\limits^{-1$o}}" },
5890  { "&atilde", ";", "{\\rm~\\tilde~a}" },
5891  { "&yuml", ";", "{\\rm~\\ddot~y}" }, /* &yuml; is last, &#255; */
5892  { "&#", ";", "{[\\&\\#nnn?]}" }, /* all other explicit &#nnn's */
5893  /* --------------------------------------------
5894  html tag termchar LaTeX equivalent...
5895  -------------------------------------------- */
5896  { "< br >", "embed\\i", "\\\\" },
5897  { "< br / >", "embed\\i", "\\\\" },
5898  { "< dd >", "embed\\i", " \000" },
5899  { "< / dd >", "embed\\i", " \000" },
5900  { "< dl >", "embed\\i", " \000" },
5901  { "< / dl >", "embed\\i", " \000" },
5902  { "< p >", "embed\\i", " \000" },
5903  { "< / p >", "embed\\i", " \000" },
5904  /* --------------------------------------------
5905  garbage termchar LaTeX equivalent...
5906  -------------------------------------------- */
5907  { "< tex >", "embed\\i", " \000" },
5908  { "< / tex >", "embed\\i", " \000" },
5909  /* --------------------------------------------
5910  LaTeX termchar mimeTeX equivalent...
5911  -------------------------------------------- */
5912  { "\\AA", NULL, "{\\rm~A\\limits^{-1$o}}" },
5913  { "\\aa", NULL, "{\\rm~a\\limits^{-1$o}}" },
5914  { "\\bmod", NULL, "{\\hspace2{\\rm~mod}\\hspace2}" },
5915  { "\\vdots", NULL, "{\\raisebox3{\\rotatebox{90}{\\ldots}}}" },
5916  { "\\dots", NULL, "{\\cdots}" },
5917  { "\\cdots", NULL, "{\\raisebox3{\\ldots}}" },
5918  { "\\ldots", NULL, "{\\fs4.\\hspace1.\\hspace1.}" },
5919  { "\\ddots", NULL, "{\\fs4\\raisebox8.\\hspace1\\raisebox4."
5920  "\\hspace1\\raisebox0.}"},
5921  { "\\notin", NULL, "{\\not\\in}" },
5922  { "\\neq", NULL, "{\\not=}" },
5923  { "\\ne", NULL, "{\\not=}" },
5924  { "\\pm", NULL, "{\\math\\plusminus}" }, /* don't have \bf\pm */
5925  { "\\mapsto", NULL, "{\\rule[fs/2]{1}{5+fs}\\hspace{-99}\\to}" },
5926  { "\\hbar", NULL, "{\\compose~h{{\\fs{-1}-\\atop\\vspace3}}}" },
5927  { "\\angle", NULL, "{\\compose{\\hspace{3}\\lt}{\\circle(10,15;-80,80)}}"},
5928  { "\\textcelsius", NULL, "{\\textdegree C}"},
5929  { "\\textdegree", NULL, "{\\Large^{^{\\tiny\\mathbf o}}}"},
5930  { "\\cr", NULL, "\\\\" },
5931  /*{ "\\colon", NULL, "{:}" },*/
5932  { "\\iiint", NULL, "{\\int\\int\\int}\\limits" },
5933  { "\\iint", NULL, "{\\int\\int}\\limits" },
5934  { "\\Bigiint", NULL, "{\\Bigint\\Bigint}\\limits" },
5935  { "\\bigsqcap",NULL, "{\\fs{+4}\\sqcap}" },
5936  { "\\_", "embed","{\\underline{\\ }}" }, /* displayed underscore */
5937  { "!`", NULL, "{\\raisebox{-2}{\\rotatebox{180}{!}}}" },
5938  { "?`", NULL, "{\\raisebox{-2}{\\rotatebox{180}{?}}}" },
5939  { "^\'", "embed","\'" }, /* avoid ^^ when re-xlating \' below */
5940  { "\'\'\'\'","embed","^{\\fs{-1}\\prime\\prime\\prime\\prime}" },
5941  { "\'\'\'", "embed","^{\\fs{-1}\\prime\\prime\\prime}" },
5942  { "\'\'", "embed","^{\\fs{-1}\\prime\\prime}" },
5943  { "\'", "embed","^{\\fs{-1}\\prime}" },
5944  { "\\rightleftharpoons",NULL,"{\\rightharpoonup\\atop\\leftharpoondown}" },
5945  { "\\therefore",NULL,"{\\Huge\\raisebox{-4}{.\\atop.\\,.}}" },
5946  { "\\LaTeX", NULL, "{\\rm~L\\raisebox{3}{\\fs{-1}A}\\TeX}" },
5947  { "\\TeX", NULL, "{\\rm~T\\raisebox{-3}{E}X}" },
5948  { "\\cyan", NULL, "{\\reverse\\red\\reversebg}" },
5949  { "\\magenta",NULL, "{\\reverse\\green\\reversebg}" },
5950  { "\\yellow",NULL, "{\\reverse\\blue\\reversebg}" },
5951  { "\\cancel",NULL, "\\Not" },
5952  { "\\hhline",NULL, "\\Hline" },
5953  { "\\Hline", NULL, "\\hline\\,\\\\\\hline" },
5954  /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------
5955  As per emails with Zbigniew Fiedorowicz <fiedorow@math.ohio-state.edu>
5956  "Algebra Syntax" termchar mimeTeX/LaTeX equivalent...
5957  ----------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5958  { "sqrt", "1", "{\\sqrt{#1}}" },
5959  { "sin", "1", "{\\sin{#1}}" },
5960  { "cos", "1", "{\\cos{#1}}" },
5961  { "asin", "1", "{\\sin^{-1}{#1}}" },
5962  { "acos", "1", "{\\cos^{-1}{#1}}" },
5963  { "exp", "1", "{{\\rm~e}^{#1}}" },
5964  { "det", "1", "{\\left|{#1}\\right|}" },
5965  /* --------------------------------------------
5966  LaTeX Constant termchar value...
5967  -------------------------------------------- */
5968  { "\\thinspace", NULL, "\\," },
5969  { "\\thinmathspace", NULL, "\\," },
5970  { "\\textwidth", NULL, "400" },
5971  /* --- end-of-table indicator --- */
5972  { NULL, NULL, NULL }
5973  } ; /* --- end-of-symbols[] --- */
5974 /* ---
5975  * html &#nn chars converted to latex equivalents
5976  * ---------------------------------------------- */
5977 int htmlnum=0; /* numbers[inum].html */
5978 static struct { int html; char *latex; } numbers[] =
5979  { /* ---------------------------------------
5980  html num LaTeX equivalent...
5981  --------------------------------------- */
5982  { 9, " " }, /* horizontal tab */
5983  { 10, " " }, /* line feed */
5984  { 13, " " }, /* carriage return */
5985  { 32, " " }, /* space */
5986  { 33, "!" }, /* exclamation point */
5987  { 34, "\"" }, /* &quot; */
5988  { 35, "#" }, /* hash mark */
5989  { 36, "$" }, /* dollar */
5990  { 37, "%" }, /* percent */
5991  { 38, "&" }, /* &amp; */
5992  { 39, "\'" }, /* apostrophe (single quote) */
5993  { 40, ")" }, /* left parenthesis */
5994  { 41, ")" }, /* right parenthesis */
5995  { 42, "*" }, /* asterisk */
5996  { 43, "+" }, /* plus */
5997  { 44, "," }, /* comma */
5998  { 45, "-" }, /* hyphen (minus) */
5999  { 46, "." }, /* period */
6000  { 47, "/" }, /* slash */
6001  { 58, ":" }, /* colon */
6002  { 59, ";" }, /* semicolon */
6003  { 60, "<" }, /* &lt; */
6004  { 61, "=" }, /* = */
6005  { 62, ">" }, /* &gt; */
6006  { 63, "\?" }, /* question mark */
6007  { 64, "@" }, /* commercial at sign */
6008  { 91, "[" }, /* left square bracket */
6009  { 92, "\\" }, /* backslash */
6010  { 93, "]" }, /* right square bracket */
6011  { 94, "^" }, /* caret */
6012  { 95, "_" }, /* underscore */
6013  { 96, "`" }, /* grave accent */
6014  { 123, "{" }, /* left curly brace */
6015  { 124, "|" }, /* vertical bar */
6016  { 125, "}" }, /* right curly brace */
6017  { 126, "~" }, /* tilde */
6018  { 160, "~" }, /* &nbsp; (use tilde for latex) */
6019  { 166, "|" }, /* &brvbar; (broken vertical bar) */
6020  { 173, "-" }, /* &shy; (soft hyphen) */
6021  { 177, "{\\pm}" }, /* &plusmn; (plus or minus) */
6022  { 215, "{\\times}" }, /* &times; (plus or minus) */
6023  { -999, NULL }
6024  } ; /* --- end-of-numbers[] --- */
6025 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6026 first remove comments
6027 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6028 expptr = expression; /* start search at beginning */
6029 while ( (leftptr=strstr(expptr,leftcomment)) != NULL ) /*found leftcomment*/
6030  {
6031  char *rightsym=NULL; /* rightcomment[isymbol] */
6032  expptr = leftptr+strlen(leftcomment); /* start rightcomment search here */
6033  /* --- check for any closing rightcomment, in given precedent order --- */
6034  if ( *expptr != '\000' ) /*have chars after this leftcomment*/
6035  for(isymbol=0; (rightsym=rightcomment[isymbol]) != NULL; isymbol++)
6036  if ( (tokptr=strstr(expptr,rightsym)) != NULL ) /*found rightcomment*/
6037  { tokptr += strlen(rightsym); /* first char after rightcomment */
6038  if ( *tokptr == '\000' ) /*nothing after this rightcomment*/
6039  { *leftptr = '\000'; /*so terminate expr at leftcomment*/
6040  break; } /* and stop looking for comments */
6041  *leftptr = '~'; /* replace entire comment by ~ */
6042  strsqueezep(leftptr+1,tokptr); /* squeeze out comment */
6043  goto next_comment; } /* stop looking for rightcomment */
6044  /* --- no rightcomment after opening leftcomment --- */
6045  *leftptr = '\000'; /* so terminate expression */
6046  /* --- resume search past squeezed-out comment --- */
6047  next_comment:
6048  if ( *leftptr == '\000' ) break; /* reached end of expression */
6049  expptr = leftptr+1; /*resume search after this comment*/
6050  } /* --- end-of-while(leftptr!=NULL) --- */
6051 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6052 run thru table, converting all occurrences of each macro to its expansion
6053 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6054 for(isymbol=0; (htmlsym=symbols[isymbol].html) != NULL; isymbol++)
6055  {
6056  int htmllen = strlen(htmlsym); /* length of escape, _without_ ; */
6057  int isalgebra = isalpha((int)(*htmlsym)); /* leading char alphabetic */
6058  int isembedded = 0, /* true to xlate even if embedded */
6059  istag=0, isamp=0, /* true for <tag>, &char; symbols */
6060  isstrwstr = 0, /* true to use strwstr() */
6061  wstrlen = 0; /* length of strwstr() match */
6062  char *aleft="{([<|", *aright="})]>|"; /*left,right delims for alg syntax*/
6063  char embedkeywd[99] = "embed", /* keyword to signal embedded token*/
6064  embedterm = '\000'; /* char immediately after embed */
6065  int embedlen = strlen(embedkeywd); /* #chars in embedkeywd */
6066  char *args = symbols[isymbol].args, /* number {}-args, optional []-arg */
6067  *htmlterm = args, /*if *args nonumeric, then html term*/
6068  *latexsym = symbols[isymbol].latex, /*latex replacement for htmlsym*/
6069  errorsym[256]; /*or latexsym may point to error msg*/
6070  char abuff[8192]; int iarg,nargs=0; /* macro expansion params */
6071  char wstrwhite[99]; /* whitespace chars for strwstr() */
6072  skipwhite(htmlsym); /*skip any bogus leading whitespace*/
6073  htmllen = strlen(htmlsym); /* reset length of html token */
6074  istag = (isthischar(*htmlsym,"<")?1:0); /* html <tag> starts with < */
6075  isamp = (isthischar(*htmlsym,"&")?1:0); /* html &char; starts with & */
6076  if ( args != NULL ) /*we have args (or htmlterm) param*/
6077  if ( *args != '\000' ) { /* and it's not an empty string */
6078  if ( strchr("0123456789",*args) != NULL ) /* is 1st char #args=0-9 ? */
6079  { htmlterm = NULL; /* if so, then we have no htmlterm */
6080  *abuff = *args; abuff[1] = '\000'; /* #args char in ascii buffer */
6081  nargs = atoi(abuff); } /* interpret #args to numeric */
6082  else if ( strncmp(args,embedkeywd,embedlen) == 0 )/*xlate embedded token*/
6083  { int arglen = strlen(args); /* length of "embed..." string */
6084  htmlterm = NULL; /* if so, then we have no htmlterm */
6085  isembedded = 1 ; /* turn on embedded flag */
6086  if ( arglen > embedlen ) /* have embed "allow escape" flag */
6087  embedterm = args[embedlen]; /* char immediately after "embed" */
6088  if (arglen > embedlen+1) { /* have embed,flag,white for strwstr*/
6089  isstrwstr = 1; /* turn on strwtsr flag */
6090  strcpy(wstrwhite,args+embedlen+1); } } /*and set its whitespace arg*/
6091  } /* --- end-of-if(*args!='\000') --- */
6092  expptr = expression; /* re-start search at beginning */
6093  while ( ( tokptr=(!isstrwstr?strstr(expptr,htmlsym): /* just use strtsr */
6094  strwstr(expptr,htmlsym,wstrwhite,&wstrlen)) ) /* or use our strwstr */
6095  != NULL ) { /* found another sym */
6096  int toklen = (!isstrwstr?htmllen:wstrlen); /* length of matched sym */
6097  char termchar = *(tokptr+toklen), /* char terminating html sequence */
6098  prevchar = (tokptr==expptr?' ':*(tokptr-1));/*char preceding html*/
6099  int isescaped = (isthischar(prevchar,ESCAPE)?1:0); /* token escaped?*/
6100  int escapelen = toklen; /* total length of escape sequence */
6101  int isflush = 0; /* true to flush (don't xlate) */
6102  /* --- check odd/even backslashes preceding tokens --- */
6103  if ( isescaped ) { /* have one preceding backslash */
6104  char *p = tokptr-1; /* ptr to that preceding backslash */
6105  while ( p != expptr ) { /* and we may have more preceding */
6106  p--; if(!isthischar(*p,ESCAPE))break; /* but we don't, so quit */
6107  isescaped = 1-isescaped; } } /* or flip isescaped flag if we do */
6108  /* --- init with "trivial" abuff,escapelen from symbols[] table --- */
6109  *abuff = '\000'; /* default to empty string */
6110  if ( latexsym != NULL ) /* table has .latex xlation */
6111  if ( *latexsym != '\000' ) /* and it's not an empty string */
6112  strcpy(abuff,latexsym); /* so get local copy */
6113  if ( !isembedded ) /*embedded sequences not terminated*/
6114  if ( htmlterm != NULL ) /* sequence may have terminator */
6115  escapelen += (isthischar(termchar,htmlterm)?1:0); /*add terminator*/
6116  /* --- don't xlate if we just found prefix of longer symbol, etc --- */
6117  if ( !isembedded ) { /* not embedded */
6118  if ( isescaped ) /* escaped */
6119  isflush = 1; /* set flag to flush escaped token */
6120  if ( !istag && isalpha((int)termchar) ) /* followed by alpha */
6121  isflush = 1; /* so just a prefix of longer symbol*/
6122  if ( isalpha((int)(*htmlsym)) ) /* symbol starts with alpha */
6123  if ( (!isspace(prevchar)&&isalpha(prevchar)) ) /* just a suffix*/
6124  isflush = 1; } /* set flag to flush token */
6125  if ( isembedded ) /* for embedded token */
6126  if ( isescaped ) /* and embedded \token escaped */
6127  if ( !isthischar(embedterm,ESCAPE) ) /* don't xlate escaped \token */
6128  isflush = 1; /* set flag to flush token */
6129  if ( isflush ) /* don't xlate this token */
6130  { expptr = tokptr+1;/*toklen;*/ /* just resume search after token */
6131  continue; } /* but don't replace it */
6132  /* --- check for &# prefix signalling &#nnn; --- */
6133  if ( strcmp(htmlsym,"&#") == 0 ) { /* replacing special &#nnn; chars */
6134  /* --- accumulate chars comprising number following &# --- */
6135  char anum[32]; /* chars comprising number after &# */
6136  int inum = 0; /* no chars accumulated yet */
6137  while ( termchar != '\000' ) { /* don't go past end-of-string */
6138  if ( !isdigit((int)termchar) ) break; /* and don't go past digits */
6139  if ( inum > 10 ) break; /* some syntax error in expression */
6140  anum[inum] = termchar; /* accumulate this digit */
6141  inum++; toklen++; /* bump field length, token length */
6142  termchar = *(tokptr+toklen); } /* char terminating html sequence */
6143  anum[inum] = '\000'; /* null-terminate anum */
6144  escapelen = toklen; /* length of &#nnn; sequence */
6145  if ( htmlterm != NULL ) /* sequence may have terminator */
6146  escapelen += (isthischar(termchar,htmlterm)?1:0); /*add terminator*/
6147  /* --- look up &#nnn in number[] table --- */
6148  htmlnum = atoi(anum); /* convert anum[] to an integer */
6149  strninit(errorsym,latexsym,128); /* init error message */
6150  latexsym = errorsym; /* init latexsym as error message */
6151  strreplace(latexsym,"nnn",anum,1); /*place actual &#num in message*/
6152  for ( inum=0; numbers[inum].html>=0; inum++ ) /* run thru numbers[] */
6153  if ( htmlnum == numbers[inum].html ) { /* till we find a match */
6154  latexsym = numbers[inum].latex; /* latex replacement */
6155  break; } /* no need to look any further */
6156  if ( latexsym != NULL ) /* table has .latex xlation */
6157  if ( *latexsym != '\000' ) /* and it's not an empty string */
6158  strcpy(abuff,latexsym); /* so get local copy */
6159  } /* --- end-of-if(strcmp(htmlsym,"&#")==0) --- */
6160  /* --- substitute macro arguments --- */
6161  if ( nargs > 0 ) /*substitute #1,#2,... in latexsym*/
6162  {
6163  char *arg1ptr = tokptr+escapelen;/* nargs begin after macro literal */
6164  char *optarg = args+1; /* ptr 1 char past #args digit 0-9 */
6165  expptr = arg1ptr; /* ptr to beginning of next arg */
6166  for ( iarg=1; iarg<=nargs; iarg++ ) /* one #`iarg` arg at a time */
6167  {
6168  char argsignal[32] = "#1", /* #1...#9 signals arg replacement */
6169  *argsigptr = NULL; /* ptr to argsignal in abuff[] */
6170  /* --- get argument value --- */
6171  *argval = '\000'; /* init arg as empty string */
6172  skipwhite(expptr); /* and skip leading white space */
6173  if ( iarg==1 && *optarg!='\000' /* check for optional [arg] */
6174  && !isalgebra ) /* but not in "algebra syntax" */
6175  { strcpy(argval,optarg); /* init with default value */
6176  if ( *expptr == '[' ) /* but user gave us [argval] */
6177  expptr = texsubexpr(expptr,argval,0,"[","]",0,0); } /*so get it*/
6178  else /* not optional, so get {argval} */
6179  if ( *expptr != '\000' ) { /* check that some argval provided */
6180  if ( !isalgebra ) /* only { } delims for latex macro */
6181  expptr = texsubexpr(expptr,argval,0,"{","}",0,0);/*get {argval}*/
6182  else { /*any delim for algebra syntax macro*/
6183  expptr = texsubexpr(expptr,argval,0,aleft,aright,0,1);
6184  if ( isthischar(*argval,aleft) ) /* have delim-enclosed arg */
6185  if ( *argval != '{' ) { /* and it's not { }-enclosed */
6186  strchange(0,argval,"\\left"); /* insert opening \left, */
6187  strchange(0,argval+strlen(argval)-1,"\\right"); } }/*\right*/
6188  } /* --- end-of-if(*expptr!='\000') --- */
6189  /* --- (recursively) call mimeprep() to prep the argument --- */
6190  if ( !isempty(argval) ) /* have an argument */
6191  mimeprep(argval); /* so (recursively) prep it */
6192  /* --- replace #`iarg` in macro with argval --- */
6193  sprintf(argsignal,"#%d",iarg); /* #1...#9 signals argument */
6194  while ( (argsigptr=strstr(argval,argsignal)) != NULL ) /* #1...#9 */
6195  {strsqueeze(argsigptr,strlen(argsignal));} /* can't be in argval */
6196  while ( (argsigptr=strstr(abuff,argsignal)) != NULL ) /* #1...#9 */
6197  strchange(strlen(argsignal),argsigptr,argval); /*replaced by argval*/
6198  } /* --- end-of-for(iarg) --- */
6199  escapelen += ((int)(expptr-arg1ptr)); /* add in length of all args */
6200  } /* --- end-of-if(nargs>0) --- */
6201  strchange(escapelen,tokptr,abuff); /*replace macro or html symbol*/
6202  expptr = tokptr + strlen(abuff); /*resume search after macro / html*/
6203  } /* --- end-of-while(tokptr!=NULL) --- */
6204  } /* --- end-of-for(isymbol) --- */
6205 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6206 convert \left( to \( and \right) to \), etc.
6207 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6208 if ( xlateleft ) /* \left...\right xlation wanted */
6209  for ( idelim=0; idelim<2; idelim++ ) /* 0 for \left and 1 for \right */
6210  {
6211  char *lrstr = (idelim==0?"\\left":"\\right"); /* \left on 1st pass */
6212  int lrlen = (idelim==0?5:6); /* strlen() of \left or \right */
6213  char *braces = (idelim==0?LEFTBRACES ".":RIGHTBRACES "."), /*([{<or)]}>*/
6214  **lrfrom= (idelim==0?leftfrom:rightfrom), /* long braces like \| */
6215  **lrto = (idelim==0?leftto:rightto), /* xlated to 1-char like = */
6216  *lrsym = NULL; /* lrfrom[isymbol] */
6217  expptr = expression; /* start search at beginning */
6218  while ( (tokptr=strstr(expptr,lrstr)) != NULL ) /* found \left or \right */
6219  {
6220  if ( isthischar(*(tokptr+lrlen),braces) ) /* followed by a 1-char brace*/
6221  { strsqueeze((tokptr+1),(lrlen-1));/*so squeeze out "left" or "right"*/
6222  expptr = tokptr+2; } /* and resume search past brace */
6223  else /* may be a "long" brace like \| */
6224  {
6225  expptr = tokptr+lrlen; /*init to resume search past\left\rt*/
6226  for(isymbol=0; (lrsym=lrfrom[isymbol]) != NULL; isymbol++)
6227  { int symlen = strlen(lrsym); /* #chars in delim, e.g., 2 for \| */
6228  if ( memcmp(tokptr+lrlen,lrsym,symlen) == 0 ) /* found long delim*/
6229  { strsqueeze((tokptr+1),(lrlen+symlen-2)); /*squeeze out delim*/
6230  *(tokptr+1) = *(lrto[isymbol]); /* last char now 1-char delim*/
6231  expptr = tokptr+2 - lrlen; /* resume search past 1-char delim*/
6232  break; } /* no need to check more lrsym's */
6233  } /* --- end-of-for(isymbol) --- */
6234  } /* --- end-of-if/else(isthischar()) --- */
6235  } /* --- end-of-while(tokptr!=NULL) --- */
6236  } /* --- end-of-for(idelim) --- */
6237 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6238 run thru table, converting all {a+b\atop c+d} to \atop{a+b}{c+d}
6239 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6240 for(isymbol=0; (atopsym=atopcommands[isymbol]) != NULL; isymbol++)
6241  {
6242  int atoplen = strlen(atopsym); /* #chars in \atop */
6243  expptr = expression; /* re-start search at beginning */
6244  while ( (tokptr=strstr(expptr,atopsym)) != NULL ) /* found another atop */
6245  { char *leftbrace=NULL, *rightbrace=NULL; /*ptr to opening {, closing }*/
6246  char termchar = *(tokptr+atoplen); /* \atop followed by terminator */
6247  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 )
6248  { fprintf(msgfp,"mimeprep> offset=%d rhs=\"%s\"\n",
6249  (int)(tokptr-expression),tokptr);
6250  fflush(msgfp); }
6251  if ( isalpha((int)termchar) ) /*we just have prefix of longer sym*/
6252  { expptr = tokptr+atoplen; /* just resume search after prefix */
6253  continue; } /* but don't process it */
6254  leftbrace = findbraces(expression,tokptr); /* find left { */
6255  rightbrace = findbraces(NULL,tokptr+atoplen-1); /* find right } */
6256  if ( leftbrace==NULL || rightbrace==NULL )
6257  { expptr += atoplen; continue; } /* skip command if didn't find */
6258  else /* we have bracketed { \atop } */
6259  {
6260  int leftlen = (int)(tokptr-leftbrace) - 1, /* #chars in left arg */
6261  rightlen = (int)(rightbrace-tokptr) - atoplen, /* and in right*/
6262  totlen = (int)(rightbrace-leftbrace) + 1; /*tot in { \atop }*/
6263  char *open=atopdelims[2*isymbol], *close=atopdelims[2*isymbol+1];
6264  char arg[8192], command[8192]; /* left/right args, new \atop{}{} */
6265  *command = '\000'; /* start with null string */
6266  if (open!=NULL) strcat(command,open); /* add open delim if needed */
6267  strcat(command,atopsym); /* add command with \atop */
6268  arg[0] = '{'; /* arg starts with { */
6269  memcpy(arg+1,leftbrace+1,leftlen); /* extract left-hand arg */
6270  arg[leftlen+1] = '\000'; /* and null terminate it */
6271  strcat(command,arg); /* concatanate {left-arg to \atop */
6272  strcat(command,"}{"); /* close left-arg, open right-arg */
6273  memcpy(arg,tokptr+atoplen,rightlen); /* right-hand arg */
6274  arg[rightlen] = '}'; /* add closing } */
6275  arg[rightlen+1] = '\000'; /* and null terminate it */
6276  if ( isthischar(*arg,WHITEMATH) ) /* 1st char was mandatory space */
6277  {strsqueeze(arg,1);} /* so squeeze it out */
6278  strcat(command,arg); /* concatanate right-arg} */
6279  if (close!=NULL) strcat(command,close); /* add close delim if needed*/
6280  strchange(totlen-2,leftbrace+1,command); /* {\atop} --> {\atop{}{}} */
6281  expptr = leftbrace+strlen(command); /*resume search past \atop{}{}*/
6282  }
6283  } /* --- end-of-while(tokptr!=NULL) --- */
6284  } /* --- end-of-for(isymbol) --- */
6285 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6286 back to caller with preprocessed expression
6287 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6288 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 ) /* display preprocessed expression */
6289  { fprintf(msgfp,"mimeprep> expression=\"\"%s\"\"\n",expression);
6290  fflush(msgfp); }
6291 return ( expression );
6292 } /* --- end-of-function mimeprep() --- */
6293 
6294 
6295 /* ==========================================================================
6296  * Function: strchange ( int nfirst, char *from, char *to )
6297  * Purpose: Changes the nfirst leading chars of `from` to `to`.
6298  * For example, to change char x[99]="12345678" to "123ABC5678"
6299  * call strchange(1,x+3,"ABC")
6300  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6301  * Arguments: nfirst (I) int containing #leading chars of `from`
6302  * that will be replace by `to`
6303  * from (I/O) char * to null-terminated string whose nfirst
6304  * leading chars will be replaced by `to`
6305  * to (I) char * to null-terminated string that will
6306  * replace the nfirst leading chars of `from`
6307  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6308  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to first char of input `from`
6309  * or NULL for any error.
6310  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6311  * Notes: o If strlen(to)>nfirst, from must have memory past its null
6312  * (i.e., we don't do a realloc)
6313  * ======================================================================= */
6314 /* --- entry point --- */
6315 char *strchange ( int nfirst, char *from, char *to )
6316 {
6317 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6318 Allocations and Declarations
6319 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6320 int tolen = (to==NULL?0:strlen(to)), /* #chars in replacement string */
6321  nshift = abs(tolen-nfirst); /*need to shift from left or right*/
6322 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6323 shift from left or right to accommodate replacement of its nfirst chars by to
6324 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6325 if ( tolen < nfirst ) /* shift left is easy */
6326  {strsqueeze(from,nshift);} /* memmove avoids overlap memory */
6327 if ( tolen > nfirst ) /* need more room at start of from */
6328  { char *pfrom = from+strlen(from); /* ptr to null terminating from */
6329  for ( ; pfrom>=from; pfrom-- ) /* shift all chars including null */
6330  *(pfrom+nshift) = *pfrom; } /* shift chars nshift places right */
6331 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6332 from has exactly the right number of free leading chars, so just put to there
6333 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6334 if ( tolen != 0 ) /* make sure to not empty or null */
6335  memcpy(from,to,tolen); /* chars moved into place */
6336 return ( from ); /* changed string back to caller */
6337 } /* --- end-of-function strchange() --- */
6338 
6339 
6340 /* ==========================================================================
6341  * Function: strreplace (char *string, char *from, char *to, int nreplace)
6342  * Purpose: Changes the first nreplace occurrences of 'from' to 'to'
6343  * in string, or all occurrences if nreplace=0.
6344  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6345  * Arguments: string (I/0) char * to null-terminated string in which
6346  * occurrence of 'from' will be replaced by 'to'
6347  * from (I) char * to null-terminated string
6348  * to be replaced by 'to'
6349  * to (I) char * to null-terminated string that will
6350  * replace 'from'
6351  * nreplace (I) int containing (maximum) number of
6352  * replacements, or 0 to replace all.
6353  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6354  * Returns: ( int ) number of replacements performed,
6355  * or 0 for no replacements or -1 for any error.
6356  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6357  * Notes: o
6358  * ======================================================================= */
6359 /* --- entry point --- */
6360 int strreplace ( char *string, char *from, char *to, int nreplace )
6361 {
6362 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6363 Allocations and Declarations
6364 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6365 int fromlen = (from==NULL?0:strlen(from)), /* #chars to be replaced */
6366  tolen = (to==NULL?0:strlen(to)); /* #chars in replacement string */
6367 char *pfrom = (char *)NULL, /*ptr to 1st char of from in string*/
6368  *pstring = string, /*ptr past previously replaced from*/
6369  *strchange(); /* change 'from' to 'to' */
6370 int nreps = 0; /* #replacements returned to caller*/
6371 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6372 repace occurrences of 'from' in string to 'to'
6373 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6374 if ( string == (char *)NULL /* no input string */
6375 || (fromlen<1 && nreplace<=0) ) /* replacing empty string forever */
6376  nreps = (-1); /* so signal error */
6377 else /* args okay */
6378  while (nreplace<1 || nreps<nreplace) /* up to #replacements requested */
6379  {
6380  if ( fromlen > 0 ) /* have 'from' string */
6381  pfrom = strstr(pstring,from); /*ptr to 1st char of from in string*/
6382  else pfrom = pstring; /*or empty from at start of string*/
6383  if ( pfrom == (char *)NULL ) break; /*no more from's, so back to caller*/
6384  if ( strchange(fromlen,pfrom,to) /* leading 'from' changed to 'to' */
6385  == (char *)NULL ) { nreps=(-1); break; } /* signal error to caller */
6386  nreps++; /* count another replacement */
6387  pstring = pfrom+tolen; /* pick up search after 'to' */
6388  if ( *pstring == '\000' ) break; /* but quit at end of string */
6389  } /* --- end-of-while() --- */
6390 return ( nreps ); /* #replacements back to caller */
6391 } /* --- end-of-function strreplace() --- */
6392 
6393 
6394 /* ==========================================================================
6395  * Function: strwstr (char *string, char *substr, char *white, int *sublen)
6396  * Purpose: Find first substr in string, but wherever substr contains
6397  * a whitespace char (in white), string may contain any number
6398  * (including 0) of whitespace chars. If white contains I or i,
6399  * then match is case-insensitive (and I,i _not_ whitespace).
6400  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6401  * Arguments: string (I) char * to null-terminated string in which
6402  * first occurrence of substr will be found
6403  * substr (I) char * to null-terminated string containing
6404  * "template" that will be searched for
6405  * white (I) char * to null-terminated string containing
6406  * whitespace chars. If NULL or empty, then
6407  * "~ \t\n\r\f\v" (WHITEMATH in mimetex.h) used.
6408  * If white contains I or i, then match is
6409  * case-insensitive (and I,i _not_ considered
6410  * whitespace).
6411  * sublen (O) address of int returning "length" of substr
6412  * found in string (which may be longer or
6413  * shorter than substr itself).
6414  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6415  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to first char of substr in string
6416  * or NULL if not found or for any error.
6417  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6418  * Notes: o Wherever a single whitespace char appears in substr,
6419  * the corresponding position in string may contain any
6420  * number (including 0) of whitespace chars, e.g.,
6421  * string="abc def" and string="abcdef" both match
6422  * substr="c d" at offset 2 of string.
6423  * o If substr="c d" (two spaces between c and d),
6424  * then string must have at least one space, so now "abcdef"
6425  * doesn't match. In general, the minimum number of spaces
6426  * in string is the number of spaces in substr minus 1
6427  * (so 1 space in substr permits 0 spaces in string).
6428  * o Embedded spaces are counted in sublen, e.g.,
6429  * string="c d" (three spaces) matches substr="c d"
6430  * with sublen=5 returned. But string="ab c d" will
6431  * also match substr=" c d" returning sublen=5 and
6432  * a ptr to the "c". That is, the mandatory preceding
6433  * space is _not_ counted as part of the match.
6434  * But all the embedded space is counted.
6435  * (An inconsistent bug/feature is that mandatory
6436  * terminating space is counted.)
6437  * o Moreover, string="c d" matches substr=" c d", i.e.,
6438  * the very beginning of a string is assumed to be preceded
6439  * by "virtual blanks".
6440  * ======================================================================= */
6441 /* --- entry point --- */
6442 char *strwstr ( char *string, char *substr, char *white, int *sublen )
6443 {
6444 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6445 Allocations and Declarations
6446 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6447 char *psubstr=substr, *pstring=string,/*ptr to current char in substr,str*/
6448  *pfound = (char *)NULL; /*ptr to found substr back to caller*/
6449 char *pwhite=NULL, whitespace[256]; /* callers white whithout i,I */
6450 int iscase = (white==NULL?1: /* case-sensitive if i,I in white */
6451  strchr(white,'i')==NULL && strchr(white,'I')==NULL);
6452 int foundlen = 0; /* length of substr found in string*/
6453 int nstrwhite=0, nsubwhite=0, /* #leading white chars in str,sub */
6454  nminwhite=0; /* #mandatory leading white in str */
6455 int nstrchars=0, nsubchars=0, /* #non-white chars to be matched */
6456  isncmp=0; /*strncmp() or strncasecmp() result*/
6457 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6458 Initialization
6459 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6460 /* --- set up whitespace --- */
6461 strcpy(whitespace,WHITEMATH); /*default if no user input for white*/
6462 if ( white != NULL ) /*user provided ptr to white string*/
6463  if ( *white != '\000' ) { /*and it's not just an empty string*/
6464  strcpy(whitespace,white); /* so use caller's white spaces */
6465  while ( (pwhite=strchr(whitespace,'i')) != NULL ) /* have an embedded i */
6466  {strsqueeze(pwhite,1);} /* so squeeze it out */
6467  while ( (pwhite=strchr(whitespace,'I')) != NULL ) /* have an embedded I */
6468  {strsqueeze(pwhite,1);} /* so squeeze it out */
6469  if ( *whitespace == '\000' ) /* caller's white just had i,I */
6470  strcpy(whitespace,WHITEMATH); } /* so revert back to default */
6471 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6472 Find first occurrence of substr in string
6473 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6474 if ( string != NULL ) /* caller passed us a string ptr */
6475  while ( *pstring != '\000' ) { /* break when string exhausted */
6476  char *pstrptr = pstring; /* (re)start at next char in string*/
6477  int leadingwhite = 0; /* leading whitespace */
6478  psubstr = substr; /* start at beginning of substr */
6479  foundlen = 0; /* reset length of found substr */
6480  if ( substr != NULL ) /* caller passed us a substr ptr */
6481  while ( *psubstr != '\000' ) { /*see if pstring begins with substr*/
6482  /* --- check for end-of-string before finding match --- */
6483  if ( *pstrptr == '\000' ) /* end-of-string without a match */
6484  goto nextstrchar; /* keep trying with next char */
6485  /* --- actual amount of whitespace in string and substr --- */
6486  nsubwhite = strspn(psubstr,whitespace); /* #leading white chars in sub */
6487  nstrwhite = strspn(pstrptr,whitespace); /* #leading white chars in str */
6488  nminwhite = max2(0,nsubwhite-1); /* #mandatory leading white in str */
6489  /* --- check for mandatory leading whitespace in string --- */
6490  if ( pstrptr != string ) /*not mandatory at start of string*/
6491  if ( nstrwhite < nminwhite ) /* too little leading white space */
6492  goto nextstrchar; /* keep trying with next char */
6493  /* ---hold on to #whitespace chars in string preceding substr match--- */
6494  if ( pstrptr == pstring ) /* whitespace at start of substr */
6495  leadingwhite = nstrwhite; /* save it as leadingwhite */
6496  /* --- check for optional whitespace --- */
6497  if ( psubstr != substr ) /* always okay at start of substr */
6498  if ( nstrwhite>0 && nsubwhite<1 ) /* too much leading white space */
6499  goto nextstrchar; /* keep trying with next char */
6500  /* --- skip any leading whitespace in substr and string --- */
6501  psubstr += nsubwhite; /* push past leading sub whitespace*/
6502  pstrptr += nstrwhite; /* push past leading str whitespace*/
6503  /* --- now get non-whitespace chars that we have to match --- */
6504  nsubchars = strcspn(psubstr,whitespace); /* #non-white chars in sub */
6505  nstrchars = strcspn(pstrptr,whitespace); /* #non-white chars in str */
6506  if ( nstrchars < nsubchars ) /* too few chars for match */
6507  goto nextstrchar; /* keep trying with next char */
6508  /* --- see if next nsubchars are a match --- */
6509  isncmp = (iscase? strncmp(pstrptr,psubstr,nsubchars): /*case sensitive*/
6510  strncasecmp(pstrptr,psubstr,nsubchars)); /*case insensitive*/
6511  if ( isncmp != 0 ) /* no match */
6512  goto nextstrchar; /* keep trying with next char */
6513  /* --- push past matched chars --- */
6514  psubstr += nsubchars; pstrptr += nsubchars; /*nsubchars were matched*/
6515  } /* --- end-of-while(*psubstr!='\000') --- */
6516  pfound = pstring + leadingwhite; /* found match starting at pstring */
6517  foundlen = (int)(pstrptr-pfound); /* consisting of this many chars */
6518  goto end_of_job; /* back to caller */
6519  /* ---failed to find substr, continue trying with next char in string--- */
6520  nextstrchar: /* continue outer loop */
6521  pstring++; /* bump to next char in string */
6522  } /* --- end-of-while(*pstring!='\000') --- */
6523 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6524 Back to caller with ptr to first occurrence of substr in string
6525 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6526 end_of_job:
6527  if ( msglevel>=999 && msgfp!=NULL) { /* debugging/diagnostic output */
6528  fprintf(msgfp,"strwstr> str=\"%.72s\" sub=\"%s\" found at offset %d\n",
6529  string,substr,(pfound==NULL?(-1):(int)(pfound-string))); fflush(msgfp); }
6530  if ( sublen != NULL ) /*caller wants length of found substr*/
6531  *sublen = foundlen; /* give it to him along with ptr */
6532  return ( pfound ); /*ptr to first found substr, or NULL*/
6533 } /* --- end-of-function strwstr() --- */
6534 
6535 
6536 /* ==========================================================================
6537  * Function: strdetex ( s, mode )
6538  * Purpose: Removes/replaces any LaTeX math chars in s
6539  * so that s can be displayed "verbatim",
6540  * e.g., for error messages.
6541  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6542  * Arguments: s (I) char * to null-terminated string
6543  * whose math chars are to be removed/replaced
6544  * mode (I) int containing 0 to _not_ use macros (i.e.,
6545  * mimeprep won't be called afterwards),
6546  * or containing 1 to use macros that will
6547  * be expanded by a subsequent call to mimeprep.
6548  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6549  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to "cleaned" copy of s
6550  * or "" (empty string) for any error.
6551  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6552  * Notes: o The returned pointer addresses a static buffer,
6553  * so don't call strdetex() again until you're finished
6554  * with output from the preceding call.
6555  * ======================================================================= */
6556 /* --- entry point --- */
6557 char *strdetex ( char *s, int mode )
6558 {
6559 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6560 Allocations and Declarations
6561 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6562 static char sbuff[4096]; /* copy of s with no math chars */
6563 int strreplace(); /* replace _ with -, etc */
6564 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6565 Make a clean copy of s
6566 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6567 /* --- check input --- */
6568 *sbuff = '\000'; /* initialize in case of error */
6569 if ( isempty(s) ) goto end_of_job; /* no input */
6570 /* --- start with copy of s --- */
6571 strninit(sbuff,s,2048); /* leave room for replacements */
6572 /* --- make some replacements -- we *must* replace \ { } first --- */
6573 strreplace(sbuff,"\\","\\backslash~\\!\\!",0); /*change all \'s to text*/
6574 strreplace(sbuff,"{", "\\lbrace~\\!\\!",0); /*change all {'s to \lbrace*/
6575 strreplace(sbuff,"}", "\\rbrace~\\!\\!",0); /*change all }'s to \rbrace*/
6576 /* --- now our further replacements may contain \directives{args} --- */
6577 if( mode >= 1 ) strreplace(sbuff,"_","\\_",0); /* change all _'s to \_ */
6578 else strreplace(sbuff,"_","\\underline{\\qquad}",0); /*change them to text*/
6579 if(0)strreplace(sbuff,"<","\\textlangle ",0); /* change all <'s to text */
6580 if(0)strreplace(sbuff,">","\\textrangle ",0); /* change all >'s to text */
6581 if(0)strreplace(sbuff,"$","\\textdollar ",0); /* change all $'s to text */
6582 strreplace(sbuff,"$","\\$",0); /* change all $'s to \$ */
6583 strreplace(sbuff,"&","\\&",0); /* change all &'s to \& */
6584 strreplace(sbuff,"%","\\%",0); /* change all %'s to \% */
6585 strreplace(sbuff,"#","\\#",0); /* change all #'s to \# */
6586 /*strreplace(sbuff,"~","\\~",0);*/ /* change all ~'s to \~ */
6587 strreplace(sbuff,"^","{\\fs{+2}\\^}",0); /* change all ^'s to \^ */
6588 end_of_job:
6589  return ( sbuff ); /* back with clean copy of s */
6590 } /* --- end-of-function strdetex() --- */
6591 
6592 
6593 /* ==========================================================================
6594  * Function: strtexchr ( char *string, char *texchr )
6595  * Purpose: Find first texchr in string, but texchr must be followed
6596  * by non-alpha
6597  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6598  * Arguments: string (I) char * to null-terminated string in which
6599  * first occurrence of delim will be found
6600  * texchr (I) char * to null-terminated string that
6601  * will be searched for
6602  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6603  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to first char of texchr in string
6604  * or NULL if not found or for any error.
6605  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6606  * Notes: o texchr should contain its leading \, e.g., "\\left"
6607  * ======================================================================= */
6608 /* --- entry point --- */
6609 char *strtexchr ( char *string, char *texchr )
6610 {
6611 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6612 Allocations and Declarations
6613 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6614 char delim, *ptexchr=(char *)NULL; /* ptr returned to caller*/
6615 char *pstring = string; /* start or continue up search here*/
6616 int texchrlen = (texchr==NULL?0:strlen(texchr)); /* #chars in texchr */
6617 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6618 locate texchr in string
6619 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6620 if ( string != (char *)NULL /* check that we got input string */
6621 && texchrlen > 0 ) { /* and a texchr to search for */
6622  while ( (ptexchr=strstr(pstring,texchr)) /* look for texchr in string */
6623  != (char *)NULL ) /* found it */
6624  if ( (delim = ptexchr[texchrlen]) /* char immediately after texchr */
6625  == '\000' ) break; /* texchr at very end of string */
6626  else /* if there are chars after texchr */
6627  if ( isalpha(delim) /*texchr is prefix of longer symbol*/
6628  || 0 ) /* other tests to be determined */
6629  pstring = ptexchr + texchrlen; /* continue search after texchr */
6630  else /* passed all tests */
6631  break; } /*so return ptr to texchr to caller*/
6632 return ( ptexchr ); /* ptr to texchar back to caller */
6633 } /* --- end-of-function strtexchr() --- */
6634 
6635 
6636 /* ==========================================================================
6637  * Function: findbraces ( char *expression, char *command )
6638  * Purpose: If expression!=NULL, finds opening left { preceding command;
6639  * if expression==NULL, finds closing right } after command.
6640  * For example, to parse out {a+b\over c+d} call findbraces()
6641  * twice.
6642  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6643  * Arguments: expression (I) NULL to find closing right } after command,
6644  * or char * to null-terminated string to find
6645  * left opening { preceding command.
6646  * command (I) char * to null-terminated string whose
6647  * first character is usually the \ of \command
6648  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6649  * Returns: ( char * ) ptr to either opening { or closing },
6650  * or NULL for any error.
6651  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6652  * Notes: o
6653  * ======================================================================= */
6654 /* --- entry point --- */
6655 char *findbraces ( char *expression, char *command )
6656 {
6657 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6658 Allocations and Declarations
6659 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6660 int isopen = (expression==NULL?0:1); /* true to find left opening { */
6661 char *left="{", *right="}", /* delims bracketing {x\command y} */
6662  *delim = (isopen?left:right), /* delim we want, { if isopen */
6663  *match = (isopen?right:left), /* matching delim, } if isopen */
6664  *brace = NULL; /* ptr to delim returned to caller */
6665 int inc = (isopen?-1:+1); /* pointer increment */
6666 int level = 1; /* nesting level, for {{}\command} */
6667 char *ptr = command; /* start search here */
6668 int setbrace = 1; /* true to set {}'s if none found */
6669 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6670 search for left opening { before command, or right closing } after command
6671 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6672 while ( 1 ) /* search for brace, or until end */
6673  {
6674  /* --- next char to check for delim --- */
6675  ptr += inc; /* bump ptr left or right */
6676  /* --- check for beginning or end of expression --- */
6677  if ( isopen ) /* going left, check for beginning */
6678  { if ( ptr < expression ) break; } /* went before start of string */
6679  else { if ( *ptr == '\000' ) break; } /* went past end of string */
6680  /* --- don't check this char if it's escaped --- */
6681  if ( !isopen || ptr>expression ) /* very first char can't be escaped*/
6682  if ( isthischar(*(ptr-1),ESCAPE) ) /* escape char precedes current */
6683  continue; /* so don't check this char */
6684  /* --- check for delim --- */
6685  if ( isthischar(*ptr,delim) ) /* found delim */
6686  if ( --level == 0 ) /* and it's not "internally" nested*/
6687  { brace = ptr; /* set ptr to brace */
6688  goto end_of_job; } /* and return it to caller */
6689  /* --- check for matching delim --- */
6690  if ( isthischar(*ptr,match) ) /* found matching delim */
6691  level++; /* so bump nesting level */
6692  } /* --- end-of-while(1) --- */
6693 end_of_job:
6694  if ( brace == (char *)NULL ) /* open{ or close} not found */
6695  if ( setbrace ) /* want to force one at start/end? */
6696  brace = ptr; /* { before expressn, } after cmmnd*/
6697  return ( brace ); /*back to caller with delim or NULL*/
6698 } /* --- end-of-function findbraces() --- */
6699 
6700 
6701 /* ==========================================================================
6702  * Function: strpspn ( char *s, char *reject, char *segment )
6703  * Purpose: finds the initial segment of s containing no chars
6704  * in reject that are outside (), [] and {} parens, e.g.,
6705  * strpspn("abc(---)def+++","+-",segment) returns
6706  * segment="abc(---)def" and a pointer to the first '+' in s
6707  * because the -'s are enclosed in () parens.
6708  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6709  * Arguments: s (I) (char *)pointer to null-terminated string
6710  * whose initial segment is desired
6711  * reject (I) (char *)pointer to null-terminated string
6712  * containing the "reject chars"
6713  * segment (O) (char *)pointer returning null-terminated
6714  * string comprising the initial segment of s
6715  * that contains non-rejected chars outside
6716  * (),[],{} parens, i.e., all the chars up to
6717  * but not including the returned pointer.
6718  * (That's the entire string if no non-rejected
6719  * chars are found.)
6720  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6721  * Returns: ( char * ) pointer to first reject-char found in s
6722  * outside parens, or a pointer to the
6723  * terminating '\000' of s if there are
6724  * no reject chars in s outside all () parens.
6725  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6726  * Notes: o the return value is _not_ like strcspn()'s
6727  * o improperly nested (...[...)...] are not detected,
6728  * but are considered "balanced" after the ]
6729  * o if reject not found, segment returns the entire string s
6730  * o leading/trailing whitespace is trimmed from returned segment
6731  * ======================================================================= */
6732 /* --- entry point --- */
6733 char *strpspn ( char *s, char *reject, char *segment )
6734 {
6735 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6736 Allocations and Declarations
6737 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6738 char *ps = s; /* current pointer into s */
6739 int depth = 0; /* () paren nesting level */
6740 int seglen=0, maxseg=2047; /* segment length, max allowed */
6741 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6742 initialization
6743 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6744 /* --- check arguments --- */
6745 if ( isempty(s) ) /* no input string supplied */
6746  goto end_of_job; /* no reject chars supplied */
6747 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6748 find first char from s outside () parens (and outside ""'s) and in reject
6749 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6750 while ( *ps != '\000' ) { /* search till end of input string */
6751  if ( isthischar(*ps,"([{") ) depth++; /* push another paren */
6752  if ( isthischar(*ps,")]}") ) depth--; /* or pop another paren */
6753  if ( depth < 1 ) { /* we're outside all parens */
6754  if ( isempty(reject) ) break; /* no reject so break immediately */
6755  if ( isthischar(*ps,reject) ) break; } /* only break on a reject char */
6756  if ( segment != NULL ) /* caller gave us segment */
6757  if ( seglen < maxseg ) /* don't overflow segment buffer */
6758  memcpy(segment+seglen,ps,1); /* so copy non-reject char */
6759  seglen += 1; ps += 1; /* bump to next char */
6760  } /* --- end-of-while(*ps!=0) --- */
6761 end_of_job:
6762  if ( segment != NULL ) { /* caller gave us segment */
6763  if ( isempty(reject) ) { /* no reject char */
6764  segment[min2(seglen,maxseg)] = *ps; seglen++; } /*closing )]} to seg*/
6765  segment[min2(seglen,maxseg)] = '\000'; /* null-terminate the segment */
6766  trimwhite(segment); } /* trim leading/trailing whitespace*/
6767  return ( ps ); /* back to caller */
6768 } /* --- end-of-function strpspn() --- */
6769 
6770 
6771 /* ==========================================================================
6772  * Function: isstrstr ( char *string, char *snippets, int iscase )
6773  * Purpose: determine whether any substring of 'string'
6774  * matches any of the comma-separated list of 'snippets',
6775  * ignoring case if iscase=0.
6776  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6777  * Arguments: string (I) char * containing null-terminated
6778  * string that will be searched for
6779  * any one of the specified snippets
6780  * snippets (I) char * containing null-terminated,
6781  * comma-separated list of snippets
6782  * to be searched for in string
6783  * iscase (I) int containing 0 for case-insensitive
6784  * comparisons, or 1 for case-sensitive
6785  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6786  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if any snippet is a substring of
6787  * string, 0 if not
6788  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6789  * Notes: o
6790  * ======================================================================= */
6791 /* --- entry point --- */
6792 int isstrstr ( char *string, char *snippets, int iscase )
6793 {
6794 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6795 Allocations and Declarations
6796 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6797 int status = 0; /*1 if any snippet found in string*/
6798 char snip[256], *snipptr = snippets, /* munge through each snippet */
6799  delim = ',', *delimptr = NULL; /* separated by delim's */
6800 char stringcp[4096], *cp = stringcp; /*maybe lowercased copy of string*/
6801 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6802 initialization
6803 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6804 /* --- arg check --- */
6805 if ( string==NULL || snippets==NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* missing arg */
6806 if ( *string=='\000' || *snippets=='\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* empty arg */
6807 /* --- copy string and lowercase it if case-insensitive --- */
6808 strninit(stringcp,string,4064); /* local copy of string */
6809 if ( !iscase ) /* want case-insensitive compares */
6810  for ( cp=stringcp; *cp != '\000'; cp++ ) /* so for each string char */
6811  if ( isupper(*cp) ) *cp = tolower(*cp); /*lowercase any uppercase chars*/
6812 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6813 extract each snippet and see if it's a substring of string
6814 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6815 while ( snipptr != NULL ) /* while we still have snippets */
6816  {
6817  /* --- extract next snippet --- */
6818  if ( (delimptr = strchr(snipptr,delim)) /* locate next comma delim */
6819  == NULL ) /*not found following last snippet*/
6820  { strninit(snip,snipptr,255); /* local copy of last snippet */
6821  snipptr = NULL; } /* signal end-of-string */
6822  else /* snippet ends just before delim */
6823  { int sniplen = (int)(delimptr-snipptr) - 1; /* #chars in snippet */
6824  memcpy(snip,snipptr,sniplen); /* local copy of snippet chars */
6825  snip[sniplen] = '\000'; /* null-terminated snippet */
6826  snipptr = delimptr + 1; } /* next snippet starts after delim */
6827  /* --- lowercase snippet if case-insensitive --- */
6828  if ( !iscase ) /* want case-insensitive compares */
6829  for ( cp=snip; *cp != '\000'; cp++ ) /* so for each snippet char */
6830  if ( isupper(*cp) ) *cp=tolower(*cp); /*lowercase any uppercase chars*/
6831  /* --- check if snippet in string --- */
6832  if ( strstr(stringcp,snip) != NULL ) /* found snippet in string */
6833  { status = 1; /* so reset return status */
6834  break; } /* no need to check any further */
6835  } /* --- end-of-while(*snipptr!=0) --- */
6836 end_of_job: return ( status ); /*1 if snippet found in list, else 0*/
6837 } /* --- end-of-function isstrstr() --- */
6838 
6839 
6840 /* ==========================================================================
6841  * Function: isnumeric ( s )
6842  * Purpose: determine if s is an integer
6843  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6844  * Arguments: s (I) (char *)pointer to null-terminated string
6845  * that's checked for a leading + or -
6846  * followed by digits
6847  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6848  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if s is numeric, 0 if it is not
6849  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6850  * Notes: o
6851  * ======================================================================= */
6852 /* --- entry point --- */
6853 int isnumeric ( char *s )
6854 {
6855 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6856 determine whether s is an integer
6857 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6858 int status = 0; /* return 0 if not numeric, 1 if is*/
6859 char *p = s; /* pointer into s */
6860 if ( isempty(s) ) goto end_of_job; /* missing arg or empty string */
6861 skipwhite(p); /*check for leading +or- after space*/
6862 if ( *p=='+' || *p=='-' ) p++; /* skip leading + or - */
6863 for ( ; *p != '\000'; p++ ) { /* check rest of s for digits */
6864  if ( isdigit(*p) ) continue; /* still got uninterrupted digits */
6865  if ( !isthischar(*p,WHITESPACE) ) goto end_of_job; /* non-numeric char */
6866  skipwhite(p); /* skip all subsequent whitespace */
6867  if ( *p == '\000' ) break; /* trailing whitespace okay */
6868  goto end_of_job; /* embedded whitespace non-numeric */
6869  } /* --- end-of-for(*p) --- */
6870 status = 1; /* numeric after checks succeeded */
6871 end_of_job:
6872  return ( status ); /*back to caller with 1=string, 0=no*/
6873 } /* --- end-of-function isnumeric() --- */
6874 
6875 
6876 /* ==========================================================================
6877  * Function: evalterm ( STORE *store, char *term )
6878  * Purpose: evaluates a term
6879  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6880  * Arguments: store (I/O) STORE * containing environment
6881  * in which term is to be evaluated
6882  * term (I) char * containing null-terminated string
6883  * with a term like "3" or "a" or "a+3"
6884  * whose value is to be determined
6885  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6886  * Returns: ( int ) value of term,
6887  * or NOVALUE for any error
6888  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
6889  * Notes: o Also evaluates index?a:b:c:etc, returning a if index<=0,
6890  * b if index=1, etc, and the last value if index is too large.
6891  * Each a:b:c:etc can be another expression, including another
6892  * (index?a:b:c:etc) which must be enclosed in parentheses.
6893  * ======================================================================= */
6894 /* --- entry point --- */
6895 int evalterm ( STORE *store, char *term )
6896 {
6897 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6898 Allocations and Declarations
6899 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6900 int termval = 0; /* term value returned to caller */
6901 char token[2048] = "\000", /* copy term */
6902  *delim = NULL; /* delim '(' or '?' in token */
6903 /*int evalwff(),*/ /* recurse to evaluate terms */
6904 /* evalfunc();*/ /* evaluate function(arg1,arg2,...)*/
6905 char *strpspn(); /* span delims */
6906 int getstore(); /* lookup variables */
6907 int isnumeric(); /* numeric=constant, else variable */
6908 static int evaltermdepth = 0; /* recursion depth */
6909 int novalue = (-89123456); /* dummy (for now) error signal */
6910 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6911 Initialization
6912 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6913 if ( ++evaltermdepth > 99 ) goto end_of_job; /*probably recursing forever*/
6914 if ( store==NULL || isempty(term) ) goto end_of_job; /*check for missing arg*/
6915 skipwhite(term); /* skip any leading whitespace */
6916 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6917 First look for conditional of the form term?term:term:...
6918 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6919 /* ---left-hand part of conditional is chars preceding "?" outside ()'s--- */
6920 delim = strpspn(term,"?",token); /* chars preceding ? outside () */
6921 if ( *delim != '\000' ) { /* found conditional expression */
6922  int ncolons = 0; /* #colons we've found so far */
6923  if ( *token != '\000' ) /* evaluate "index" value on left */
6924  if ( (termval=evalterm(store,token)) /* evaluate left-hand term */
6925  == novalue ) goto end_of_job; /* return error if failed */
6926  while ( *delim != '\000' ) { /* still have chars in term */
6927  delim++; *token='\000'; /* initialize for next "value:" */
6928  if ( *delim == '\000' ) break; /* no more values */
6929  delim = strpspn(delim,":",token); /* chars preceding : outside () */
6930  if ( ncolons++ >= termval ) break; /* have corresponding term */
6931  } /* --- end-of-while(*delim!='\000')) --- */
6932  if ( *token != '\000' ) /* have x:x:value:x:x on right */
6933  termval=evalterm(store,token); /* so evaluate it */
6934  goto end_of_job; /* return result to caller */
6935  } /* --- end-of-if(*delim!='\000')) --- */
6936 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6937 evaluate a+b recursively
6938 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6939 /* --- left-hand part of term is chars preceding "/+-*%" outside ()'s --- */
6940 term = strpspn(term,"/+-*%",token); /* chars preceding /+-*% outside ()*/
6941 /* --- evaluate a+b, a-b, etc --- */
6942 if ( *term != '\000' ) { /* found arithmetic operation */
6943  int leftval=0, rightval=0; /* init leftval for unary +a or -a */
6944  if ( *token != '\000' ) /* or eval for binary a+b or a-b */
6945  if ( (leftval=evalterm(store,token)) /* evaluate left-hand term */
6946  == novalue ) goto end_of_job; /* return error if failed */
6947  if ( (rightval=evalterm(store,term+1)) /* evaluate right-hand term */
6948  == novalue ) goto end_of_job; /* return error if failed */
6949  switch ( *term ) { /* perform requested arithmetic */
6950  default: break; /* internal error */
6951  case '+': termval = leftval+rightval; break; /* addition */
6952  case '-': termval = leftval-rightval; break; /* subtraction */
6953  case '*': termval = leftval*rightval; break; /* multiplication */
6954  case '/': if ( rightval != 0 ) /* guard against divide by zero */
6955  termval = leftval/rightval; break; /* integer division */
6956  case '%': if ( rightval != 0 ) /* guard against divide by zero */
6957  termval = leftval%rightval; break; /*left modulo right */
6958  } /* --- end-of-switch(*relation) --- */
6959  goto end_of_job; /* return result to caller */
6960  } /* --- end-of-if(*term!='\000')) --- */
6961 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6962 check for parenthesized expression or term of the form function(arg1,arg2,...)
6963 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6964 if ( (delim = strchr(token,'(')) != NULL ) { /* token contains a ( */
6965  /* --- strip trailing paren (if there hopefully is one) --- */
6966  int toklen = strlen(token); /* total #chars in token */
6967  if ( token[toklen-1] == ')' ) /* found matching ) at end of token*/
6968  token[--toklen] = '\000'; /* remove trailing ) */
6969  /* --- handle parenthesized subexpression --- */
6970  if ( *token == '(' ) { /* have parenthesized expression */
6971  strsqueeze(token,1); /* so squeeze out leading ( */
6972  /* --- evaluate edited term --- */
6973  trimwhite(token); /* trim leading/trailing whitespace*/
6974  termval = evalterm(store,token); } /* evaluate token recursively */
6975  /* --- handle function(arg1,arg2,...) --- */
6976  else { /* have function(arg1,arg2,...) */
6977  *delim = '\000'; /* separate function name and args */
6978  /*termval = evalfunc(store,token,delim+1);*/ } /* evaluate function */
6979  goto end_of_job; } /* return result to caller */
6980 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6981 evaluate constants directly, or recursively evaluate variables, etc
6982 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6983 if ( *token != '\000' ) { /* empty string */
6984  if ( isnumeric(token) ) /* have a constant */
6985  termval = atoi(token); /* convert ascii-to-int */
6986  else { /* variable or "stored proposition"*/
6987  termval = getstore(store,token); } /* look up token */
6988  } /* --- end-of-if(*token!=0) --- */
6989 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
6990 back to caller with truth value of proposition
6991 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6992 end_of_job:
6993  /* --- back to caller --- */
6994  if ( evaltermdepth > 0 ) evaltermdepth--; /* pop recursion depth */
6995  return ( termval ); /* back to caller with value */
6996 } /* --- end-of-function evalterm() --- */
6997 
6998 
6999 /* ==========================================================================
7000  * Function: getstore ( store, identifier )
7001  * Purpose: finds identifier in store and returns corresponding value
7002  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
7003  * Arguments: store (I) (STORE *)pointer to store containing
7004  * the desired identifier
7005  * identifier (I) (char *)pointer to null-terminated string
7006  * containing the identifier whose value
7007  * is to be returned
7008  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
7009  * Returns: ( int ) identifier's corresponding value,
7010  * or 0 if identifier not found (or any error)
7011  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
7012  * Notes: o
7013  * ======================================================================= */
7014 /* --- entry point --- */
7015 int getstore ( STORE *store, char *identifier )
7016 {
7017 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
7018 Allocations and Declarations
7019 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
7020 int value = 0; /* store[istore].value for identifier */
7021 int istore=0; /* store[] index containing identifier */
7022 char seek[512], hide[512]; /* identifier arg, identifier in store */
7023 /* --- first check args --- */
7024 if ( store==NULL || isempty(identifier)) goto end_of_job; /* missing arg */
7025 strninit(seek,identifier,500); /* local copy of caller's identifier */
7026 trimwhite(seek); /* remove leading/trailing whitespace */
7027 /* --- loop over store --- */
7028 for ( istore=0; istore<MAXSTORE; istore++ ) { /* until end-of-table */
7029  char *idstore = store[istore].identifier; /* ptr to identifier in store */
7030  if ( isempty(idstore) ) /* empty id signals eot */
7031  break; /* de-reference any default/error value */
7032  strninit(hide,idstore,500); /* local copy of store[] identifier */
7033  trimwhite(hide); /* remove leading/trailing whitespace */
7034  if ( !strcmp(hide,seek) ) /* found match */
7035  break; /* de-reference corresponding value */
7036  } /* --- end-of-for(istore) --- */
7037 if ( store[istore].value != NULL ) /* address of int supplied */
7038  value = *(store[istore].value); /* return de-referenced int */
7039 end_of_job:
7040  return ( value ); /* store->values[istore] or NULL */
7041 } /* --- end-of-function getstore() --- */
7042 
7043 
7044 /* ==========================================================================
7045  * Functions: int unescape_url ( char *url, int isescape )
7046  * char x2c ( char *what )
7047  * Purpose: unescape_url replaces 3-character sequences %xx in url
7048  * with the single character represented by hex xx.
7049  * x2c returns the single character represented by hex xx
7050  * passed as a 2-character sequence in what.
7051  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
7052  * Arguments: url (I) char * containing null-terminated
7053  * string with embedded %xx sequences
7054  * to be converted.
7055  * isescape (I) int containing 1 to _not_ unescape
7056  * \% sequences (0 would be NCSA default)
7057  * what (I) char * whose first 2 characters are
7058  * interpreted as ascii representations
7059  * of hex digits.
7060  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
7061  * Returns: ( int ) unescape_url always returns 0.
7062  * ( char ) x2c returns the single char
7063  * corresponding to hex xx passed in what.
7064  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
7065  * Notes: o These two functions were taken verbatim from util.c in
7066  * ftp://ftp.ncsa.uiuc.edu/Web/httpd/Unix/ncsa_httpd/cgi/ncsa-default.tar.Z
7067  * o Not quite "verbatim" -- I added the "isescape logic" 4-Dec-03
7068  * so unescape_url() can be safely applied to input which may or
7069  * may not have been url-encoded. (Note: currently, all calls
7070  * to unescape_url() pass iescape=0, so it's not used.)
7071  * o Added +++'s to blank xlation on 24-Sep-06
7072  * o Added ^M,^F,etc to blank xlation 0n 01-Oct-06
7073  * ======================================================================= */
7074 /* --- entry point --- */
7075 int unescape_url(char *url, int isescape) {
7076  int x=0,y=0,prevescape=0,gotescape=0;
7077  int xlateplus = (isplusblank==1?1:0); /* true to xlate plus to blank */
