8453  case ISDISPLAYSIZE: /* set displaysize */
8454  if ( argvalue != NOVALUE ) /* got a value */
8455  displaysize = (isdelta? displaysize+argvalue : argvalue);
8456  break;
8457  case ISCONTENTTYPE: /*enable/disable content-type lines*/
8458  if ( argvalue != NOVALUE ) /* got a value */
8459  isemitcontenttype = (argvalue>0?1:0);
8460  break;
8461  case ISCONTENTCACHED: /* write content-type to cache file*/
8462  if ( argvalue != NOVALUE ) /* got a value */
8463  iscachecontenttype = (argvalue>0?1:0);
8464  break;
8465  case ISPBMPGM: /* output pbm/pgm rather than gif */
8466  ispbmpgm = 1; /* always set pbm/pgm flag */
8467  pbmpgmtype = 1; /* and init type (1 for pbm) */
8468  if ( argvalue != NOVALUE ) /* got a value */
8469  pbmpgmtype = (argvalue<1?1:argvalue);
8470  break;
8471  case ISSMASH: /* set (minimum) "smash" margin */
8472  if ( argvalue != NOVALUE ) /* got a value */
8473  { smashmargin = argvalue; /* set value */
8474  if ( arg3 != NOVALUE ) isdelta=arg3; /* hard-coded isdelta */
8475  issmashdelta = (isdelta?1:0); } /* and set delta flag */
8476  smashmargin = max2((isdelta?-5:0),min2(smashmargin,32)); /*sanity*/
8477  isexplicitsmash = 1; /* signal explicit \smash directive*/
8478  break;
8479  case ISSHRINK: /* set shrinkfactor */
8480  if ( argvalue != NOVALUE ) /* got a value */
8481  shrinkfactor = (isdelta? shrinkfactor+argvalue : argvalue);
8482  shrinkfactor = max2(1,min2(shrinkfactor,27)); /* sanity check */
8483  break;
8484  case ISAAALGORITHM: /* set anti-aliasing algorithm */
8485  if ( argvalue != NOVALUE ) { /* got a value */
8486  if ( argvalue >= 0 ) { /* non-negative to set algorithm */
8487  aaalgorithm = argvalue; /* set algorithm number */
8488  aaalgorithm = max2(0,min2(aaalgorithm,4)); } /* bounds check */
8489  else maxfollow = abs(argvalue); } /* or maxfollow=abs(negative#) */
8490  break;
8491  case ISWEIGHT: /* set font weight number */
8492  value = (argvalue==NOVALUE? NOVALUE : /* don't have a value */
8493  (isdelta? weightnum+argvalue : argvalue));
8494  if ( value>=0 && value<maxaaparams ) /* in range */
8495  { weightnum = value; /* reset weightnum index */
8496  minadjacent = aaparams[weightnum].minadjacent;
8497  maxadjacent = aaparams[weightnum].maxadjacent;
8498  cornerwt = aaparams[weightnum].cornerwt;
8499  adjacentwt = aaparams[weightnum].adjacentwt;
8500  centerwt = aaparams[weightnum].centerwt;
8501  fgalias = aaparams[weightnum].fgalias;
8502  fgonly = aaparams[weightnum].fgonly;
8503  bgalias = aaparams[weightnum].bgalias;
8504  bgonly = aaparams[weightnum].bgonly; }
8505  break;
8506  case ISCENTERWT: /* set lowpass center pixel weight */
8507  if ( argvalue != NOVALUE ) /* got a value */
8508  centerwt = argvalue; /* set lowpass center weight */
8509  break;
8510  case ISADJACENTWT: /* set lowpass adjacent weight */
8511  if ( argvalue != NOVALUE ) /* got a value */
8512  adjacentwt = argvalue; /* set lowpass adjacent weight */
8513  break;
8514  case ISCORNERWT: /* set lowpass corner weight */
8515  if ( argvalue != NOVALUE ) /* got a value */
8516  cornerwt = argvalue; /* set lowpass corner weight */
8517  break;
8518  case ISGAMMA: /* set gamma correction */
8519  if ( dblvalue >= 0.0 ) /* got a value */
8520  gammacorrection = dblvalue; /* set gamma correction */
8521  break;
8522  } /* --- end-of-switch() --- */
8523  break;
8524  case PNMPARAMS: /*set fgalias,fgonly,bgalias,bgonly*/
8525  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,valuearg,1023,"{","}",0,0);
8526  valuelen = strlen(valuearg); /* ought to be 1-4 */
8527  if ( valuelen>0 && isthischar(toupper(valuearg[0]),"TY1") ) fgalias=1;
8528  if ( valuelen>0 && isthischar(toupper(valuearg[0]),"FN0") ) fgalias=0;
8529  if ( valuelen>1 && isthischar(toupper(valuearg[1]),"TY1") ) fgonly =1;
8530  if ( valuelen>1 && isthischar(toupper(valuearg[1]),"FN0") ) fgonly =0;
8531  if ( valuelen>2 && isthischar(toupper(valuearg[2]),"TY1") ) bgalias=1;
8532  if ( valuelen>2 && isthischar(toupper(valuearg[2]),"FN0") ) bgalias=0;
8533  if ( valuelen>3 && isthischar(toupper(valuearg[3]),"TY1") ) bgonly =1;
8534  if ( valuelen>3 && isthischar(toupper(valuearg[3]),"FN0") ) bgonly =0;
8535  break;
8536  case UNITLENGTH:
8537  if ( value != NOVALUE ) /* passed a fixed value to be set */
8538  unitlength = (double)(value); /* set given fixed value */
8539  else /* get value from expression */
8540  { *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,valuearg,1023,"{","}",0,0);
8541  if ( *valuearg != '\000' ) /* guard against empty string */
8542  unitlength = strtod(valuearg,NULL); } /* convert to double */
8543  iunitlength = (int)(unitlength+0.5); /* iunitlength reset */
8544  break;
8545  } /* --- end-of-switch(flag) --- */
8546 return ( NULL ); /*just set value, nothing to display*/
8547 } /* --- end-of-function rastflags() --- */
8548 
8549 
8550 /* ==========================================================================
8551  * Function: rastspace(expression, size, basesp, width, isfill, isheight)
8552  * Purpose: returns a blank/space subraster width wide,
8553  * with baseline and height corresponding to basep
8554  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8555  * Arguments: expression (I) char ** to first char of null-terminated
8556  * LaTeX expression (unused/unchanged)
8557  * size (I) int containing base font size (not used,
8558  * just stored in subraster)
8559  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
8560  * immediately preceding space, whose baseline
8561  * and height params are transferred to space
8562  * width (I) int containing #bits/pixels for space width
8563  * isfill (I) int containing true to \hfill complete
8564  * expression out to width
8565  * (Kludge: isfill=99 signals \hspace*
8566  * for negative space)
8567  * isheight (I) int containing true (but not NOVALUE)
8568  * to treat width arg as height
8569  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8570  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to empty/blank subraster
8571  * or NULL for any error
8572  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8573  * Notes: o
8574  * ======================================================================= */
8575 /* --- entry point --- */
8576 subraster *rastspace ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
8577  int width, int isfill, int isheight )
8578 {
8579 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8580 Allocations and Declarations
8581 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8582 subraster *new_subraster(), *spacesp=NULL; /* subraster for space */
8583 raster *bp=NULL, *backspace_raster(); /* for negative space */
8584 int delete_subraster(); /* if fail, free unneeded subraster*/
8585 int baseht=1, baseln=0; /* height,baseline of base symbol */
8586 int pixsz = 1; /*default #bits per pixel, 1=bitmap*/
8587 int isstar=0, minspace=0; /* defaults for negative hspace */
8588 int maxwidth = 2047; /* max width of expression in pixels*/
8589 char *texsubexpr(), widtharg[256]; /* parse for optional {width} */
8590 int evalterm(), evalue=0; /* evaluate [args], {args} */
8591 subraster *rasterize(), *rightsp=NULL; /*rasterize right half of expression*/
8592 subraster *rastcat(); /* cat rightsp after \hfill */
8593 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8594 initialization
8595 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8596 if ( isfill > 1 ) { isstar=1; isfill=0; } /* large fill signals \hspace* */
8597 if ( isfill == NOVALUE ) isfill=0; /* novalue means false */
8598 if ( isheight == NOVALUE ) isheight=0; /* novalue means false */
8599 minspace = (isstar?(-1):0); /* reset default minspace */
8600 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8601 determine width if not given (e.g., \hspace{width}, \hfill{width})
8602 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8603 if ( width == 0 ) { /* width specified in expression */
8604  double dwidth; int widthval; /* test {width} before using it */
8605  int minwidth = (isfill||isheight?1:-maxwidth); /* \hspace allows negative */
8606  /* --- check if optional [minspace] given for negative \hspace --- */
8607  if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) { /* [minspace] if leading char is [ */
8608  /* ---parse [minspace], bump expression past it, evaluate expression--- */
8609  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,widtharg,127,"[","]",0,0);
8610  if ( !isempty(widtharg) ) { /* got [minspace] */
8611  evalue = evalterm(mimestore,widtharg); /* evaluate widtharg expr */
8612  minspace = iround(unitlength*((double)evalue)); } /* in pixels */
8613  } /* --- end-of-if(*(*expression)=='[') --- */
8614  width = 1; /* set default width */
8615  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,widtharg,255,"{","}",0,0);
8616  dwidth = unitlength*((double)evalterm(mimestore,widtharg)); /* scaled */
8617  widthval = /* convert {width} to integer */
8618  (int)( dwidth + (dwidth>=0.0?0.5:(-0.5)) );
8619  if ( widthval>=minwidth && widthval<=maxwidth ) /* sanity check */
8620  width = widthval; /* replace deafault width */
8621  } /* --- end-of-if(width==0) --- */
8622 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8623 first check for negative space
8624 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8625 if ( width < 0 ) { /* have negative hspace */
8626  if ( leftexpression != (subraster *)NULL ) /* can't backspace */
8627  if ( (spacesp=new_subraster(0,0,0)) /* get new subraster for backspace */
8628  != NULL ) { /* and if we succeed... */
8629  int nback=(-width), pback; /*#pixels wanted,actually backspaced*/
8630  if ( (bp=backspace_raster(leftexpression->image,nback,&pback,minspace,0))
8631  != NULL ) { /* and if backspace succeeds... */
8632  spacesp->image = bp; /* save backspaced image */
8633  /*spacesp->type = leftexpression->type;*/ /* copy original type */
8634  spacesp->type = blanksignal; /* need to propagate blanks */
8635  spacesp->size = leftexpression->size; /* copy original font size */
8636  spacesp->baseline = leftexpression->baseline; /* and baseline */
8637  blanksymspace += -(nback-pback); /* wanted more than we got */
8638  isreplaceleft = 1; } /*signal to replace entire expressn*/
8639  else { /* backspace failed */
8640  delete_subraster(spacesp); /* free unneeded envelope */
8641  spacesp = (subraster *)NULL; } } /* and signal failure */
8642  goto end_of_job;
8643  } /* --- end-of-if(width<0) --- */
8644 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8645 see if width is "absolute" or fill width
8646 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8647 if ( isfill /* called as \hfill{} */
8648 && !isheight ) /* parameter conflict */
8649  { if ( leftexpression != NULL ) /* if we have left half */
8650  width -= (leftexpression->image)->width; /*reduce left width from total*/
8651  if ( (rightsp=rasterize(*expression,size)) /* rasterize right half */
8652  != NULL ) /* succeeded */
8653  width -= (rightsp->image)->width; } /* reduce right width from total */
8654 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8655 construct blank subraster, and return it to caller
8656 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8657 /* --- get parameters from base symbol --- */
8658 if ( basesp != (subraster *)NULL ) /* we have base symbol for space */
8659  { baseht = (basesp->image)->height; /* height of base symbol */
8660  baseln = basesp->baseline; } /* and its baseline */
8661 /* --- flip params for height --- */
8662 if ( isheight ) /* width is actually height */
8663  { baseht = width; /* use given width as height */
8664  width = 1; } /* and set default width */
8665 /* --- generate and init space subraster --- */
8666 if ( width > 0 ) /*make sure we have positive width*/
8667  if ( (spacesp=new_subraster(width,baseht,pixsz)) /*generate space subraster*/
8668  != NULL ) /* and if we succeed... */
8669  { /* --- ...re-init subraster parameters --- */
8670  spacesp->size = size; /*propagate base font size forward*/
8671  if(1)spacesp->type = blanksignal; /* need to propagate blanks (???) */
8672  spacesp->baseline = baseln; } /* ditto baseline */
8673 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8674 concat right half if \hfill-ing
8675 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8676 if ( rightsp != NULL ) /* we have a right half after fill */
8677  { spacesp = (spacesp==NULL? rightsp: /* no space, so just use right half*/
8678  rastcat(spacesp,rightsp,3)); /* or cat right half after space */
8679  spacesp->type = blanksignal; /* need to propagate blanks */
8680  *expression += strlen((*expression)); } /* push expression to its null */
8681 end_of_job:
8682  return ( spacesp );
8683 } /* --- end-of-function rastspace() --- */
8684 
8685 
8686 /* ==========================================================================
8687  * Function: rastnewline ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
8688  * Purpose: \\ handler, returns subraster corresponding to
8689  * left-hand expression preceding \\ above right-hand expression
8690  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8691  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
8692  * string immediately following \\ to be
8693  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
8694  * to terminating null.
8695  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
8696  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
8697  * immediately preceding \\
8698  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
8699  * arg1 (I) int unused
8700  * arg2 (I) int unused
8701  * arg3 (I) int unused
8702  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8703  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to expression,
8704  * or NULL for any parsing error
8705  * (expression ptr unchanged if error occurs)
8706  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8707  * Notes: o
8708  * ======================================================================= */
8709 /* --- entry point --- */
8710 subraster *rastnewline ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
8711  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
8712 {
8713 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8714 Allocations and Declarations
8715 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8716 subraster *rastack(), *newlsp=NULL; /* subraster for both lines */
8717 subraster *rasterize(), *rightsp=NULL; /*rasterize right half of expression*/
8718 char *texsubexpr(), spacexpr[129]/*, *xptr=spacexpr*/; /*for \\[vspace]*/
8719 int evalterm(), evalue=0; /* evaluate [arg], {arg} */
8720 int vspace = size+2; /* #pixels between lines */
8721 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8722 obtain optional [vspace] argument immediately following \\ command
8723 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8724 /* --- check if [vspace] given --- */
8725 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /*have [vspace] if leading char is [*/
8726  {
8727  /* ---parse [vspace] and bump expression past it, interpret as double--- */
8728  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,spacexpr,127,"[","]",0,0);
8729  if ( *spacexpr == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* couldn't get [vspace] */
8730  evalue = evalterm(mimestore,spacexpr); /* evaluate [space] arg */
8731  vspace = iround(unitlength*((double)evalue)); /* vspace in pixels */
8732  } /* --- end-of-if(*(*expression)=='[') --- */
8733 if ( leftexpression == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* nothing preceding \\ */
8734 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8735 rasterize right half of expression and stack left half above it
8736 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8737 /* --- rasterize right half --- */
8738 if ( (rightsp=rasterize(*expression,size)) /* rasterize right half */
8739 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
8740 /* --- stack left half above it --- */
8741 /*newlsp = rastack(rightsp,leftexpression,1,vspace,0,3);*//*right under left*/
8742 newlsp = rastack(rightsp,leftexpression,1,vspace,0,1); /*right under left*/
8743 /* --- back to caller --- */
8744 end_of_job:
8745  if ( newlsp != NULL ) /* returning entire expression */
8746  { int newht = (newlsp->image)->height; /* height of returned subraster */
8747  newlsp->baseline = min2(newht-1,newht/2+5); /* guess new baseline */
8748  isreplaceleft = 1; /* so set flag to replace left half*/
8749  *expression += strlen(*expression); } /* and push to terminating null*/
8750  return ( newlsp ); /* 1st line over 2nd, or null=error*/
8751 } /* --- end-of-function rastnewline() --- */
8752 
8753 
8754 /* ==========================================================================
8755  * Function: rastarrow ( expression, size, basesp, drctn, isBig, arg3 )
8756  * Purpose: returns left/right arrow subraster (e.g., for \longrightarrow)
8757  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8758  * Arguments: expression (I) char ** to first char of null-terminated
8759  * LaTeX expression (unused/unchanged)
8760  * size (I) int containing base font size (not used,
8761  * just stored in subraster)
8762  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
8763  * immediately preceding space, whose baseline
8764  * and height params are transferred to space
8765  * drctn (I) int containing +1 for right, -1 for left,
8766  * or 0 for leftright
8767  * isBig (I) int containing 0 for ---> or 1 for ===>
8768  * arg3 (I) int unused
8769  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8770  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to left/right arrow subraster
8771  * or NULL for any error
8772  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8773  * Notes: o An optional argument [width] may *immediately* follow
8774  * the \longxxx to explicitly set the arrow's width in pixels.
8775  * For example, \longrightarrow calculates a default width
8776  * (as usual in LaTeX), whereas \longrightarrow[50] explicitly
8777  * draws a 50-pixel long arrow. This can be used, e.g.,
8778  * to draw commutative diagrams in conjunction with
8779  * \array (and maybe with \stackrel and/or \relstack, too).
8780  * o In case you really want to render, say, [f]---->[g], just
8781  * use an intervening space, i.e., [f]\longrightarrow~[g].
8782  * In text mode use two spaces {\rm~[f]\longrightarrow~~[g]}.
8783  * ======================================================================= */
8784 /* --- entry point --- */
8785 subraster *rastarrow ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
8786  int drctn, int isBig, int arg3 )
8787 {
8788 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8789 Allocations and Declarations
8790 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8791 subraster *arrow_subraster(), *arrowsp=NULL; /* subraster for arrow */
8792 char *texsubexpr(), widtharg[256]; /* parse for optional [width] */
8793 char *texscripts(), sub[1024],super[1024]; /* and _^limits after [width]*/
8794 subraster *rasterize(), *subsp=NULL,*supsp=NULL; /*rasterize limits*/
8795 subraster *new_subraster(), *rastack(), *spacesp=NULL; /*space below arrow*/
8796 int delete_subraster(); /*free work areas in case of error*/
8797 int evalterm(); /* evaluate [arg], {arg} */
8798 int width = 10 + 8*size, height; /* width, height for \longxxxarrow */
8799 int maxwidth = 1024; /* max arrow width in pixels */
8800 int islimits = 1; /*true to handle limits internally*/
8801 int limsize = size-1; /* font size for limits */
8802 int vspace = 1; /* #empty rows below arrow */
8803 int pixsz = 1; /*default #bits per pixel, 1=bitmap*/
8804 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8805 construct longleft/rightarrow subraster, with limits, and return it to caller
8806 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8807 /* --- check for optional width arg and replace default width --- */
8808 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /*check for []-enclosed optional arg*/
8809  { int widthval; /* test [width] before using it */
8810  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,widtharg,255,"[","]",0,0);
8811  widthval = /* convert [width] to integer */
8812  (int)((unitlength*((double)evalterm(mimestore,widtharg)))+0.5);
8813  if ( widthval>=2 && widthval<=maxwidth ) /* sanity check */
8814  width = widthval; } /* replace deafault width */
8815 /* --- now parse for limits, and bump expression past it(them) --- */
8816 if ( islimits ) /* handling limits internally */
8817  { *expression = texscripts(*expression,sub,super,3); /* parse for limits */
8818  if ( *sub != '\000' ) /*have a subscript following arrow*/
8819  subsp = rasterize(sub,limsize); /* so try to rasterize subscript */
8820  if ( *super != '\000' ) /*have superscript following arrow*/
8821  supsp = rasterize(super,limsize); } /*so try to rasterize superscript*/
8822 /* --- set height based on width --- */
8823 height = min2(17,max2(9,(width+2)/6)); /* height based on width */
8824 height = 1 + (height/2)*2; /* always force odd height */
8825 /* --- generate arrow subraster --- */
8826 if ( (arrowsp=arrow_subraster(width,height,pixsz,drctn,isBig)) /*build arrow*/
8827 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if we failed */
8828 /* --- add space below arrow --- */
8829 if ( vspace > 0 ) /* if we have space below arrow */
8830  if ( (spacesp=new_subraster(width,vspace,pixsz)) /*allocate required space*/
8831  != NULL ) /* and if we succeeded */
8832  if ( (arrowsp = rastack(spacesp,arrowsp,2,0,1,3)) /* space below arrow */
8833  == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if we failed */
8834 /* --- init arrow subraster parameters --- */
8835 arrowsp->size = size; /*propagate base font size forward*/
8836 arrowsp->baseline = height+vspace-1; /* set baseline at bottom of arrow */
8837 /* --- add limits above/below arrow, as necessary --- */
8838 if ( subsp != NULL ) /* stack subscript below arrow */
8839  if ( (arrowsp = rastack(subsp,arrowsp,2,0,1,3)) /* subscript below arrow */
8840  == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
8841 if ( supsp != NULL ) /* stack superscript above arrow */
8842  if ( (arrowsp = rastack(arrowsp,supsp,1,vspace,1,3)) /*supsc above arrow*/
8843  == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
8844 /* --- return arrow (or NULL) to caller --- */
8845 end_of_job:
8846  return ( arrowsp );
8847 } /* --- end-of-function rastarrow() --- */
8848 
8849 
8850 /* ==========================================================================
8851  * Function: rastuparrow ( expression, size, basesp, drctn, isBig, arg3 )
8852  * Purpose: returns an up/down arrow subraster (e.g., for \longuparrow)
8853  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8854  * Arguments: expression (I) char ** to first char of null-terminated
8855  * LaTeX expression (unused/unchanged)
8856  * size (I) int containing base font size (not used,
8857  * just stored in subraster)
8858  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
8859  * immediately preceding space, whose baseline
8860  * and height params are transferred to space
8861  * drctn (I) int containing +1 for up, -1 for down,
8862  * or 0 for updown
8863  * isBig (I) int containing 0 for ---> or 1 for ===>
8864  * arg3 (I) int unused
8865  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8866  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to up/down arrow subraster
8867  * or NULL for any error
8868  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8869  * Notes: o An optional argument [height] may *immediately* follow
8870  * the \longxxx to explicitly set the arrow's height in pixels.
8871  * For example, \longuparrow calculates a default height
8872  * (as usual in LaTeX), whereas \longuparrow[25] explicitly
8873  * draws a 25-pixel high arrow. This can be used, e.g.,
8874  * to draw commutative diagrams in conjunction with
8875  * \array (and maybe with \stackrel and/or \relstack, too).
8876  * o In case you really want to render, say, [f]---->[g], just
8877  * use an intervening space, i.e., [f]\longuparrow~[g].
8878  * In text use two spaces {\rm~[f]\longuparrow~~[g]}.
8879  * ======================================================================= */
8880 /* --- entry point --- */
8881 subraster *rastuparrow ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
8882  int drctn, int isBig, int arg3 )
8883 {
8884 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8885 Allocations and Declarations
8886 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8887 subraster *uparrow_subraster(), *arrowsp=NULL; /* subraster for arrow */
8888 char *texsubexpr(), heightarg[256]; /* parse for optional [height] */
8889 char *texscripts(), sub[1024],super[1024]; /* and _^limits after [width]*/
8890 subraster *rasterize(), *subsp=NULL,*supsp=NULL; /*rasterize limits*/
8891 subraster *rastcat(); /* cat superscript left, sub right */
8892 int evalterm(); /* evaluate [arg], {arg} */
8893 int height = 8 + 2*size, width; /* height, width for \longxxxarrow */
8894 int maxheight = 800; /* max arrow height in pixels */
8895 int islimits = 1; /*true to handle limits internally*/
8896 int limsize = size-1; /* font size for limits */
8897 int pixsz = 1; /*default #bits per pixel, 1=bitmap*/
8898 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8899 construct blank subraster, and return it to caller
8900 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8901 /* --- check for optional height arg and replace default height --- */
8902 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /*check for []-enclosed optional arg*/
8903  { int heightval; /* test height before using it */
8904  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,heightarg,255,"[","]",0,0);
8905  heightval = /* convert [height] to integer */
8906  (int)((unitlength*((double)evalterm(mimestore,heightarg)))+0.5);
8907  if ( heightval>=2 && heightval<=maxheight ) /* sanity check */
8908  height = heightval; } /* replace deafault height */
8909 /* --- now parse for limits, and bump expression past it(them) --- */
8910 if ( islimits ) /* handling limits internally */
8911  { *expression = texscripts(*expression,sub,super,3); /* parse for limits */
8912  if ( *sub != '\000' ) /*have a subscript following arrow*/
8913  subsp = rasterize(sub,limsize); /* so try to rasterize subscript */
8914  if ( *super != '\000' ) /*have superscript following arrow*/
8915  supsp = rasterize(super,limsize); } /*so try to rasterize superscript*/
8916 /* --- set width based on height --- */
8917 width = min2(17,max2(9,(height+2)/4)); /* width based on height */
8918 width = 1 + (width/2)*2; /* always force odd width */
8919 /* --- generate arrow subraster --- */
8920 if ( (arrowsp=uparrow_subraster(width,height,pixsz,drctn,isBig)) /*build arr*/
8921 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if we failed */
8922 /* --- init arrow subraster parameters --- */
8923 arrowsp->size = size; /*propagate base font size forward*/
8924 arrowsp->baseline = height-1; /* set baseline at bottom of arrow */
8925 /* --- add limits above/below arrow, as necessary --- */
8926 if ( supsp != NULL ) /* cat superscript to left of arrow*/
8927  { int supht = (supsp->image)->height, /* superscript height */
8928  deltab = (1+abs(height-supht))/2; /* baseline difference to center */
8929  supsp->baseline = supht-1; /* force script baseline to bottom */
8930  if ( supht <= height ) /* arrow usually taller than script*/
8931  arrowsp->baseline -= deltab; /* so bottom of script goes here */
8932  else supsp->baseline -= deltab; /* else bottom of arrow goes here */
8933  if ( (arrowsp = rastcat(supsp,arrowsp,3)) /* superscript left of arrow */
8934  == NULL ) goto end_of_job; } /* quit if failed */
8935 if ( subsp != NULL ) /* cat subscript to right of arrow */
8936  { int subht = (subsp->image)->height, /* subscript height */
8937  deltab = (1+abs(height-subht))/2; /* baseline difference to center */
8938  arrowsp->baseline = height-1; /* reset arrow baseline to bottom */
8939  subsp->baseline = subht-1; /* force script baseline to bottom */
8940  if ( subht <= height ) /* arrow usually taller than script*/
8941  arrowsp->baseline -= deltab; /* so bottom of script goes here */
8942  else subsp->baseline -= deltab; /* else bottom of arrow goes here */
8943  if ( (arrowsp = rastcat(arrowsp,subsp,3)) /* subscript right of arrow */
8944  == NULL ) goto end_of_job; } /* quit if failed */
8945 /* --- return arrow (or NULL) to caller --- */
8946 end_of_job:
8947  arrowsp->baseline = height-1; /* reset arrow baseline to bottom */
8948  return ( arrowsp );
8949 } /* --- end-of-function rastuparrow() --- */
8950 
8951 
8952 /* ==========================================================================
8953  * Function: rastoverlay (expression, size, basesp, overlay, offset2, arg3)
8954  * Purpose: overlays one raster on another
8955  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8956  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
8957  * string immediately following overlay \cmd to
8958  * be rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
8959  * following last character processed.
8960  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
8961  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
8962  * immediately preceding overlay \cmd
8963  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
8964  * overlay (I) int containing 1 to overlay / (e.g., \not)
8965  * or NOVALUE to pick up 2nd arg from expression
8966  * offset2 (I) int containing #pixels to horizontally offset
8967  * overlay relative to underlying symbol,
8968  * positive(right) or negative or 0,
8969  * or NOVALUE to pick up optional [offset] arg
8970  * arg3 (I) int unused
8971  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8972  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to composite,
8973  * or NULL for any parsing error
8974  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
8975  * Notes: o
8976  * ======================================================================= */
8977 /* --- entry point --- */
8978 subraster *rastoverlay ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
8979  int overlay, int offset2, int arg3 )
8980 {
8981 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8982 Allocations and Declarations
8983 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8984 char *texsubexpr(), /*parse expression for base,overlay*/
8985  expr1[512], expr2[512]; /* base, overlay */
8986 subraster *rasterize(), *sp1=NULL, *sp2=NULL, /*rasterize 1=base, 2=overlay*/
8987  *new_subraster(); /*explicitly alloc sp2 if necessary*/
8988 subraster *rastcompose(), *overlaysp=NULL; /*subraster for composite overlay*/
8989 int isalign = 0; /* true to align baselines */
8990 int line_raster(); /* draw diagonal for \Not */
8991 int evalterm(); /* evaluate [arg], {arg} */
8992 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
8993 Obtain base, and maybe overlay, and rasterize them
8994 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
8995 /* --- check for optional offset2 arg --- */
8996 if ( offset2 == NOVALUE ) /* only if not explicitly specified*/
8997  if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /*check for []-enclosed optional arg*/
8998  { int offsetval; /* test before using it */
8999  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,expr2,511,"[","]",0,0);
9000  offsetval = /* convert [offset2] to int */
9001  (int)(((double)evalterm(mimestore,expr2))+0.5);
9002  if ( abs(offsetval) <= 25 ) /* sanity check */
9003  offset2 = offsetval; } /* replace deafault */
9004 if ( offset2 == NOVALUE ) offset2 = 0; /* novalue means no offset */
9005 /* --- parse for base, bump expression past it, and rasterize it --- */
9006 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,expr1,511,"{","}",0,0);
9007 if ( isempty(expr1) ) goto end_of_job; /* nothing to overlay, so quit */
9008 rastlift1 = rastlift = 0; /* reset all raisebox() lifts */
9009 if ( strstr(expr1,"\\raise") != NULL ) /* have a \raisebox */
9010  isalign = 2; /* so align baselines */
9011 if ( (sp1=rasterize(expr1,size)) /* rasterize base expression */
9012 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed to rasterize */
9013 overlaysp = sp1; /*in case we return with no overlay*/
9014 rastlift1 = rastlift; /* save lift for base expression */
9015 /* --- get overlay expression, and rasterize it --- */
9016 if ( overlay == NOVALUE ) /* get overlay from input stream */
9017  { *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,expr2,511,"{","}",0,0);
9018  if ( !isempty(expr2) ) { /* have an overlay */
9019  if ( strstr(expr2,"\\raise") != NULL ) /* have a \raisebox */
9020  isalign = 2; /* so align baselines */
9021  sp2 = rasterize(expr2,size); } } /* rasterize overlay expression */
9022 else /* use specific built-in overlay */
9023  switch ( overlay )
9024  {
9025  default: break;
9026  case 1: /* e.g., \not overlays slash */
9027  sp2 = rasterize("/",size+1); /* rasterize overlay expression */
9028  isalign = 0; /* automatically handled correctly */
9029  offset2 = max2(1,size-3); /* push / right a bit */
9030  offset2 = 0;
9031  break;
9032  case 2: /* e.g., \Not draws diagonal */
9033  sp2 = NULL; /* no overlay required */
9034  isalign = 0; /* automatically handled correctly */
9035  if ( overlaysp != NULL ) /* check that we have raster */
9036  { raster *rp = overlaysp->image; /* raster to be \Not-ed */
9037  int width=rp->width, height=rp->height; /* raster dimensions */
9038  if ( 0 ) /* diagonal within bounding box */
9039  line_raster(rp,0,width-1,height-1,0,1); /* just draw diagonal */
9040  else /* construct "wide" diagonal */
9041  { int margin=3; /* desired extra margin width */
9042  sp2 = new_subraster(width+margin,height+margin,1); /*alloc it*/
9043  if ( sp2 != NULL ) /* allocated successfully */
9044  line_raster(sp2->image,0,width+margin-1,height+margin-1,0,1);}}
9045  break;
9046  case 3: /* e.g., \sout for strikeout */
9047  sp2 = NULL; /* no overlay required */
9048  if ( overlaysp != NULL ) /* check that we have raster */
9049  { raster *rp = overlaysp->image; /* raster to be \sout-ed */
9050  int width=rp->width, height=rp->height; /* raster dimensions */
9051  int baseline = (overlaysp->baseline)-rastlift; /*skip descenders*/
9052  int midrow = max2(0,min2(height-1,offset2+((baseline+1)/2)));
9053  if ( 1 ) /* strikeout within bounding box */
9054  line_raster(rp,midrow,0,midrow,width-1,1); } /*draw strikeout*/
9055  break;
9056  } /* --- end-of-switch(overlay) --- */
9057 if ( sp2 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /*return sp1 if failed to rasterize*/
9058 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9059 construct composite overlay
9060 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9061 overlaysp = rastcompose(sp1,sp2,offset2,isalign,3);
9062 end_of_job:
9063  return ( overlaysp );
9064 } /* --- end-of-function rastoverlay() --- */
9065 
9066 
9067 /* ==========================================================================
9068  * Function: rastfrac ( expression, size, basesp, isfrac, arg2, arg3 )
9069  * Purpose: \frac,\atop handler, returns a subraster corresponding to
9070  * expression (immediately following \frac,\atop) at font size
9071  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9072  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
9073  * string immediately following \frac to be
9074  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
9075  * following last character processed.
9076  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
9077  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
9078  * immediately preceding \frac
9079  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
9080  * isfrac (I) int containing true to draw horizontal line
9081  * between numerator and denominator,
9082  * or false not to draw it (for \atop).
9083  * arg2 (I) int unused
9084  * arg3 (I) int unused
9085  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9086  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to fraction,
9087  * or NULL for any parsing error
9088  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9089  * Notes: o
9090  * ======================================================================= */
9091 /* --- entry point --- */
9092 subraster *rastfrac ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
9093  int isfrac, int arg2, int arg3 )
9094 {
9095 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9096 Allocations and Declarations
9097 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9098 char *texsubexpr(), /*parse expression for numer,denom*/
9099  numer[MAXSUBXSZ+1], denom[MAXSUBXSZ+1]; /* parsed numer, denom */
9100 subraster *rasterize(), *numsp=NULL, *densp=NULL; /*rasterize numer, denom*/
9101 subraster *rastack(), *fracsp=NULL; /* subraster for numer/denom */
9102 subraster *new_subraster()/*, *spacesp=NULL*/; /* space for num or den */
9103 int width=0, /* width of constructed raster */
9104  numheight=0; /* height of numerator */
9105 int baseht=0, baseln=0; /* height,baseline of base symbol */
9106 /*int istweak = 1;*/ /*true to tweak baseline alignment*/
9107 int rule_raster(), /* draw horizontal line for frac */
9108  lineheight = 1; /* thickness of fraction line */
9109 int vspace = (size>2?2:1); /*vertical space between components*/
9110 int delete_subraster(); /*free work areas in case of error*/
9111 int type_raster(); /* display debugging output */
9112 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9113 Obtain numerator and denominator, and rasterize them
9114 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9115 /* --- parse for numerator,denominator and bump expression past them --- */
9116 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,numer,0,"{","}",0,0);
9117 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,denom,0,"{","}",0,0);
9118 if ( *numer=='\000' && *denom=='\000' ) /* missing both components of frac */
9119  goto end_of_job; /* nothing to do, so quit */
9120 /* --- rasterize numerator, denominator --- */
9121 if ( *numer != '\000' ) /* have a numerator */
9122  if ( (numsp = rasterize(numer,size-1)) /* so rasterize numer at size-1 */
9123  == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
9124 if ( *denom != '\000' ) /* have a denominator */
9125  if ( (densp = rasterize(denom,size-1)) /* so rasterize denom at size-1 */
9126  == NULL ) /* failed */
9127  { if ( numsp != NULL ) /* already rasterized numerator */
9128  delete_subraster(numsp); /* so free now-unneeded numerator */
9129  goto end_of_job; } /* and quit */
9130 /* --- if one componenet missing, use a blank space for it --- */
9131 if ( numsp == NULL ) /* no numerator given */
9132  numsp = rasterize("[?]",size-1); /* missing numerator */
9133 if ( densp == NULL ) /* no denominator given */
9134  densp = rasterize("[?]",size-1); /* missing denominator */
9135 /* --- check that we got both components --- */
9136 if ( numsp==NULL || densp==NULL ) /* some problem */
9137  { delete_subraster(numsp); /*delete numerator (if it existed)*/
9138  delete_subraster(densp); /*delete denominator (if it existed)*/
9139  goto end_of_job; } /* and quit */
9140 /* --- get height of numerator (to determine where line belongs) --- */
9141 numheight = (numsp->image)->height; /* get numerator's height */
9142 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9143 construct raster with numerator stacked over denominator
9144 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9145 /* --- construct raster with numer/denom --- */
9146 if ( (fracsp = rastack(densp,numsp,0,2*vspace+lineheight,1,3))/*numer/denom*/
9147 == NULL ) /* failed to construct numer/denom */
9148  { delete_subraster(numsp); /* so free now-unneeded numerator */
9149  delete_subraster(densp); /* and now-unneeded denominator */
9150  goto end_of_job; } /* and then quit */
9151 /* --- determine width of constructed raster --- */
9152 width = (fracsp->image)->width; /*just get width of embedded image*/
9153 /* --- initialize subraster parameters --- */
9154 fracsp->size = size; /* propagate font size forward */
9155 fracsp->baseline = (numheight+vspace+lineheight)+(size+2);/*default baseline*/
9156 fracsp->type = FRACRASTER; /* signal \frac image */
9157 if ( basesp != (subraster *)NULL ) /* we have base symbol for frac */
9158  { baseht = (basesp->image)->height; /* height of base symbol */
9159  baseln = basesp->baseline; /* and its baseline */
9160  } /* --- end-of-if(basesp!=NULL) --- */
9161 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9162 draw horizontal line between numerator and denominator
9163 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9164 fraccenterline = numheight+vspace; /* signal that we have a \frac */
9165 if ( isfrac ) /*line for \frac, but not for \atop*/
9166  rule_raster(fracsp->image,fraccenterline,0,width,lineheight,0);
9167 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9168 return final result to caller
9169 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9170 end_of_job:
9171  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 )
9172  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastfrac> returning %s\n",(fracsp==NULL?"null":"..."));
9173  if ( fracsp != NULL ) /* have a constructed raster */
9174  type_raster(fracsp->image,msgfp); } /* display constructed raster */
9175  return ( fracsp );
9176 } /* --- end-of-function rastfrac() --- */
9177 
9178 
9179 /* ==========================================================================
9180  * Function: rastackrel ( expression, size, basesp, base, arg2, arg3 )
9181  * Purpose: \stackrel handler, returns a subraster corresponding to
9182  * stacked relation
9183  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9184  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
9185  * string immediately following \stackrel to be
9186  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
9187  * following last character processed.
9188  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
9189  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
9190  * immediately preceding \stackrel
9191  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
9192  * base (I) int containing 1 if upper/first subexpression
9193  * is base relation, or 2 if lower/second is
9194  * arg2 (I) int unused
9195  * arg3 (I) int unused
9196  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9197  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to stacked
9198  * relation, or NULL for any parsing error
9199  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9200  * Notes: o
9201  * ======================================================================= */
9202 /* --- entry point --- */
9203 subraster *rastackrel ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
9204  int base, int arg2, int arg3 )
9205 {
9206 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9207 Allocations and Declarations
9208 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9209 char *texsubexpr(), /*parse expression for upper,lower*/
9210  upper[MAXSUBXSZ+1], lower[MAXSUBXSZ+1]; /* parsed upper, lower */
9211 subraster *rasterize(), *upsp=NULL, *lowsp=NULL; /* rasterize upper, lower */
9212 subraster *rastack(), *relsp=NULL; /* subraster for upper/lower */
9213 int upsize = (base==1? size:size-1), /* font size for upper component */
9214  lowsize = (base==2? size:size-1); /* font size for lower component */
9215 int vspace = 1; /*vertical space between components*/
9216 int delete_subraster(); /*free work areas in case of error*/
9217 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9218 Obtain numerator and denominator, and rasterize them
9219 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9220 /* --- parse for numerator,denominator and bump expression past them --- */
9221 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,upper,0,"{","}",0,0);
9222 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,lower,0,"{","}",0,0);
9223 if ( *upper=='\000' || *lower=='\000' ) /* missing either component */
9224  goto end_of_job; /* nothing to do, so quit */
9225 /* --- rasterize upper, lower --- */
9226 if ( *upper != '\000' ) /* have upper component */
9227  if ( (upsp = rasterize(upper,upsize)) /* so rasterize upper component */
9228  == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
9229 if ( *lower != '\000' ) /* have lower component */
9230  if ( (lowsp = rasterize(lower,lowsize)) /* so rasterize lower component */
9231  == NULL ) /* failed */
9232  { if ( upsp != NULL ) /* already rasterized upper */
9233  delete_subraster(upsp); /* so free now-unneeded upper */
9234  goto end_of_job; } /* and quit */
9235 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9236 construct stacked relation raster
9237 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9238 /* --- construct stacked relation --- */
9239 if ( (relsp = rastack(lowsp,upsp,3-base,vspace,1,3)) /* stacked relation */
9240 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
9241 /* --- initialize subraster parameters --- */
9242 relsp->size = size; /* propagate font size forward */
9243 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9244 return final result to caller
9245 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9246 end_of_job:
9247  return ( relsp );
9248 } /* --- end-of-function rastackrel() --- */
9249 
9250 
9251 /* ==========================================================================
9252  * Function: rastmathfunc ( expression, size, basesp, base, arg2, arg3 )
9253  * Purpose: \log, \lim, etc handler, returns a subraster corresponding
9254  * to math functions
9255  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9256  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
9257  * string immediately following \mathfunc to be
9258  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
9259  * following last character processed.
9260  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
9261  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
9262  * immediately preceding \mathfunc
9263  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
9264  * mathfunc (I) int containing 1=arccos, 2=arcsin, etc.
9265  * islimits (I) int containing 1 if function may have
9266  * limits underneath, e.g., \lim_{n\to\infty}
9267  * arg3 (I) int unused
9268  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9269  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to mathfunc,
9270  * or NULL for any parsing error
9271  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9272  * Notes: o
9273  * ======================================================================= */
9274 /* --- entry point --- */
9275 subraster *rastmathfunc ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
9276  int mathfunc, int islimits, int arg3 )
9277 {
9278 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9279 Allocations and Declarations
9280 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9281 char *texscripts(), /* parse expression for _limits */
9282  func[MAXTOKNSZ+1], limits[MAXSUBXSZ+1]; /*func as {\rm func}, limits*/
9283 char *texsubexpr(), /* parse expression for arg */
9284  funcarg[MAXTOKNSZ+1]; /* optional func arg */
9285 subraster *rasterize(), *funcsp=NULL, *limsp=NULL; /*rasterize func,limits*/
9286 subraster *rastack(), *mathfuncsp=NULL; /* subraster for mathfunc/limits */
9287 int limsize = size-1; /* font size for limits */
9288 int vspace = 1; /*vertical space between components*/
9289 int delete_subraster(); /*free work areas in case of error*/
9290 /* --- table of function names by mathfunc number --- */
9291 static int numnames = 34; /* number of names in table */
9292 static char *funcnames[] = {
9293  "error", /* 0 index is illegal/error bucket*/
9294  "arccos", "arcsin", "arctan", /* 1 - 3 */
9295  "arg", "cos", "cosh", /* 4 - 6 */
9296  "cot", "coth", "csc", /* 7 - 9 */
9297  "deg", "det", "dim", /* 10 - 12 */
9298  "exp", "gcd", "hom", /* 13 - 15 */
9299  "inf", "ker", "lg", /* 16 - 18 */
9300  "lim", "liminf", "limsup", /* 19 - 21 */
9301  "ln", "log", "max", /* 22 - 24 */
9302  "min", "Pr", "sec", /* 25 - 27 */
9303  "sin", "sinh", "sup", /* 28 - 30 */
9304  "tan", "tanh", /* 31 - 32 */
9305  /* --- extra mimetex funcnames --- */
9306  "tr", /* 33 */
9307  "pmod" /* 34 */
9308  } ;
9309 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9310 set up and rasterize function name in \rm
9311 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9312 if ( mathfunc<0 || mathfunc>numnames ) mathfunc=0; /* check index bounds */
9313 switch ( mathfunc ) /* check for special processing */
9314  {
9315  default: /* no special processing */
9316  strcpy(func,"{\\rm~"); /* init string with {\rm~ */
9317  strcat(func,funcnames[mathfunc]); /* concat function name */
9318  strcat(func,"}"); /* and add terminating } */
9319  break;
9320  case 34: /* \pmod{x} --> (mod x) */
9321  /* --- parse for \pmod{arg} argument --- */
9322  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,funcarg,2047,"{","}",0,0);
9323  strcpy(func,"{\\({\\rm~mod}"); /* init with {\left({\rm~mod} */
9324  strcat(func,"\\hspace2"); /* concat space */
9325  strcat(func,funcarg); /* and \pmodargument */
9326  strcat(func,"\\)}"); /* and add terminating \right)} */
9327  break;
9328  } /* --- end-of-switch(mathfunc) --- */
9329 if ( (funcsp = rasterize(func,size)) /* rasterize function name */
9330 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
9331 mathfuncsp = funcsp; /* just return funcsp if no limits */
9332 if ( !islimits ) goto end_of_job; /* treat any subscript normally */
9333 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9334 Obtain limits, if permitted and if provided, and rasterize them
9335 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9336 /* --- parse for subscript limits, and bump expression past it(them) --- */
9337 *expression = texscripts(*expression,limits,limits,1);
9338 if ( *limits=='\000') goto end_of_job; /* no limits, nothing to do, quit */
9339 /* --- rasterize limits --- */
9340 if ( (limsp = rasterize(limits,limsize)) /* rasterize limits */
9341 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
9342 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9343 construct func atop limits
9344 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9345 /* --- construct func atop limits --- */
9346 if ( (mathfuncsp = rastack(limsp,funcsp,2,vspace,1,3)) /* func atop limits */
9347 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
9348 /* --- initialize subraster parameters --- */
9349 mathfuncsp->size = size; /* propagate font size forward */
9350 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9351 return final result to caller
9352 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9353 end_of_job:
9354  return ( mathfuncsp );
9355 } /* --- end-of-function rastmathfunc() --- */
9356 
9357 
9358 /* ==========================================================================
9359  * Function: rastsqrt ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
9360  * Purpose: \sqrt handler, returns a subraster corresponding to
9361  * expression (immediately following \sqrt) at font size
9362  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9363  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
9364  * string immediately following \sqrt to be
9365  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
9366  * following last character processed.
9367  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
9368  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
9369  * immediately preceding \accent
9370  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
9371  * arg1 (I) int unused
9372  * arg2 (I) int unused
9373  * arg3 (I) int unused
9374  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9375  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to expression,
9376  * or NULL for any parsing error
9377  * (expression ptr unchanged if error occurs)
9378  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9379  * Notes: o
9380  * ======================================================================= */
9381 /* --- entry point --- */
9382 subraster *rastsqrt ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
9383  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
9384 {
9385 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9386 Allocations and Declarations
9387 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9388 char *texsubexpr(), subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ+1], /*parse subexpr to be sqrt-ed*/
9389  rootarg[MAXSUBXSZ+1]; /* optional \sqrt[rootarg]{...} */
9390 subraster *rasterize(), *subsp=NULL; /* rasterize subexpr */
9391 subraster *accent_subraster(), *sqrtsp=NULL, /* subraster with the sqrt */
9392  *new_subraster(), *rootsp=NULL; /* optionally preceded by [rootarg]*/
9393 int sqrtheight=0, sqrtwidth=0, surdwidth=0, /* height,width of sqrt */
9394  rootheight=0, rootwidth=0, /* height,width of rootarg raster */
9395  subheight=0, subwidth=0, pixsz=0; /* height,width,pixsz of subexpr */
9396 int rastput(); /* put subexpr in constructed sqrt */
9397 int overspace = 2; /*space between subexpr and overbar*/
9398 int delete_subraster(); /* free work areas */
9399 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9400 Obtain subexpression to be sqrt-ed, and rasterize it
9401 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9402 /* --- first check for optional \sqrt[rootarg]{...} --- */
9403 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /*check for []-enclosed optional arg*/
9404  { *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,rootarg,0,"[","]",0,0);
9405  if ( *rootarg != '\000' ) /* got rootarg */
9406  if ( (rootsp=rasterize(rootarg,size-1)) /*rasterize it at smaller size*/
9407  != NULL ) /* rasterized successfully */
9408  { rootheight = (rootsp->image)->height; /* get height of rootarg */
9409  rootwidth = (rootsp->image)->width; } /* and its width */
9410  } /* --- end-of-if(**expression=='[') --- */
9411 /* --- parse for subexpr to be sqrt-ed, and bump expression past it --- */
9412 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,subexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
9413 if ( *subexpr == '\000' ) /* couldn't get subexpression */
9414  goto end_of_job; /* nothing to do, so quit */
9415 /* --- rasterize subexpression to be accented --- */
9416 if ( (subsp = rasterize(subexpr,size)) /*rasterize subexpr at original size*/
9417 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
9418 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9419 determine height and width of sqrt raster to be constructed
9420 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9421 /* --- first get height and width of subexpr --- */
9422 subheight = (subsp->image)->height; /* height of subexpr */
9423 subwidth = (subsp->image)->width; /* and its width */
9424 pixsz = (subsp->image)->pixsz; /* pixsz remains constant */
9425 /* --- determine height and width of sqrt to contain subexpr --- */
9426 sqrtheight = subheight + overspace; /* subexpr + blank line + overbar */
9427 surdwidth = SQRTWIDTH(sqrtheight,(rootheight<1?2:1)); /* width of surd */
9428 sqrtwidth = subwidth + surdwidth + 1; /* total width */
9429 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9430 construct sqrt (with room to move in subexpr) and embed subexpr in it
9431 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9432 /* --- construct sqrt --- */
9433 if ( (sqrtsp=accent_subraster(SQRTACCENT,
9434 (rootheight<1?sqrtwidth:(-sqrtwidth)),sqrtheight,0,pixsz))
9435 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed to build sqrt */
9436 /* --- embed subexpr in sqrt at lower-right corner--- */
9437 rastput(sqrtsp->image,subsp->image,overspace,sqrtwidth-subwidth,1);
9438 sqrtsp->baseline = subsp->baseline + overspace; /* adjust baseline */
9439 /* --- "embed" rootarg at upper-left --- */
9440 if ( rootsp != NULL ) /*have optional \sqrt[rootarg]{...}*/
9441  {
9442  /* --- allocate full raster to contain sqrtsp and rootsp --- */
9443  int fullwidth = sqrtwidth +rootwidth - min2(rootwidth,max2(0,surdwidth-4)),
9444  fullheight= sqrtheight+rootheight- min2(rootheight,3+size);
9445  subraster *fullsp = new_subraster(fullwidth,fullheight,pixsz);
9446  if ( fullsp != NULL ) /* allocated successfully */
9447  { /* --- embed sqrtsp exactly at lower-right corner --- */
9448  rastput(fullsp->image,sqrtsp->image, /* exactly at lower-right corner*/
9449  fullheight-sqrtheight,fullwidth-sqrtwidth,1);
9450  /* --- embed rootsp near upper-left, nestled above leading surd --- */
9451  rastput(fullsp->image,rootsp->image,
9452  0,max2(0,surdwidth-rootwidth-2-size),0);
9453  /* --- replace sqrtsp with fullsp --- */
9454  delete_subraster(sqrtsp); /* free original sqrtsp */
9455  sqrtsp = fullsp; /* and repoint it to fullsp instead*/
9456  sqrtsp->baseline = fullheight - (subheight - subsp->baseline); }
9457  } /* --- end-of-if(rootsp!=NULL) --- */
9458 /* --- initialize subraster parameters --- */
9459 sqrtsp->size = size; /* propagate font size forward */
9460 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9461 free unneeded component subrasters and return final result to caller
9462 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9463 end_of_job:
9464  if ( subsp != NULL ) delete_subraster(subsp); /* free unneeded subexpr */
9465  return ( sqrtsp );
9466 } /* --- end-of-function rastsqrt() --- */
9467 
9468 
9469 /* ==========================================================================
9470  * Function: rastaccent (expression,size,basesp,accent,isabove,isscript)
9471  * Purpose: \hat, \vec, \etc handler, returns a subraster corresponding
9472  * to expression (immediately following \accent) at font size
9473  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9474  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
9475  * string immediately following \accent to be
9476  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
9477  * following last character processed.
9478  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
9479  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
9480  * immediately preceding \accent
9481  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
9482  * accent (I) int containing HATACCENT or VECACCENT, etc,
9483  * between numerator and denominator,
9484  * or false not to draw it (for \over).
9485  * isabove (I) int containing true if accent is above
9486  * expression to be accented, or false
9487  * if accent is below (e.g., underbrace)
9488  * isscript (I) int containing true if sub/superscripts
9489  * allowed (for under/overbrace), or 0 if not.
9490  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9491  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to expression,
9492  * or NULL for any parsing error
9493  * (expression ptr unchanged if error occurs)
9494  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9495  * Notes: o Also handles \overbrace{}^{} and \underbrace{}_{} by way
9496  * of isabove and isscript args.
9497  * ======================================================================= */
9498 /* --- entry point --- */
9499 subraster *rastaccent ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
9500  int accent, int isabove, int isscript )
9501 {
9502 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9503 Allocations and Declarations
9504 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9505 char *texsubexpr(), subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ+1]; /*parse subexpr to be accented*/
9506 char *texscripts(), *script=NULL, /* \under,overbrace allow scripts */
9507  subscript[MAXTOKNSZ+1], supscript[MAXTOKNSZ+1]; /* parsed scripts */
9508 subraster *rasterize(), *subsp=NULL, *scrsp=NULL; /*rasterize subexpr,script*/
9509 subraster *rastack(), *accsubsp=NULL; /* stack accent, subexpr, script */
9510 subraster *accent_subraster(), *accsp=NULL; /*raster for the accent itself*/
9511 int accheight=0, accwidth=0, accdir=0,/*accent height, width, direction*/
9512  subheight=0, subwidth=0, pixsz=0; /* height,width,pixsz of subexpr */
9513 int delete_subraster(); /*free work areas in case of error*/
9514 int vspace = 0; /*vertical space between accent,sub*/
9515 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9516 Obtain subexpression to be accented, and rasterize it
9517 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9518 /* --- parse for subexpr to be accented, and bump expression past it --- */
9519 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,subexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
9520 if ( *subexpr=='\000' ) /* couldn't get subexpression */
9521  goto end_of_job; /* nothing to do, so quit */
9522 /* --- rasterize subexpression to be accented --- */
9523 if ( (subsp = rasterize(subexpr,size)) /*rasterize subexpr at original size*/
9524 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
9525 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9526 determine desired accent width and height
9527 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9528 /* --- first get height and width of subexpr --- */
9529 subheight = (subsp->image)->height; /* height of subexpr */
9530 subwidth = (subsp->image)->width; /* and its width is overall width */
9531 pixsz = (subsp->image)->pixsz; /* original pixsz remains constant */
9532 /* --- determine desired width, height of accent --- */
9533 accwidth = subwidth; /* same width as subexpr */
9534 accheight = 4; /* default for bars */
9535 switch ( accent )
9536  { default: break; /* default okay */
9537  case DOTACCENT: case DDOTACCENT:
9538  accheight = (size<4? 3:4); /* default for dots */
9539  break;
9540  case VECACCENT:
9541  vspace = 1; /* set 1-pixel vertical space */
9542  accdir = isscript; /* +1=right,-1=left,0=lr; +10for==>*/
9543  isscript = 0; /* >>don't<< signal sub/supscript */
9544  case HATACCENT:
9545  accheight = 7; /* default */
9546  if ( subwidth < 10 ) accheight = 5; /* unless small width */
9547  else if ( subwidth > 25 ) accheight = 9; /* or large */
9548  break;
9549  } /* --- end-of-switch(accent) --- */
9550 accheight = min2(accheight,subheight); /*never higher than accented subexpr*/
9551 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9552 construct accent, and construct subraster with accent over (or under) subexpr
9553 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9554 /* --- first construct accent --- */
9555 if ( (accsp = accent_subraster(accent,accwidth,accheight,accdir,pixsz))
9556 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed to build accent */
9557 /* --- now stack accent above (or below) subexpr, and free both args --- */
9558 accsubsp = (isabove? rastack(subsp,accsp,1,vspace,1,3)/*accent above subexpr*/
9559  : rastack(accsp,subsp,2,vspace,1,3)); /*accent below subexpr*/
9560 if ( accsubsp == NULL ) /* failed to stack accent */
9561  { delete_subraster(subsp); /* free unneeded subsp */
9562  delete_subraster(accsp); /* and unneeded accsp */
9563  goto end_of_job; } /* and quit */
9564 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9565 look for super/subscript (annotation for over/underbrace)
9566 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9567 /* --- first check whether accent permits accompanying annotations --- */
9568 if ( !isscript ) goto end_of_job; /* no annotations for this accent */
9569 /* --- now get scripts if there actually are any --- */
9570 *expression = texscripts(*expression,subscript,supscript,(isabove?2:1));
9571 script = (isabove? supscript : subscript); /*select above^ or below_ script*/
9572 if ( *script == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* no accompanying script */
9573 /* --- rasterize script annotation at size-2 --- */
9574 if ( (scrsp = rasterize(script,size-2)) /* rasterize script at size-2 */
9575 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
9576 /* --- stack annotation above (or below) accent, and free both args --- */
9577 accsubsp = (isabove? rastack(accsubsp,scrsp,1,0,1,3) /* accent above base */
9578  : rastack(scrsp,accsubsp,2,0,1,3)); /* accent below base */
9579 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9580 return final result to caller
9581 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9582 end_of_job:
9583  if ( accsubsp != NULL ) /* initialize subraster parameters */
9584  accsubsp->size = size; /* propagate font size forward */
9585  return ( accsubsp );
9586 } /* --- end-of-function rastaccent() --- */
9587 
9588 
9589 /* ==========================================================================
9590  * Function: rastfont (expression,size,basesp,ifontnum,arg2,arg3)
9591  * Purpose: \cal{}, \scr{}, \etc handler, returns subraster corresponding
9592  * to char(s) within {}'s rendered at size
9593  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9594  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
9595  * string immediately following \font to be
9596  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
9597  * following last character processed.
9598  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
9599  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
9600  * immediately preceding \accent
9601  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
9602  * ifontnum (I) int containing 1 for \cal{}, 2 for \scr{}
9603  * arg2 (I) int unused
9604  * arg3 (I) int unused
9605  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9606  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to chars
9607  * between {}'s, or NULL for any parsing error
9608  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9609  * Notes: o
9610  * ======================================================================= */
9611 /* --- entry point --- */
9612 subraster *rastfont ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
9613  int ifontnum, int arg2, int arg3 )
9614 {
9615 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9616 Allocations and Declarations
9617 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9618 char *texsubexpr(), fontchars[MAXSUBXSZ+1], /* chars to render in font */
9619  subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ+1]; /* turn \cal{AB} into \calA\calB */
9620 char *pfchars=fontchars, fchar='\0'; /* run thru fontchars one at a time*/
9621 char *name = NULL; /* fontinfo[ifontnum].name */
9622 int family = 0, /* fontinfo[ifontnum].family */
9623  istext = 0, /* fontinfo[ifontnum].istext */
9624  class = 0; /* fontinfo[ifontnum].class */
9625 subraster *rasterize(), *fontsp=NULL, /* rasterize chars in font */
9626  *rastflags(); /* or just set flag to switch font */
9627 int oldsmashmargin = smashmargin; /* turn off smash in text mode */
9628 #if 0
9629 /* --- fonts recognized by rastfont --- */
9630 static int nfonts = 11; /* legal font #'s are 1...nfonts */
9631 static struct {char *name; int class;}
9632  fonts[] =
9633  { /* --- name class 1=upper,2=alpha,3=alnum,4=lower,5=digit,9=all --- */
9634  { "\\math", 0 },
9635  { "\\mathcal", 1 }, /*(1) calligraphic, uppercase */
9636  { "\\mathscr", 1 }, /*(2) rsfs/script, uppercase */
9637  { "\\textrm", -1 }, /*(3) \rm,\text{abc} --> {\rm~abc} */
9638  { "\\textit", -1 }, /*(4) \it,\textit{abc}-->{\it~abc} */
9639  { "\\mathbb", -1 }, /*(5) \bb,\mathbb{abc}-->{\bb~abc} */
9640  { "\\mathbf", -1 }, /*(6) \bf,\mathbf{abc}-->{\bf~abc} */
9641  { "\\mathrm", -1 }, /*(7) \mathrm */
9642  { "\\cyr", -1 }, /*(8) \cyr */
9643  { "\\textgreek",-1 }, /*(9) \textgreek */
9644  { "\\textbfgreek",CMMI10BGR,1,-1 },/*(10) \textbfgreek{ab} */
9645  { "\\textbbgreek",BBOLD10GR,1,-1 },/*(11) \textbbgreek{ab} */
9646  { NULL, 0 }
9647  } ; /* --- end-of-fonts[] --- */
9648 #endif
9649 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9650 first get font name and class to determine type of conversion desired
9651 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9652 if (ifontnum<=0 || ifontnum>nfontinfo) ifontnum=0; /*math if out-of-bounds*/
9653 name = fontinfo[ifontnum].name; /* font name */
9654 family = fontinfo[ifontnum].family; /* font family */
9655 istext = fontinfo[ifontnum].istext; /*true in text mode (respect space)*/
9656 class = fontinfo[ifontnum].class; /* font class */
9657 if ( istext ) /* text (respect blanks) */
9658  { mathsmashmargin = smashmargin; /* needed for \text{if $n-m$ even} */
9659  smashmargin = 0; } /* don't smash internal blanks */
9660 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9661 now convert \font{abc} --> {\font~abc}, or convert ABC to \calA\calB\calC
9662 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9663 if ( 1 || class<0 ) /* not character-by-character */
9664  {
9665  /* ---
9666  if \font not immediately followed by { then it has no arg, so just set flag
9667  ------------------------------------------------------------------------ */
9668  if ( *(*expression) != '{' ) /* no \font arg, so just set flag */
9669  {
9670  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 )
9671  fprintf(msgfp,"rastfont> \\%s rastflags() for font#%d\n",name,ifontnum);
9672  fontsp = rastflags(expression,size,basesp,ISFONTFAM,ifontnum,arg3);
9673  goto end_of_job;
9674  } /* --- end-of-if(*(*expression)!='{') --- */
9675  /* ---
9676  convert \font{abc} --> {\font~abc}
9677  ---------------------------------- */
9678  /* --- parse for {fontchars} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
9679  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,fontchars,0,"{","}",0,0);
9680  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 )
9681  fprintf(msgfp,"rastfont> \\%s fontchars=\"%s\"\n",name,fontchars);
9682  /* --- convert all fontchars at the same time --- */
9683  strcpy(subexpr,"{"); /* start off with opening { */
9684  strcat(subexpr,name); /* followed by font name */
9685  strcat(subexpr,"~"); /* followed by whitespace */
9686  strcat(subexpr,fontchars); /* followed by all the chars */
9687  strcat(subexpr,"}"); /* terminate with closing } */
9688  } /* --- end-of-if(class<0) --- */
9689 else /* character-by-character */
9690  {
9691  /* ---
9692  convert ABC to \calA\calB\calC
9693  ------------------------------ */
9694  int isprevchar=0; /* true if prev char converted */
9695  /* --- parse for {fontchars} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
9696  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,fontchars,0,"{","}",0,0);
9697  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 )
9698  fprintf(msgfp,"rastfont> \\%s fontchars=\"%s\"\n",name,fontchars);
9699  /* --- convert fontchars one at a time --- */
9700  strcpy(subexpr,"{\\rm~"); /* start off with opening {\rm */
9701  strcpy(subexpr,"{"); /* nope, just start off with { */
9702  for ( pfchars=fontchars; (fchar= *pfchars)!='\000'; pfchars++ )
9703  {
9704  if ( isthischar(fchar,WHITEMATH) ) /* some whitespace */
9705  { if ( 0 || istext ) /* and we're in a text mode font */
9706  strcat(subexpr,"\\;"); } /* so respect whitespace */
9707  else /* char to be displayed in font */
9708  { int exprlen = 0; /* #chars in subexpr before fchar */
9709  int isinclass = 0; /* set true if fchar in font class */
9710  /* --- class: 1=upper, 2=alpha, 3=alnum, 4=lower, 5=digit, 9=all --- */
9711  switch ( class ) /* check if fchar is in font class */
9712  { default: break; /* no chars in unrecognized class */
9713  case 1: if ( isupper((int)fchar) ) isinclass=1; break;
9714  case 2: if ( isalpha((int)fchar) ) isinclass=1; break;
9715  case 3: if ( isalnum((int)fchar) ) isinclass=1; break;
9716  case 4: if ( islower((int)fchar) ) isinclass=1; break;
9717  case 5: if ( isdigit((int)fchar) ) isinclass=1; break;
9718  case 9: isinclass=1; break; }
9719  if ( isinclass ) /* convert current char to \font */
9720  { strcat(subexpr,name); /* by prefixing it with font name */
9721  isprevchar = 1; } /* and set flag to signal separator*/
9722  else /* current char not in \font */
9723  { if ( isprevchar ) /* extra separator only after \font*/
9724  if ( isalpha(fchar) ) /* separator only before alpha */
9725  strcat(subexpr,"~"); /* need separator after \font */
9726  isprevchar = 0; } /* reset flag for next char */
9727  exprlen = strlen(subexpr); /* #chars so far */
9728  subexpr[exprlen] = fchar; /*fchar immediately after \fontname*/
9729  subexpr[exprlen+1] = '\000'; } /* replace terminating '\0' */
9730  } /* --- end-of-for(pfchars) --- */
9731  strcat(subexpr,"}"); /* add closing } */
9732  } /* --- end-of-if/else(class<0) --- */
9733 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9734 rasterize subexpression containing chars to be rendered at font
9735 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9736 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 )
9737  fprintf(msgfp,"rastfont> subexpr=\"%s\"\n",subexpr);
9738 if ( (fontsp = rasterize(subexpr,size)) /* rasterize chars in font */
9739 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
9740 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9741 back to caller with chars rendered in font
9742 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9743 end_of_job:
9744  smashmargin = oldsmashmargin; /* restore smash */
9745  mathsmashmargin = SMASHMARGIN; /* this one probably not necessary */
9746  if ( istext && fontsp!=NULL ) /* raster contains text mode font */
9747  fontsp->type = blanksignal; /* signal nosmash */
9748  return ( fontsp ); /* chars rendered in font */
9749 } /* --- end-of-function rastfont() --- */
9750 
9751 
9752 /* ==========================================================================
9753  * Function: rastbegin ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
9754  * Purpose: \begin{}...\end{} handler, returns a subraster corresponding
9755  * to array expression within environment, i.e., rewrites
9756  * \begin{}...\end{} as mimeTeX equivalent, and rasterizes that.
9757  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9758  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
9759  * string immediately following \begin to be
9760  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
9761  * following last character processed.
9762  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
9763  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
9764  * immediately preceding \begin
9765  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
9766  * arg1 (I) int unused
9767  * arg2 (I) int unused
9768  * arg3 (I) int unused
9769  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9770  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to array
9771  * expression, or NULL for any parsing error
9772  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9773  * Notes: o
9774  * ======================================================================= */
9775 /* --- entry point --- */
9776 subraster *rastbegin ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
9777  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
9778 {
9779 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9780 Allocations and Declarations
9781 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9782 char *texsubexpr(), subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ+1], /* \begin{} environment params*/
9783  *exprptr=NULL,*begptr=NULL,*endptr=NULL,*braceptr=NULL; /* ptrs */
9784 char *begtoken="\\begin{", *endtoken="\\end{"; /*tokens we're looking for*/
9785 int strreplace(); /* replace substring in string */
9786 char *strchange(); /*\begin...\end --> {\begin...\end}*/
9787 char *delims = (char *)NULL; /* mdelims[ienviron] */
9788 subraster *rasterize(), *sp=NULL; /* rasterize environment */
9789 int ienviron = 0; /* environs[] index */
9790 int nbegins = 0; /* #\begins nested beneath this one*/
9791 int envlen=0, sublen=0; /* #chars in environ, subexpr */
9792 static int blevel = 0; /* \begin...\end nesting level */
9793 static char *mdelims[] = { NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL,
9794  "()","[]","{}","||","==", /* for pbBvVmatrix */
9795  NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, "{.", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL,
9796  NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL };
9797 static char *environs[] = { /* types of environments we process*/
9798  "eqnarray", /* 0 eqnarray environment */
9799  "array", /* 1 array environment */
9800  "matrix", /* 2 array environment */
9801  "tabular", /* 3 array environment */
9802  "pmatrix", /* 4 ( ) */
9803  "bmatrix", /* 5 [ ] */
9804  "Bmatrix", /* 6 { } */
9805  "vmatrix", /* 7 | | */
9806  "Vmatrix", /* 8 || || */
9807  "gather", /* 9 gather environment */
9808  "align", /* 10 align environment */
9809  "verbatim", /* 11 verbatim environment */
9810  "picture", /* 12 picture environment */
9811  "cases", /* 13 cases environment */
9812  "equation", /* 14 for \begin{equation} */
9813  NULL }; /* trailer */
9814 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
9815 determine type of environment we're beginning
9816 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
9817 /* --- first bump nesting level --- */
9818 blevel++; /* count \begin...\begin...'s */
9819 /* --- \begin must be followed by {type_of_environment} --- */
9820 exprptr = texsubexpr(*expression,subexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
9821 if ( *subexpr == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* no environment given */
9822 while ( (delims=strchr(subexpr,'*')) != NULL ) /* have environment* */
9823  {strsqueeze(delims,1);} /* treat it as environment */
9824 /* --- look up environment in our table --- */
9825 for ( ienviron=0; ;ienviron++ ) /* search table till NULL */
9826  if ( environs[ienviron] == NULL ) /* found NULL before match */
9827  goto end_of_job; /* so quit */
9828  else /* see if we have an exact match */
9829  if ( memcmp(environs[ienviron],subexpr,strlen(subexpr)) == 0 ) /*match*/
9830  break; /* leave loop with ienviron index */
