11152 /* --- rescale coords so we start at 0,0 --- */
11153 r0 -= rmin; c0 -= cmin; /* rescale r0,c0 */
11154 r1 -= rmin; c1 -= cmin; /* rescale r1,c1 */
11155 rt -= rmin; ct -= cmin; /* rescale rt,ct */
11156 /* --- flip rows so 0,0 becomes lower-left corner instead of upper-left--- */
11157 r0 = rdelta - r0 + 1; /* map 0-->height-1, height-1-->0 */
11158 r1 = rdelta - r1 + 1;
11159 rt = rdelta - rt + 1;
11160 /* --- determine width,height of raster needed for bezier --- */
11161 width = (int)(cdelta + 0.9999) + 1; /* round width up */
11162 height = (int)(rdelta + 0.9999) + 1; /* round height up */
11163 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=29 ) /* debugging */
11164  fprintf(msgfp,"rastbezier> width,height,origin=%d,%d,%d; c0,r0=%g,%g; "
11165  "c1,r1=%g,%g\n rmin,mid,max=%g,%g,%g; cmin,mid,max=%g,%g,%g\n",
11166  width,height,origin, c0,r0, c1,r1, rmin,rmid,rmax, cmin,cmid,cmax);
11167 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11168 allocate raster
11169 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11170 /* --- sanity check on width,height args --- */
11171 if ( width < 1 || width > maxwidth
11172 || height < 1 || height > maxheight ) goto end_of_job;
11173 /* --- allocate and initialize subraster for constructed bezier --- */
11174 if ( (bezsp=new_subraster(width,height,pixsz)) /* allocate new subraster */
11175 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
11176 /* --- initialize bezier subraster parameters --- */
11177 bezsp->type = IMAGERASTER; /* image */
11178 bezsp->symdef = NULL; /* not applicable for image */
11179 bezsp->baseline = height/2 + 2; /* is a little above center good? */
11180 bezsp->size = size; /* size (probably unneeded) */
11181 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11182 draw the bezier
11183 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11184 bezier_raster ( bezsp->image, /* embedded raster image */
11185  r0, c0, /* row0,col0 are lower-left corner */
11186  r1, c1, /* row1,col1 are upper-right */
11187  rt, ct ); /* bezier tangent point */
11188 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11189 return constructed bezier to caller
11190 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11191 end_of_job:
11192  if ( workingparam != NULL ) /* caller wants origin */
11193  *workingparam = origin; /* return center origin to caller */
11194  return ( bezsp ); /* return bezier to caller */
11195 } /* --- end-of-function rastbezier() --- */
11196 
11197 
11198 /* ==========================================================================
11199  * Function: rastraise ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
11200  * Purpose: \raisebox{lift}{subexpression} handler, returns subraster
11201  * containing subexpression with its baseline "lifted" by lift
11202  * pixels, scaled by \unitlength, or "lowered" if lift arg
11203  * negative
11204  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11205  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
11206  * string immediately following \raisebox to be
11207  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
11208  * following last character processed.
11209  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
11210  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
11211  * immediately preceding \raisebox
11212  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
11213  * arg1 (I) int unused
11214  * arg2 (I) int unused
11215  * arg3 (I) int unused
11216  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11217  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to \raisebox
11218  * requested, or NULL for any parsing error
11219  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11220  * Notes: o Summary of syntax...
11221  * \raisebox{lift}{subexpression}
11222  * o
11223  * ======================================================================= */
11224 /* --- entry point --- */
11225 subraster *rastraise ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
11226  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
11227 {
11228 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11229 Allocations and Declarations
11230 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11231 char *texsubexpr(), subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ+1], *liftexpr=subexpr; /* args */
11232 subraster *rasterize(), *raisesp=NULL; /* rasterize subexpr to be raised */
11233 int lift=0; /* amount to raise/lower baseline */
11234 int evalterm(); /* evaluate [arg],{arg} expressions*/
11235 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11236 obtain {lift} argument immediately following \raisebox command
11237 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11238 rastlift = 0; /* reset global lift adjustment */
11239 /* --- parse for {lift} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
11240 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,liftexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
11241 if ( *liftexpr == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* couldn't get {lift} */
11242 lift = eround(liftexpr); /* {lift} to integer */
11243 if ( abs(lift) > 200 ) lift=0; /* sanity check */
11244 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11245 obtain {subexpr} argument after {lift}, and rasterize it
11246 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11247 /* --- parse for {subexpr} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
11248 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,subexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
11249 /* --- rasterize subexpression to be raised/lowered --- */
11250 if ( (raisesp = rasterize(subexpr,size)) /* rasterize subexpression */
11251 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
11252 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11253 raise/lower baseline and return it to caller
11254 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11255 /* --- raise/lower baseline --- */
11256 raisesp->baseline += lift; /* new baseline (no height checks) */
11257 rastlift = lift; /* set global to signal adjustment */
11258 /* --- return raised subexpr to caller --- */
11259 end_of_job:
11260  return ( raisesp ); /* return raised subexpr to caller */
11261 } /* --- end-of-function rastraise() --- */
11262 
11263 
11264 /* ==========================================================================
11265  * Function: rastrotate ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
11266  * Purpose: \rotatebox{degrees}{subexpression} handler, returns subraster
11267  * containing subexpression rotated by degrees (counterclockwise
11268  * if degrees positive)
11269  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11270  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
11271  * string immediately following \rotatebox to be
11272  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
11273  * following last character processed.
11274  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
11275  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
11276  * immediately preceding \rotatebox
11277  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
11278  * arg1 (I) int unused
11279  * arg2 (I) int unused
11280  * arg3 (I) int unused
11281  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11282  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to \rotatebox
11283  * requested, or NULL for any parsing error
11284  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11285  * Notes: o Summary of syntax...
11286  * \rotatebox{degrees}{subexpression}
11287  * o
11288  * ======================================================================= */
11289 /* --- entry point --- */
11290 subraster *rastrotate ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
11291  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
11292 {
11293 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11294 Allocations and Declarations
11295 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11296 char *texsubexpr(), subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ+1], *degexpr=subexpr; /* args */
11297 subraster *rasterize(), *rotsp=NULL; /* subraster for rotated subexpr */
11298 raster *rastrot(), *rotrp=NULL; /* rotate subraster->image 90 degs */
11299 int delete_raster(); /* delete intermediate rasters */
11300 int baseline=0; /* baseline of rasterized image */
11301 double degrees=0.0, ipart,fpart; /* degrees to be rotated */
11302 int idegrees=0, isneg=0; /* positive ipart, isneg=1 if neg */
11303 int n90=0, isn90=1; /* degrees is n90 multiples of 90 */
11304 int evalterm(); /* evaluate [arg],{arg} expressions*/
11305 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11306 obtain {degrees} argument immediately following \rotatebox command
11307 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11308 /* --- parse for {degrees} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
11309 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,degexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
11310 if ( *degexpr == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* couldn't get {degrees} */
11311 degrees = (double)evalterm(mimestore,degexpr); /* degrees to be rotated */
11312 if ( degrees < 0.0 ) /* clockwise rotation desired */
11313  { degrees = -degrees; /* flip sign so degrees positive */
11314  isneg = 1; } /* and set flag to indicate flip */
11315 fpart = modf(degrees,&ipart); /* integer and fractional parts */
11316 ipart = (double)(((int)degrees)%360); /* degrees mod 360 */
11317 degrees = ipart + fpart; /* restore fractional part */
11318 if ( isneg ) /* if clockwise rotation requested */
11319  degrees = 360.0 - degrees; /* do equivalent counterclockwise */
11320 idegrees = (int)(degrees+0.5); /* integer degrees */
11321 n90 = idegrees/90; /* degrees is n90 multiples of 90 */
11322 isn90 = (90*n90==idegrees); /*true if degrees is multiple of 90*/
11323 isn90 = 1; /* forced true for time being */
11324 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11325 obtain {subexpr} argument after {degrees}, and rasterize it
11326 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11327 /* --- parse for {subexpr} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
11328 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,subexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
11329 /* --- rasterize subexpression to be rotated --- */
11330 if ( (rotsp = rasterize(subexpr,size)) /* rasterize subexpression */
11331 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
11332 /* --- return unmodified image if no rotation requested --- */
11333 if ( abs(idegrees) < 2 ) goto end_of_job; /* don't bother rotating image */
11334 /* --- extract params for image to be rotated --- */
11335 rotrp = rotsp->image; /* unrotated rasterized image */
11336 baseline = rotsp->baseline; /* and baseline of that image */
11337 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11338 rotate by multiples of 90 degrees
11339 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11340 if ( isn90 ) /* rotation by multiples of 90 */
11341  if ( n90 > 0 ) /* do nothing for 0 degrees */
11342  {
11343  n90 = 4-n90; /* rasrot() rotates clockwise */
11344  while ( n90 > 0 ) /* still have remaining rotations */
11345  { raster *nextrp = rastrot(rotrp); /* rotate raster image */
11346  if ( nextrp == NULL ) break; /* something's terribly wrong */
11347  delete_raster(rotrp); /* free previous raster image */
11348  rotrp = nextrp; /* and replace it with rotated one */
11349  n90--; } /* decrement remaining count */
11350  } /* --- end-of-if(isn90) --- */
11351 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11352 requested rotation not multiple of 90 degrees
11353 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11354 if ( !isn90 ) /* explicitly construct rotation */
11355  { ; } /* not yet implemented */
11356 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11357 re-populate subraster envelope with rotated image
11358 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11359 /* --- re-init various subraster parameters, embedding raster in it --- */
11360 if ( rotrp != NULL ) /* rotated raster constructed okay */
11361  { rotsp->type = IMAGERASTER; /* signal constructed image */
11362  rotsp->image = rotrp; /* raster we just constructed */
11363  /* --- now try to guess pleasing baseline --- */
11364  if ( idegrees > 2 ) { /* leave unchanged if unrotated */
11365  if ( strlen(subexpr) < 3 /* we rotated a short expression */
11366  || abs(idegrees-180) < 3 ) /* or just turned it upside-down */
11367  baseline = rotrp->height - 1; /* so set with nothing descending */
11368  else /* rotated a long expression */
11369  baseline = (65*(rotrp->height-1))/100; } /* roughly center long expr */
11370  rotsp->baseline = baseline; } /* set baseline as calculated above*/
11371 /* --- return rotated subexpr to caller --- */
11372 end_of_job:
11373  return ( rotsp ); /*return rotated subexpr to caller*/
11374 } /* --- end-of-function rastrotate() --- */
11375 
11376 
11377 /* ==========================================================================
11378  * Function: rastmagnify ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
11379  * Purpose: \magnify{magstep}{subexpression} handler, returns subraster
11380  * containing magnified subexpression
11381  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11382  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
11383  * string immediately following \reflectbox to
11384  * be rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
11385  * following last character processed.
11386  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
11387  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
11388  * immediately preceding \reflectbox
11389  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
11390  * arg1 (I) int unused
11391  * arg2 (I) int unused
11392  * arg3 (I) int unused
11393  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11394  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to \magnify
11395  * requested, or NULL for any parsing error
11396  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11397  * Notes: o Summary of syntax...
11398  * \magnify{magstep}{subexpression}
11399  * o
11400  * ======================================================================= */
11401 /* --- entry point --- */
11402 subraster *rastmagnify ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
11403  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
11404 {
11405 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11406 Allocations and Declarations
11407 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11408 char *texsubexpr(), subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ+1], *magexpr=subexpr; /* args */
11409 subraster *rasterize(), *magsp=NULL; /* subraster for magnified subexpr */
11410 raster *rastmag(), *magrp=NULL; /* magnify subraster->image */
11411 int magstep = 1; /* default magnification */
11412 int delete_raster(); /* delete intermediate raster */
11413 int baseline=0; /* baseline of rasterized image */
11414 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11415 obtain {magstep} argument immediately following \magnify command
11416 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11417 /* --- parse for {magstep} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
11418 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,magexpr,255,"{","}",0,0);
11419 magstep = atoi(magexpr); /* convert {magstep} to int */
11420 if ( magstep<1 || magstep>10 ) /* check magstep input */
11421  magstep = 1; /* back to default if illegal */
11422 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11423 obtain {subexpr} argument after {magstep}, and rasterize it
11424 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11425 /* --- parse for {subexpr} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
11426 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,subexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
11427 /* --- rasterize subexpression to be reflected --- */
11428 if ( (magsp = rasterize(subexpr,size)) /* rasterize subexpression */
11429 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
11430 /* --- return unmodified image if no magnification requested --- */
11431 if ( magstep<=1 ) goto end_of_job; /* don't bother magnifying image */
11432 /* --- extract params for image to be magnified --- */
11433 magrp = magsp->image; /* unmagnified rasterized image */
11434 baseline = magsp->baseline; /* and baseline of that image */
11435 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11436 magnify image and adjust its parameters
11437 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11438 /* --- magnify image --- */
11439 magrp = rastmag(magsp->image,magstep); /* magnify raster image */
11440 if ( magrp == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* failed to magnify image */
11441 delete_raster(magsp->image); /* free original raster image */
11442 magsp->image = magrp; /*and replace it with magnified one*/
11443 /* --- adjust parameters --- */
11444 baseline *= magstep; /* scale baseline */
11445 if ( baseline > 0 ) baseline += 1; /* adjust for no descenders */
11446 magsp->baseline = baseline; /*reset baseline of magnified image*/
11447 /* --- return magnified subexpr to caller --- */
11448 end_of_job:
11449  return ( magsp ); /*back to caller with magnified expr*/
11450 } /* --- end-of-function rastmagnify() --- */
11451 
11452 
11453 /* ==========================================================================
11454  * Function: rastreflect ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
11455  * Purpose: \reflectbox[axis]{subexpression} handler, returns subraster
11456  * containing subexpression reflected horizontally (i.e., around
11457  * vertical axis, |_ becomes _|) if [axis] not given or axis=1,
11458  * or reflected vertically if axis=2 given.
11459  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11460  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
11461  * string immediately following \reflectbox to
11462  * be rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
11463  * following last character processed.
11464  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
11465  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
11466  * immediately preceding \reflectbox
11467  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
11468  * arg1 (I) int unused
11469  * arg2 (I) int unused
11470  * arg3 (I) int unused
11471  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11472  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to \reflectbox
11473  * requested, or NULL for any parsing error
11474  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11475  * Notes: o Summary of syntax...
11476  * \reflectbox[axis]{subexpression}
11477  * o
11478  * ======================================================================= */
11479 /* --- entry point --- */
11480 subraster *rastreflect ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
11481  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
11482 {
11483 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11484 Allocations and Declarations
11485 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11486 char *texsubexpr(), subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ+1], *axisexpr=subexpr; /* args */
11487 subraster *rasterize(), *refsp=NULL; /* subraster for reflected subexpr */
11488 raster *rastref(), *refrp=NULL; /* reflect subraster->image */
11489 int axis = 1; /* default horizontal reflection */
11490 int delete_raster(); /* delete intermediate raster */
11491 int baseline=0; /* baseline of rasterized image */
11492 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11493 obtain [axis] argument immediately following \reflectbox command, if given
11494 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11495 /* --- check for optional [axis] arg --- */
11496 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /*check for []-enclosed optional arg*/
11497  { *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,axisexpr,255,"[","]",0,0);
11498  axis = atoi(axisexpr); /* convert [axis] to int */
11499  if ( axis<1 || axis>2 ) /* check axis input */
11500  axis = 1; } /* back to default if illegal */
11501 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11502 obtain {subexpr} argument after optional [axis], and rasterize it
11503 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11504 /* --- parse for {subexpr} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
11505 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,subexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
11506 /* --- rasterize subexpression to be reflected --- */
11507 if ( (refsp = rasterize(subexpr,size)) /* rasterize subexpression */
11508 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* and quit if failed */
11509 /* --- return unmodified image if no reflection requested --- */
11510 if ( axis<1 || axis>2 ) goto end_of_job; /* don't bother reflecting image */
11511 /* --- extract params for image to be reflected --- */
11512 refrp = refsp->image; /* unreflected rasterized image */
11513 baseline = refsp->baseline; /* and baseline of that image */
11514 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11515 reflect image and adjust its parameters
11516 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11517 /* --- reflect image --- */
11518 refrp = rastref(refsp->image,axis); /* reflect raster image */
11519 if ( refrp == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* failed to reflect image */
11520 delete_raster(refsp->image); /* free original raster image */
11521 refsp->image = refrp; /*and replace it with reflected one*/
11522 /* --- adjust parameters --- */
11523 if ( axis == 2 ) /* for vertical reflection */
11524  baseline = refrp->height - 1; /* set with nothing descending */
11525 refsp->baseline = baseline; /* reset baseline of reflected image*/
11526 /* --- return reflected subexpr to caller --- */
11527 end_of_job:
11528  return ( refsp ); /*back to caller with reflected expr*/
11529 } /* --- end-of-function rastreflect() --- */
11530 
11531 
11532 /* ==========================================================================
11533  * Function: rastfbox ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
11534  * Purpose: \fbox{subexpression} handler, returns subraster
11535  * containing subexpression with frame box drawn around it
11536  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11537  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
11538  * string immediately following \fbox to be
11539  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
11540  * following last character processed.
11541  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
11542  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
11543  * immediately preceding \fbox
11544  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
11545  * arg1 (I) int unused
11546  * arg2 (I) int unused
11547  * arg3 (I) int unused
11548  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11549  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to \fbox
11550  * requested, or NULL for any parsing error
11551  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11552  * Notes: o Summary of syntax...
11553  * \fbox[width][height]{subexpression}
11554  * o
11555  * ======================================================================= */
11556 /* --- entry point --- */
11557 subraster *rastfbox ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
11558  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
11559 {
11560 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11561 Allocations and Declarations
11562 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11563 char *texsubexpr(), subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ+1], widtharg[512]; /* args */
11564 subraster *rasterize(), *framesp=NULL; /* rasterize subexpr to be framed */
11565 raster *border_raster(), *bp=NULL; /* framed image raster */
11566 int evalterm(), evalue=0; /* interpret [width][height] */
11567 int fwidth=6, fthick=1, /*extra frame width, line thickness*/
11568  fsides=0; /* frame sides: 1=left,2=top,4=right,8=bot */
11569 int width=(-1), height=(-1), /* optional [width][height] args */
11570  iscompose = 0; /* set true if optional args given */
11571 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11572 obtain optional [width][height] arguments immediately following \fbox
11573 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11574 /* --- first check for optional \fbox[width] --- */
11575 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) { /* check for []-enclosed width arg */
11576  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,widtharg,511,"[","]",0,0);
11577  if ( !isempty(widtharg) ) { /* got widtharg */
11578  char *comma = strchr(widtharg,','); /* look for [width,sides] */
11579  if ( comma == (char *)NULL ) /* no comma */
11580  comma = strchr(widtharg,';'); /* permit semicolon [width;sides] */
11581  if ( comma != (char *)NULL ) { /* optional [width,fsides] found */
11582  fsides = atoi(comma+1); /* interpret fsides after comma */
11583  if ( size < 5 ) /* for smaller fonts */
11584  { fwidth = 2; fthick = 1; } /* tighten frame, thinner accent */
11585  else { fwidth = 3; fthick = 2; } /* loosen frame, thicken accent */
11586  *comma = '\000'; /* null-terminate width at comma */
11587  trimwhite(widtharg); } /*remove leading/trailing whitespace*/
11588  if ( comma==(char *)NULL || !isempty(widtharg) ) { /* have a width */
11589  height = 1; /* default explicit height, too */
11590  if ( fsides == 0 ) { /* a normal framebox */
11591  evalue = eround(widtharg); /* interpret and scale width */
11592  width = max2(1,evalue); /* must be >0 */
11593  fwidth = 2; iscompose = 1; }
11594  else /* absolute pixels for "accents" */
11595  width = evalterm(mimestore,widtharg); }
11596  } /* --- end-of-if(!isempty(widtharg)) --- */
11597  } /* --- end-of-if(**expression=='[') --- */
11598 if ( width > 0 || fsides > 0) /* found leading [width], so... */
11599  if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /* check for []-enclosed height arg */
11600  { *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,widtharg,511,"[","]",0,0);
11601  if ( !isempty(widtharg) ) { /* got widtharg */
11602  if ( fsides == 0 ) { /* a normal framebox */
11603  evalue = eround(widtharg); /* interpret and scale height */
11604  height = max2(1,evalue); /* must be >0 */
11605  fwidth = 0; } /* no extra border */
11606  else /* absolute pixels for "accents" */
11607  height = evalterm(mimestore,widtharg); }
11608  } /* --- end-of-if(**expression=='[') --- */
11609 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11610 obtain {subexpr} argument
11611 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11612 /* --- parse for {subexpr} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
11613 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,subexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
11614 /* --- rasterize subexpression to be framed --- */
11615 if ( width<0 || height<0 ) /* no explicit dimensions given */
11616  { if ( (framesp = rasterize(subexpr,size)) /* rasterize subexpression */
11617  == NULL ) goto end_of_job; } /* and quit if failed */
11618 else
11619  { char composexpr[8192]; /* compose subexpr with empty box */
11620  sprintf(composexpr,"\\compose{\\hspace{%d}\\vspace{%d}}{%.8000s}",
11621  width,height,subexpr);
11622  if ( (framesp = rasterize(composexpr,size)) /* rasterize subexpression */
11623  == NULL ) goto end_of_job; } /* and quit if failed */
11624 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11625 draw frame, reset params, and return it to caller
11626 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11627 /* --- draw border --- */
11628 if ( fsides > 0 ) fthick += (100*fsides); /* embed fsides in fthick arg */
11629 if ( (bp = border_raster(framesp->image,-fwidth,-fwidth,fthick,1))
11630 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* draw border and quit if failed */
11631 /* --- replace original image and raise baseline to accommodate frame --- */
11632 framesp->image = bp; /* replace image with framed one */
11633 if ( !iscompose ) /* simple border around subexpr */
11634  framesp->baseline += fwidth; /* so just raise baseline */
11635 else
11636  framesp->baseline = (framesp->image)->height - 1; /* set at bottom */
11637 /* --- return framed subexpr to caller --- */
11638 end_of_job:
11639  return ( framesp ); /* return framed subexpr to caller */
11640 } /* --- end-of-function rastfbox() --- */
11641 
11642 
11643 /* ==========================================================================
11644  * Function: rastinput ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
11645  * Purpose: \input{filename} handler, reads filename and returns
11646  * subraster containing image of expression read from filename
11647  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11648  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
11649  * string immediately following \input to be
11650  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
11651  * following last character processed.
11652  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
11653  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
11654  * immediately preceding \input
11655  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
11656  * arg1 (I) int unused
11657  * arg2 (I) int unused
11658  * arg3 (I) int unused
11659  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11660  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to expression
11661  * in filename, or NULL for any parsing error
11662  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11663  * Notes: o Summary of syntax...
11664  * \input{filename} reads entire file named filename
11665  * \input{filename:tag} reads filename, but returns only
11666  * those characters between <tag>...</tag> in that file.
11667  * o
11668  * ======================================================================= */
11669 /* --- entry point --- */
11670 subraster *rastinput ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
11671  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
11672 {
11673 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11674 Allocations and Declarations
11675 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11676 char *texsubexpr(), tag[1024]="\000", filename[1024]="\000"; /* args */
11677 subraster *rasterize(), *inputsp=NULL; /* rasterized input image */
11678 int status, rastreadfile(); /* read input file */
11679 int format=0, npts=0; /* don't reformat (numerical) input */
11680 int isinput = (seclevel<=inputseclevel?1:0); /*true if \input permitted*/
11681 /*int evalterm();*/ /* evaluate expressions */
11682 char *inputpath = INPUTPATH; /* permitted \input{} paths for any user */
11683 int isstrstr(); /* search for valid inputpath in filename */
11684 char subexpr[MAXFILESZ+1] = "\000", /*concatanated lines from input file*/
11685  *mimeprep(), /* preprocess inputted data */
11686  *dbltoa(), *reformat=NULL; /* reformat numerical input */
11687 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11688 obtain [tag]{filename} argument
11689 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11690 /* --- parse for optional [tag] or [fmt] arg, bump expression past it --- */
11691 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /* check for []-enclosed value */
11692  { char argfld[MAXTOKNSZ+1]; /* optional argument field */
11693  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,argfld,MAXTOKNSZ-1,"[","]",0,0);
11694  if ( (reformat=strstr(argfld,"dtoa")) != NULL ) /*dtoa/dbltoa requested*/
11695  { format = 1; /* signal dtoa()/dbltoa() format */
11696  if ( (reformat=strchr(reformat,'=')) != NULL ) /* have dtoa= */
11697  npts = (int)strtol(reformat+1,NULL,0); } /* so set npts */
11698  if ( format == 0 ) { /* reformat not requested */
11699  strninit(tag,argfld,1020); } } /* so interpret arg as tag */
11700 /* --- parse for {filename} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
11701 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,filename,1020,"{","}",0,0);
11702 /* --- check for alternate filename:tag --- */
11703 if ( !isempty(filename) /* got filename */
11704 /*&& isempty(tag)*/ ) /* but no [tag] */
11705  { char *delim = strchr(filename,':'); /* look for : in filename:tag */
11706  if ( delim != (char *)NULL ) /* found it */
11707  { *delim = '\000'; /* null-terminate filename at : */
11708  strninit(tag,delim+1,1020); } } /* and stuff after : is tag */
11709 /* --- check filename for an inputpath valid for all users --- */
11710 if ( !isinput /* if this user can't \input{} */
11711 && !isempty(filename) /* and we got a filename */
11712 && !isempty(inputpath) ) /* and an inputpath */
11713  if ( isstrstr(filename,inputpath,0) ) /* filename has allowed inputpath */
11714  isinput = 1; /* okay to \input{} this filename */
11715 /* --- guard against recursive runaway (e.g., file \input's itself) --- */
11716 if ( ++ninputcmds > 8 ) /* max \input's per expression */
11717  isinput = 0; /* flip flag off after the max */
11718 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11719 Read file (and convert to numeric if [dtoa] option was given)
11720 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11721 if ( isinput ) { /* user permitted to use \input{} */
11722  status = rastreadfile(filename,0,tag,subexpr); /* read file */
11723  if ( *subexpr == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if problem */
11724  /* --- rasterize input subexpression --- */
11725  mimeprep(subexpr); /* preprocess subexpression */
11726  if ( format == 1 ) { /* dtoa()/dbltoa() */
11727  double d = strtod(subexpr,NULL); /* interpret subexpr as double */
11728  if ( d != 0.0 ) /* conversion to double successful */
11729  if ( (reformat=dbltoa(d,npts)) != NULL ) /* reformat successful */
11730  strcpy(subexpr,reformat); } /*replace subexpr with reformatted*/
11731  } /* --- end-of-if(isinput) --- */
11732 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11733 emit error message for unauthorized users trying to use \input{}
11734 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11735 else { /* inputseclevel > seclevel */
11736  sprintf(subexpr,
11737  "\\ \\text{[\\backslash input\\lbrace %.128s\\rbrace\\ not permitted]}\\ ",
11738  (isempty(filename)?"???":filename));
11739  } /* --- end-of-if/else(isinput) --- */
11740 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11741 Rasterize constructed subexpression
11742 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11743 inputsp = rasterize(subexpr,size); /* rasterize subexpression */
11744 /* --- return input image to caller --- */
11745 end_of_job:
11746  return ( inputsp ); /* return input image to caller */
11747 } /* --- end-of-function rastinput() --- */
11748 
11749 
11750 /* ==========================================================================
11751  * Function: rastcounter ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
11752  * Purpose: \counter[value]{filename} handler, returns subraster
11753  * containing image of counter value read from filename
11754  * (or optional [value]), and increments counter
11755  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11756  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
11757  * string immediately following \counter to be
11758  * rasterized, and returning ptr immediately
11759  * following last character processed.
11760  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
11761  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
11762  * immediately preceding \counter
11763  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
11764  * arg1 (I) int unused
11765  * arg2 (I) int unused
11766  * arg3 (I) int unused
11767  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11768  * Returns: ( subraster * ) ptr to subraster corresponding to \counter
11769  * requested, or NULL for any parsing error
11770  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11771  * Notes: o Summary of syntax...
11772  * \counter[value][logfile]{filename:tag}
11773  * o :tag is optional
11774  * ======================================================================= */
11775 /* --- entry point --- */
11776 subraster *rastcounter ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
11777  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
11778 {
11779 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11780 Allocations and Declarations
11781 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11782 char *texsubexpr(), filename[1024]="\000", /* counter file */
11783  logfile[1024]="\000", tag[1024]="\000"; /*optional log file and tag*/
11784 subraster *rasterize(), *countersp=NULL; /* rasterized counter image */
11785 FILE /* *fp=NULL,*/ *logfp=NULL; /* counter and log file pointers */
11786 int status=0,rastreadfile(),rastwritefile(), /*read,write counter file*/
11787  iscounter = (seclevel<=counterseclevel?1:0), /*is \counter permitted*/
11788  isstrict = 1; /* true to only write to existing files */
11789 char text[MAXFILESZ] = "1_", /* only line in counter file without tags */
11790  *delim = NULL, /* delimiter in text */
11791  utext[128] = "1_", /* default delimiter */
11792  *udelim = utext+1; /* underscore delimiter */
11793 char *rasteditfilename(), /* edit log file name */
11794  *timestamp(), /* timestamp for logging */
11795  *dbltoa(); /* double to comma-separated ascii */
11796 int counter = 1, /* atoi(text) (after _ removed, if present) */
11797  value = 1, /* optional [value] argument */
11798  gotvalue = 0, /* set true if [value] supplied */
11799  isdelta = 0, /* set true if [+value] or [-value] is delta*/
11800  ordindex = (-1); /* ordinal[] index to append ordinal suffix */
11801 /*--- ordinal suffixes based on units digit of counter ---*/
11802 static char *ordinal[]={"th","st","nd","rd","th","th","th","th","th","th"};
11803 static char *logvars[]={"REMOTE_ADDR","HTTP_REFERER",NULL}; /* log vars*/
11804 static int commentvar = 1; /* logvars[commentvar] replaced by comment */
11805 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11806 first obtain optional [value][logfile] args immediately following \counter
11807 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11808 /* --- first check for optional \counter[value] --- */
11809 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /* check for []-enclosed value */
11810  { *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,text,1023,"[","]",0,0);
11811  if ( *text != '\000' ) /* got counter value (or logfile) */
11812  if ( strlen(text) >= 1 ) { /* and it's not an empty string */
11813  if ( isthischar(*text,"+-0123456789") ) /* check for leading +-digit */
11814  gotvalue = 1; /* signal we got optional value */
11815  else /* not +-digit, so must be logfile */
11816  strcpy(logfile,text); } /* so just copy it */
11817  } /* --- end-of-if(**expression=='[') --- */
11818 /* --- next check for optional \counter[][logfile] --- */
11819 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /* check for []-enclosed logfile */
11820  { *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,filename,1023,"[","]",0,0);
11821  if ( *filename != '\000' ) /* got logfile (or counter value) */
11822  if ( strlen(filename) >= 1 ) { /* and it's not an empty string */
11823  if ( !(isthischar(*text,"+-0123456789")) /* not a leading +-digit */
11824  || gotvalue ) /* or we already got counter value */
11825  strcpy(logfile,filename); /* so just copy it */
11826  else /* leading +-digit must be value */
11827  { strcpy(text,filename); /* copy value to text line */
11828  gotvalue = 1; } } /* and signal we got optional value*/
11829  } /* --- end-of-if(**expression=='[') --- */
11830 /* --- evaluate [value] if present --- */
11831 if ( gotvalue ) { /*leading +-digit should be in text*/
11832  if ( *text == '+' ) isdelta = (+1); /* signal adding */
11833  if ( *text == '-' ) isdelta = (-1); /* signal subtracting */
11834  value = (int)(strtod((isdelta==0?text:text+1),&udelim)+0.1); /*abs(value)*/
11835  if ( isdelta == (-1) ) value = (-value); /* set negative value if needed */
11836  counter = value; /* re-init counter */
11837  } /* --- end-of-if(gotvalue) --- */
11838 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11839 obtain counter {filename} argument
11840 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11841 /* --- parse for {filename} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
11842 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,filename,1023,"{","}",0,0);
11843 /* --- check for counter filename:tag --- */
11844 if ( *filename != '\000' ) /* got filename */
11845  if ( (delim=strchr(filename,':')) /* look for : in filename:tag */
11846  != (char *)NULL ) /* found it */
11847  { *delim = '\000'; /* null-terminate filename at : */
11848  strcpy(tag,delim+1); } /* and stuff after : is tag */
11849 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11850 emit error message for unauthorized users trying to use \counter{}
11851 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11852 if ( !iscounter ) { /* counterseclevel > seclevel */
11853  sprintf(text,
11854  "\\ \\text{[\\backslash counter\\lbrace %.128s\\rbrace\\ not permitted]}\\ ",
11855  (isempty(filename)?"???":filename));
11856  goto rasterize_counter; /* rasterize error message */
11857  } /* --- end-of-if(!iscounter) --- */
11858 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11859 Read and parse file, increment and rewrite counter (with optional underscore)
11860 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11861 if ( strlen(filename) > 1 ) /* make sure we got {filename} arg */
11862  {
11863  /* --- read and interpret first (and only) line from counter file --- */
11864  if ( !gotvalue || (isdelta!=0) ) /*if no [count] arg or if delta arg*/
11865  if ( (status=rastreadfile(filename,1,tag,text)) > 0 ) /*try reading file*/
11866  { char *vdelim = NULL; /* underscore delim from file */
11867  double fileval = strtod(text,&vdelim); /* value and delim from file */
11868  counter = (int)(fileval<0.0?fileval-0.1:fileval+0.1); /* integerized */
11869  counter += value; /* bump count by 1 or add/sub delta*/
11870  if ( !gotvalue ) udelim=vdelim; } /* default to file's current delim */
11871  /* --- check for ordinal suffix --- */
11872  if ( udelim != (char *)NULL ) /* have some delim after value */
11873  if ( *udelim == '_' ) /* underscore signals ordinal */
11874  { int abscount = (counter>=0?counter:(-counter)); /* abs(counter) */
11875  ordindex = abscount%10; /* least significant digit */
11876  if ( abscount >= 10 ) /* counter is 10 or greater */
11877  if ( (abscount/10)%10 == 1 ) /* and the last two are 10-19 */
11878  ordindex = 0; } /* use th for 11,12,13 rather than st,nd,rd */
11879  /* --- rewrite counter file --- */
11880  if ( status >= 0 ) /* file was read okay */
11881  { sprintf(text,"%d",counter); /*build image of incremented counter*/
11882  if ( ordindex >= 0 ) strcat(text,"_"); /* tack on _ */
11883  if ( *tag == '\000' ) strcat(text,"\n"); /* and newline */
11884  status = rastwritefile(filename,tag,text,isstrict); } /*rewrite counter*/
11885  } /* --- end-of-if(strlen(filename)>1) --- */
11886 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11887 log counter request
11888 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11889 if ( strlen(logfile) > 1 ) /* optional [logfile] given */
11890  {
11891  char comment[1024] = "\000", /* embedded comment, logfile:comment*/
11892  *commptr = strchr(logfile,':'); /* check for : signalling comment */
11893  int islogokay = 1; /* logfile must exist if isstrict */
11894  if ( commptr != NULL ) /* have embedded comment */
11895  { strcpy(comment,commptr+1); /* comment follows : */
11896  *commptr = '\000'; } /* null-terminate actual logfile */
11897  strcpy(logfile,rasteditfilename(logfile)); /* edit log file name */
11898  if ( *logfile == '\000' ) islogokay = 0; /* given an invalid file name */
11899  else if ( isstrict ) { /*okay, but only write if it exists*/
11900  if ( (logfp=fopen(logfile,"r")) == (FILE *)NULL ) /*doesn't already exist*/
11901  islogokay = 0; /* so don't write log file */
11902  else fclose(logfp); } /* close file opened for test read */
11903  if ( islogokay ) /* okay to write logfile */
11904  if ( (logfp = fopen(logfile,"a")) /* open logfile */
11905  != (FILE *)NULL ) { /* opened successfully for append */
11906  int ilog=0; /* logvars[] index */
11907  fprintf(logfp,"%s ",timestamp(TZDELTA,0)); /* first emit timestamp */
11908  if (*tag=='\000') fprintf(logfp,"%s",filename); /* emit counter filename */
11909  else fprintf(logfp,"<%s>",tag); /* or tag if we have one */
11910  fprintf(logfp,"=%d",counter); /* emit counter value */
11911  if ( status < 1 ) /* read or re-write failed */
11912  fprintf(logfp,"(%s %d)","error status",status); /* emit error */
11913  for ( ilog=0; logvars[ilog] != NULL; ilog++ ) /* log till end-of-table */
11914  if ( ilog == commentvar /* replace with comment... */
11915  && commptr != NULL ) /* ...if available */
11916  fprintf(logfp," %.256s",comment); /* log embedded comment */
11917  else
11918  { char *logval = getenv(logvars[ilog]); /*getenv(variable) to be logged*/
11919  fprintf(logfp," %.64s", /* log variable */
11920  (logval!=NULL?logval:"<unknown>")); } /* emit value or <unknown> */
11921  fprintf(logfp,"\n"); /* terminating newline */
11922  fclose(logfp); /* close logfile */
11923  } /* --- end-of-if(islogokay&&logfp!=NULL) --- */
11924  } /* --- end-of-if(strlen(logfile)>1) --- */
11925 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11926 construct counter expression and rasterize it
11927 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11928 /* --- construct expression --- */
11929 /*sprintf(text,"%d",counter);*/ /* start with counter */
11930 strcpy(text,dbltoa(((double)counter),0)); /* comma-separated counter value */
11931 if ( ordindex >= 0 ) /* need to tack on ordinal suffix */
11932  { strcat(text,"^{\\underline{\\rm~"); /* start with ^ and {\underline{\rm */
11933  strcat(text,ordinal[ordindex]); /* then st,nd,rd, or th */
11934  strcat(text,"}}"); } /* finish with }} */
11935 /* --- rasterize it --- */
11936 rasterize_counter:
11937  countersp = rasterize(text,size); /* rasterize counter subexpression */
11938 /* --- return counter image to caller --- */
11939 /*end_of_job:*/
11940  return ( countersp ); /* return counter image to caller */
11941 } /* --- end-of-function rastcounter() --- */
11942 
11943 
11944 /* ==========================================================================
11945  * Function: rasteval ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
11946  * Purpose: handle \eval
11947  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11948  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
11949  * string immediately following \eval,
11950  * and returning ptr immediately
11951  * following last character processed.
11952  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
11953  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
11954  * immediately preceding \eval
11955  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
11956  * arg1 (I) int unused
11957  * arg2 (I) int unused
11958  * arg3 (I) int unused
11959  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11960  * Returns: ( subraster * ) subraster ptr to date stamp
11961  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11962  * Notes: o
11963  * ======================================================================= */
11964 /* --- entry point --- */
11965 subraster *rasteval ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
11966  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
11967 {
11968 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11969 Allocations and Declarations
11970 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11971 char *texsubexpr(), subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ]; /* arg to be evaluated */
11972 subraster *rasterize(), *evalsp=NULL; /* rasterize evaluated expression */
11973 int evalterm(), value=0; /* evaluate expression */
11974 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11975 Parse for subexpr to be \eval-uated, and bump expression past it
11976 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11977 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,subexpr,0,"{","}",0,0);
11978 if ( *subexpr == '\000' ) /* couldn't get subexpression */
11979  goto end_of_job; /* nothing to do, so quit */
11980 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
11981 Evaluate expression, ascii-ize integer result, rasterize it
11982 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
11983 /* --- evaluate expression --- */
11984 value = evalterm(mimestore,subexpr); /* evaluate expression */
11985 /* --- ascii-ize it --- */
11986 sprintf(subexpr,"%d",value); /* ascii version of value */
11987 /* --- rasterize ascii-ized expression value --- */
11988 evalsp = rasterize(subexpr,size); /* rasterize evaluated expression */
11989 /* --- return evaluated expression raster to caller --- */
11990 end_of_job:
11991  return ( evalsp ); /* return evaluated expr to caller */
11992 } /* --- end-of-function rasteval() --- */
11993 
11994 
11995 /* ==========================================================================
11996  * Function: rasttoday ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
11997  * Purpose: handle \today
11998  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
11999  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
12000  * string immediately following \today,
12001  * and returning ptr immediately
12002  * following last character processed.
12003  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
12004  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
12005  * immediately preceding \today
12006  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
12007  * arg1 (I) int unused
12008  * arg2 (I) int unused
12009  * arg3 (I) int unused
12010  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12011  * Returns: ( subraster * ) subraster ptr to date stamp
12012  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12013  * Notes: o
12014  * ======================================================================= */
12015 /* --- entry point --- */
12016 subraster *rasttoday ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
12017  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
12018 {
12019 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12020 Allocations and Declarations
12021 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12022 char *texsubexpr(), optarg[2050]; /* optional [+/-tzdelta,ifmt] args */
12023 char *timestamp(), *today=optarg; /* timestamp to be rasterized */
12024 subraster *rasterize(), *todaysp=NULL; /* rasterize timestamp */
12025 int ifmt=1, tzdelta=0; /* default timestamp() args */
12026 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12027 Get optional args \today[+/-tzdelta,ifmt]
12028 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12029 /* --- check for optional \today[+/-tzdelta,ifmt] --- */
12030 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /* check for []-enclosed value */
12031  { *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,optarg,2047,"[","]",0,0);
12032  if ( *optarg != '\000' ) /* got optional arg */
12033  { char *comma = strchr(optarg,','); /* comma between +/-tzdelta,ifmt */
12034  int iarg, nargs=(comma==NULL?1:2); /* #optional args between []'s */
12035  if ( comma != NULL ) *comma = '\000'; /* null-terminate first arg */
12036  for ( iarg=1; iarg<=nargs; iarg++ ) /* process one or both args */
12037  { char *arg = (iarg==1?optarg:comma+1); /* choose 1st or 2nd arg */
12038  if ( isthischar(*arg,"+-") ) /* leading +/- signals tzdelta */
12039  tzdelta = atoi(arg); /* so interpret arg as tzdelta */
12040  else ifmt = atoi(arg); } /* else interpret args as ifmt */
12041  } /* --- end-of-if(*optarg!='\0') --- */
12042  } /* --- end-of-if(**expression=='[') --- */
12043 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12044 Get timestamp and rasterize it
12045 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12046 strcpy(today,"\\text{"); /* rasterize timestamp as text */
12047 strcat(today,timestamp(tzdelta,ifmt)); /* get timestamp */
12048 strcat(today,"}"); /* terminate \text{} braces */
12049 todaysp = rasterize(today,size); /* rasterize timestamp */
12050 /* --- return timestamp raster to caller --- */
12051 /*end_of_job:*/
12052  return ( todaysp ); /* return timestamp to caller */
12053 } /* --- end-of-function rasttoday() --- */
12054 
12055 
12056 /* ==========================================================================
12057  * Function: rastcalendar ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
12058  * Purpose: handle \calendar
12059  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12060  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
12061  * string immediately following \calendar
12062  * and returning ptr immediately
12063  * following last character processed.
12064  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
12065  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
12066  * immediately preceding \calendar
12067  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
12068  * arg1 (I) int unused
12069  * arg2 (I) int unused
12070  * arg3 (I) int unused
12071  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12072  * Returns: ( subraster * ) subraster ptr to rendered one-month calendar
12073  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12074  * Notes: o
12075  * ======================================================================= */
12076 /* --- entry point --- */
12077 subraster *rastcalendar ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
12078  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
12079 {
12080 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12081 Allocations and Declarations
12082 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12083 char *texsubexpr(), optarg[2050]; /* optional [year,month] args */
12084 char *calendar(), *calstr=NULL; /* calendar to be rasterized */
12085 subraster *rasterize(), *calendarsp=NULL; /* rasterize calendar string */
12086 int year=0,month=0,day=0, argval=0; /* default calendar() args */
12087 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12088 Get optional args \today[+/-tzdelta,ifmt]
12089 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12090 /* --- check for optional \calendar[year,month] --- */
12091 if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) /* check for []-enclosed value */
12092  { *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,optarg,2047,"[","]",0,0);
12093  if ( *optarg != '\000' ) /* got optional arg */
12094  { char *comma = strchr(optarg,','), /* comma between year,month */
12095  *comma2 = NULL; /* second comma before day */
12096  int iarg, nargs=(comma==NULL?1:2); /* #optional args between []'s */
12097  if ( comma != NULL ) { *comma = '\000'; /*null-terminate first arg*/
12098  if ( (comma2=strchr(comma+1,',')) != NULL ) /* have third arg */
12099  { *comma2 = '\000'; nargs++; } } /* null-term 2nd arg, bump count */
12100  for ( iarg=1; iarg<=nargs; iarg++ ) /* process one or both args */
12101  { char *arg= (iarg==1?optarg:(iarg==2?comma+1:comma2+1)); /*get arg*/
12102  argval = atoi(arg); /* interpret arg as integer */
12103  if ( iarg < 3 ) /* first two args are month,year */
12104  {if ( argval>1972 && argval<2100 ) year = argval; /* year value */
12105  else if ( argval>=1 && argval<=12 ) month = argval;} /*or month*/
12106  else /* only 3rd arg can be day */
12107  if ( argval>=1 && argval<=31 ) day = argval; } /* day value */
12108  } /* --- end-of-if(*optarg!='\0') --- */
12109  } /* --- end-of-if(**expression=='[') --- */
12110 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12111 Get calendar string and rasterize it
12112 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12113 if ( msgfp!= NULL && msglevel>=9 )
12114  fprintf(msgfp,"rastcalendar> year=%d, month=%d, day=%d\n",
12115  year,month,day);
12116 calstr = calendar(year,month,day); /* get calendar string */
12117 calendarsp = rasterize(calstr,size); /* rasterize calendar string */
12118 /* --- return calendar raster to caller --- */
12119 /*end_of_job:*/
12120  return ( calendarsp ); /* return calendar to caller */
12121 } /* --- end-of-function rastcalendar() --- */
12122 
12123 
12124 /* ==========================================================================
12125  * Function: rastenviron ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
12126  * Purpose: handle \environment
12127  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12128  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
12129  * string immediately following \environment
12130  * and returning ptr immediately
12131  * following last character processed (in this
12132  * case, \environment takes no arguments, so
12133  * expression is returned unchanged).
12134  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
12135  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
12136  * immediately preceding \environment
12137  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
12138  * arg1 (I) int unused
12139  * arg2 (I) int unused
12140  * arg3 (I) int unused
12141  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12142  * Returns: ( subraster * ) subraster ptr to rendered environment image
12143  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12144  * Notes: o
12145  * ======================================================================= */
12146 /* --- entry point --- */
12147 subraster *rastenviron ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
12148  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
12149 {
12150 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12151 Allocations and Declarations
12152 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12153 char *texsubexpr(), optarg[255]; /* optional [...] args (for future)*/
12154 char environstr[8192] = "\000", /* string for all environment vars */
12155  environvar[1024] = "\000"; /* one environment variable */
12156 char *strwrap(), /* wrap long lines */
12157  *strdetex(), /* removes/replaces any math chars */
12158  *environptr = NULL; /* ptr to preprocessed environvar */
12159 char *mimeprep(); /* preprocess environvar string */
12160 int unescape_url(); /* convert all %xx's to chars */
12161 int isenviron = (seclevel<=environseclevel?1:0); /*is \environ permitted*/
12162 int maxvarlen = 512, /* max chars in environment var */
12163  maxenvlen = 6400, /* max chars in entire string */
12164  wraplen = 48; /* strwrap() wrap lines at 48 chars*/
12165 int ienv = 0; /* environ[] index */
12166 subraster *rasterize(), *environsp=NULL; /* rasterize environment string */
12167 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12168 Get args
12169 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12170 /* --- check for optional \environment args --- */
12171 if ( 1 ) /* there aren't any args (yet) */
12172  if ( *(*expression) == '[' ) { /* check for []-enclosed value */
12173  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,optarg,250,"[","]",0,0);
12174  if ( *optarg != '\000' ) { ; /* got optional arg, so process it */
12175  wraplen = atoi(optarg); /* interpret \environment[wraplen] */
12176  if ( wraplen < 1 ) wraplen = 8; /* set minimum */
12177  } /* --- end-of-if(*optarg!='\0') --- */
12178  } /* --- end-of-if(**expression=='[') --- */
12179 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12180 emit error message for unauthorized users trying to use \environ
12181 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12182 if ( !isenviron ) { /* environseclevel > seclevel */
12183  sprintf(environstr,
12184  "\\ \\text{[\\backslash environment\\ not permitted]}\\ ");
12185  goto rasterize_environ; /* rasterize error message */
12186  } /* --- end-of-if(!isenviron) --- */
12187 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12188 Accumulate environment variables and rasterize string containing them
12189 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12190 *environstr = '\000'; /* reset environment string */
12191 strcat(environstr,"\\nocaching\\fbox{\\normalsize\\text{"); /*init string*/
12192 for ( ienv=0; ; ienv++ ) { /* loop over environ[] strings */
12193  if ( environ[ienv] == (char *)NULL ) break; /* null terminates list */
12194  if ( *(environ[ienv]) == '\000' ) break; /* double-check empty string */
12195  strninit(environvar,environ[ienv],maxvarlen); /* max length displayed */
12196  if ( strlen(environ[ienv]) > maxvarlen ) /* we truncated the variable */
12197  strcat(environvar,"..."); /* so add an ellipsis */
12198  unescape_url(environvar,0); /* convert all %xx's to chars */
12199  environptr = strdetex(environvar,1); /* remove/replace any math chars */
12200  strninit(environvar,environptr,maxvarlen); /*de-tex'ed/nomath environvar*/
12201  environptr = strwrap(environvar,wraplen,-6); /* wrap long lines */
12202  strninit(environvar,environptr,maxvarlen); /* line-wrapped environvar */
12203  mimeprep(environvar); /* preprocess environvar string */
12204  if ( strlen(environstr) + strlen(environvar) > maxenvlen ) break;
12205  sprintf(environstr+strlen(environstr), /* display environment string */
12206  " %2d. %s\\\\\n", ienv+1,environvar);
12207  if ( msgfp!= NULL && msglevel>=9 )
12208  fprintf(msgfp,"rastenviron> %2d. %.256s\n",
12209  ienv+1,/*environ[ienv]*/environvar);
12210  if ( strlen(environstr) >= 7200 ) break; /* don't overflow buffer */
12211  } /* --- end-of-for(ienv) --- */
12212 strcat(environstr,"}}"); /* end {\text{...}} mode */
12213 rasterize_environ:
12214  environsp = rasterize(environstr,size); /* rasterize environment string */
12215 /* --- return environment raster to caller --- */
12216 /*end_of_job:*/
12217  return ( environsp ); /* return environment to caller */
12218 } /* --- end-of-function rastenviron() --- */
12219 
12220 
12221 /* ==========================================================================
12222  * Function: rastmessage ( expression, size, basesp, arg1, arg2, arg3 )
12223  * Purpose: handle \message
12224  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12225  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
12226  * string immediately following \message
12227  * and returning ptr immediately
12228  * following last character processed.
12229  * size (I) int containing 0-7 default font size
12230  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
12231  * immediately preceding \mesasge
12232  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
12233  * arg1 (I) int unused
12234  * arg2 (I) int unused
12235  * arg3 (I) int unused
12236  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12237  * Returns: ( subraster * ) subraster ptr to rendered message image
12238  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12239  * Notes: o
12240  * ======================================================================= */
12241 /* --- entry point --- */
12242 subraster *rastmessage ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
12243  int arg1, int arg2, int arg3 )
12244 {
12245 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12246 Allocations and Declarations
12247 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12248 char *texsubexpr(), amsg[256]="\000"; /* message number text */
12249 int imsg = 0; /* default message number */
12250 char msg[4096];
12251 subraster *rasterize(), *messagesp=NULL; /* rasterize requested message */
12252 int strreplace(); /*replace SERVER_NAME in refmsgnum*/
12253 int reflevels = REFLEVELS; /* #topmost levels to match */
12254 char *urlprune(); /*prune referer_match in refmsgnum*/
12255 char *strdetex(); /* remove math chars from messages */
12256 char *http_host = getenv("HTTP_HOST"), /* http host for mimeTeX */
12257  *server_name = getenv("SERVER_NAME"), /* server hosting mimeTeX */
12258  *referer_match = (!isempty(http_host)?http_host: /*match http_host*/
12259  (!isempty(server_name)?server_name:(NULL))); /* or server_name */
12260 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12261 obtain message {amsg} argument
12262 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12263 /* --- parse for {amsg} arg, and bump expression past it --- */
12264 *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,amsg,255,"{","}",0,0);
12265 /* --- interpret argument --- */
12266 if ( *amsg != '\000' ) { /* got amsg arg */
12267  imsg = atoi(amsg); /* interpret as an int */
12268  if ( imsg < 0 /* if too small */
12269  || imsg > maxmsgnum ) /* or too big */
12270  imsg = 0; } /* default to first message */
12271 /* --- retrieve requested message --- */
12272 strninit(msg,msgtable[imsg],4095); /* local copy of message */
12273 /* --- process as necessary --- */
12274 if ( imsg == refmsgnum) { /* urlncmp() failed to validate */
12275  if ( reflevels > 0 ) /* have #levels to validate */
12276  strreplace(msg,"SERVER_NAME", /* replace SERVER_NAME */
12277  strdetex(urlprune(referer_match,reflevels),1),0); /*with referer_match*/
12278  } /* --- end-of-switch(imsg) --- */
12279 /* --- rasterize requested message --- */
12280 messagesp = rasterize(msg,size); /* rasterize message string */
12281 /* --- return message raster to caller --- */
12282 /*end_of_job:*/
12283  return ( messagesp ); /* return message to caller */
12284 } /* --- end-of-function rastmessage() --- */
12285 
12286 
12287 /* ==========================================================================
12288  * Function: rastnoop ( expression, size, basesp, nargs, arg2, arg3 )
12289  * Purpose: no op -- flush \escape without error
12290  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12291  * Arguments: expression (I/O) char ** to first char of null-terminated
12292  * string immediately following \escape to be
12293  * flushed, and returning ptr immediately
12294  * following last character processed.
12295  * size (I) int containing 0-5 default font size
12296  * basesp (I) subraster * to character (or subexpression)
12297  * immediately preceding \escape
12298  * (unused, but passed for consistency)
12299  * nargs (I) int containing number of {}-args after
12300  * \escape to be flushed along with it
12301  * arg2 (I) int unused
12302  * arg3 (I) int unused
12303  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12304  * Returns: ( subraster * ) NULL subraster ptr
12305  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12306  * Notes: o
12307  * ======================================================================= */
12308 /* --- entry point --- */
12309 subraster *rastnoop ( char **expression, int size, subraster *basesp,
12310  int nargs, int arg2, int arg3 )
12311 {
12312 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12313 Allocations and Declarations
12314 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12315 char *texsubexpr(), subexpr[MAXSUBXSZ+1]; /*dummy args eaten by \escape*/
12316 subraster *rasterize(), *noopsp=NULL; /* rasterize subexpr */
12317 /* --- flush accompanying args if necessary --- */
12318 if ( nargs != NOVALUE /* not unspecified */
12319 && nargs > 0 ) /* and args to be flushed */
12320  while ( --nargs >= 0 ) /* count down */
12321  *expression = texsubexpr(*expression,subexpr,0,"{","}",0,0); /*flush arg*/
12322 /* --- return null ptr to caller --- */
12323 /*end_of_job:*/
12324  return ( noopsp ); /* return NULL ptr to caller */
12325 } /* --- end-of-function rastnoop() --- */
12326 
12327 
12328 /* ==========================================================================
12329  * Function: rastopenfile ( filename, mode )
12330  * Purpose: Opens filename[.tex] in mode, returning FILE *
12331  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12332  * Arguments: filename (I/O) char * to null-terminated string containing
12333  * name of file to open (preceded by path
12334  * relative to mimetex executable)
12335  * If fopen() fails, .tex appeneded,
12336  * and returned if that fopen() succeeds
12337  * mode (I) char * to null-terminated string containing
12338  * fopen() mode
12339  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12340  * Returns: ( FILE * ) pointer to opened file, or NULL if error
12341  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12342  * Notes: o
12343  * ======================================================================= */
12344 /* --- entry point --- */
12345 FILE *rastopenfile ( char *filename, char *mode )
12346 {
12347 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12348 Allocations and Declarations
12349 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12350 FILE *fp = (FILE *)NULL /*,*fopen()*/; /*file pointer to opened filename*/
12351 char texfile[2050] = "\000", /* local, edited copy of filename */
12352  *rasteditfilename(), /* prepend pathprefix if necessary */
12353  amode[512] = "r"; /* test open mode if arg mode=NULL */
12354 int ismode = 0; /* true of mode!=NULL */
12355 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12356 Check mode and open file
12357 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12358 /* --- edit filename --- */
12359 strncpy(texfile,rasteditfilename(filename),2047); /*edited copy of filename*/
12360 texfile[2047] = '\000'; /* make sure it's null terminated */
12361 /* --- check mode --- */
12362 if ( mode != (char *)NULL ) /* caller passed mode arg */
12363  if ( *mode != '\000' ) /* and it's not an empty string */
12364  { ismode = 1; /* so flip mode flag true */
12365  strncpy(amode,mode,254); /* and replace "r" with caller's */
12366  amode[254] = '\000'; /* make sure it's null terminated */
12367  compress(amode,' '); } /* remove embedded blanks */
12368 /* --- open filename or filename.tex --- */
12369 if ( strlen(texfile) > 1 ) /* make sure we got actual filename*/
12370  if ( (fp = fopen(texfile,amode)) /* try opening given filename */
12371  == NULL ) /* failed to open given filename */
12372  { strcpy(filename,texfile); /* signal possible filename error */
12373  strcat(texfile,".tex"); /* but first try adding .tex */
12374  if ( (fp = fopen(texfile,amode)) /* now try opening filename.tex */
12375  != NULL ) /* filename.tex succeeded */
12376  strcpy(filename,texfile); } /* replace caller's filename */
12377 /* --- close file if only opened to check name --- */
12378 if ( !ismode && fp!=NULL ) /* no mode, so just checking */
12379  fclose(fp); /* close file, fp signals success */
12380 /* --- return fp or NULL to caller --- */
12381 /*end_of_job:*/
12382  if ( msglevel>=9 && msgfp!=NULL ) /* debuging */
12383  { fprintf(msgfp,"rastopenfile> returning fopen(%s,%s) = %s\n",
12384  filename,amode,(fp==NULL?"NULL":"Okay")); fflush(msgfp); }
12385  return ( fp ); /* return fp or NULL to caller */
12386 } /* --- end-of-function rastopenfile() --- */
12387 
12388 
12389 /* ==========================================================================
12390  * Function: rasteditfilename ( filename )
12391  * Purpose: edits filename to remove security problems,
12392  * e.g., removes all ../'s and ..\'s.
12393  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12394  * Arguments: filename (I) char * to null-terminated string containing
12395  * name of file to be edited
12396  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12397  * Returns: ( char * ) pointer to edited filename,
12398  * or empty string "\000" if any problem
12399  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12400  * Notes: o
12401  * ======================================================================= */
12402 /* --- entry point --- */
12403 char *rasteditfilename ( char *filename )
12404 {
12405 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12406 Allocations and Declarations
12407 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12408 static char editname[2050]; /*edited filename returned to caller*/
12409 char *strchange(); /* prepend pathprefix if necessary */
12410 int strreplace(), /* remove ../'s and ..\'s */
12411  isprefix = (*pathprefix=='\000'?0:1); /* true if paths have prefix */
12412 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12413 edit filename
12414 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12415 /* --- first check filename arg --- */
12416 *editname = '\000'; /* init edited name as empty string*/
12417 if ( filename == (char *)NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no filename arg */
12418 if ( *filename == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* filename is an empty string */
12419 /* --- init edited filename --- */
12420 strcpy(editname,filename); /* init edited name as input name */
12421 compress(editname,' '); /* remove embedded blanks */
12422 /* --- remove leading or embedded ....'s --- */
12423 while ( strreplace(editname,"....",NULL,0) > 0 ) ; /* squeeze out ....'s */
12424 /* --- remove leading / and \ and dots (and blanks) --- */
12425 if ( *editname != '\000' ) /* still have chars in filename */
12426  while ( isthischar(*editname," ./\\") ) /* absolute paths invalid */
12427  {strsqueeze(editname,1);} /* so flush leading / or \ (or ' ')*/
12428 if ( *editname == '\000' ) goto end_of_job; /* no chars left in filename */
12429 /* --- remove leading or embedded ../'s and ..\'s --- */
12430 while ( strreplace(editname,"../",NULL,0) > 0 ) ; /* squeeze out ../'s */
12431 while ( strreplace(editname,"..\\",NULL,0) > 0 ) ; /* and ..\'s */
12432 while ( strreplace(editname,"../",NULL,0) > 0 ) ; /* and ../'s again */
12433 /* --- prepend path prefix (if compiled with -DPATHPREFIX) --- */
12434 if ( isprefix && *editname!='\000' ) /* filename is preceded by prefix */
12435  strchange(0,editname,pathprefix); /* so prepend prefix */
12436 end_of_job:
12437  return ( editname ); /* back with edited filename */
12438 } /* --- end-of-function rasteditfilename() --- */
12439 
12440 
12441 /* ==========================================================================
12442  * Function: rastreadfile ( filename, islock, tag, value )
12443  * Purpose: Read filename, returning value as string
12444  * between <tag>...</tag> or entire file if tag=NULL passed.
12445  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12446  * Arguments: filename (I) char * to null-terminated string containing
12447  * name of file to read (preceded by path
12448  * relative to mimetex executable)
12449  * islock (I) int containing 1 to lock file while reading
12450  * (hopefully done by opening in "r+" mode)
12451  * tag (I) char * to null-terminated string containing
12452  * html-like tagname. File contents between
12453  * <tag> and </tag> will be returned, or
12454  * entire file if tag=NULL passed.
12455  * value (O) char * returning value between <tag>...</tag>
12456  * or entire file if tag=NULL.
12457  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12458  * Returns: ( int ) 1=okay, 0=some error
12459  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12460  * Notes: o
12461  * ======================================================================= */
12462 /* --- entry point --- */
12463 int rastreadfile ( char *filename, int islock, char *tag, char *value )
12464 {
12465 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
12466 Allocations and Declarations
12467 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12468 FILE *fp = (FILE *)NULL, *rastopenfile(); /* pointer to opened filename */
12469 char texfile[1024] = "\000", /* local copy of input filename */
12470  text[MAXLINESZ+1]; /* line from input file */
12471 char *tagp, tag1[1024], tag2[1024]; /* left <tag> and right <tag/> */
12472 int vallen=0, maxvallen=MAXFILESZ; /* #chars in value, max allowed */
12473 int status = (-1); /* status returned, 1=okay */
12474 int tagnum = 0; /* tag we're looking for */
12475 /*int islock = 1;*/ /* true to lock file */
12476 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12477 Open file
12478 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12479 /* --- first check output arg --- */
12480 if ( value == (char *)NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no output buffer supplied */
12481 *value = '\000'; /* init buffer with empty string */
12482 /* --- open filename or filename.tex --- */
12483 if ( filename != (char *)NULL ) /* make sure we got filename arg */
12484  { strncpy(texfile,filename,1023); /* local copy of filename */
12485  texfile[1023] = '\000'; /* make sure it's null terminated */
12486  fp = rastopenfile(texfile,(islock?"r+":"r")); } /* try opening it */
12487 /* --- check that file opened --- */
12488 if ( fp == (FILE *)NULL ) /* failed to open file */
12489  { sprintf(value,"{\\normalsize\\rm[file %s?]}",texfile);
12490  goto end_of_job; } /* return error message to caller */
12491 status = 0; /* file opened successfully */
12492 if ( islock ) rewind(fp); /* start at beginning of file */
12493 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
12494 construct <tag>'s
12495 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
12496 if ( tag != (char *)NULL ) /* caller passed tag arg */
