13892  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
13893  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster whose bitmap
13894  * is to be anti-aliased
13895  * irow (I) int containing row, 0...height-1,
13896  * of pixel to be antialiased
13897  * icol (I) int containing col, 0...width-1,
13898  * of pixel to be antialiased
13899  * gridnum (I) int containing 0...511 corresponding to
13900  * 3x3 pixel grid surrounding irow,icol
13901  * grayscale (I) int containing number of grayscales
13902  * to be calculated, 0...grayscale-1
13903  * (should typically be given as 256)
13904  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
13905  * Returns: ( int ) 0...grayscale-1 for success, -1=any error
13906  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
13907  * Notes: o Handles the eight gridnum's
13908  * (gridnum/2 shown to eliminate irrelevant low-order bit)
13909  * --- --- -*- -*-
13910  * --* = 10 *-- = 18 --* = 72 *-- = 80 (pattern$11)
13911  * -*- -*- --- ---
13912  *
13913  * --- --- -** **-
13914  * --* = 11 *-- = 22 --* = 104 *-- = 208 (pattern$24)
13915  * -** **- --- ---
13916  * o For black * center pixel, using grid#10 as an example,
13917  * pixel stays --- antialiased ---*
13918  * black if -*** if part of -**
13919  * part of a -*- a diagonal -*-
13920  * corner, eg, * line, eg, *
13921  * ======================================================================= */
13922 /* --- entry point --- */
13923 int aapattern1124 (raster *rp, int irow, int icol,
13924  int gridnum, int grayscale)
13925 {
13926 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
13927 Allocations and Declarations
13928 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
13929 int aaval = (-1); /* antialiased value returned */
13930 int iscenter = gridnum&1; /* true if pixel at irow,icol black*/
13931 int patternum = 24; /* init for pattern#24 default */
13932 pixbyte *bitmap = rp->pixmap; /* local rp->pixmap ptr */
13933 int width=rp->width, height=rp->height; /* width, height of raster */
13934 int jrow=irow, jcol=icol; /* corner or diagonal row,col */
13935 int vertcornval=0, horzcornval=0, /* vertical, horizontal corner bits*/
13936  topdiagval=0, botdiagval=0, /* upper,lower diagonal pixel bits */
13937  cornval=0, diagval=0; /* vert+horzcorn, top+botdiag */
13938 int hdirection=99, vdirection=99, /* horz,vert corner direction */
13939  hturn=99,vturn=99, aafollowline(); /* follow corner till turns */
13940 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
13941 Check corner and diagonal pixels
13942 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
13943 if ( 0 ) goto end_of_job; /* true to turn off pattern1124 */
13944 switch ( gridnum/2 ) { /* check pattern#11,24 corner, diag*/
13945  default: goto end_of_job; /* not a pattern#11,24 gridnum */
13946  case 10: patternum=11; case 11:
13947  hdirection = 2; vdirection = -1; /* directions to follow corner */
13948  if ( (jrow=irow+2) < height ) { /* vert corner below center pixel */
13949  vertcornval = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol+jrow*width));
13950  if ( (icol-1) >= 0 ) /* lower diag left of center */
13951  botdiagval = getlongbit(bitmap,((icol-1)+jrow*width)); }
13952  if ( (jcol=icol+2) < width ) { /* horz corner right of center */
13953  horzcornval = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+irow*width));
13954  if ( (irow-1) >= 0 ) /* upper diag above center */
13955  topdiagval = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+(irow-1)*width)); }
13956  break;
13957  case 18: patternum=11; case 22:
13958  hdirection = -2; vdirection = -1; /* directions to follow corner */
13959  if ( (jrow=irow+2) < height ) { /* vert corner below center pixel */
13960  vertcornval = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol+jrow*width));
13961  if ( (icol+1) < width ) /* lower diag right of center */
13962  botdiagval = getlongbit(bitmap,((icol+1)+jrow*width)); }
13963  if ( (jcol=icol-2) >= 0 ) { /* horz corner left of center */
13964  horzcornval = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+irow*width));
13965  if ( (irow-1) >= 0 ) /* upper diag above center */
13966  topdiagval = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+(irow-1)*width)); }
13967  break;
13968  case 72: patternum=11; case 104:
13969  hdirection = 2; vdirection = 1; /* directions to follow corner */
13970  if ( (jrow=irow-2) >= 0 ) { /* vert corner above center pixel */
13971  vertcornval = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol+jrow*width));
13972  if ( (icol-1) >= 0 ) /* upper diag left of center */
13973  topdiagval = getlongbit(bitmap,((icol-1)+jrow*width)); }
13974  if ( (jcol=icol+2) < width ) { /* horz corner right of center */
13975  horzcornval = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+irow*width));
13976  if ( (irow+1) < height ) /* lower diag below center */
13977  botdiagval = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+(irow+1)*width)); }
13978  break;
13979  case 80: patternum=11; case 208:
13980  hdirection = -2; vdirection = 1; /* directions to follow corner */
13981  if ( (jrow=irow-2) >= 0 ) { /* vert corner above center pixel */
13982  vertcornval = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol+jrow*width));
13983  if ( (icol+1) < width ) /* upper diag right of center */
13984  topdiagval = getlongbit(bitmap,((icol+1)+jrow*width)); }
13985  if ( (jcol=icol-2) >= 0 ) { /* horz corner left of center */
13986  horzcornval = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+irow*width));
13987  if ( (irow+1) < height ) /* lower diag below center */
13988  botdiagval = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+(irow+1)*width)); }
13989  break;
13990  } /* --- end-of-switch(gridnum/2) --- */
13991 cornval = vertcornval+horzcornval; /* 0=no corner bits, 1, 2=both */
13992 diagval = topdiagval+botdiagval; /* 0=no diag bits, 1, 2=both */
13993 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
13994 Handle white center
13995 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
13996 if ( 1 && !iscenter ) { aaval = (patternum==11?51:64); goto end_of_job; }
13997 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
13998 Handle black center
13999 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14000 if ( diagval > 1 ) aaval = ( patternum==24? 255:191 );
14001 else {
14002  hturn = aafollowline(rp,irow,icol,hdirection);
14003  vturn = aafollowline(rp,irow,icol,vdirection);
14004  if ( vturn*hdirection < 0 && hturn*vdirection < 0 )
14005  aaval = ( patternum==24? 255:191 );
14006  else aaval = grayscale-1; } /* actual corner */
14007 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14008 Back to caller with grayscale antialiased value for pixel at irow,icol
14009 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14010 end_of_job:
14011  if ( aaval >= 0 ) /* have antialiasing result */
14012  if ( msglevel>=99 && msgfp!=NULL ) fprintf(msgfp, /* diagnostic output */
14013  "aapattern1124> irow,icol,grid#/2=%d,%d,%d, top,botdiag=%d,%d, "
14014  "vert,horzcorn=%d,%d, v,hdir=%d,%d, v,hturn=%d,%d, aaval=%d\n",
14015  irow,icol,gridnum/2, topdiagval,botdiagval, vertcornval,horzcornval,
14016  vdirection,hdirection, vturn,hturn, aaval);
14017  return ( aaval ); /* back with antialiased value */
14018 } /* --- end-of-function aapattern1124() --- */
14019 
14020 
14021 /* ==========================================================================
14022  * Function: aapattern19 ( rp, irow, icol, gridnum, grayscale )
14023  * Purpose: calculates anti-aliased value for pixel at irow,icol,
14024  * whose surrounding 3x3 pixel grid is coded by gridnum
14025  * (which must correspond to pattern #19).
14026  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14027  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster whose bitmap
14028  * is to be anti-aliased
14029  * irow (I) int containing row, 0...height-1,
14030  * of pixel to be antialiased
14031  * icol (I) int containing col, 0...width-1,
14032  * of pixel to be antialiased
14033  * gridnum (I) int containing 0...511 corresponding to
14034  * 3x3 pixel grid surrounding irow,icol
14035  * grayscale (I) int containing number of grayscales
14036  * to be calculated, 0...grayscale-1
14037  * (should typically be given as 256)
14038  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14039  * Returns: ( int ) 0...grayscale-1 for success, -1=any error
14040  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14041  * Notes: o Handles the four gridnum's
14042  * (gridnum/2 shown to eliminate irrelevant low-order bit)
14043  * --- --* *-- ***
14044  * --- = 7 --* = 41 *-- = 148 --- = 224
14045  * *** --* *-- ---
14046  * ======================================================================= */
14047 /* --- entry point --- */
14048 int aapattern19 (raster *rp, int irow, int icol,
14049  int gridnum, int grayscale)
14050 {
14051 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14052 Allocations and Declarations
14053 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14054 int aaval = (-1); /* antialiased value returned */
14055 int iscenter = gridnum&1; /* true if pixel at irow,icol black*/
14056 int orientation = 1, /* 1=vertical, 2=horizontal */
14057  jrow=irow, jcol=icol; /* middle pixel of *** line */
14058 int turn1=0,turn2=0, aafollowline(); /* follow *** line till it turns */
14059 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14060 Initialization and calculation of antialiased value
14061 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14062 /* --- check input -- */
14063 if ( iscenter ) goto end_of_job; /* we only antialias white pixels */
14064 /* --- set params --- */
14065 switch ( gridnum/2 ) { /* check pattern#19 orientation */
14066  default: goto end_of_job; /* not a pattern#19 gridnum */
14067  case 7: orientation=2; jrow++; break;
14068  case 41: orientation=1; jcol++; break;
14069  case 148: orientation=1; jcol--; break;
14070  case 224: orientation=2; jrow--; break;
14071  } /* --- end-of-switch(gridnum/2) --- */
14072 /* --- get turns in both directions --- */
14073 if ( (turn1 = aafollowline(rp,jrow,jcol,orientation)) == 0 ) goto end_of_job;
14074 if ( (turn2 = aafollowline(rp,jrow,jcol,-orientation)) == 0) goto end_of_job;
14075 if ( turn1*turn2 >= 0 ) goto end_of_job; /* both turns in same direction */
14076 /* --- weight pixel --- */
14077 aaval = grayscale / ( 3 + min2(abs(turn1),abs(turn2)) );
14078 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14079 Back to caller with grayscale antialiased value for pixel at irow,icol
14080 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14081 end_of_job:
14082  if ( aaval >= 0 ) /* have antialiasing result */
14083  if ( msglevel>=99 && msgfp!=NULL ) fprintf(msgfp, /* diagnostic output */
14084  "aapattern19> irow,icol,grid#/2=%d,%d,%d, turn+%d,%d=%d,%d, aaval=%d\n",
14085  irow,icol,gridnum/2, orientation,-orientation,turn1,turn2, aaval);
14086  return ( aaval ); /* back with antialiased value */
14087 } /* --- end-of-function aapattern19() --- */
14088 
14089 
14090 /* ==========================================================================
14091  * Function: aapattern20 ( rp, irow, icol, gridnum, grayscale )
14092  * Purpose: calculates anti-aliased value for pixel at irow,icol,
14093  * whose surrounding 3x3 pixel grid is coded by gridnum
14094  * (which must correspond to pattern #20).
14095  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14096  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster whose bitmap
14097  * is to be anti-aliased
14098  * irow (I) int containing row, 0...height-1,
14099  * of pixel to be antialiased
14100  * icol (I) int containing col, 0...width-1,
14101  * of pixel to be antialiased
14102  * gridnum (I) int containing 0...511 corresponding to
14103  * 3x3 pixel grid surrounding irow,icol
14104  * grayscale (I) int containing number of grayscales
14105  * to be calculated, 0...grayscale-1
14106  * (should typically be given as 256)
14107  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14108  * Returns: ( int ) 0...grayscale-1 for success, -1=any error
14109  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14110  * Notes: o Handles the eight gridnum's
14111  * (gridnum/2 shown to eliminate irrelevant low-order bit)
14112  * --- --- --* -*-
14113  * --* = 14 *-- = 19 --* = 42 --* = 73
14114  * **- -** -*- --*
14115  *
14116  * -*- -** *-- **-
14117  * *-- = 84 *-- = 112 *-- = 146 --* = 200
14118  * *-- --- -*- ---
14119  * ======================================================================= */
14120 /* --- entry point --- */
14121 int aapattern20 (raster *rp, int irow, int icol,
14122  int gridnum, int grayscale)
14123 {
14124 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14125 Allocations and Declarations
14126 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14127 int aaval = (-1); /* antialiased value returned */
14128 int iscenter = gridnum&1; /* true if pixel at irow,icol black*/
14129 int direction = 1, /* direction to follow ** line */
14130  jrow1=irow, jcol1=icol, /* coords of * */
14131  jrow2=irow, jcol2=icol; /* coords of adjacent ** pixel */
14132 int turn1=0,turn2=0, aafollowline(); /* follow *,** lines till turns */
14133 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14134 Initialization and calculation of antialiased value
14135 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14136 /* --- check input -- */
14137 if ( 1 ) goto end_of_job; /* don't want this one */
14138 if ( iscenter ) goto end_of_job; /* we only antialias white pixels */
14139 /* --- set params --- */
14140 switch ( gridnum/2 ) { /* check pattern#20 orientation */
14141  default: goto end_of_job; /* not a pattern#20 gridnum */
14142  case 14: direction=-2; jcol1++; jrow2++; break;
14143  case 19: direction=2; jcol1--; jrow2++; break;
14144  case 42: direction=1; jrow1++; jcol2++; break;
14145  case 73: direction=-1; jrow1--; jcol2++; break;
14146  case 84: direction=-1; jrow1--; jcol2--; break;
14147  case 112: direction=2; jcol1--; jrow2--; break;
14148  case 146: direction=1; jrow1++; jcol2--; break;
14149  case 200: direction=-2; jcol1++; jrow2--; break;
14150  } /* --- end-of-switch(gridnum/2) --- */
14151 /* --- get turns in both directions --- */
14152 if ( (turn1=aafollowline(rp,jrow1,jcol1,-direction)) == 0 ) goto end_of_job;
14153 if ( (turn2=aafollowline(rp,jrow2,jcol2,direction)) == 0 ) goto end_of_job;
14154 if ( turn1*turn2 >= 0 ) goto end_of_job; /* both turns in same direction */
14155 /* --- weight pixel --- */
14156 aaval = grayscale / ( 3 + min2(abs(turn1),abs(turn2)) );
14157 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14158 Back to caller with grayscale antialiased value for pixel at irow,icol
14159 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14160 end_of_job:
14161  if ( aaval >= 0 ) /* have antialiasing result */
14162  if ( msglevel>=99 && msgfp!=NULL ) fprintf(msgfp, /* diagnostic output */
14163  "aapattern20> irow,icol,grid#/2=%d,%d,%d, turn%d,%d=%d,%d, aaval=%d\n",
14164  irow,icol,gridnum/2, -direction,direction,turn1,turn2, aaval);
14165  return ( aaval ); /* back with antialiased value */
14166 } /* --- end-of-function aapattern20() --- */
14167 
14168 
14169 /* ==========================================================================
14170  * Function: aapattern39 ( rp, irow, icol, gridnum, grayscale )
14171  * Purpose: calculates anti-aliased value for pixel at irow,icol,
14172  * whose surrounding 3x3 pixel grid is coded by gridnum
14173  * (which must correspond to pattern #39).
14174  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14175  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster whose bitmap
14176  * is to be anti-aliased
14177  * irow (I) int containing row, 0...height-1,
14178  * of pixel to be antialiased
14179  * icol (I) int containing col, 0...width-1,
14180  * of pixel to be antialiased
14181  * gridnum (I) int containing 0...511 corresponding to
14182  * 3x3 pixel grid surrounding irow,icol
14183  * grayscale (I) int containing number of grayscales
14184  * to be calculated, 0...grayscale-1
14185  * (should typically be given as 256)
14186  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14187  * Returns: ( int ) 0...grayscale-1 for success, -1=any error
14188  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14189  * Notes: o Handles the eight gridnum's
14190  * (gridnum/2 shown to eliminate irrelevant low-order bit)
14191  * --- --- --* -**
14192  * --* = 15 *-- = 23 --* = 43 --* = 105
14193  * *** *** -** --*
14194  *
14195  * **- *** *-- ***
14196  * *-- = 212 *-- = 240 *-- = 150 --* = 232
14197  * *-- --- **- ---
14198  * ======================================================================= */
14199 /* --- entry point --- */
14200 int aapattern39 (raster *rp, int irow, int icol,
14201  int gridnum, int grayscale)
14202 {
14203 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14204 Allocations and Declarations
14205 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14206 int aaval = (-1); /* antialiased value returned */
14207 int iscenter = gridnum&1; /* true if pixel at irow,icol black*/
14208 int direction = 1, /* direction to follow ** line */
14209  jrow1=irow, jcol1=icol, /* coords of * */
14210  jrow2=irow, jcol2=icol; /* coords of adjacent ** pixel */
14211 int turn1=0,turn2=0, aafollowline(); /* follow *,** lines till turns */
14212 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14213 Initialization and calculation of antialiased value
14214 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14215 /* --- check input -- */
14216 if ( iscenter ) goto end_of_job; /* we only antialias white pixels */
14217 /* --- set params --- */
14218 switch ( gridnum/2 ) { /* check pattern#39 orientation */
14219  default: goto end_of_job; /* not a pattern#39 gridnum */
14220  case 15: direction=-2; jcol1++; jrow2++; break;
14221  case 23: direction=2; jcol1--; jrow2++; break;
14222  case 43: direction=1; jrow1++; jcol2++; break;
14223  case 105: direction=-1; jrow1--; jcol2++; break;
14224  case 212: direction=-1; jrow1--; jcol2--; break;
14225  case 240: direction=2; jcol1--; jrow2--; break;
14226  case 150: direction=1; jrow1++; jcol2--; break;
14227  case 232: direction=-2; jcol1++; jrow2--; break;
14228  } /* --- end-of-switch(gridnum/2) --- */
14229 /* --- get turns directions (tunr1==1 signals inside corner) --- */
14230 if ( (turn1=aafollowline(rp,jrow1,jcol1,-direction)) == 1 )
14231  { aaval=0; goto end_of_job; }
14232 if ( 1 ) goto end_of_job; /* stop here for now */
14233 if ( (turn2=aafollowline(rp,jrow2,jcol2,direction)) == 0 ) goto end_of_job;
14234 if ( turn1*turn2 >= 0 ) goto end_of_job; /* both turns in same direction */
14235 /* --- weight pixel --- */
14236 aaval = grayscale / ( 3 + min2(abs(turn1),abs(turn2)) );
14237 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14238 Back to caller with grayscale antialiased value for pixel at irow,icol
14239 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14240 end_of_job:
14241  if ( aaval >= 0 ) /* have antialiasing result */
14242  if ( msglevel>=99 && msgfp!=NULL ) fprintf(msgfp, /* diagnostic output */
14243  "aapattern39> irow,icol,grid#/2=%d,%d,%d, turn%d,%d=%d,%d, aaval=%d\n",
14244  irow,icol,gridnum/2, -direction,direction,turn1,turn2, aaval);
14245  return ( aaval ); /* back with antialiased value */
14246 } /* --- end-of-function aapattern39() --- */
14247 
14248 
14249 /* ==========================================================================
14250  * Function: aafollowline ( rp, irow, icol, direction )
14251  * Purpose: starting with pixel at irow,icol, moves in
14252  * specified direction looking for a "turn"
14253  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14254  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster containing pixel image
14255  * irow (I) int containing row, 0...height-1,
14256  * of first pixel
14257  * icol (I) int containing col, 0...width-1,
14258  * of first pixel
14259  * direction (I) int containing +1 to follow line up/north
14260  * (decreasing irow), -1 to follow line
14261  * down/south (increasing irow), +2 to follow
14262  * line right/east (increasing icol),
14263  * -2 to follow line left/west (decreasing icol)
14264  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14265  * Returns: ( int ) #rows or #cols traversed prior to turn,
14266  * or 0 if no turn detected (or for any error).
14267  * Sign is + if turn direction is right/east or
14268  * up/north, or is - if left/west or down/south.
14269  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14270  * Notes: o Here are some examples illustrating turn detection in
14271  * +2 (right/east) direction. Turns in other directions
14272  * are detected similarly/symmetrically. * denotes black
14273  * bits (usually fg), - denotes white bits (usually bg),
14274  * and ? denotes "don't care" bit (won't affect outcome).
14275  * Arrow --> points to start pixel denoted by irow,icol.
14276  *
14277  * *??? -??? turn=0 (no turn) is returned
14278  * -->*??? or -->-??? because the start pixel isn't
14279  * *??? -??? on an edge to begin with
14280  *
14281  * ---- **-- turn=0 returned because the
14282  * -->***- or -->***- line ends abruptly without
14283  * ---- ---- turning (even the second case)
14284  *
14285  * ---* ---* turn=0 returned because the
14286  * -->***- or -->**** line forms a Y or T rather
14287  * ---* ---* than turning
14288  *
14289  * ***- **** turn=+3 returned
14290  * -->***- or -->***- (outside corner)
14291  * ---- ----
14292  *
14293  * ***** ****- turn=-4 returned
14294  * -->***** or -->****- (inside corner)
14295  * ----* ----*
14296  *
14297  * ----* ----* turn=+4 returned
14298  * -->****- or -->***** (outside or inside corner)
14299  * ----- -----
14300  * ======================================================================= */
14301 /* --- entry point --- */
14302 int aafollowline (raster *rp, int irow, int icol, int direction)
14303 {
14304 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14305 Allocations and Declarations
14306 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14307 pixbyte *bitmap = rp->pixmap; /* local rp->pixmap ptr */
14308 int width=rp->width, height=rp->height; /* width, height of raster */
14309 int drow=0, dcol=0, /* delta row,col to follow line */
14310  jrow=irow, jcol=icol; /* current row,col following line */
14311 int bitval=1, /* value of rp bit at irow,icol */
14312  fgval=1, bgval=0, /* "fg" is whatever bitval is */
14313  bitminus=0, bitplus=0; /* value of left/down, right/up bit*/
14314 int isline=1, isedge=0; /*isline signals one-pixel wide line*/
14315 int turn = 0, /* detected turn back to caller */
14316  maxturn = maxfollow; /* don't follow more than max pixels*/
14317 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14318 Initialization
14319 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14320 /* --- check input --- */
14321 if ( irow<0 || irow>=height /* irow out-of-bounds */
14322 || icol<0 || icol>=width ) goto end_of_job; /* icol out-of-bounds */
14323 /* --- adjust maxturn for magstep --- */
14324 if ( 1 ) /* guard */
14325  if ( magstep > 1 && magstep <= 10 ) /* sanity check */
14326  maxturn *= magstep; /* factor in magnification */
14327 /* --- starting bit -- see if we're following a fg (usual), or bg line --- */
14328 bitval = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol+irow*width)); /* starting pixel (bg or fg)*/
14329 fgval = bitval; bgval = (1-bitval); /* define "fg" as whatever bitval is*/
14330 /* --- set drow,dcol corresponding to desired direction --- */
14331 switch ( direction ) { /* determine drow,dcol for direction*/
14332  default: goto end_of_job; /* unrecognized direction arg */
14333  case 1: drow = (-1); break; /* follow line up/north */
14334  case -1: drow = 1; break; /* down/south */
14335  case 2: dcol = 1; break; /* right/east */
14336  case -2: dcol = (-1); break; } /* left/west */
14337 /* --- set bitminus and bitplus --- */
14338 if ( drow == 0 ) { /* we're following line right/left */
14339  if ( irow < height ) /* there's a pixel below current */
14340  bitminus = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol+(irow+1)*width)); /* get it */
14341  if ( irow > 0 ) /* there's a pixel above current */
14342  bitplus = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol+(irow-1)*width)); } /* get it */
14343 if ( dcol == 0 ) { /* we're following line up/down */
14344  if ( icol < width ) /* there's a pixel to the right */
14345  bitplus = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol+1+irow*width)); /* get it */
14346  if ( icol > 0 ) /* there's a pixel to the left */
14347  bitminus = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol-1+irow*width)); } /* get it */
14348 /* --- check for lack of line to follow --- */
14349 if ( bitval == bitplus /* starting pixel same as above */
14350 && bitval == bitminus ) /* and below (or right and left) */
14351  goto end_of_job; /* so there's no line to follow */
14352 /* --- set isline and isedge (already initted for isline) --- */
14353 if ( bitval == bitplus ) /* starting pixel same as above */
14354  { isedge = (-1); isline = 0; } /* so we're at an edge below */
14355 if ( bitval == bitminus ) /* starting pixel same as below */
14356  { isedge = 1; isline = 0; } /* so we're at an edge above */
14357 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14358 follow line
14359 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14360 while ( 1 ) { /* until turn found (or max) */
14361  /* --- local allocations and declarations --- */
14362  int dbitval=0, /* value of bit at jrow,jcol */
14363  dbitminus=0, dbitplus=0; /* value of left/down, right/up bit*/
14364  /* --- bump pixel count and indexes; check for max or end-of-raster --- */
14365  turn++; /* bump #pixels followed */
14366  jrow += drow; jcol += dcol; /* indexes of next pixel to check */
14367  if ( turn > maxturn /* already followed max #pixels */
14368  || jrow<0 || jrow>=height /* or jrow past end-of-raster */
14369  || jcol<0 || jcol>=width ) /* or jcol past end-of-raster */
14370  { turn = 0; goto end_of_job; } /* so quit without finding a turn */
14371  /* --- set current bit (dbitval) --- */
14372  dbitval = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+jrow*width)); /*value of jrow,jcol bit*/
14373  /* --- set dbitminus and dbitplus --- */
14374  if ( drow == 0 ) { /* we're following line right/left */
14375  if ( irow < height ) /* there's a pixel below current */
14376  dbitminus = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+(irow+1)*width)); /* get it */
14377  if ( irow > 0 ) /* there's a pixel above current */
14378  dbitplus = getlongbit(bitmap,(jcol+(irow-1)*width)); } /* get it */
14379  if ( dcol == 0 ) { /* we're following line up/down */
14380  if ( icol < width ) /* there's a pixel to the right */
14381  dbitplus = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol+1+jrow*width)); /* get it */
14382  if ( icol > 0 ) /* there's a pixel to the left */
14383  dbitminus = getlongbit(bitmap,(icol-1+jrow*width)); } /* get it */
14384  /* --- first check for abrupt end-of-line, or for T or Y --- */
14385  if ( isline != 0 ) /* abrupt end or T,Y must be a line*/
14386  if ( ( bgval == dbitval /* end-of-line if pixel flips to bg*/
14387  && bgval == dbitplus /* and bg same as above pixel */
14388  && bgval == dbitminus ) /* and below (or right and left) */
14389  || ( fgval == dbitplus /* T or Y if fg same as above pixel*/
14390  && fgval == dbitminus ) ) /* and below (or right and left) */
14391  { turn = 0; goto end_of_job; } /* so we're at a T or Y */
14392  /* --- check for turning line --- */
14393  if ( isline != 0 ) { /* turning line must be a line */
14394  if ( fgval == dbitminus ) /* turning down */
14395  { turn = -turn; goto end_of_job; } /* so return negative turn */
14396  else if ( fgval == dbitplus ) /* turning up */
14397  goto end_of_job; } /* so return positive turn */
14398  /* --- check for inside corner at edge --- */
14399  if ( isedge != 0 ) { /* inside corner must be a edge */
14400  if ( isedge < 0 && fgval == bitminus ) /* corner below */
14401  { turn = -turn; goto end_of_job; } /* so return negative turn */
14402  if ( isedge > 0 && fgval == bitplus ) /* corner above */
14403  goto end_of_job; } /* so return positive turn */
14404  /* --- check for abrupt end at edge --- */
14405  if ( isedge != 0 /* abrupt edge end must be an edge */
14406  && fgval == dbitval ) /* and line must not end */
14407  if ( (isedge < 0 && bgval == bitplus) /* abrupt end above */
14408  || (isedge > 0 && bgval == bitminus) ) /* or abrupt end below */
14409  { turn = 0; goto end_of_job; } /* so edge ended abruptly */
14410  /* --- check for outside corner at edge --- */
14411  if ( isedge != 0 /* outside corner must be a edge */
14412  && bgval == dbitval ) { /* and line must end */
14413  if ( isedge > 0 ) turn = -turn; /* outside turn down from edge above*/
14414  goto end_of_job; }
14415  } /* --- end-of-while(1) --- */
14416 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14417 Back to caller with #rows or #cols traversed, and direction of detected turn
14418 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14419 end_of_job:
14420  if ( msglevel>=99 && msgfp!=NULL ) /* debugging/diagnostic output */
14421  fprintf(msgfp,"aafollowline> irow,icol,direction=%d,%d,%d, turn=%d\n",
14422  irow,icol,direction,turn);
14423  return ( turn );
14424 } /* --- end-of-function aafollowline() --- */
14425 
14426 
14427 /* ==========================================================================
14428  * Function: aagridnum ( rp, irow, icol )
14429  * Purpose: calculates gridnum, 0-511 (see Notes below),
14430  * for 3x3 grid centered at irow,icol
14431  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14432  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster containing
14433  * bitmap image (to be anti-aliased)
14434  * irow (I) int containing row, 0...height-1,
14435  * at center of 3x3 grid
14436  * icol (I) int containing col, 0...width-1,
14437  * at center of 3x3 grid
14438  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14439  * Returns: ( int ) 0-511 grid number, or -1=any error
14440  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14441  * Notes: o Input gridnum is a 9-bit int, 0-511, coding a 3x3 pixel grid
14442  * whose bit positions (and corresponding values) in gridnum are
14443  * 876 256 128 64
14444  * 504 = 32 1 16
14445  * 321 8 4 2
14446  * Thus, for example (*=pixel set/black, -=pixel not set/white),
14447  * *-- *-- -** (note that 209 is the
14448  * -*- = 259 *-- = 302 -** = 209 inverse, set<-->unset,
14449  * --* *** --- of 302)
14450  * o A set pixel is considered black, an unset pixel considered
14451  * white.
14452  * ======================================================================= */
14453 /* --- entry point --- */
14454 int aagridnum (raster *rp, int irow, int icol)
14455 {
14456 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14457 Allocations and Declarations
14458 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14459 pixbyte *bitmap = rp->pixmap; /* local rp->pixmap ptr */
14460 int width=rp->width, height=rp->height, /* width, height of raster */
14461  imap = icol + irow*width; /* pixel index = icol + irow*width */
14462 int bitval=0, /* value of rp bit at irow,icol */
14463  nnbitval=0, nebitval=0, eebitval=0, sebitval=0, /*adjacent vals*/
14464  ssbitval=0, swbitval=0, wwbitval=0, nwbitval=0, /*compass pt names*/
14465  gridnum = (-1); /* grid# 0-511 for above 9 bits */
14466 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14467 check input
14468 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14469 if ( irow<0 || irow>=height /* irow out-of-bounds */
14470 || icol<0 || icol>=width ) goto end_of_job; /* icol out-of-bounds */
14471 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14472 get the 9 bits comprising the 3x3 grid centered at irow,icol
14473 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14474 /* --- get center bit --- */
14475 bitval = getlongbit(bitmap,imap); /* value of rp input bit at imap */
14476 /* --- get 8 surrounding bits --- */
14477 if ( irow > 0 ) /* nn (north) bit available */
14478  nnbitval = getlongbit(bitmap,imap-width); /* nn bit value */
14479 if ( irow < height-1 ) /* ss (south) bit available */
14480  ssbitval = getlongbit(bitmap,imap+width); /* ss bit value */
14481 if ( icol > 0 ) /* ww (west) bit available */
14482  { wwbitval = getlongbit(bitmap,imap-1); /* ww bit value */
14483  if ( irow > 0 ) /* nw bit available */
14484  nwbitval = getlongbit(bitmap,imap-width-1); /* nw bit value */
14485  if ( irow < height-1 ) /* sw bit available */
14486  swbitval = getlongbit(bitmap,imap+width-1); } /* sw bit value */
14487 if ( icol < width-1 ) /* ee (east) bit available */
14488  { eebitval = getlongbit(bitmap,imap+1); /* ee bit value */
14489  if ( irow > 0 ) /* ne bit available */
14490  nebitval = getlongbit(bitmap,imap-width+1); /* ne bit value */
14491  if ( irow < height-1 ) /* se bit available */
14492  sebitval = getlongbit(bitmap,imap+width+1); } /* se bit value */
14493 /* --- set gridnum --- */
14494 gridnum = 0; /* clear all bits */
14495 if ( bitval ) gridnum = 1; /* set1bit(gridnum,0); */
14496 if ( nwbitval ) gridnum += 256; /* set1bit(gridnum,8); */
14497 if ( nnbitval ) gridnum += 128; /* set1bit(gridnum,7); */
14498 if ( nebitval ) gridnum += 64; /* set1bit(gridnum,6); */
14499 if ( wwbitval ) gridnum += 32; /* set1bit(gridnum,5); */
14500 if ( eebitval ) gridnum += 16; /* set1bit(gridnum,4); */
14501 if ( swbitval ) gridnum += 8; /* set1bit(gridnum,3); */
14502 if ( ssbitval ) gridnum += 4; /* set1bit(gridnum,2); */
14503 if ( sebitval ) gridnum += 2; /* set1bit(gridnum,1); */
14504 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14505 Back to caller with gridnum coding 3x3 grid centered at irow,icol
14506 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14507 end_of_job:
14508  return ( gridnum );
14509 } /* --- end-of-function aagridnum() --- */
14510 
14511 
14512 /* ==========================================================================
14513  * Function: aapatternnum ( gridnum )
14514  * Purpose: Looks up the pattern number 1...51
14515  * corresponding to the 3x3 pixel grid coded by gridnum 0=no
14516  * pixels set (white) to 511=all pixels set (black).
14517  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14518  * Arguments: gridnum (I) int containing 0-511 coding a 3x3 pixel grid
14519  * (see Notes below)
14520  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14521  * Returns: ( int ) 1 to 51, or -1=error
14522  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14523  * Notes: o Input gridnum is a 9-bit int, 0-511, coding a 3x3 pixel grid
14524  * whose bit positions (and corresponding values) in gridnum are
14525  * 876 256 128 64
14526  * 504 = 32 1 16
14527  * 321 8 4 2
14528  * Thus, for example (*=pixel set/black, -=pixel not set/white),
14529  * *-- *-- -** (note that 209 is the
14530  * -*- = 259 *-- = 302 -** = 209 inverse, set<-->unset,
14531  * --* *** --- of 302)
14532  * o A set pixel is considered black, an unset pixel considered
14533  * white.
14534  * o Ignoring whether the center pixel is set or unset, and
14535  * taking rotation, reflection and inversion (set<-->unset)
14536  * symmetries into account, there are 32 unique pixel patterns.
14537  * If inversions are listed separately, there are 51 patterns.
14538  * o Here are the 51 unique patterns, with ? always denoting the
14539  * undetermined center pixel. At the upper-left corner of each
14540  * pattern is the "pattern index number" assigned to it in this
14541  * function. At the upper-right is the pattern's multiplicity,
14542  * i.e., the number of different patterns obtained by rotations
14543  * and reflection of the illustrated one. Inverse patters are
14544  * illustrated immediately beneath the original (the first three
14545  * four-pixel patterns have identical inverses).
14546  * -------------------------------------------------------------
14547  * No pixels set:
14548  * #1 1 (in this case, 1 signifies that rotation
14549  * --- and reflection give no different grids)
14550  * -?-
14551  * ---
14552  * Inverse, all eight pixels set
14553  * #2 1 (the inverse multiplicity is always the same)
14554  * ***
14555  * *?*
14556  * ***
14557  * -------------------------------------------------------------
14558  * One pixel set:
14559  * #3 4 #4 4
14560  * *-- -*-
14561  * -?- -?-
14562  * --- ---
14563  * Inverse, seven pixels set:
14564  * #5 4 #6 4
14565  * -** *-*
14566  * *?* *?*
14567  * *** ***
14568  * -------------------------------------------------------------
14569  * Two pixels set:
14570  * #7 8 #8 4 #9 8 10 2 11 4 12 2
14571  * **- *-* *-- *-- -*- -*-
14572  * -?- -?- -?* -?- -?* -?-
14573  * --- --- --- --* --- -*-
14574  * Inverse, six pixels set:
14575  * #13 8 14 4 15 8 16 2 17 4 18 2
14576  * --* -*- -** -** *-* *-*
14577  * *?* *?* *?- *?* *?- *?*
14578  * *** *** *** **- *** *-*
14579  * -------------------------------------------------------------
14580  * Three pixels set:
14581  * #19 4 20 8 21 8 22 8 23 8 24 4 25 4 26 4 27 4 28 4
14582  * *** **- **- **- **- **- *-* *-* -*- -*-
14583  * -?- -?* -?- -?- -?- *?- -?- -?- -?* -?*
14584  * --- --- --* -*- *-- --- --* -*- -*- *--
14585  * Inverse, five pixels set:
14586  * #29 4 30 8 31 8 32 8 33 8 34 4 35 4 36 4 37 4 38 4
14587  * --- --* --* --* --* --* -*- -*- *-* *-*
14588  * *?* *?- *?* *?* *?* -?* *?* *?* *?- *?-
14589  * *** *** **- *-* -** *** **- *-* *-* -**
14590  * -------------------------------------------------------------
14591  * Four pixels set (including inverses):
14592  * #39 8 40 4 41 8 42 8 43 4 44 4 45 8 46 1
14593  * *** **- **- *** *** **- **- *-*
14594  * -?* -?- -?* -?- -?- -?* -?* -?-
14595  * --- -** *-- --* -*- --* -*- *-*
14596  *
14597  * #47 8 48 4 49 4 50 8 51 1
14598  * --- --- --* --* -*-
14599  * *?* *?* *?- *?- *?*
14600  * **- *-* **- *-* -*-
14601  * ======================================================================= */
14602 /* --- entry point --- */
14603 int aapatternnum ( int gridnum )
14604 {
14605 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14606 Allocations and Declarations
14607 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14608 int pattern = (-1); /*pattern#, 1-51, for input gridnum*/
14609 /* ---
14610  * pattern number corresponding to input gridnum/2 code
14611  * ( gridnum/2 strips off gridnum's low bit because it's
14612  * the same pattern whether or not center pixel is set )
14613  * --- */
14614 static int patternnum[] = {
14615  1, 3, 4, 7, 3, 8, 7,19, 4, 7,11,24, 9,23,20,39, /* 0- 15 */
14616  4, 9,11,20, 7,23,24,39,12,22,27,47,22,48,47,29, /* 16- 31 */
14617  3, 8, 9,23,10,25,21,42, 7,19,20,39,21,42,44,34, /* 32- 47 */
14618  9,26,28,41,21,50,49,30,22,43,45,33,40,32,31,13, /* 48- 63 */
14619  4, 9,12,22, 9,26,22,43,11,20,27,47,28,41,45,33, /* 64- 79 */
14620  11,28,27,45,20,41,47,33,27,45,51,35,45,36,35,14, /* 80- 95 */
14621  7,23,22,48,21,50,40,32,24,39,47,29,49,30,31,13, /* 96-111 */
14622  20,41,45,36,44,38,31,15,47,33,35,14,31,15,16, 5, /* 112-127 */
14623  3,10, 9,21, 8,25,23,42, 9,21,28,49,26,50,41,30, /* 128-143 */
14624  7,21,20,44,19,42,39,34,22,40,45,31,43,32,33,13, /* 144-159 */
14625  8,25,26,50,25,46,50,37,23,42,41,30,50,37,38,17, /* 160-175 */
14626  23,50,41,38,42,37,30,17,48,32,36,15,32,18,15, 6, /* 176-191 */
14627  7,21,22,40,23,50,48,32,20,44,45,31,41,38,36,15, /* 192-207 */
14628  24,49,47,31,39,30,29,13,47,31,35,16,33,15,14, 5, /* 208-223 */
14629  19,42,43,32,42,37,32,18,39,34,33,13,30,17,15, 6, /* 224-239 */
14630  39,30,33,15,34,17,13, 6,29,13,14, 5,13, 6, 5, 2, /* 240-255 */
14631  -1 } ; /* --- end-of-patternnum[] --- */
14632 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14633 look up pattern number for gridnum
14634 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14635 /* --- first check input --- */
14636 if ( gridnum<0 || gridnum>511 ) goto end_of_job; /* gridnum out of bounds */
14637 /* --- look up pattern number, 1-51, corresponding to input gridnum --- */
14638 pattern = patternnum[gridnum/2]; /* /2 strips off gridnum's low bit */
14639 if ( pattern<1 || pattern>51 ) pattern = (-1); /* some internal error */
14640 end_of_job:
14641  return ( pattern ); /* back to caller with pattern# */
14642 } /* --- end-of-function aapatternnum() --- */
14643 
14644 
14645 /* ==========================================================================
14646  * Function: aalookup ( gridnum )
14647  * Purpose: Looks up the grayscale value 0=white to 255=black
14648  * corresponding to the 3x3 pixel grid coded by gridnum 0=no
14649  * pixels set (white) to 511=all pixels set (black).
14650  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14651  * Arguments: gridnum (I) int containing 0-511 coding a 3x3 pixel grid
14652  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14653  * Returns: ( int ) 0=white to 255=black, or -1=error
14654  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14655  * Notes: o Input gridnum is a 9-bit int, 0-511, coding a 3x3 pixel grid
14656  * o A set pixel is considered black, an unset pixel considered
14657  * white. Likewise, the returned grayscale is 255 for black,
14658  * 0 for white. You'd more typically want to use 255-grayscale
14659  * so that 255 is white and 0 is black.
14660  * o The returned number is the (lowpass) antialiased grayscale
14661  * for the center pixel (gridnum bit 0) of the grid.
14662  * ======================================================================= */
14663 /* --- entry point --- */
14664 int aalookup ( int gridnum )
14665 {
14666 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14667 Allocations and Declarations
14668 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14669 int grayscale = (-1); /*returned grayscale, init for error*/
14670 int pattern = (-1), aapatternnum(); /*pattern#, 1-51, for input gridnum*/
14671 int iscenter = gridnum&1; /*low-order bit set for center pixel*/
14672 /* --- gray scales --- */
14673 #define WHT 0
14674 #define LGT 64
14675 #define GRY 128
14676 #define DRK 192
14677 #define BLK 255
14678 #if 1
14679 /* ---
14680  * modified aapnm() grayscales (second try)
14681  * --- */
14682 /* --- grayscale for each pattern when center pixel set/black --- */
14683 static int grayscale1[] = { -1, /* [0] index not used */
14684  BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,242,230,BLK,BLK,BLK,160, /* 1-10 */
14685 /* BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,242,230,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK, */ /* 1-10 */
14686  BLK,BLK,217,230,217,230,204,BLK,BLK,166, /* 11-20 */
14687  BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,178,166,204,191, /* 21-30 */
14688  204,BLK,204,191,217,204,BLK,191,178,BLK, /* 31-40 */
14689  178,BLK,BLK,178,191,BLK,191,BLK,178,BLK,204, /* 41-51 */
14690  -1 } ; /* --- end-of-grayscale1[] --- */
14691 /* --- grayscale for each pattern when center pixel not set/white --- */
14692 static int grayscale0[] = { -1, /* [0] index not used */
14693  WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT, /* 1-10 */
14694  64,WHT,WHT,128,115,128,WHT,WHT,WHT, 64, /* 11-20 */
14695  /* 51,WHT,WHT,128,115,128,WHT,WHT,WHT, 64, */ /* 11-20 */
14696  WHT,WHT,WHT, 64,WHT,WHT, 76, 64,102, 89, /* 21-30 */
14697  102,WHT,102,WHT,115,102,WHT, 89, 76,WHT, /* 31-40 */
14698  76,WHT,WHT, 76, 89,WHT, 89,WHT, 76,WHT,102, /* 41-51 */
14699  -1 } ; /* --- end-of-grayscale0[] --- */
14700 #endif
14701 #if 0
14702 /* ---
14703  * modified aapnm() grayscales (first try)
14704  * --- */
14705 /* --- grayscale for each pattern when center pixel set/black --- */
14706 static int grayscale1[] = { -1, /* [0] index not used */
14707  BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,242,230,GRY,BLK,BLK,BLK, /* 1-10 */
14708 /* BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,242,230,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK, */ /* 1-10 */
14709  BLK,BLK,217,230,217,230,204,BLK,BLK,166, /* 11-20 */
14710  BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,166,204,191, /* 21-30 */
14711 /* BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,178,166,204,191, */ /* 21-30 */
14712  204,BLK,204,BLK,217,204,BLK,191,GRY,BLK, /* 31-40 */
14713 /* 204,BLK,204,191,217,204,BLK,191,178,BLK, */ /* 31-40 */
14714  178,BLK,BLK,178,191,BLK,BLK,BLK,178,BLK,204, /* 41-51 */
14715 /* 178,BLK,BLK,178,191,BLK,191,BLK,178,BLK,204, */ /* 41-51 */
14716  -1 } ; /* --- end-of-grayscale1[] --- */
14717 /* --- grayscale for each pattern when center pixel not set/white --- */
14718 static int grayscale0[] = { -1, /* [0] index not used */
14719  WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT, /* 1-10 */
14720  GRY,WHT,WHT,128,115,128,WHT,WHT,WHT,GRY, /* 11-20 */
14721 /* 51,WHT,WHT,128,115,128,WHT,WHT,WHT, 64, */ /* 11-20 */
14722  WHT,WHT,WHT,GRY,WHT,WHT, 76, 64,102, 89, /* 21-30 */
14723 /* WHT,WHT,WHT, 64,WHT,WHT, 76, 64,102, 89, */ /* 21-30 */
14724  102,WHT,102,WHT,115,102,WHT, 89,GRY,WHT, /* 31-40 */
14725 /* 102,WHT,102,WHT,115,102,WHT, 89, 76,WHT, */ /* 31-40 */
14726  76,WHT,WHT,GRY, 89,WHT, 89,WHT, 76,WHT,102, /* 41-51 */
14727 /* 76,WHT,WHT, 76, 89,WHT, 89,WHT, 76,WHT,102, */ /* 41-51 */
14728  -1 } ; /* --- end-of-grayscale0[] --- */
14729 #endif
14730 #if 0
14731 /* ---
14732  * these grayscales _exactly_ correspond to the aapnm() algorithm
14733  * --- */
14734 /* --- grayscale for each pattern when center pixel set/black --- */
14735 static int grayscale1[] = { -1, /* [0] index not used */
14736  BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,242,230,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK, /* 1-10 */
14737  BLK,BLK,217,230,217,230,204,BLK,BLK,166, /* 11-20 */
14738  BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,BLK,178,166,204,191, /* 21-30 */
14739  204,BLK,204,191,217,204,BLK,191,178,BLK, /* 31-40 */
14740  178,BLK,BLK,178,191,BLK,191,BLK,178,BLK,204, /* 41-51 */
14741  -1 } ; /* --- end-of-grayscale1[] --- */
14742 /* --- grayscale for each pattern when center pixel not set/white --- */
14743 static int grayscale0[] = { -1, /* [0] index not used */
14744  WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT,WHT, /* 1-10 */
14745  51,WHT,WHT,128,115,128,WHT,WHT,WHT, 64, /* 11-20 */
14746  WHT,WHT,WHT, 64,WHT,WHT, 76, 64,102, 89, /* 21-30 */
14747  102,WHT,102,WHT,115,102,WHT, 89, 76,WHT, /* 31-40 */
14748  76,WHT,WHT, 76, 89,WHT, 89,WHT, 76,WHT,102, /* 41-51 */
14749  -1 } ; /* --- end-of-grayscale0[] --- */
14750 #endif
14751 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14752 look up grayscale for gridnum
14753 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14754 /* --- first check input --- */
14755 if ( gridnum<0 || gridnum>511 ) goto end_of_job; /* gridnum out of bounds */
14756 /* --- look up pattern number, 1-51, corresponding to input gridnum --- */
14757 pattern = aapatternnum(gridnum); /* look up pattern number */
14758 if ( pattern<1 || pattern>51 ) goto end_of_job; /* some internal error */
14759 if ( ispatternnumcount ) { /* counts being accumulated */
14760  if (iscenter) patternnumcount1[pattern] += 1; /* bump diagnostic count */
14761  else patternnumcount0[pattern] += 1; }
14762 /* --- look up grayscale for this pattern --- */
14763 grayscale = ( iscenter? grayscale1[pattern] : grayscale0[pattern] );
14764 end_of_job:
14765  return ( grayscale ); /* back to caller with grayscale */
14766 } /* --- end-of-function aalookup() --- */
14767 
14768 
14769 /* ==========================================================================
14770  * Function: aalowpasslookup ( rp, bytemap, grayscale )
14771  * Purpose: calls aalookup() for each pixel in rp->bitmap
14772  * to create anti-aliased bytemap
14773  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14774  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster whose bitmap
14775  * is to be anti-aliased
14776  * bytemap (O) intbyte * to bytemap, calculated
14777  * by calling aalookup() for each pixel
14778  * in rp->bitmap
14779  * grayscale (I) int containing number of grayscales
14780  * to be calculated, 0...grayscale-1
14781  * (should typically be given as 256)
14782  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14783  * Returns: ( int ) 1=success, 0=any error
14784  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14785  * Notes: o
14786  * ======================================================================= */
14787 /* --- entry point --- */
14788 int aalowpasslookup (raster *rp, intbyte *bytemap, int grayscale)
14789 {
14790 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14791 Allocations and Declarations
14792 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14793 int width=rp->width, height=rp->height, /* width, height of raster */
14794  icol = 0, irow = 0, imap = (-1); /* width, height, bitmap indexes */
14795 int bgbitval=0 /*, fgbitval=1*/; /* background, foreground bitval */
14796 int bitval=0, /* value of rp bit at irow,icol */
14797  aabyteval=0; /* antialiased (or unchanged) value*/
14798 int gridnum=0, aagridnum(), /* grid# for 3x3 grid at irow,icol */
14799  aalookup(); /* table look up antialiased value*/
14800 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14801 generate bytemap by table lookup for each pixel of bitmap
14802 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14803 for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ )
14804  for ( icol=0; icol<width; icol++ )
14805  {
14806  /* --- get gridnum and center bit value, init aabyteval --- */
14807  gridnum = aagridnum(rp,irow,icol); /*grid# coding 3x3 grid at irow,icol*/
14808  bitval = (gridnum&1); /* center bit set if gridnum odd */
14809  aabyteval = (intbyte)(bitval==bgbitval?0:grayscale-1); /* default aa val */
14810  imap++; /* first bump bitmap[] index */
14811  bytemap[imap] = (intbyte)(aabyteval); /* init antialiased pixel */
14812  /* --- look up antialiased value for this grid --- */
14813  aabyteval = aalookup(gridnum); /* look up on grid# */
14814  if ( aabyteval>=0 && aabyteval<=255 ) /* check for success */
14815  bytemap[imap] = (intbyte)(aabyteval); /* init antialiased pixel */
14816  } /* --- end-of-for(irow,icol) --- */
14817 ispatternnumcount = 0; /* accumulate counts only once */
14818 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14819 Back to caller with gray-scale anti-aliased bytemap
14820 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14821 /*end_of_job:*/
14822  return ( 1 );
14823 } /* --- end-of-function aalowpasslookup() --- */
14824 
14825 
14826 /* ==========================================================================
14827  * Function: aasupsamp ( rp, aa, sf, grayscale )
14828  * Purpose: calculates a supersampled anti-aliased bytemap
14829  * for rp->bitmap, with each byte 0...grayscale-1
14830  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14831  * Arguments: rp (I) raster * to raster whose bitmap
14832  * is to be anti-aliased
14833  * aa (O) address of raster * to supersampled bytemap,
14834  * calculated by supersampling rp->bitmap
14835  * sf (I) int containing supersampling shrinkfactor
14836  * grayscale (I) int containing number of grayscales
14837  * to be calculated, 0...grayscale-1
14838  * (should typically be given as 256)
14839  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14840  * Returns: ( int ) 1=success, 0=any error
14841  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14842  * Notes: o If the center point of the box being averaged is black,
14843  * then the entire "average" is forced black (grayscale-1)
14844  * regardless of the surrounding points. This is my attempt
14845  * to avoid a "washed-out" appearance of thin (one-pixel-wide)
14846  * lines, which would otherwise turn from black to a gray shade.
14847  * ======================================================================= */
14848 /* --- entry point --- */
14849 int aasupsamp (raster *rp, raster **aa, int sf, int grayscale)
14850 {
14851 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14852 Allocations and Declarations
14853 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14854 int status = 0; /* 1=success, 0=failure to caller */
14855 int rpheight=rp->height, rpwidth=rp->width, /*bitmap raster dimensions*/
14856  heightrem=0, widthrem=0, /* rp+rem is a multiple of shrinkf */
14857  aaheight=0, aawidth=0, /* supersampled dimensions */
14858  aapixsz=8; /* output pixels are 8-bit bytes */
14859 int maxaaval=(-9999), /* max grayscale val set in matrix */
14860  isrescalemax=1; /* 1=rescale maxaaval to grayscale */
14861 int irp=0,jrp=0, iaa=0,jaa=0, iwt=0,jwt=0; /*indexes, i=width j=height*/
14862 raster *aap=NULL, *new_raster(); /* raster for supersampled image */
14863 raster *aaweights(); /* get weight matrix applied to rp */
14864 static raster *aawts = NULL; /* aaweights() resultant matrix */
14865 static int prevshrink = NOVALUE, /* shrinkfactor from previous call */
14866  sumwts = 0; /* sum of weights */
14867 static int blackfrac = 40, /* force black if this many pts are */
14868  /*grayfrac = 20,*/
14869  maxwt = 10, /* max weight in weight matrix */
14870  minwtfrac=10, maxwtfrac=70; /* force light pts white, dark black*/
14871 int type_raster(), type_bytemap(); /* debugging display routines */
14872 int delete_raster(); /* delete old rasters */
14873 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14874 Initialization
14875 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14876 /* --- check args --- */
14877 if ( aa == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no ptr for return output arg */
14878 *aa = NULL; /* init null ptr for error return */
14879 if ( rp == NULL /* no ptr to input arg */
14880 || sf < 1 /* invalid shrink factor */
14881 || grayscale < 2 ) goto end_of_job; /* invalid grayscale */
14882 /* --- get weight matrix (or use current one) --- */
14883 if ( sf != prevshrink ) /* have new shrink factor */
14884  { if ( aawts != NULL ) /* have unneeded weight matrix */
14885  delete_raster(aawts); /* so free it */
14886  sumwts = 0; /* reinitialize sum of weights */
14887  aawts = aaweights(sf,sf); /* get new weight matrix */
14888  if ( aawts != NULL ) /* got weight matrix okay*/
14889  for ( jwt=0; jwt<sf; jwt++ ) /* for each row */
14890  for ( iwt=0; iwt<sf; iwt++ ) /* and each column */
14891  { int wt = (int)(getpixel(aawts,jwt,iwt)); /* weight */
14892  if ( wt > maxwt ) /* don't overweight center pts */
14893  { wt = maxwt; /* scale it back */
14894  setpixel(aawts,jwt,iwt,wt); } /* and replace it in matrix */
14895  sumwts += wt; } /* add weight to sum */
14896  prevshrink = sf; } /* save new shrink factor */
14897 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 )
14898  { fprintf(msgfp,"aasupsamp> sf=%d, sumwts=%d weights=...\n", sf,sumwts);
14899  type_bytemap((intbyte *)aawts->pixmap,grayscale,
14900  aawts->width,aawts->height,msgfp); }
14901 /* --- calculate supersampled height,width and allocate output raster */
14902 heightrem = rpheight%sf; /* remainder after division... */
14903 widthrem = rpwidth%sf; /* ...by shrinkfactor */
14904 aaheight = 1+(rpheight+sf-(heightrem+1))/sf; /* ss height */
14905 aawidth = 1+(rpwidth+sf-(widthrem+1))/sf; /* ss width */
14906 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 )
14907  { fprintf(msgfp,"aasupsamp> rpwid,ht=%d,%d wd,htrem=%d,%d aawid,ht=%d,%d\n",
14908  rpwidth,rpheight, widthrem,heightrem, aawidth,aaheight);
14909  fprintf(msgfp,"aasupsamp> dump of original bitmap image...\n");
14910  type_raster(rp,msgfp); } /* ascii image of rp raster */
14911 if ( (aap = new_raster(aawidth,aaheight,aapixsz)) /* alloc output raster*/
14912 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if alloc fails */
14913 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14914 Step through rp->bitmap, applying aawts to each "submatrix" of bitmap
14915 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14916 for ( jaa=0,jrp=(-(heightrem+1)/2); jrp<rpheight; jrp+=sf ) /* height */
14917  {
14918  for ( iaa=0,irp=(-(widthrem+1)/2); irp<rpwidth; irp+=sf ) /* width */
14919  {
14920  int aaval=0; /* weighted rpvals */
14921  int nrp=0, mrp=0; /* #rp bits set, #within matrix */
14922  for ( jwt=0; jwt<sf; jwt++ )
14923  for ( iwt=0; iwt<sf; iwt++ )
14924  {
14925  int i=irp+iwt, j=jrp+jwt; /* rp->pixmap point */
14926  int rpval = 0; /* rp->pixmap value at i,j */
14927  if ( i>=0 && i<rpwidth /* i within actual pixmap */
14928  && j>=0 && j<rpheight ) /* ditto j */
14929  { mrp++; /* count another bit within matrix */
14930  rpval = (int)(getpixel(rp,j,i)); } /* get actual pixel value */
14931  if ( rpval != 0 )
14932  { nrp++; /* count another bit set */
14933  aaval += (int)(getpixel(aawts,jwt,iwt)); } /* sum weighted vals */
14934  } /* --- end-of-for(iwt,jwt) --- */
14935  if ( aaval > 0 ) /*normalize and rescale non-zero val*/
14936  { int aafrac = (100*aaval)/sumwts; /* weighted percent of black points */
14937  /*if((100*nrp)/mrp >=blackfrac)*/ /* many black interior pts */
14938  if( aafrac >= maxwtfrac ) /* high weight of sampledblack pts */
14939  aaval = grayscale-1; /* so set supersampled pt black */
14940  else if( aafrac <= minwtfrac ) /* low weight of sampledblack pts */
14941  aaval = 0; /* so set supersampled pt white */
14942  else /* rescale calculated weight */
14943  aaval = ((sumwts/2 - 1) + (grayscale-1)*aaval)/sumwts; }
14944  maxaaval = max2(maxaaval,aaval); /* largest aaval so far */
14945  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 )
14946  fprintf(msgfp,"aasupsamp> jrp,irp=%d,%d jaa,iaa=%d,%d"
14947  " mrp,nrp=%d,%d aaval=%d\n",
14948  jrp,irp, jaa,iaa, mrp,nrp, aaval);
14949  if ( jaa<aaheight && iaa<aawidth ) /* bounds check */
14950  setpixel(aap,jaa,iaa,aaval); /*weighted val in supersamp raster*/
14951  else if( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9 ) /* emit error if out-of-bounds */
14952  fprintf(msgfp,"aasupsamp> Error: aaheight,aawidth=%d,%d jaa,iaa=%d,%d\n",
14953  aaheight,aawidth, jaa,iaa);
14954  iaa++; /* bump aa col index */
14955  } /* --- end-of-for(irp) --- */
14956  jaa++; /* bump aa row index */
14957  } /* --- end-of-for(jrp) --- */
14958 /* --- rescale supersampled image so darkest points become black --- */
14959 if ( isrescalemax ) /* flag set to rescale maxaaval */
14960  {
14961  double scalef = ((double)(grayscale-1))/((double)maxaaval);
14962  for ( jaa=0; jaa<aaheight; jaa++ ) /* height */
14963  for ( iaa=0; iaa<aawidth; iaa++ ) /* width */
14964  { int aafrac, aaval = getpixel(aap,jaa,iaa); /* un-rescaled value */
14965  aaval = (int)(0.5+((double)aaval)*scalef); /*multiply by scale factor*/
14966  aafrac = (100*aaval)/(grayscale-1); /* fraction of blackness */
14967  if( aafrac >= blackfrac ) /* high weight of sampledblack pts */
14968  aaval = grayscale-1; /* so set supersampled pt black */
14969  else if( 0&&aafrac <= minwtfrac ) /* low weight of sampledblack pts */
14970  aaval = 0; /* so set supersampled pt white */
14971  setpixel(aap,jaa,iaa,aaval); } /* replace rescaled val in raster */
14972  } /* --- end-of-if(isrescalemax) --- */
14973 *aa = aap; /* return supersampled image*/
14974 status = 1; /* set successful status */
14975 if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 )
14976  { fprintf(msgfp,"aasupsamp> anti-aliased image...\n");
14977  type_bytemap((intbyte *)aap->pixmap,grayscale,
14978  aap->width,aap->height,msgfp); fflush(msgfp); }
14979 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
14980 Back to caller with gray-scale anti-aliased bytemap
14981 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
14982 end_of_job:
14983  return ( status );
14984 } /* --- end-of-function aasupsamp() --- */
14985 
14986 
14987 /* ==========================================================================
14988  * Function: aacolormap ( bytemap, nbytes, colors, colormap )
14989  * Purpose: searches bytemap, returning a list of its discrete values
14990  * in ascending order in colors[], and returning an "image"
14991  * of bytemap (where values are replaced by colors[]
14992  * indexes) in colormap[].
14993  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
14994  * Arguments: bytemap (I) intbyte * to bytemap containing
14995  * grayscale values (usually 0=white
14996  * through 255=black) for which colors[]
14997  * and colormap[] will be constructed.
14998  * nbytes (I) int containing #bytes in bytemap
14999  * (usually just #rows * #cols)
15000  * colors (O) intbyte * (to be interpreted as ints)
15001  * returning a list of the discrete/different
15002  * values in bytemap, in ascending value order,
15003  * and with gamma correction applied
15004  * colormap (O) intbyte * returning a bytemap "image",
15005  * i.e., in one-to-one pixel correspondence
15006  * with bytemap, but where the values have been
15007  * replaced with corresponding colors[] indexes.
15008  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15009  * Returns: ( int ) #colors in colors[], or 0 for any error
15010  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15011  * Notes: o
15012  * ======================================================================= */
15013 /* --- entry point --- */
15014 int aacolormap ( intbyte *bytemap, int nbytes,
15015  intbyte *colors, intbyte *colormap )
15016 {
15017 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15018 Allocations and Declarations
15019 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15020 int ncolors = 0, /* #different values in bytemap */
15021  igray, grayscale = 256; /* bytemap contains intbyte's */
15022 intbyte *bytevalues = NULL; /* 1's where bytemap contains value*/
15023 int ibyte; /* bytemap/colormap index */
15024 int isscale = 0, /* true to scale largest val to 255*/
15025  isgamma = 1; /* true to apply gamma correction */
15026 int maxcolors = 0; /* maximum ncolors */
15027 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15028 Accumulate colors[] from values occurring in bytemap
15029 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15030 /* --- initialization --- */
15031 if ( (bytevalues = (intbyte *)malloc(grayscale)) /*alloc bytevalues*/
15032 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* signal error if malloc() failed */
15033 memset(bytevalues,0,grayscale); /* zero out bytevalues */
15034 /* --- now set 1's at offsets corresponding to values found in bytemap --- */
15035 for ( ibyte=0; ibyte<nbytes; ibyte++ ) /* for each byte in bytemap */
15036  bytevalues[(int)bytemap[ibyte]] = 1; /*use its value to index bytevalues*/
15037 /* --- collect the 1's indexes in colors[] --- */
15038 for ( igray=0; igray<grayscale; igray++ ) /* check all possible values */
15039  if ( (int)bytevalues[igray] ) /*bytemap contains igray somewheres*/
15040  { colors[ncolors] = (intbyte)igray; /* so store igray in colors */
15041  bytevalues[igray] = (intbyte)ncolors; /* save colors[] index */
15042  if ( maxcolors>0 && ncolors>=maxcolors ) /* too many color indexes */
15043  bytevalues[igray] = (intbyte)(maxcolors-1); /*so scale back to max*/
15044  ncolors++; } /* and bump #colors */
15045 /* --- rescale colors so largest, colors[ncolors-1], is black --- */
15046 if ( isscale ) /* only rescale if requested */
15047  if ( ncolors > 1 ) /* and if not a "blank" raster */
15048  if ( colors[ncolors-1] > 0 ) /*and at least one pixel non-white*/
15049  {
15050  /* --- multiply each colors[] by factor that scales largest to 255 --- */
15051  double scalefactor = ((double)(grayscale-1))/((double)colors[ncolors-1]);
15052  for ( igray=1; igray<ncolors; igray++ ) /* re-scale each colors[] */
15053  { colors[igray] = min2(grayscale-1,(int)(scalefactor*colors[igray]+0.5));
15054  if (igray>5) colors[igray] = min2(grayscale-1,colors[igray]+2*igray); }
15055  } /* --- end-of-if(isscale) --- */
15056 /* --- apply gamma correction --- */
15057 if ( isgamma /* only gamma correct if requested */
15058 && gammacorrection > 0.0001 ) /* and if we have gamma correction */
15059  if ( ncolors > 1 ) /* and if not a "blank" raster */
15060  if ( colors[ncolors-1] > 0 ) /*and at least one pixel non-white*/
15061  {
15062  for ( igray=1; igray<ncolors; igray++ ) { /*gamma correct each colors[]*/
15063  int grayval = colors[igray], /* original 0=white to 255=black */
15064  gmax = grayscale-1; /* should be 255 */
15065  double dgray=((double)(gmax-grayval))/((double)gmax); /*0=black 1=white*/
15066  dgray = pow(dgray,(1.0/gammacorrection)); /* apply gamma correction */
15067  grayval = (int)( gmax*(1.0-dgray) + 0.5 ); /* convert back to grayval */
15068  colors[igray] = grayval; } /* store back in colors[] */
15069  } /* --- end-of-if(isgamma) --- */
15070 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15071 Construct colormap
15072 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15073 for ( ibyte=0; ibyte<nbytes; ibyte++ ) /* for each byte in bytemap */
15074  colormap[ibyte] = bytevalues[(int)bytemap[ibyte]]; /*index for this value*/
15075 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15076 back to caller with #colors, or 0 for any error
15077 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15078 end_of_job:
15079  if ( bytevalues != NULL ) free(bytevalues); /* free working memory */
15080  if ( maxcolors>0 && ncolors>maxcolors ) /* too many color indexes */
15081  ncolors = maxcolors; /* return maximum to caller */
15082  return ( ncolors ); /* back with #colors, or 0=error */
15083 } /* --- end-of-function aacolormap() --- */
15084 
15085 
15086 /* ==========================================================================
15087  * Function: aaweights ( width, height )
15088  * Builds "canonical" weight matrix, width x height, in a raster
15089  * (see Notes below for discussion).
15090  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15091  * Arguments: width (I) int containing width (#cols) of returned
15092  * raster/matrix of weights
15093  * height (I) int containing height (#rows) of returned
15094  * raster/matrix of weights
15095  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15096  * Returns: ( raster * ) ptr to raster containing width x height
15097  * weight matrix, or NULL for any error
15098  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15099  * Notes: o For example, given width=7, height=5, builds the matrix
15100  * 1 2 3 4 3 2 1
15101  * 2 4 6 8 6 4 2
15102  * 3 6 9 12 9 6 3
15103  * 2 4 6 8 6 4 2
15104  * 1 2 3 4 3 2 1
15105  * If an even dimension given, the two center numbers stay
15106  * the same, e.g., 123321 for the top row if width=6.
15107  * o For an odd square n x n matrix, the sum of all n^2
15108  * weights will be ((n+1)/2)^4.
15109  * o The largest weight (in the allocated pixsz=8 raster) is 255,
15110  * so the largest square matrix is 31 x 31. Any weight that
15111  * tries to grow beyond 255 is held constant at 255.
15112  * o A new_raster(), pixsz=8, is allocated for the caller.
15113  * To avoid memory leaks, be sure to delete_raster() when done.
15114  * ======================================================================= */
15115 /* --- entry point --- */
15116 raster *aaweights ( int width, int height )
15117 {
15118 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15119 Allocations and Declarations
15120 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15121 raster *new_raster(), *weights=NULL; /* raster of weights returned */
15122 int irow=0, icol=0, /* height, width indexes */
15123  weight = 0; /*running weight, as per Notes above*/
15124 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15125 Initialization
15126 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15127 /* --- allocate raster for weights --- */
15128 if ( (weights = new_raster(width,height,8)) /* allocate 8-bit byte raster */
15129 == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* return NULL error if failed */
15130 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15131 Fill weight matrix, as per Notes above
15132 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15133 for ( irow=0; irow<height; irow++ ) /* outer loop over rows */
15134  for ( icol=0; icol<width; icol++ ) /* inner loop over cols */
15135  {
15136  int jrow = height-irow-1, /* backwards irow, height-1,...,0 */
15137  jcol = width-icol-1; /* backwards icol, width-1,...,0 */
15138  weight = min2(irow+1,jrow+1) * min2(icol+1,jcol+1); /* weight */
15139  if ( aaalgorithm == 1 ) weight=1; /* force equal weights */
15140  setpixel(weights,irow,icol,min2(255,weight)); /*store weight in matrix*/
15141  } /* --- end-of-for(irow,icol) --- */
15142 end_of_job:
15143  return ( weights ); /* back with weights or NULL=error */
15144 } /* --- end-of-function aaweights() --- */
15145 
15146 
15147 /* ==========================================================================
15148  * Function: aawtpixel ( image, ipixel, weights, rotate )
15149  * Purpose: Applies matrix of weights to the pixels
15150  * surrounding ipixel in image, rotated clockwise
15151  * by rotate degrees (typically 0 or 30).
15152  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15153  * Arguments: image (I) raster * to bitmap (though it can be bytemap)
15154  * containing image with pixels to be averaged.
15155  * ipixel (I) int containing index (irow*width+icol) of
15156  * center pixel of image for weighted average.
15157  * weights (I) raster * to bytemap of relative weights
15158  * (0-255), whose dimensions (usually odd width
15159  * and odd height) determine the "subgrid" of
15160  * image surrounding ipixel to be averaged.
15161  * rotate (I) int containing degrees clockwise rotation
15162  * (typically 0 or 30), i.e., imagine weights
15163  * rotated clockwise and then averaging the
15164  * image pixels "underneath" it now.
15165  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15166  * Returns: ( int ) 0-255 weighted average, or -1 for any error
15167  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15168  * Notes: o The rotation matrix used (when requested) is
15169  * / x' \ / cos(theta) sin(theta)/a \ / x \
15170  * | | = | | | |
15171  * \ y' / \ -a*sin(theta) cos(theta) / \ y /
15172  * where a=1 (current default) is the pixel (not screen)
15173  * aspect ratio width:height, and theta is rotate (converted
15174  * from degrees to radians). Then x=col,y=row are the integer
15175  * pixel coords relative to the input center ipixel, and
15176  * x',y' are rotated coords which aren't necessarily integer.
15177  * The actual pixel used is the one nearest x',y'.
15178  * ======================================================================= */
15179 /* --- entry point --- */
15180 int aawtpixel ( raster *image, int ipixel, raster *weights, int rotate )
15181 {
15182 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15183 Allocations and Declarations
15184 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15185 int aaimgval = 0, /* weighted avg returned to caller */
15186  totwts=0, sumwts=0; /* total of all wts, sum wts used */
15187 int pixsz = image->pixsz, /* #bits per image pixel */
15188  black1=1, black8=255, /* black for 1-bit, 8-bit pixels */
15189  black = (pixsz==1? black1:black8), /* black value for our image */
15190  scalefactor = (black1+black8-black), /* only scale 1-bit images */
15191  iscenter = 0; /* set true if center pixel black */
15192 /* --- grid dimensions and indexes --- */
15193 int wtheight = weights->height, /* #rows in weight matrix */
15194  wtwidth = weights->width, /* #cols in weight matrix */
15195  imgheight = image->height, /* #rows in image */
15196  imgwidth = image->width; /* #cols in image */
15197 int wtrow, wtrow0 = wtheight/2, /* center row index for weights */
15198  wtcol, wtcol0 = wtwidth/2, /* center col index for weights */
15199  imgrow, imgrow0= ipixel/imgwidth, /* center row index for ipixel */
15200  imgcol, imgcol0= ipixel-(imgrow0*imgwidth); /*center col for ipixel*/
15201 /* --- rotated grid variables --- */
15202 static int prevrotate = 0; /* rotate from previous call */
15203 static double costheta = 1.0, /* cosine for previous rotate */
15204  sintheta = 0.0; /* and sine for previous rotate */
15205 double a = 1.0; /* default aspect ratio */
15206 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15207 Initialization
15208 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15209 /* --- refresh trig functions for rotate when it changes --- */
15210 if ( rotate != prevrotate ) /* need new sine/cosine */
15211  { costheta = cos(((double)rotate)/57.29578); /*cos of rotate in radians*/
15212  sintheta = sin(((double)rotate)/57.29578); /*sin of rotate in radians*/
15213  prevrotate = rotate; } /* save current rotate as prev */
15214 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15215 Calculate aapixel as weighted average over image points around ipixel
15216 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15217 for ( wtrow=0; wtrow<wtheight; wtrow++ )
15218  for ( wtcol=0; wtcol<wtwidth; wtcol++ )
15219  {
15220  /* --- allocations and declarations --- */
15221  int wt = (int)getpixel(weights,wtrow,wtcol); /* weight for irow,icol */
15222  int drow = wtrow - wtrow0, /* delta row offset from center */
15223  dcol = wtcol - wtcol0; /* delta col offset from center */
15224  int iscenter = 0; /* set true if center point black */
15225  /* --- initialization --- */
15226  totwts += wt; /* sum all weights */
15227  /* --- rotate (if requested) --- */
15228  if ( rotate != 0 ) /* non-zero rotation */
15229  {
15230  /* --- apply rotation matrix to (x=dcol,y=drow) --- */
15231  double dx=(double)dcol, dy=(double)drow, dtemp; /* need floats */
15232  dtemp = dx*costheta + dy*sintheta/a; /* save new dx' */
15233  dy = -a*dx*sintheta + dy*costheta; /* dy becomes new dy' */
15234  dx = dtemp; /* just for notational convenience */
15235  /* --- replace original (drow,dcol) with nearest rotated point --- */
15236  drow = (int)(dy+0.5); /* round dy for nearest row */
15237  dcol = (int)(dx+0.5); /* round dx for nearest col */
15238  } /* --- end-of-if(rotate!=0) --- */
15239  /* --- select image pixel to be weighted --- */
15240  imgrow = imgrow0 + drow; /*apply displacement to center row*/
15241  imgcol = imgcol0 + dcol; /*apply displacement to center col*/
15242  /* --- if pixel in bounds, accumulate weighted average --- */
15243  if ( imgrow>=0 && imgrow<imgheight ) /* row is in bounds */
15244  if ( imgcol>=0 && imgcol<imgwidth ) /* and col is in bounds */
15245  {
15246  /* --- accumulate weighted average --- */
15247  int imgval = (int)getpixel(image,imgrow,imgcol); /* image value */
15248  aaimgval += wt*imgval; /* weighted sum of image values */
15249  sumwts += wt; /* and also sum weights used */
15250  /* --- check if center image pixel black --- */
15251  if ( drow==0 && dcol==0 ) /* this is center ipixel */
15252  if ( imgval==black ) /* and it's black */
15253  iscenter = 1; /* so set black center flag true */
15254  } /* --- end-of-if(bounds checks ok) --- */
15255  } /* --- end-of-for(irow,icol) --- */
15256 if ( 0 && iscenter ) /* center point is black */
15257  aaimgval = black8; /* so force average black */
15258 else /* center point not black */
15259  aaimgval = /* 0=white ... black */
15260  ((totwts/2 - 1) + scalefactor*aaimgval)/totwts; /* not /sumwts; */
15261 /*end_of_job:*/
15262  return ( aaimgval );
15263 } /* --- end-of-function aawtpixel() --- */
15264 
15265 
15266 /* ==========================================================================
15267  * Function: mimetexsetmsg ( newmsglevel, newmsgfp )
15268  * Purpose: Sets msglevel and msgfp, usually called from
15269  * an external driver (i.e., DRIVER not defined
15270  * in this module).
15271  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15272  * Arguments: newmsglevel (I) int containing new msglevel
15273  * (unchanged if newmsglevel<0)
15274  * newmsgfp (I) FILE * containing new msgfp
15275  * (unchanged if newmsgfp=NULL)
15276  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15277  * Returns: ( int ) always 1
15278  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15279  * Notes: o
15280  * ======================================================================= */
15281 /* --- entry point --- */
15282 int mimetexsetmsg ( int newmsglevel, FILE *newmsgfp )
15283 {
15284 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15285 set msglevel and msgfp
15286 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15287 if ( newmsglevel >= 0 ) msglevel = newmsglevel;
15288 if ( newmsgfp != NULL ) msgfp = newmsgfp;
15289 return ( 1 );
15290 } /* --- end-of-function mimetexsetmsg() --- */
15291 #endif /* PART3 */
15292 
15293 /* ---
15294  * PART1
15295  * ------ */
15296 #if !defined(PARTS) || defined(PART1)
15297 #ifdef DRIVER
15298 /* ==========================================================================
15299  * Function: main() driver for mimetex.c
15300  * Purpose: emits a mime xbitmap or gif image of a LaTeX math expression
15301  * entered either as
15302  * (1) html query string from a browser (most typical), or
15303  * (2) a query string from an html <form method="get">
15304  * whose <input name="formdata"> (mostly for demo), or
15305  * (3) command-line arguments (mostly to test).
15306  * If no input supplied, expression defaults to "f(x)=x^2",
15307  * treated as test (input method 3).
15308  * If args entered on command-line (or if no input supplied),
15309  * output is (usually) human-viewable ascii raster images on
15310  * stdout rather than the usual mime xbitmaps or gif images.
15311  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15312  * Command-Line Arguments:
15313  * When running mimeTeX from the command-line, rather than
15314  * from a browser, syntax is
15315  * ./mimetex [-d ] dump gif to stdout
15316  * [expression expression, e.g., x^2+y^2,
15317  * |-f input_file] or read expression from file
