15318  * [-m msglevel] verbosity of debugging output
15319  * [-s fontsize] default fontsize, 0-5
15320  * -d Rather than ascii debugging output, mimeTeX dumps the
15321  * actual gif (or xbitmap) to stdout, e.g.,
15322  * ./mimetex -d x^2+y^2 > expression.gif
15323  * creates a gif file containing an image of x^2+y^2
15324  * -f Reads expression from input_file, and automatically
15325  * assumes -d switch. The input_file may contain the
15326  * expression on one line or spread out over many lines.
15327  * MimeTeX will concatanate all lines from input_file
15328  * to construct one long expression. Blanks, tabs, and
15329  * newlines will just be ignored.
15330  * -m 0-99, controls verbosity level for debugging output
15331  * (usually used only while testing code).
15332  * -s Font size, 0-5. As usual, the font size can
15333  * also be specified in the expression by a leading
15334  * preamble terminated by $, e.g., 3$f(x)=x^2 displays
15335  * f(x)=x^2 at font size 3. Default font size is 2.
15336  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15337  * Exits: 0=success, 1=some error
15338  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
15339  * Notes: o For an executable that emits mime xbitmaps, compile as
15340  * cc -DXBITMAP mimetex.c -lm -o mimetex.cgi
15341  * or, alternatively, for an executable that emits gif images
15342  * cc -DGIF mimetex.c gifsave.c -lm -o mimetex.cgi
15343  * or for gif images with anti-aliasing
15344  * cc -DGIF -DAA mimetex.c gifsave.c -lm -o mimetex.cgi
15345  * See Notes at top of file for other compile-line -D options.
15346  * o Move executable to your cgi-bin directory and either
15347  * point your browser to it directly in the form
15348  * http://www.yourdomain.com/cgi-bin/mimetex.cgi?3$f(x)=x^2
15349  * or put a tag in your html document of the form
15350  * <img src="../cgi-bin/mimetex.cgi?3$f(x)=x^2"
15351  * border=0 align=absmiddle>
15352  * where f(x)=x^2 (or any other expression) will be displayed
15353  * either as a mime xbitmap or gif image (as per -D flag).
15354  * ======================================================================= */
15355 
15356 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15357 header files and other data
15358 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15359 /* --- (additional) standard headers --- */
15360 /* --- other data --- */
15361 #ifdef DUMPENVIRON
15362  extern char **environ; /* environment information */
15363 #endif
15364 
15365 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15366 globals for gif and png callback functions
15367 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15368 GLOBAL(raster,*bitmap_raster,NULL); /* use 0/1 bitmap image or */
15369 GLOBAL(intbyte,*colormap_raster,NULL); /* anti-aliased color indexes */
15370 GLOBAL(int,raster_width,0); /* width of final/displayed image */
15371 GLOBAL(int,raster_height,0); /* height of final/displayed image */
15372 GLOBAL(int,raster_baseline,0); /* baseline of final/displayed image*/
15373 /* --- anti-aliasing flags (needed by GetPixel() as well as main()) --- */
15374 #ifdef AA /* if anti-aliasing requested */
15375  #define ISAAVALUE 1 /* turn flag on */
15376 #else
15377  #define ISAAVALUE 0 /* else turn flag off */
15378 #endif
15379 GLOBAL(int,isaa,ISAAVALUE); /* set anti-aliasing flag */
15380 
15381 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15382 logging data structure, and default data to be logged
15383 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15384 /* --- logging data structure --- */
15385 #define logdata struct logdata_struct /* "typedef" for logdata_struct*/
15386 logdata
15387  {
15388  /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------
15389  environment variable name, max #chars to display, min msglevel to display
15390  ------------------------------------------------------------------------ */
15391  char *name; /* environment variable name */
15392  int maxlen; /* max #chars to display */
15393  int msglevel; /* min msglevel to display data */
15394  } ; /* --- end-of-logdata_struct --- */
15395 /* --- data logged by mimeTeX --- */
15396 STATIC logdata mimelog[]
15397 #ifdef INITVALS
15398  =
15399  {
15400  /* ------ variable ------ maxlen msglevel ----- */
15401  { "QUERY_STRING", 999, 4 },
15402  { "REMOTE_ADDR", 999, 3 },
15403  { "HTTP_REFERER", 999, 3 },
15404  { "REQUEST_URI", 999, 5 },
15405  { "HTTP_USER_AGENT", 999, 3 },
15406  { "HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR", 999, 3 },
15407  { NULL, -1, -1 } /* trailer record */
15408  } /* --- end-of-mimelog[] --- */
15409 #endif
15410  ;
15411 
15412 
15413 /* --- entry point --- */
15414 int main ( int argc, char *argv[]
15415  #ifdef DUMPENVP
15416  , char *envp[]
15417  #endif
15418  )
15419 {
15420 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15421 Allocations and Declarations
15422 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15423 /* --- expression to be emitted --- */
15424 static char exprbuffer[MAXEXPRSZ+1] = "f(x)=x^2"; /* input TeX expression */
15425 char *expression = exprbuffer; /* ptr to expression */
15426 int size = NORMALSIZE; /* default font size */
15427 char *query = getenv("QUERY_STRING"); /* getenv("QUERY_STRING") result */
15428 char *mimeprep(); /* preprocess expression */
15429 int unescape_url(); /* convert %xx's to ascii chars */
15430 int emitcache(); /* emit cached image if it exists */
15431 int /*isquery = 0, (now global)*/ /* true if input from QUERY_STRING */
15432  isqempty = 0, /* true if query string empty */
15433  isqforce = 0, /* true to force query emulation */
15434  isqlogging = 0, /* true if logging in query mode */
15435  isformdata = 0, /* true if input from html form */
15436  isinmemory = 1, /* true to generate image in memory*/
15437  isdumpimage = 0, /* true to dump image on stdout */
15438  isdumpbuffer = 0; /* true to dump to memory buffer */
15439 /* --- rasterization --- */
15440 subraster *rasterize(), *sp=NULL; /* rasterize expression */
15441 raster *border_raster(), *bp=NULL; /* put a border around raster */
15442 int delete_subraster(); /* for clean-up at end-of-job */
15443 int type_raster(), type_bytemap(), /* screen dump function prototypes */
15444  xbitmap_raster(); /* mime xbitmap output function */
15445 /* --- http_referer --- */
15446 char *referer = REFERER; /* http_referer must contain this */
15447 char *inputreferer = INPUTREFERER; /*http_referer's permitted to \input*/
15448 int reflevels = REFLEVELS, urlncmp(); /* cmp http_referer,server_name */
15449 int strreplace(); /* replace SERVER_NAME in errmsg */
15450 char *urlprune(); /* prune referer_match */
15451 struct { char *referer; int msgnum; } /* http_referer can't contain this */
15452  denyreferer[] = { /* referer table to deny access to */
15453  #ifdef DENYREFERER
15454  #include DENYREFERER /* e.g., {"",1}, for no referer */
15455  #endif
15456  { NULL, -999 } }; /* trailer */
15457 char *http_referer = getenv("HTTP_REFERER"), /* referer using mimeTeX */
15458  *http_host = getenv("HTTP_HOST"), /* http host for mimeTeX */
15459  *server_name = getenv("SERVER_NAME"), /* server hosting mimeTeX */
15460  *referer_match = (!isempty(http_host)?http_host: /*match http_host*/
15461  (!isempty(server_name)?server_name:(NULL))); /* or server_name */
15462 int ishttpreferer = (isempty(http_referer)?0:1);
15463 int isstrstr(); /* search http_referer for referer */
15464 int isinvalidreferer = 0; /* true for inavlid referer */
15465 int norefmaxlen = NOREFMAXLEN; /*max query_string len if no referer*/
15466 /* --- gif --- */
15467 #if defined(GIF)
15468  int GetPixel(); /* feed pixels to gifsave library */
15469  int GIF_Create(),GIF_CompressImage(),GIF_Close(); /* prototypes for... */
15470  void GIF_SetColor(),GIF_SetTransparent(); /* ...gifsave enntry points */
15471 #endif
15472 char *gif_outfile = (char *)NULL, /* gif output defaults to stdout */
15473  gif_buffer[MAXGIFSZ] = "\000", /* or gif written in memory buffer */
15474  cachefile[256] = "\000", /* full path and name to cache file*/
15475  *md5str(); /* md5 has of expression */
15476 int maxage = 7200; /* max-age is two hours */
15477 int valign = (-9999); /*Vertical-Align:baseline-(height-1)*/
15478 /* --- pbm/pgm (-g switch) --- */
15479 /*int ispbmpgm = 0; (now global)*/ /* true to write pbm/pgm file */
15480 int type_pbmpgm(); /* entry point, graphic format */
15481 char *pbm_outfile = (char *)NULL; /* output file defaults to stdout */
15482 /* --- anti-aliasing --- */
15483 intbyte *bytemap_raster = NULL, /* anti-aliased bitmap */
15484  colors[256]; /* grayscale vals in bytemap */
15485 int aalowpass(), aapnm(), /*lowpass filters for anti-aliasing*/
15486  grayscale = 256; /* 0-255 grayscales in 8-bit bytes */
15487 int ncolors=2, /* #colors (2=b&w) */
15488  aacolormap(); /* build colormap from bytemap */
15489 int ipattern; /*patternnumcount[] index diagnostic*/
15490 /* --- advertisement preprocessing --- */
15491 int advertisement(), crc16(); /*wrap expression in advertisement*/
15492 char *adtemplate = NULL; /* usually use default message */
15493 char *host_showad = HOST_SHOWAD; /* show ads only on this host */
15494 /* --- messages --- */
15495 char logfile[256] = LOGFILE, /*log queries if msglevel>=LOGLEVEL*/
15496  cachelog[256] = CACHELOG; /* cached image log in cachepath/ */
15497 char *timestamp(); /* time stamp for logged messages */
15498 char *strdetex(); /* remove math chars from messages */
15499 int logger(); /* logs environ variables */
15500 int ismonth(); /* check argv[0] for current month */
15501 char *progname = (argc>0?argv[0]:"noname"); /* name program executed as */
15502 char *dashes = /* separates logfile entries */
15503  "--------------------------------------------------------------------------";
15504 char *invalid_referer_msg = msgtable[invmsgnum]; /*msg to invalid referer*/
15505 char *invalid_referer_match = msgtable[refmsgnum]; /*referer isn't host*/
15506 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15507 initialization
15508 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15509 /* --- run optional system command string --- */
15510 #ifdef SYSTEM
15511  system(SYSTEM);
15512 #endif
15513 /* --- set global variables --- */
15514 daemonlevel++; /* signal other funcs to reset */
15515 msgfp = stdout; /* for comamnd-line mode output */
15516 isss = issupersampling; /* set supersampling flag */
15517 isemitcontenttype = 1; /* true to emit mime content-type */
15518 iscachecontenttype = 0; /* true to cache mime content-type */
15519 *contenttype = '\000'; /* reset content-type:, etc. cache */
15520 isnomath = 0; /* true to inhibit math mode */
15521 seclevel = SECURITY; /* overall security level */
15522 inputseclevel = INPUTSECURITY; /* security level for \input{} */
15523 counterseclevel = COUNTERSECURITY; /* security level for \counter{} */
15524 environseclevel = ENVIRONSECURITY; /* security level for \environ */
15525 ninputcmds = 0; /* reset count of \input commands */
15526 exitstatus=0; errorstatus=ERRORSTATUS; /* reset exit/error status */
15527 iscaching = ISCACHING; /* true if caching images */
15528 if ( iscaching ) { /* images are being cached */
15529  strcpy(cachepath,CACHEPATH); /* relative path to cached files */
15530  if ( *cachepath == '%' ) { /* leading % signals cache headers */
15531  iscachecontenttype = 1; /* signal caching mime content-type*/
15532  strsqueeze(cachepath,1); } } /* and squeeze out leading % char */
15533 gifSize = 0; /* signal that image not in memory */
15534 fgred=FGRED; fggreen=FGGREEN; fgblue=FGBLUE; /* default foreground colors */
15535 bgred=BGRED; bggreen=BGGREEN; bgblue=BGBLUE; /* default background colors */
15536 shrinkfactor = shrinkfactors[NORMALSIZE]; /* set shrinkfactor */
15537 for ( ipattern=1; ipattern<=51; ipattern++ )
15538  patternnumcount0[ipattern] = patternnumcount1[ipattern] = 0;
15539 /* ---
15540  * check QUERY_STRING query for expression overriding command-line arg
15541  * ------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15542 if ( query != NULL ) /* check query string from environ */
15543  if ( strlen(query) >= 1 ) { /* caller gave us a query string */
15544  strncpy(expression,query,MAXEXPRSZ); /* so use it as expression */
15545  expression[MAXEXPRSZ] = '\000'; /* make sure it's null terminated */
15546  if ( 0 ) /*true to remove leading whitespace*/
15547  while ( isspace(*expression) && *expression!='\000' )
15548  {strsqueeze(expression,1);} /* squeeze out white space */
15549  isquery = 1; } /* and set isquery flag */
15550 if ( !isquery ) { /* empty query string */
15551  char *host = getenv("HTTP_HOST"), /* additional getenv("") results */
15552  *name = getenv("SERVER_NAME"), *addr = getenv("SERVER_ADDR");
15553  if ( host!=NULL || name!=NULL || addr!=NULL ) { /* assume http query */
15554  isquery = 1; /* set flag to signal query */
15555  if ( exitstatus == 0 ) exitstatus = errorstatus; /* signal error */
15556  strcpy(expression, /* and give user an error message */
15557  "\\red\\small\\rm\\fbox{\\begin{gather}\\LaTeX~expression~not~supplied"
15558  "\\\\i.e.,~no~?query\\_string~given~to~mimetex.cgi\\end{gather}}"); }
15559  isqempty = 1; /* signal empty query string */
15560  } /* --- end-of-if(!isquery) --- */
15561 /* ---
15562  * process command-line input args (if not a query)
15563  * ------------------------------------------------ */
15564 if ( !isquery /* don't have an html query string */
15565 || ( /*isqempty &&*/ argc>1) ) /* or have command-line args */
15566  {
15567  char *argsignal = ARGSIGNAL, /* signals start of mimeTeX args */
15568  stopsignal[32] = "--"; /* default Unix end-of-args signal */
15569  int iarg=0, argnum=0, /*argv[] index for command-line args*/
15570  exprarg = 0, /* argv[] index for expression */
15571  infilearg = 0, /* argv[] index for infile */
15572  nswitches = 0, /* number of -switches */
15573  isstopsignal = 0, /* true after stopsignal found */
15574  isstrict = 1/*iswindows*/, /* true for strict arg checking */
15575  /*nb, windows has apache "x -3" bug*/
15576  nargs=0, nbadargs=0, /* number of arguments, bad ones */
15577  maxbadargs = (isstrict?0:1), /*assume query if too many bad args*/
15578  isgoodargs = 0; /* true to accept command-line args*/
15579  if ( argsignal != NULL ) /* if compiled with -DARGSIGNAL */
15580  while ( argc > ++iarg ) /* check each argv[] for argsignal */
15581  if ( !strcmp(argv[iarg],argsignal) ) /* check for exact match */
15582  { argnum = iarg; /* got it, start parsing next arg */
15583  break; } /* stop looking for argsignal */
15584  while ( argc > ++argnum ) /* check for switches and values, */
15585  {
15586  nargs++; /* count another command-line arg */
15587  if ( strcmp(argv[argnum],stopsignal) == 0 ) /* found stopsignal */
15588  { isstopsignal = 1; /* so set stopsignal flag */
15589  continue; } /* and get expression after it */
15590  if ( !isstopsignal /* haven't seen stopsignal switch */
15591  && *argv[argnum] == '-' ) /* and have some '-' switch */
15592  {
15593  char *field = argv[argnum] + 1; /* ptr to char(s) following - */
15594  char flag = tolower(*field); /* single char following '-' */
15595  int arglen = strlen(field); /* #chars following - */
15596  argnum++; /* arg following flag/switch is usually its value */
15597  nswitches++; /* another switch on command line */
15598  if ( isstrict && /* if strict checking then... */
15599  !isthischar(flag,"g") && arglen!=1 ) /*must be single-char switch*/
15600  { nbadargs++; argnum--; } /* so ignore longer -xxx switch */
15601  else /* process single-char -x switch */
15602  switch ( flag ) { /* see what user wants to tell us */
15603  /* --- ignore uninterpreted flag --- */
15604  default: nbadargs++; argnum--; break;
15605  /* --- adjustable program parameters (not checking input) --- */
15606  case 'b': isdumpimage++; isdumpbuffer++; argnum--; break;
15607  case 'd': isdumpimage++; argnum--; break;
15608  case 'e': isdumpimage++; gif_outfile=argv[argnum]; break;
15609  case 'f': isdumpimage++; infilearg=argnum; break;
15610  case 'g': ispbmpgm++;
15611  if ( arglen > 1 ) pbmpgmtype = atoi(field+1); /* -g2==>type=2 */
15612  if ( 1 || *argv[argnum]=='-' ) argnum--; /*next arg is -switch*/
15613  else pbm_outfile = argv[argnum]; break; /*next arg is filename*/
15614  case 'm': if ( argnum < argc ) msglevel = atoi(argv[argnum]); break;
15615  case 'o': istransparent = (istransparent?0:1); argnum--; break;
15616  case 'q': isqforce = 1; argnum--; break;
15617  case 's': if ( argnum < argc ) size = atoi(argv[argnum]); break;
15618  } /* --- end-of-switch(flag) --- */
15619  } /* --- end-of-if(*argv[argnum]=='-') --- */
15620  else /* expression if arg not a -flag */
15621  if ( infilearg == 0 ) /* no infile arg yet */
15622  { if ( exprarg != 0 ) nbadargs++; /* 2nd expression invalid */
15623  exprarg = argnum; /* but take last expression */
15624  /*infilearg = (-1);*/ } /* and set infilearg */
15625  else nbadargs++; /* infile and expression invalid */
15626  } /* --- end-of-while(argc>++argnum) --- */
15627  if ( msglevel>=999 && msgfp!=NULL ) /* display command-line info */
15628  { fprintf(msgfp,"argc=%d, progname=%s, #args=%d, #badargs=%d\n",
15629  argc,progname,nargs,nbadargs);
15630  fprintf(msgfp,"cachepath=\"%.50s\" pathprefix=\"%.50s\"\n",
15631  cachepath,pathprefix); }
15632  /* ---
15633  * decide whether command-line input overrides query_string
15634  * -------------------------------------------------------- */
15635  if ( isdumpimage > 2 ) nbadargs++; /* duplicate/conflicting -switch */
15636  isgoodargs = ( !isstrict /*good if not doing strict checking*/
15637  || !isquery /* or if no query, must use args */
15638  || (nbadargs<nargs && nbadargs<=maxbadargs) ); /* bad args imply query */
15639  /* ---
15640  * take expression from command-line args
15641  * -------------------------------------- */
15642  if ( isgoodargs && exprarg > 0 /* good expression on command line */
15643  && infilearg <= 0 ) /* and not given in input file */
15644  if ( !isquery /* no conflict if no query_string */
15645  || nswitches > 0 ) /* explicit -switch(es) also given */
15646  { strncpy(expression,argv[exprarg],MAXEXPRSZ); /*expr from command-line*/
15647  expression[MAXEXPRSZ] = '\000'; /* make sure it's null terminated */
15648  isquery = 0; } /* and not from a query_string */
15649  /* ---
15650  * or read expression from input file
15651  * ---------------------------------- */
15652  if ( isgoodargs && infilearg > 0 ) /* have a good -f arg */
15653  {
15654  FILE *infile = fopen(argv[infilearg],"r"); /* open input file for read */
15655  if ( infile != (FILE *)NULL ) /* opened input file successfully */
15656  { char instring[MAXLINESZ+1]; /* line from file */
15657  int exprsz = 0; /* total #bytes read from file */
15658  isquery = 0; /* file input, not a query_string */
15659  *expression = '\000'; /* start expresion as empty string */
15660  while ( fgets(instring,MAXLINESZ,infile) != (char *)NULL ) /*till eof*/
15661  if ( exprsz + strlen(instring) < MAXEXPRSZ ) { /* have room for line */
15662  strcat(expression,instring); /* concat line to end of expression*/
15663  exprsz += strlen(instring); } /* update expression buffer length */
15664  fclose ( infile ); } /*close input file after reading expression*/
15665  } /* --- end-of-if(infilearg>0) --- */
15666  /* ---
15667  * xlate +++'s to blanks only if query
15668  * ----------------------------------- */
15669  if ( !isquery ) isplusblank = 0; /* don't xlate +++'s to blanks */
15670  /* ---
15671  * check if emulating query (for testing)
15672  * -------------------------------------- */
15673  if ( isqforce ) isquery = 1; /* emulate query string processing */
15674  /* ---
15675  * check if emitting pbm/pgm graphic
15676  * --------------------------------- */
15677  if ( isgoodargs && ispbmpgm > 0 ) /* have a good -g arg */
15678  if ( 1 && gif_outfile != NULL ) /* had an -e switch with file */
15679  if ( *gif_outfile != '\000' ) /* make sure string isn't empty */
15680  { pbm_outfile = gif_outfile; /* use -e switch file for pbm/pgm */
15681  gif_outfile = (char *)NULL; /* reset gif output file */
15682  /*isdumpimage--;*/ } /* and decrement -e count */
15683  } /* --- end-of-if(!isquery) --- */
15684 /* ---
15685  * check for <form> input
15686  * ---------------------- */
15687 if ( isquery ) { /* must be <form method="get"> */
15688  if ( !memcmp(expression,"formdata",8) ) /*must be <input name="formdata"> */
15689  { char *delim=strchr(expression,'='); /* find equal following formdata */
15690  if ( delim != (char *)NULL ) /* found unescaped equal sign */
15691  {strsqueezep(expression,delim+1);} /* so shift name= out */
15692  while ( (delim=strchr(expression,'+')) != NULL ) /*unescaped plus sign*/
15693  *delim = ' '; /* is "shorthand" for blank space */
15694  /*unescape_url(expression,1);*/ /* convert unescaped %xx's to chars */
15695  unescape_url(expression,0); /* convert all %xx's to chars */
15696  unescape_url(expression,0); /* repeat */
15697  if(0) msglevel = FORMLEVEL; /* msglevel for forms */
15698  isformdata = 1; } /* set flag to signal form data */
15699  else /* --- query, but not <form> input --- */
15700  unescape_url(expression,0); } /* convert _all_ %xx's to chars */
15701 /* ---
15702  * check queries for prefixes/suffixes/embedded that might cause problems
15703  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15704 /* --- expression whose last char is \ --- */
15705 if ( lastchar(expression) == '\\' ) /* last char is backslash */
15706  strcat(expression," "); /* assume "\ " lost the final space*/
15707 /* ---
15708  * check queries for embedded prefixes signalling special processing
15709  * ----------------------------------------------------------------- */
15710 if ( isquery ) /* only check queries */
15711  {
15712  /* --- check for msglevel=###$ prefix --- */
15713  if ( !memcmp(expression,"msglevel=",9) ) /* query has msglevel prefix */
15714  { char *delim=strchr(expression,'$'); /* find $ delim following msglevel*/
15715  if ( delim != (char *)NULL ) /* check that we found delim */
15716  { *delim = '\000'; /* replace delim with null */
15717  if ( seclevel <= 9 ) /* permit msglevel specification */
15718  msglevel = atoi(expression+9); /* interpret ### in msglevel###$ */
15719  strsqueezep(expression,delim+1); } } /* squeeze out prefix & delim */
15720  /* --- next check for logfile=xxx$ prefix (must follow msglevel) --- */
15721  if ( !memcmp(expression,"logfile=",8) ) /* query has logfile= prefix */
15722  { char *delim=strchr(expression,'$'); /* find $ delim following logfile=*/
15723  if ( delim != (char *)NULL ) /* check that we found delim */
15724  { *delim = '\000'; /* replace delim with null */
15725  if ( seclevel <= 3 ) /* permit logfile specification */
15726  strcpy(logfile,expression+8); /* interpret xxx in logfile=xxx$ */
15727  strsqueezep(expression,delim+1); } } /* squeeze out prefix & delim */
15728  } /* --- end-of-if(isquery) --- */
15729 /* ---
15730  * log query (e.g., for debugging)
15731  * ------------------------------- */
15732 if ( isquery ) /* only log query_string's */
15733  if ( msglevel >= LOGLEVEL /* check if logging */
15734  && seclevel <= 5 ) /* and if logging permitted */
15735  if ( logfile != NULL ) /* if a logfile is given */
15736  if ( *logfile != '\000' ) { /*and if it's not an empty string*/
15737  if ( (msgfp=fopen(logfile,"a")) /* open logfile for append */
15738  != NULL ) /* ignore logging if can't open */
15739  {
15740  /* --- default logging --- */
15741  logger(msgfp,msglevel,expression,mimelog); /* log query */
15742  /* --- additional debug logging (argv and environment) --- */
15743  if ( msglevel >= 9 ) /* log environment */
15744  { int i; /*char name[999],*value;*/
15745  fprintf(msgfp,"Command-line arguments...\n");
15746  if ( argc < 1 ) /* no command-line args */
15747  fprintf(msgfp," ...argc=%d, no argv[] variables\n",argc);
15748  else
15749  for ( i=0; i<argc; i++ ) /* display all argv[]'s */
15750  fprintf(msgfp," argv[%d] = \"%s\"\n",i,argv[i]);
15751  #ifdef DUMPENVP /* char *envp[] available for dump */
15752  fprintf(msgfp,"Environment variables (using envp[])...\n");
15753  if ( envp == (char **)NULL ) /* envp not provided */
15754  fprintf(msgfp," ...envp[] environment variables not available\n");
15755  else
15756  for ( i=0; ; i++ ) /* display all envp[]'s */
15757  if ( envp[i] == (char *)NULL ) break;
15758  else fprintf(msgfp," envp[%d] = \"%s\"\n",i,envp[i]);
15759  #endif /* --- DUMPENVP ---*/
15760  #ifdef DUMPENVIRON /* skip what should be redundant output */
15761  fprintf(msgfp,"Environment variables (using environ)...\n");
15762  if ( environ == (char **)NULL ) /* environ not provided */
15763  fprintf(msgfp," ...extern environ variables not available\n");
15764  else
15765  for ( i=0; ; i++ ) /*display environ[] and getenv()'s*/
15766  if ( environ[i] == (char *)NULL ) break;
15767  else {
15768  strcpy(name,environ[i]); /* set up name for getenv() arg */
15769  if ( (value=strchr(name,'=')) != NULL ) /* = delimits name */
15770  { *value = '\000'; /* got it, so null-terminate name */
15771  value = getenv(name); } /* and look up name using getenv() */
15772  else strcpy(name,"NULL"); /* missing = delim in environ[i] */
15773  fprintf(msgfp,"environ[%d]: \"%s\"\n\tgetenv(%s) = \"%s\"\n",
15774  i,environ[i],name,(value==NULL?"NULL":value));
15775  } /* --- end-of-if/else --- */
15776  #endif /* --- DUMPENVIRON ---*/
15777  } /* --- end-of-if(msglevel>=9) --- */
15778  /* --- close log file if no longer needed --- */
15779  if ( msglevel < DBGLEVEL ) /* logging, but not debugging */
15780  { fprintf(msgfp,"%s\n",dashes); /* so log separator line, */
15781  fclose(msgfp); /* close logfile immediately, */
15782  msgfp = NULL; } /* and reset msgfp pointer */
15783  else
15784  isqlogging = 1; /* set query logging flag */
15785  } /* --- end-of-if(msglevel>=LOGLEVEL) --- */
15786  else /* couldn't open logfile */
15787  msglevel = 0; } /* can't emit messages */
15788 /* ---
15789  * prepend prefix to submitted expression
15790  * -------------------------------------- */
15791 if ( 1 || isquery ) /* queries or command-line */
15792  if ( *exprprefix != '\000' ) /* we have a prefix string */
15793  { int npref = strlen(exprprefix); /* #chars in prefix */
15794  memmove(expression+npref+1,expression,strlen(expression)+1);/*make room*/
15795  memcpy(expression,exprprefix,npref); /* copy prefix into expression */
15796  expression[npref] = '{'; /* followed by { */
15797  strcat(expression,"}"); } /* and terminating } to balance { */
15798 /* ---
15799  * check if http_referer is allowed to use this image and to use \input{}
15800  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15801 if ( isquery ) { /* not relevant if "interactive" */
15802  /* --- check -DREFERER=\"comma,separated,list\" of valid referers --- */
15803  if ( referer != NULL ) { /* compiled with -DREFERER=\"...\" */
15804  if ( strcmp(referer,"month") != 0 ) /* but it's *only* "month" signal */
15805  if ( ishttpreferer ) /* or called "standalone" */
15806  if ( !isstrstr(http_referer,referer,0) ) { /* invalid http_referer */
15807  expression = invalid_referer_msg; /* so give user error message */
15808  isinvalidreferer = 1; } } /* and signal invalid referer */
15809  else /* compiled without -DREFERER= */
15810  if ( reflevels > 0 ) { /*match referer unless -DREFLEVELS=0*/
15811  /* --- check topmost levels of http_referer against http_host --- */
15812  if ( ishttpreferer /* have http_referer */
15813  && !isempty(referer_match) ) /* and something to match it with */
15814  if ( !urlncmp(http_referer,referer_match,reflevels) ) { /*match failed*/
15815  strcpy(exprbuffer,invalid_referer_match); /* init error message */
15816  strreplace(exprbuffer,"SERVER_NAME", /* and then replace SERVER_NAME */
15817  strdetex(urlprune(referer_match,reflevels),1),0);/*with referer_match*/
15818  isinvalidreferer = 1; } /* and signal invalid referer */
15819  } /* --- end-of-if(reflevels>0) --- */
15820  /* --- check -DINPUTREFERER=\"comma,separated,list\" of \input users --- */
15821  inputseclevel = INPUTSECURITY; /* set default input security */
15822  if ( inputreferer != NULL ) { /* compiled with -DINPUTREFERER= */
15823  if ( http_referer == NULL ) /* but no http_referer given */
15824  inputseclevel = (-1); /* unknown user can't \input{} */
15825  else /*have inputreferer and http_referer*/
15826  if ( !isstrstr(http_referer,inputreferer,0) ) /*http_referer can't \input*/
15827  inputseclevel = (-1); /* this known user can't \input{} */
15828  } /* --- end-of-if(inputreferer!=NULL) --- */
15829  } /* --- end-of-if(isquery) --- */
15830 /* ---
15831  * check if referer contains "month" signal
15832  * ---------------------------------------- */
15833 if ( isquery ) /* not relevant if "interactive" */
15834  if ( referer != NULL ) /* nor if compiled w/o -DREFERER= */
15835  if ( !isinvalidreferer ) /* nor if already invalid referer */
15836  if ( strstr(referer,"month") != NULL ) /* month check requested */
15837  if ( !ismonth(progname) ) /* not executed as mimetexJan-Dec */
15838  { expression = invalid_referer_msg; /* so give user error message */
15839  isinvalidreferer = 1; } /* and signal invalid referer */
15840 /* ---
15841  * check if http_referer is to be denied access
15842  * -------------------------------------------- */
15843 if ( isquery ) /* not relevant if "interactive" */
15844  if ( !isinvalidreferer ) /* nor if already invalid referer */
15845  { int iref=0, msgnum=(-999), /* denyreferer index, message# */
15846  whundredths = 0; /* or wait hundredths of a sec */
15847  for ( iref=0; msgnum<0; iref++ ) { /* run through denyreferer[] table */
15848  char *deny = denyreferer[iref].referer; /* referer to be denied */
15849  if ( deny == NULL ) break; /* null signals end-of-table */
15850  if ( msglevel>=999 && msgfp!=NULL ) /* debugging */
15851  {fprintf(msgfp,"main> invalid iref=%d: deny=%s http_referer=%s\n",
15852  iref,deny,(http_referer==NULL?"null":http_referer)); fflush(msgfp);}
15853  if ( *deny == '\000' ) /* signal to check for no referer */
15854  { if ( http_referer == NULL ) /* http_referer not supplied */
15855  msgnum = denyreferer[iref].msgnum; } /* so set message# */
15856  else /* have referer to check for */
15857  if ( http_referer != NULL ) /* and have referer to be checked */
15858  if ( isstrstr(http_referer,deny,0) ) /* invalid http_referer */
15859  msgnum = denyreferer[iref].msgnum; /* so set message# */
15860  } /* --- end-of-for(iref) --- */
15861  if ( msgnum >= 100 ) { /* wait but don't deny */
15862  whundredths = 10*(msgnum-100); /* hundredths=10*tenths */
15863  msgnum = (-999); } /* reset valid referer */
15864  if ( msgnum >= 0 ) { /* deny access to this referer */
15865  if ( msgnum > maxmsgnum ) msgnum = 0; /* keep index within bounds */
15866  expression = msgtable[msgnum]; /* set user error message */
15867  isinvalidreferer = 1; } /* and signal invalid referer */
15868  } /* --- end-of-if(!isinvalidreferer) --- */
15869 /* --- also check maximum query_string length if no http_referer given --- */
15870 if ( isquery ) /* not relevant if "interactive" */
15871  if ( !isinvalidreferer ) /* nor if already invalid referer */
15872  if ( !ishttpreferer ) /* no http_referer supplied */
15873  if ( strlen(expression) > norefmaxlen ) { /* query_string too long */
15874  if ( isempty(referer_match) ) /* no referer_match to display */
15875  expression = invalid_referer_msg; /* set invalid http_referer message*/
15876  else { /* error with referer_match display*/
15877  strcpy(exprbuffer,invalid_referer_match); /* init error message */
15878  strreplace(exprbuffer,"SERVER_NAME", /* and then replace SERVER_NAME */
15879  strdetex(urlprune(referer_match,reflevels),1),0); } /*with host_http*/
15880  isinvalidreferer = 1; } /* and signal invalid referer */
15881 /* ---
15882  * check for "advertisement"
15883  * ------------------------- */
15884 /* --- check if advertisement messages only for one particular host --- */
15885 if ( !isempty(host_showad) ) /* messages only for this referer */
15886  if ( !isempty(referer_match) ) /* have HTTP_HOST or SERVER_NAME */
15887  if ( strstr(referer_match,host_showad) /* see if this host sees ad */
15888  == NULL ) /* not mimetex host for ad */
15889  adfrequency = 0; /* turn off advertisements */
15890 /* --- check for advertisement directive (\advertisement) --- */
15891 if ( strreplace(expression,"\\advertisement","",0) /*remove \advertisement*/
15892 >= 1 ) adfrequency = 1; /* force advertisement display */
15893 if ( adfrequency > 0 ) { /* advertising enabled */
15894  int npump = crc16(expression)%16; /* #times, 0-15, to pump rand() */
15895  srand(atoi(timestamp(TZDELTA,4))); /* init rand() with mmddhhmmss */
15896  while ( npump-- >= 0 ) rand(); /* pre-pump rand() before use */
15897  if ( (1+rand())%adfrequency == 0 ) { /* once every adfrequency calls */
15898  advertisement(expression,adtemplate); } } /*wrap expression in advert*/
15899 /* ---
15900  * check for image caching (and whether or not caching content type)
15901  * ----------------------------------------------------------------- */
15902 if ( strstr(expression,"\\counter") != NULL /* can't cache \counter{} */
15903 || strstr(expression,"\\input") != NULL /* can't cache \input{} */
15904 || strstr(expression,"\\today") != NULL /* can't cache \today */
15905 || strstr(expression,"\\calendar") != NULL /* can't cache \calendar */
15906 || strstr(expression,"\\nocach") != NULL /* no caching requested */
15907 || isformdata /* don't cache user form input */
15908  ) { iscaching = 0; /* so turn caching off */
15909  maxage = 5; } /* and set max-age to 5 seconds */
15910 if ( strstr(expression,"\\depth") != NULL ) /* cache content-type lines */
15911  iscachecontenttype = 1; /* set flag to cache content-type */
15912 if ( strstr(expression,"\\nodepth") != NULL ) /* don't cache content-type */
15913  iscachecontenttype = 0; /*set flag to not cache content-type*/
15914 if ( isquery ) /* don't cache command-line images */
15915  if ( iscaching ) /* image caching enabled */
15916  {
15917  /* --- set up path to cached image file --- */
15918  char *md5hash = md5str(expression); /* md5 hash of expression */
15919  if ( md5hash == NULL ) /* failed for some reason */
15920  iscaching = 0; /* so turn off caching */
15921  else
15922  {
15923  strcpy(cachefile,cachepath); /* start with (relative) path */
15924  strcat(cachefile,md5hash); /* add md5 hash of expression */
15925  strcat(cachefile,".gif"); /* finish with .gif extension */
15926  gif_outfile = cachefile; /* signal GIF_Create() to cache */
15927  /* --- emit mime content-type line --- */
15928  if ( 0 && isemitcontenttype ) /* now done in emitcache() */
15929  { fprintf( stdout, "Cache-Control: max-age=%d\n",maxage );
15930  if ( abs(valign) < 999 ) /* have vertical align */
15931  fprintf( stdout, "Vertical-Align: %d\n",valign );
15932  fprintf( stdout, "Content-type: image/gif\n\n" ); }
15933  /* --- emit cached image if it already exists --- */
15934  if ( emitcache(cachefile,maxage,valign,0) > 0 ) /* cached image emitted */
15935  goto end_of_job; /* so nothing else to do */
15936  /* --- log caching request --- */
15937  if ( msglevel >= 1 /* check if logging */
15938  /*&& seclevel <= 5*/ ) /* and if logging permitted */
15939  if ( cachelog != NULL ) /* if a logfile is given */
15940  if ( *cachelog != '\000' ) /*and if it's not an empty string*/
15941  { char filename[256]; /* construct cachepath/cachelog */
15942  FILE *filefp=NULL; /* fopen(filename) */
15943  strcpy(filename,cachepath); /* start with (relative) path */
15944  strcat(filename,cachelog); /* add cache log filename */
15945  if ( (filefp=fopen(filename,"a")) /* open cache logfile for append */
15946  != NULL ) /* ignore logging if can't open */
15947  { int isreflogged = 0; /* set true if http_referer logged */
15948  fprintf(filefp,"%s %s\n", /* timestamp, md5 file */
15949  timestamp(TZDELTA,0),cachefile+strlen(cachepath)); /*skip path*/
15950  fprintf(filefp,"%s\n",expression); /* expression in filename */
15951  if ( http_referer != NULL ) /* show referer if we have one */
15952  if ( *http_referer != '\000' ) /* and if not an empty string*/
15953  { int loglen = strlen(dashes); /* #chars on line in log file*/
15954  char *refp = http_referer; /* line to be printed */
15955  isreflogged = 1; /* signal http_referer logged*/
15956  while ( 1 ) { /* printed in parts if needed*/
15957  fprintf(filefp,"%.*s\n",loglen,refp); /* print a part */
15958  if ( strlen(refp) <= loglen ) break; /* no more parts */
15959  refp += loglen; } } /* bump ptr to next part */
15960  if ( !isreflogged ) /* http_referer not logged */
15961  fprintf(filefp,"http://none\n"); /* so log dummy referer line */
15962  fprintf(filefp,"%s\n",dashes); /* separator line */
15963  fclose(filefp); } /* close logfile immediately */
15964  } /* --- end-of-if(cachelog!=NULL) --- */
15965  } /* --- end-of-if/else(md5hash==NULL) --- */
15966  } /* --- end-of-if(iscaching) --- */
15967 /* ---
15968  * emit copyright, gnu/gpl notice (if "interactive")
15969  * ------------------------------------------------- */
15970 if ( !isdumpimage && !ispbmpgm ) /* don't mix ascii with image dump */
15971  if ( (!isquery||isqlogging) && msgfp!=NULL ) { /* called from command line */
15972  fprintf(msgfp,"%s\n%s\n",copyright1,copyright2); /* display copyright */
15973  fprintf(msgfp,"Most recent revision: %s\n",REVISIONDATE); /*revision date*/
15974  } /* --- end-of-if(!isquery...) --- */
15975 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
15976 rasterize expression and put a border around it
15977 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
15978 /* --- preprocess expression, converting LaTeX constructs for mimeTeX --- */
15979 if ( expression != NULL ) { /* have expression to rasterize */
15980  expression = mimeprep(expression); } /* preprocess expression */
15981 /* --- double-check that we actually have an expression to rasterize --- */
15982 if ( expression == NULL ) { /* nothing to rasterize */
15983  if ( exitstatus == 0 ) exitstatus = errorstatus; /*signal error to parent*/
15984  if ( (!isquery||isqlogging) && msgfp!=NULL ) { /*emit error if not query*/
15985  if ( exitstatus != 0 ) fprintf(msgfp,"Exit code = %d,\n",exitstatus);
15986  fprintf(msgfp,"No LaTeX expression to rasterize\n"); }
15987  goto end_of_job; } /* and then quit */
15988 /* --- rasterize expression --- */
15989 if ( (sp = rasterize(expression,size)) == NULL ) { /* failed to rasterize */
15990  if ( exitstatus == 0 ) exitstatus = errorstatus; /*signal error to parent*/
15991  if ( (!isquery||isqlogging) && msgfp!=NULL ) { /*emit error if not query*/
15992  if ( exitstatus != 0 ) fprintf(msgfp,"Exit code = %d,\n",exitstatus);
15993  fprintf(msgfp,"Failed to rasterize %.2048s\n",expression); }
15994  if ( isquery ) { /* try to display failed expression*/
15995  char errormsg[4096]; /* buffer for failed expression */
15996  strcpy(errormsg, /* init error message */
15997  "\\red\\fbox{\\begin{gather}"
15998  "{\\rm~mi\\underline{meTeX~failed~to~render~your~expressi}on}\\\\[5]");
15999  strcat(errormsg,"{\\rm\\hspace{10}{"); /*render expression as \rm*/
16000  strcat(errormsg,strdetex(expression,0));/*add detexed expression to msg*/
16001  strcat(errormsg,"}\\hspace{10}}\\end{gather}}"); /* finish up */
16002  if ( (sp = rasterize(errormsg,1)) == NULL ) /*couldn't rasterize errmsg*/
16003  sp = rasterize( /* so rasterize generic error */
16004  "\\red\\rm~\\fbox{mimeTeX~failed~to~render\\\\your~expression}",1); }
16005  if ( sp == NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* re-check for err message failure*/
16006  magstep = 1; /* don't magstep error msgs */
16007  } /* --- end-of-if((sp=rasterize())==NULL) --- */
16008 /* --- magnify entire image here if we need >>bit<<map for pbm output --- */
16009 if ( !isaa || (ispbmpgm && pbmpgmtype<2) ) { /*or use bytemapmag() instead*/
16010  if ( magstep > 1 && magstep <= 10 ) { /* magnify entire bitmap image */
16011  raster *rastmag(), *magrp=NULL; /* bitmap magnify function */
16012  int baseline = sp->baseline; /* original image baseline */
16013  magrp = rastmag(sp->image,magstep); /* magnify raster image */
16014  if ( magrp != NULL ) { /* succeeded to magnify image */
16015  delete_raster(sp->image); /* free original raster image */
16016  sp->image = magrp; /*and replace it with magnified one*/
16017  /* --- adjust parameters --- */
16018  baseline *= magstep; /* scale baseline */
16019  if ( baseline > 0 ) baseline += 1; /* adjust for no descenders */
16020  sp->baseline = baseline; } /*reset baseline of magnified image*/
16021  magstep = (-1); /*done, don't also use bytemapmag()*/
16022  } /* --- end-of-if(magstep) --- */
16023  } /* --- end-of-if(1||(ispbmpgm&&pbmpgmtype<2)) --- */
16024 /* ---no border requested, but this adjusts width to multiple of 8 bits--- */
16025 if ( issupersampling ) /* no border needed for gifs */
16026  bp = sp->image; /* so just extract pixel map */
16027 else /* for mime xbitmaps must have... */
16028  bp = border_raster(sp->image,0,0,0,1); /* image width multiple of 8 bits */
16029 sp->image = bitmap_raster = bp; /* global copy for gif,png output */
16030 raster_width = bp->width; raster_height = bp->height; /* global copy */
16031 raster_baseline = sp->baseline; /* global copy (not needed) */
16032 if ( sp!=NULL && bp!=NULL ) { /* have raster */
16033  valign= raster_baseline -(raster_height -1);/*#pixels for Vertical-Align:*/
16034  if ( abs(valign) > 255 ) valign = (-9999); } /* sanity check */
16035 if ( ispbmpgm && pbmpgmtype<2 ) /* -g switch or -g1 switch */
16036  type_pbmpgm(bp,pbmpgmtype,pbm_outfile); /* emit b/w pbm file */
16037 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16038 generate anti-aliased bytemap from (bordered) bitmap
16039 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16040 if ( isaa ) /* we want anti-aliased bitmap */
16041  {
16042  /* ---
16043  * allocate bytemap and colormap as per width*height of bitmap
16044  * ----------------------------------------------------------- */
16045  int nbytes = (raster_width)*(raster_height); /*#bytes for byte,colormap*/
16046  if ( isss ) /* anti-aliasing by supersampling */
16047  bytemap_raster = (intbyte *)(bitmap_raster->pixmap); /*bytemap in raster*/
16048  else /* need to allocate bytemap */
16049  if ( aaalgorithm == 0 ) /* anti-aliasing not wanted */
16050  isaa = 0; /* so signal no anti-aliasing */
16051  else /* anti-aliasing wanted */
16052  if ( (bytemap_raster = (intbyte *)malloc(nbytes)) /* malloc bytemap */
16053  == NULL ) isaa = 0; /* reset flag if malloc failed */
16054  /* ---
16055  * now generate anti-aliased bytemap and colormap from bitmap
16056  * ---------------------------------------------------------- */
16057  if ( isaa ) /*re-check that we're anti-aliasing*/
16058  {
16059  /* ---
16060  * select anti-aliasing algorithm
16061  * ------------------------------ */
16062  if ( !isss ) /* generate bytemap for lowpass */
16063  switch ( aaalgorithm ) { /* choose antialiasing algorithm */
16064  default: isaa = 0; break; /* unrecognized algorithm */
16065  case 1: /* 1 for aalowpass() */
16066  if ( aalowpass(bp,bytemap_raster,grayscale) /*my own lowpass filter*/
16067  == 0 ) isaa = 0; /*failed, so turn off anti-aliasing*/
16068  break;
16069  case 2: /*2 for netpbm pnmalias.c algorithm*/
16070  if ( aapnm(bp,bytemap_raster,grayscale) /* pnmalias.c filter */
16071  == 0 ) isaa = 0; /*failed, so turn off anti-aliasing*/
16072  break;
16073  case 3: /*3 for aapnm() based on aagridnum()*/
16074  if ( aapnmlookup(bp,bytemap_raster,grayscale) /* pnmalias.c filter */
16075  == 0 ) isaa = 0; /*failed, so turn off anti-aliasing*/
16076  break;
16077  case 4: /* 4 for aalookup() table lookup */
16078  if ( aalowpasslookup(bp,bytemap_raster,grayscale) /* aalookup() */
16079  == 0 ) isaa = 0; /*failed, so turn off anti-aliasing*/
16080  break;
16081  } /* --- end-of-switch(aaalgorithm) --- */
16082  /* ---
16083  * emit aalookup() pattern# counts/percents diagnostics
16084  * ---------------------------------------------------- */
16085  if ( !isquery && msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=99 ) { /*emit patternnumcounts*/
16086  int pcount0=0, pcount1=0; /* init total w,b center counts */
16087  for ( ipattern=1; ipattern<=51; ipattern++ ) { /*each possible pattern*/
16088  if ( ipattern > 1 ) /* ignore all-white squares */
16089  pcount0 += patternnumcount0[ipattern]; /* bump total white centers */
16090  pcount1 += patternnumcount1[ipattern]; } /* bump total black centers */
16091  if ( pcount0+pcount1 > 0 ) /* have pcounts (using aalookup) */
16092  fprintf(msgfp, " aalookup() patterns excluding#1 white"
16093  " (%%'s are in tenths of a percent)...\n");
16094  for ( ipattern=1; ipattern<=51; ipattern++ ) { /*each possible pattern*/
16095  int tot = patternnumcount0[ipattern] + patternnumcount1[ipattern];
16096  if ( tot > 0 ) /* this pattern occurs in image */
16097  fprintf(msgfp,
16098  " pattern#%2d: %7d(%6.2f%%) +%7d(%6.2f%%) =%7d(%6.2f%%)\n",
16099  ipattern, patternnumcount0[ipattern], (ipattern<=1? 999.99:
16100  1000.*((double)patternnumcount0[ipattern])/((double)pcount0)),
16101  patternnumcount1[ipattern],
16102  1000.*((double)patternnumcount1[ipattern])/((double)pcount1),
16103  tot, (ipattern<=1? 999.99:
16104  1000.*((double)tot)/((double)(pcount0+pcount1))) ); }
16105  if ( pcount0+pcount1 > 0 ) /* true when using aalookup() */
16106  fprintf(msgfp,
16107  "all patterns: %7d +%7d =%7d total pixels\n",
16108  pcount0,pcount1,pcount0+pcount1); }
16109  /* ---
16110  * apply magstep if requested and not already done to bitmap above
16111  * --------------------------------------------------------------- */
16112  if ( 1 ) { /* or use rastmag() above instead */
16113  if ( magstep > 1 && magstep <= 10 ) { /*magnify entire bytemap image*/
16114  intbyte *bytemapmag(), *magmap=NULL; /* bytemap magnify function */
16115  magmap=bytemapmag(bytemap_raster,raster_width,raster_height,magstep);
16116  if ( magmap != NULL ) { /* succeeded to magnify image */
16117  free(bytemap_raster); /* free original bytemap image */
16118  bytemap_raster = magmap; /*and replace it with magnified one*/
16119  /* --- adjust parameters --- */
16120  raster_width *= magstep; raster_height *= magstep; /*scale raster*/
16121  nbytes *= (magstep*magstep); /* scale total image size */
16122  if ( abs(valign) < 255 ) { /* valign okay */
16123  valign *= magstep; /* scale by magstep */
16124  if ( abs(valign) > 512 ) valign = (-9999); } /* sanity check */
16125  } /* --- end-of-if(magmap!=NULL) --- */
16126  magstep = (-1); /*done, don't also use bytemapmag()*/
16127  } /* --- end-of-if(magstep) --- */
16128  } /* --- end-of-if(1) --- */
16129  /* ---
16130  * finally, generate colors and colormap
16131  * ------------------------------------- */
16132  if ( isaa ) /* have bytemap, so... */
16133  if ( (colormap_raster = (intbyte *)malloc(nbytes)) /*malloc colormap*/
16134  == NULL ) isaa = 0; /* reset flag if malloc failed */
16135  if ( isaa ) { /* we have byte/colormap_raster */
16136  ncolors = aacolormap(bytemap_raster,nbytes,colors,colormap_raster);
16137  if ( ncolors < 2 ) /* failed */
16138  { isaa = 0; /* so turn off anti-aliasing */
16139  ncolors = 2; } /* and reset for black&white */
16140  } /* --- end-of-if(isaa) --- */
16141  if ( isaa && ispbmpgm && pbmpgmtype>1 ) { /* -g2 switch */
16142  raster pbm_raster; /*construct arg for write_pbmpgm()*/
16143  pbm_raster.width = raster_width; pbm_raster.height = raster_height;
16144  pbm_raster.pixsz = 8; pbm_raster.pixmap = (pixbyte *)bytemap_raster;
16145  type_pbmpgm(&pbm_raster,pbmpgmtype,pbm_outfile); } /*grayscale file*/
16146  } /* --- end-of-if(isaa) --- */
16147  } /* --- end-of-if(isaa) --- */
16148 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16149 display results on msgfp if called from command line (usually for testing)
16150 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16151 if ( (!isquery||isqlogging) || msglevel >= 99 ) /*command line or debuging*/
16152  if ( !isdumpimage && !ispbmpgm ) /* don't mix ascii with image dump */
16153  {
16154  /* ---
16155  * display ascii image of rasterize()'s rasterized bitmap
16156  * ------------------------------------------------------ */
16157  if ( !isss ) /* no bitmap for supersampling */
16158  { fprintf(msgfp,"\nAscii dump of bitmap image...\n");
16159  type_raster(bp,msgfp); } /* emit ascii image of raster */
16160  /* ---
16161  * display anti-aliasing results applied to rasterized bitmap
16162  * ---------------------------------------------------------- */
16163  if ( isaa ) /* if anti-aliasing applied */
16164  {
16165  int igray; /* colors[] index */
16166  /* --- anti-aliased bytemap image --- */
16167  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9 ) /* don't usually emit raw bytemap */
16168  { fprintf(msgfp,"\nHex dump of anti-aliased bytemap, " /*emit bytemap*/
16169  "asterisks denote \"black\" bytes (value=%d)...\n",grayscale-1);
16170  type_bytemap(bytemap_raster,grayscale,
16171  raster_width,raster_height,msgfp); }
16172  /* --- colormap image --- */
16173  fprintf(msgfp,"\nHex dump of colormap indexes, " /* emit colormap */
16174  "asterisks denote \"black\" bytes (index=%d)...\n",ncolors-1);
16175  type_bytemap(colormap_raster,ncolors,
16176  raster_width,raster_height,msgfp);
16177  /* --- rgb values corresponding to colormap indexes */
16178  fprintf(msgfp,"\nThe %d colormap indexes denote rgb values...",ncolors);
16179  for ( igray=0; igray<ncolors; igray++ ) /* show colors[] values */
16180  fprintf(msgfp,"%s%2x-->%3d", (igray%5?" ":"\n"),
16181  igray,(int)(colors[ncolors-1]-colors[igray]));
16182  fprintf(msgfp,"\n"); /* always needs a final newline */
16183  } /* --- end-of-if(isaa) --- */
16184  } /* --- end-of-if(!isquery||msglevel>=9) --- */
16185 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16186 emit xbitmap or gif image, and exit
16187 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16188 if ( (isquery && !ispbmpgm) /* called from browser (usual) */
16189 || (isdumpimage && !ispbmpgm) /* or to emit gif dump of image */
16190 || (msglevel >= 99) ) /* or for debugging */
16191  {
16192  int igray = 0; /* grayscale index */
16193  #if defined(GIF) /* compiled to emit gif */
16194  /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------
16195  emit GIF image
16196  ------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16197  /* --- don't use memory buffer if outout file given --- */
16198  if ( gif_outfile != NULL ) isinmemory = 0; /* reset memory buffer flag */
16199  /* --- construct contenttype[] buffer containing mime headers --- */
16200  if ( 1 ) { /* always construct buffer */
16201  sprintf( contenttype, "Cache-Control: max-age=%d\n", maxage );
16202  /*sprintf(contenttype+strlen(contenttype),
16203  "Expires: Fri, 31 Oct 2003 23:59:59 GMT\n" );*/
16204  /*sprintf(contenttype+strlen(contenttype),
16205  "Last-Modified: Wed, 15 Oct 2003 01:01:01 GMT\n");*/
16206  if ( abs(valign) < 999 ) /* have Vertical-Align: header info*/
16207  sprintf( contenttype+strlen(contenttype),
16208  "Vertical-Align: %d\n", valign );
16209  sprintf( contenttype+strlen(contenttype),
16210  "Content-type: image/gif\n\n" ); }
16211  /* --- emit mime content-type line --- */
16212  if ( isemitcontenttype /* content-type lines wanted */
16213  && !isdumpimage /* don't mix ascii with image dump */
16214  && !isinmemory /* done below if in memory */
16215  && !iscaching ) /* done by emitcache() if caching */
16216  { fputs(contenttype,stdout); } /* emit content-type: header buffer*/
16217  /* --- write output to memory buffer, possibly for testing --- */
16218  if ( isinmemory /* want gif written to memory */
16219  || isdumpbuffer ) /*or dump memory buffer for testing*/
16220  if ( gif_outfile == NULL ) /* and don't already have a file */
16221  { *gif_buffer = '\000'; /* init buffer as empty string */
16222  memset(gif_buffer,0,MAXGIFSZ); /* zero out buffer */
16223  gif_outfile = gif_buffer; /* and point outfile to buffer */
16224  if ( isdumpbuffer ) /* buffer dump test requested */
16225  isdumpbuffer = 999; } /* so signal dumping to buffer */
16226  /* --- initialize gifsave library and colors --- */
16227  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=999 )
16228  { fprintf(msgfp,"main> calling GIF_Create(*,%d,%d,%d,8)\n",
16229  raster_width,raster_height,ncolors); fflush(msgfp); }
16230  while ( 1 ) /* init gifsave lib, and retry if caching fails */
16231  { int status = GIF_Create(gif_outfile,
16232  raster_width,raster_height, ncolors, 8);
16233  if ( status == 0 ) break; /* continue if succeeded */
16234  if ( iscaching == 0 ) goto end_of_job; /* quit if failed */
16235  iscaching = 0; /* retry without cache file */
16236  isdumpbuffer = 0; /* reset isdumpbuffer signal */
16237  if ( isquery ) isinmemory = 1; /* force in-memory image generation*/
16238  if ( isinmemory ) { /* using memory buffer */
16239  gif_outfile = gif_buffer; /* emit images to memory buffer */
16240  *gif_outfile = '\000'; } /* empty string signals buffer */
16241  else { /* or */
16242  gif_outfile = (char *)NULL; /* emit images to stdout */
16243  if ( isemitcontenttype ) { /* content-type lines wanted */
16244  fprintf( stdout, "Cache-Control: max-age=%d\n",maxage );
16245  fprintf( stdout, "Content-type: image/gif\n\n" ); } }
16246  } /* --- end-of-while(1) --- */
16247  GIF_SetColor(0,bgred,bggreen,bgblue); /* background white if all 255 */
16248  if ( !isaa ) /* just b&w if not anti-aliased */
16249  { GIF_SetColor(1,fgred,fggreen,fgblue); /* foreground black if all 0 */
16250  colors[0]='\000'; colors[1]='\001'; } /* and set 2 b&w color indexes */
16251  else /* set grayscales for anti-aliasing */
16252  /* --- anti-aliased, so call GIF_SetColor() for each colors[] --- */
16253  for ( igray=1; igray<ncolors; igray++ ) /* for colors[] values */
16254  {
16255  /*--- gfrac goes from 0 to 1.0, as igray goes from 0 to ncolors-1 ---*/
16256  double gfrac = ((double)colors[igray])/((double)colors[ncolors-1]);
16257  /* --- r,g,b components go from background to foreground color --- */
16258  int red = iround(((double)bgred) +gfrac*((double)(fgred-bgred))),
16259  green= iround(((double)bggreen)+gfrac*((double)(fggreen-bggreen))),
16260  blue = iround(((double)bgblue) +gfrac*((double)(fgblue-bgblue)));
16261  /* --- set color index number igray to rgb values gray,gray,gray --- */
16262  GIF_SetColor(igray, red,green,blue); /*set gray,grayer,...,0=black*/
16263  } /* --- end-of-for(igray) --- */
16264  /* --- set gif color#0 (background) transparent --- */
16265  if ( istransparent ) /* transparent background wanted */
16266  GIF_SetTransparent(0); /* set transparent background */
16267  if (msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9) fflush(msgfp); /*flush debugging output*/
16268  /* --- emit compressed gif image (to stdout or cache file) --- */
16269  GIF_CompressImage(0, 0, -1, -1, GetPixel); /* emit gif */
16270  GIF_Close(); /* close file */
16271  if ( msgfp!=NULL && msglevel>=9 )
16272  { fprintf(msgfp,"main> created gifSize=%d\n", gifSize);
16273  fflush(msgfp); }
16274  /* --- may need to emit image from cached file or from memory --- */
16275  if ( isquery /* have an actual query string */
16276  || isdumpimage /* or dumping image */
16277  || msglevel >= 99 ) { /* or debugging */
16278  int maxage2 = (isdumpimage?(-1):maxage); /* no headers if dumping image */
16279  if ( iscaching ) /* caching enabled */
16280  emitcache(cachefile,maxage2,valign,0); /*emit cached image (hopefully)*/
16281  else if ( isinmemory ) /* or emit image from memory buffer*/
16282  emitcache(gif_buffer,maxage2,valign,1); } /*emitted from memory buffer*/
16283  /* --- for testing, may need to write image buffer to file --- */
16284  if ( isdumpbuffer > 99 ) /* gif image in memory buffer */
16285  if ( gifSize > 0 ) /* and it's not an empty buffer */
16286  { FILE *dumpfp = fopen("mimetex.gif","wb"); /* dump to mimetex.gif */
16287  if ( dumpfp != NULL ) /* file opened successfully */
16288  { fwrite(gif_buffer,sizeof(unsigned char),gifSize,dumpfp); /*write*/
16289  fclose(dumpfp); } /* and close file */
16290  } /* --- end-of-if(isdumpbuffer>99) --- */
16291  #else
16292  /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------
16293  emit mime XBITMAP image
16294  ------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16295  xbitmap_raster(bp,stdout); /* default emits mime xbitmap */
16296  #endif
16297  } /* --- end-of-if(isquery) --- */
16298 /* --- exit --- */
16299 end_of_job:
16300  if ( !isss ) /*bytemap raster in sp for supersamp*/
16301  if ( bytemap_raster != NULL ) free(bytemap_raster);/*free bytemap_raster*/
16302  if (colormap_raster != NULL )free(colormap_raster); /*and colormap_raster*/
16303  if ( 0 && gif_buffer != NULL ) free(gif_buffer); /* free malloced buffer */
16304  if ( 1 && sp != NULL ) delete_subraster(sp); /* and free expression */
16305  if ( msgfp != NULL /* have message/log file open */
16306  && msgfp != stdout ) /* and it's not stdout */
16307  { fprintf(msgfp,"mimeTeX> successful end-of-job at %s\n",
16308  timestamp(TZDELTA,0));
16309  fprintf(msgfp,"%s\n",dashes); /* so log separator line */
16310  fclose(msgfp); } /* and close logfile */
16311  /* --- dump memory leaks in debug window if in MS VC++ debug mode --- */
16312  #if defined(_CRTDBG_MAP_ALLOC)
16313  _CrtDumpMemoryLeaks();
16314  #endif
16315  /* --- exit() if not running as Windows DLL (see CreateGifFromEq()) --- */
16316  #if !defined(_USRDLL)
16317  if ( errorstatus == 0 ) /*user doesn't want errors signalled*/
16318  exitstatus = 0; /* so reset error status */
16319  exit ( exitstatus );
16320  #endif
16321 } /* --- end-of-function main() --- */
16322 
16323 /* ==========================================================================
16324  * Function: CreateGifFromEq ( expression, gifFileName )
16325  * Purpose: shortcut method to create GIF file for expression,
16326  * with antialising and all other capabilities
16327  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16328  * Arguments: expression (I) char *ptr to null-terminated string
16329  * containing LaTeX expression to be rendred
16330  * gifFileName (I) char *ptr to null-terminated string
16331  * containing name of output gif file
16332  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16333  * Returns: ( int ) exit value from main (0 if successful)
16334  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16335  * Notes: o This function is the entry point when mimeTeX is built
16336  * as a Win32 DLL rather then a standalone app or CGI
16337  * o Contributed to mimeTeX by Shital Shah. See his homepage
16338  * http://www.shitalshah.com
16339  * o Shital discusses the mimeTeX Win32 DLL project at
16340  * http://www.codeproject.com/dotnet/Eq2Img.asp
16341  * and you can download his latest code from
16342  * http://www.shitalshah.com/dev/eq2img_all.zip
16343  * ======================================================================= */
16344 /* --- include function to expose Win32 DLL to outside world --- */
16345 #if defined(_USRDLL)
16346  extern _declspec(dllexport)int _cdecl
16347  CreateGifFromEq ( char *expression, char *gifFileName );
16348 #endif
16349 /* --- entry point --- */
16350 int CreateGifFromEq ( char *expression, char *gifFileName )
16351 {
16352 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16353 Allocations and Declarations
16354 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16355 int main(); /* main() akways returns an int */
16356 /* --- set constants --- */
16357 int argc = 4; /* count of args supplied to main() */
16358 char *argv[5] = /* command line args to run with -e option */
16359  { "MimeTeXWin32DLL", "-e", /* constant args */
16360  /*gifFileName, expression,*/ NULL, NULL, NULL };
16361 /* --- set argv[]'s not computable at load time --- */
16362 argv[2] = gifFileName; /* args are -e gifFileName */
16363 argv[3] = expression; /* and now -e gifFileName expression */
16364 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16365 Run mimeTeX in command-line mode with -e (export) option, and then return
16366 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16367 return main ( argc, argv
16368  #ifdef DUMPENVP
16369  , NULL
16370  #endif
16371  ) ;
16372 } /* --- end-of-function CreateGifFromEq() --- */
16373 
16374 
16375 /* ==========================================================================
16376  * Function: ismonth ( char *month )
16377  * Purpose: returns 1 if month contains current month "jan"..."dec".
16378  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16379  * Arguments: month (I) char * containing null-terminated string
16380  * in which "jan"..."dec" is (putatively)
16381  * contained as a substring.
16382  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16383  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if month contains current month,
16384  * 0 otherwise
16385  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16386  * Notes: o There's a three day "grace period", e.g., Dec 3 mtaches Nov.
16387  * ======================================================================= */
16388 /* --- entry point --- */
16389 int ismonth ( char *month )
16390 {
16391 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16392 Allocations and Declarations
16393 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16394 int isokay = 0; /*1 if month contains current month*/
16395 /*long time_val = 0L;*/ /* binary value returned by time() */
16396 time_t time_val = (time_t)(0); /* binary value returned by time() */
16397 struct tm *tmstruct=(struct tm *)NULL, *localtime(); /* interpret time_val */
16398 int imonth, mday; /* current month 1-12 and day 1-31 */
16399 int ngrace = 3; /* grace period */
16400 char lcmonth[128]="\000"; int i=0; /* lowercase month */
16401 static char *months[] = /* month must contain current one */
16402  {"dec","jan","feb","mar","apr","may","jun",
16403  "jul","aug","sep","oct","nov","dec","jan"};
16404 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16405 get current date:time info, and check month
16406 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16407 /* --- lowercase input month --- */
16408 if ( month != NULL ) /* check that we got input */
16409  for ( i=0; i<120 && *month!='\000'; i++,month++ ) /* go thru month chars */
16410  lcmonth[i] = tolower(*month); /* lowerase each char in month */
16411 if ( i < 2 ) goto end_of_job; /* must be invalid input */
16412 lcmonth[i] = '\000'; /* null-terminate lcmonth[] */
16413 /* --- get current date:time --- */
16414 time((time_t *)(&time_val)); /* get date and time */
16415 tmstruct = localtime((time_t *)(&time_val)); /* interpret time_val */
16416 /* --- month and day --- */
16417 imonth = 1 + (int)(tmstruct->tm_mon); /* 1=jan ... 12=dec */
16418 mday = (int)(tmstruct->tm_mday); /* 1-31 */
16419 if ( imonth<1 || imonth>12 /* quit if month out-of-range */
16420 || mday<0 || mday>31 ) goto end_of_job; /* or date out of range */
16421 /* --- check input month against current date --- */
16422 if ( strstr(lcmonth,months[imonth]) != NULL ) isokay = 1; /* current month */
16423 if ( mday <= ngrace ) /* 1-3 within grace period */
16424  if ( strstr(lcmonth,months[imonth-1]) != NULL ) isokay = 1; /* last month */
16425 if ( mday >= 31-ngrace ) /* 28-31 within grace period */
16426  if ( strstr(lcmonth,months[imonth+1]) != NULL ) isokay = 1; /* next month */
16427 end_of_job:
16428  return ( isokay ); /*1 if month contains current month*/
16429 } /* --- end-of-function ismonth() --- */
16430 
16431 
16432 /* ==========================================================================
16433  * Function: logger ( fp, msglevel, message, logvars )
16434  * Purpose: Logs the environment variables specified in logvars
16435  * to fp if their msglevel is >= the passed msglevel.
16436  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16437  * Arguments: fp (I) FILE * to file containing log
16438  * msglevel (I) int containing logging message level
16439  * message (I) char * to optional message, or NULL
16440  * logvars (I) logdata * to array of environment variables
16441  * to be logged
16442  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16443  * Returns: ( int ) number of variables from logvars
16444  * that were actually logged
16445  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16446  * Notes: o
16447  * ======================================================================= */
16448 /* --- entry point --- */
16449 int logger ( FILE *fp, int msglevel, char *message, logdata *logvars )
16450 {
16451 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16452 Allocations and Declarations
16453 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16454 int ilog=0, nlogged=0; /* logvars[] index, #vars logged */
16455 char *timestamp(); /* timestamp logged */
16456 char *value = NULL; /* getenv(name) to be logged */
16457 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16458 Log each variable
16459 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16460 fprintf(fp,"%s\n",timestamp(TZDELTA,0)); /*emit timestamp before first var*/
16461 if ( message != NULL ) /* optional message supplied */
16462  fprintf(fp," MESSAGE = %s\n",message); /* emit caller-supplied message */
16463 if ( logvars != (logdata *)NULL ) /* have logvars */
16464  for ( ilog=0; logvars[ilog].name != NULL; ilog++ ) /* till end-of-table */
16465  if ( msglevel >= logvars[ilog].msglevel ) /* check msglevel for this var */
16466  if ( (value=getenv(logvars[ilog].name)) /* getenv(name) to be logged */
16467  != NULL ) /* check that name exists */
16468  {
16469  fprintf(fp," %s = %.*s\n", /* emit variable name = value */
16470  logvars[ilog].name,logvars[ilog].maxlen,value);
16471  nlogged++; /* bump #vars logged */
16472  } /* --- end-of-for(ilog) --- */
16473 return ( nlogged ); /* back to caller */
16474 } /* --- end-of-function logger() --- */
16475 
16476 
16477 /* ==========================================================================
16478  * Function: emitcache ( cachefile, maxage, valign, isbuffer )
16479  * Purpose: dumps bytes from cachefile to stdout
16480  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16481  * Arguments: cachefile (I) pointer to null-terminated char string
16482  * containing full path to file to be dumped,
16483  * or contains buffer of bytes to be dumped
16484  * maxage (I) int containing maxage, in seconds, for
16485  * http header, or -1 to not emit headers
16486  * valign (I) int containing Vertical-Align:, in pixels,
16487  * for http header, or <= -999 to not emit
16488  * isbuffer (I) 1 if cachefile is buffer of bytes to be
16489  * dumped
16490  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16491  * Returns: ( int ) #bytes dumped (0 signals error)
16492  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16493  * Notes: o
16494  * ======================================================================= */
16495 /* --- entry point --- */
16496 int emitcache ( char *cachefile, int maxage, int valign, int isbuffer )
16497 {
16498 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16499 Allocations and Declarations
16500 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16501 int nbytes=gifSize, readcachefile(); /* read cache file */
16502 FILE *emitptr = stdout; /* emit cachefile to stdout */
16503 unsigned char buffer[MAXGIFSZ+1]; /* bytes from cachefile */
16504 unsigned char *buffptr = buffer; /* ptr to buffer */
16505 int isvalign = (abs(valign)<999?1:0); /* true to emit Vertical-Align: */
16506 int iscontenttypecached = iscachecontenttype; /*true if headers cached*/
16507 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16508 initialization
16509 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16510 /* --- check that files opened okay --- */
16511 if ( emitptr == (FILE *)NULL ) /* failed to open emit file */
16512  goto end_of_job; /* so return 0 bytes to caller */
16513 /* --- read the file if necessary --- */
16514 if ( isbuffer ) { /* cachefile is buffer */
16515  buffptr = (unsigned char *)cachefile; /* so reset buffer pointer */
16516  iscontenttypecached = 0; } /* and iscontenttypecached flag */
16517 else { /* cachefile is file name */
16518  if ( (nbytes = readcachefile(cachefile,buffer)) /* read the file */
16519  < 1 ) goto end_of_job; } /* quit if file not read */
16520 /* --- first emit http headers if requested --- */
16521 if ( isemitcontenttype /* content-type lines enabled */
16522 && !iscontenttypecached /* and not in cached image */
16523 && maxage >= 0 ) /* caller wants http headers */
16524  { /* --- emit mime content-type line --- */
16525  fprintf( emitptr, "Cache-Control: max-age=%d\n",maxage );
16526  fprintf( emitptr, "Content-Length: %d\n",nbytes );
16527  if ( isvalign ) /* Vertical-Align: header wanted */
16528  fprintf( emitptr, "Vertical-Align: %d\n",valign );
16529  fprintf( emitptr, "Content-type: image/gif\n\n" ); }
16530 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16531 set stdout to binary mode (for Windows)
16532 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16533 /* emitptr = fdopen(STDOUT_FILENO,"wb"); */ /* doesn't work portably, */
16534 #ifdef WINDOWS /* so instead... */
16535  #ifdef HAVE_SETMODE /* prefer (non-portable) setmode() */
16536  if ( setmode ( fileno (stdout), O_BINARY) /* windows specific call */
16537  == -1 ) ; /* handle error */ /* sets stdout to binary mode */
16538  #else /* setmode() not available */
16539  #if 1
16540  freopen ("CON", "wb", stdout); /* freopen() stdout binary */
16541  #else
16542  stdout = fdopen (STDOUT_FILENO, "wb"); /* fdopen() stdout binary */
16543  #endif
16544  #endif
16545 #endif
16546 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16547 emit bytes from cachefile
16548 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16549 /* --- write bytes to stdout --- */
16550 if ( fwrite(buffptr,sizeof(unsigned char),nbytes,emitptr) /* write buffer */
16551 < nbytes ) /* failed to write all bytes */
16552  nbytes = 0; /* reset total count to 0 */
16553 end_of_job:
16554  return ( nbytes ); /* back with #bytes emitted */
16555 } /* --- end-of-function emitcache() --- */
16556 
16557 
16558 /* ==========================================================================
16559  * Function: readcachefile ( cachefile, buffer )
16560  * Purpose: read cachefile into buffer
16561  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16562  * Arguments: cachefile (I) pointer to null-terminated char string
16563  * containing full path to file to be read
16564  * buffer (O) pointer to unsigned char string
16565  * returning contents of cachefile
16566  * (max 64000 bytes)
16567  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16568  * Returns: ( int ) #bytes read (0 signals error)
16569  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16570  * Notes: o
16571  * ======================================================================= */
16572 /* --- entry point --- */
16573 int readcachefile ( char *cachefile, unsigned char *buffer )
16574 {
16575 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16576 Allocations and Declarations
16577 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16578 FILE *cacheptr = fopen(cachefile,"rb"); /*open cachefile for binary read*/
16579 unsigned char cachebuff[64]; /* bytes from cachefile */
16580 int buflen = 32, /* #bytes we try to read from file */
16581  nread = 0, /* #bytes actually read from file */
16582  maxbytes = MAXGIFSZ, /* max #bytes returned in buffer */
16583  nbytes = 0; /* total #bytes read */
16584 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16585 initialization
16586 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16587 /* --- check that files opened okay --- */
16588 if ( cacheptr == (FILE *)NULL ) goto end_of_job; /*failed to open cachefile*/
16589 /* --- check that output buffer provided --- */
16590 if ( buffer == (unsigned char *)NULL ) goto end_of_job; /* no buffer */
16591 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16592 read bytes from cachefile
16593 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16594 while ( 1 )
16595  {
16596  /* --- read bytes from cachefile --- */
16597  nread = fread(cachebuff,sizeof(unsigned char),buflen,cacheptr); /* read */
16598  if ( nbytes + nread > maxbytes ) /* block too big for buffer */
16599  nread = maxbytes - nbytes; /* so truncate it */
16600  if ( nread < 1 ) break; /* no bytes left in cachefile */
16601  /* --- store bytes in buffer --- */
16602  memcpy(buffer+nbytes,cachebuff,nread); /* copy current block to buffer */
16603  /* --- ready to read next block --- */
16604  nbytes += nread; /* bump total #bytes emitted */
16605  if ( nread < buflen ) break; /* no bytes left in cachefile */
16606  if ( nbytes >= maxbytes ) break; /* avoid buffer overflow */
16607  } /* --- end-of-while(1) --- */
16608 end_of_job:
16609  if ( cacheptr != NULL ) fclose(cacheptr); /* close file if opened */
16610  return ( nbytes ); /* back with #bytes emitted */
16611 } /* --- end-of-function readcachefile() --- */
16612 
16613 
16614 /* ==========================================================================
16615  * Function: advertisement ( expression, message )
16616  * Purpose: wrap expression in advertisement message
16617  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16618  * Arguments: expression (I/O) pointer to null-terminated char string
16619  * containing expression to be "wrapped",
16620  * and returning wrapped expression
16621  * message (I) pointer to null-terminated char string
16622  * containing template for advertisement
16623  * message, or NULL to use default message
16624  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16625  * Returns: ( int ) 1 if successful, 0=error
16626  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16627  * Notes: o
16628  * ======================================================================= */
16629 /* --- entry point --- */
16630 int advertisement ( char *expression, char *message )
16631 {
16632 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16633 Allocations and Declarations
16634 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16635 /* --- advertisement template --- */
16636 char *adtemplate =
16637  #if defined(ADVERTISEMENT) /* cc -DADVERTISEMENT=\"filename\" */
16638  #include ADVERTISEMENT /* filename with advertisement */
16639  #else /* formatted as illustrated below */
16640  "\\begin{gather} {\\small\\text \\fbox{\\begin{gather}"
16641  "mime\\TeX rendering courtesy of\\\\"
16642  "\\homepagetext \\end{gather}}}\\\\"
16643  " %%beginmath%% %%expression%% %%endmath%% \\end{gather}"
16644  #endif
16645  ; /* terminating semicolon */
16646 /* --- other variables --- */
16647 char adbuffer[MAXEXPRSZ+2048]; /*construct wrapped expression here*/
16648 char *beginmath = " ", /* start math mode */
16649  *endmath = " "; /* end math mode */
16650 int strreplace(); /* replace %%keywords%% with values*/
16651 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16652 wrap expression in advertisement
16653 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16654 /* --- start with template --- */
16655 if ( isempty(message) ) /* caller didn't supply message */
16656  message = adtemplate; /* so use default message */
16657 strcpy(adbuffer,message); /* copy message template to buffer */
16658 /* --- replace %%beginmath%%...%%endmath%% --- */
16659  strreplace(adbuffer,"%%beginmath%%",beginmath,0);
16660  strreplace(adbuffer,"%%endmath%%",endmath,0);
16661 /* --- replace %%expression%% in template with expression --- */
16662  strreplace(adbuffer,"%%expression%%",expression,0);
16663 /* --- replace original expression --- */
16664 strcpy(expression,adbuffer); /* expression now wrapped in ad */
16665 return ( 1 ); /* always just return 1 */
16666 } /* --- end-of-function advertisement() --- */
16667 
16668 
16669 /* ==========================================================================
16670  * Function: crc16 ( s )
16671  * Purpose: 16-bit crc of string s
16672  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16673  * Arguments: s (I) pointer to null-terminated char string
16674  * whose crc is desired
16675  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16676  * Returns: ( int ) 16-bit crc of s
16677  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16678  * Notes: o From Numerical Recipes in C, 2nd ed, page 900.
16679  * ======================================================================= */
16680 /* --- entry point --- */
16681 int crc16 ( char *s )
16682 {
16683 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------
16684 Compute the crc
16685 -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
16686 unsigned short crc = 0; /* returned crc */
16687 int ibit; /* for(ibit) eight one-bit shifts */
16688 while ( !isempty(s) ) { /* while there are still more chars*/
16689  crc = (crc ^ (*s)<<8); /* add next char */
16690  for ( ibit=0; ibit<8; ibit++ ) /* generator polynomial */
16691  if ( crc & 0x8000 ) { crc<<=1; crc=crc^4129; }
16692  else crc <<= 1;
16693  s++; /* next xhar */
16694  } /* --- end-of-while(!isempty(s)) --- */
16695 return ( (int)crc ); /* back to caller with crc */
16696 } /* --- end-of-function crc16() --- */
16697 
16698 
16699 /* ==========================================================================
16700  * Function: md5str ( instr )
16701  * Purpose: returns null-terminated character string containing
16702  * md5 hash of instr (input string)
16703  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
16704  * Arguments: instr (I) pointer to null-terminated char string
